messenger summer one sweet sweet morning aurora called carefull eye attend day forth came faire shepherdesse vrania faire indeed yet farre meane title beautie deserud highest stile could giuen best knowing iudgements meade came vsually shee draue flock feede whose leaping wantonnesse shewed proud guide whose sad thought led another manner spending time made soone leaue follow late begun custome delighted themselues sit vnder shade bewailing misfortune fed feed vpon owne sorrow teares time began againe summon sitting downe vnder shade wellspread beech ground blest tree full fine leaued branch growing proud beare shadow perfection regarding nothing comparison woe thus proceeded griefe ala vrania said true seruant misfortune miserie befall woman greatest thou art falne neare vnhappinesse ignorant highest kind certaine mine owne estate birth stil continued beleefe appeare shepherdes nd daughter shepherd ambition went higher state fly knowledge contented perplexed ignorance thy dulnesse yet procure sharpe paine thought make aspire vnto knowledge ioy poore life quiet blest loue tooke parent know contrary knowledge know selfe miserable vrania worse art thou thy lamb know dam thou dost liue vnknowne e others come meade flock shee esteeming owing thought best choycest companie left place taking little path brought side plaine foote rock speaking went line eies fixt vpon ground soule turnd mourning vnseene vnknowne alone complaine rock hill meadowes spring helpe returne ease paine back sorrowes sad eccho brings thus still encreasing woe doubly resounded monefull voice seemes second miserie answere giues like friend mine owne choice thus onely doth companion proue others silently doe offer ease grieue grieuing note doe loue pleasure dying eies bring disease daily ending liue wayling state comfort giue passion went till came foote great rocke shee thinking nothing lesse ease sought might ascend hoping passe away time peaceably lonelinesse though find least respit sorrow deerely value meanes would impart way hard though winding making ascent pleasing hauing attained top saw vnder hollow tree entrie rocke fearing nothing continuance ignorance went shee found pretty roome stonie place yet pitie giuen leaue perfection come heart chiefest beloued place louing place vnlike ancient description ancient hermitage instead hanging couered lined iuie disdaining ought el come perfection richnesse nature plentie made stay behold almost grudge pleasant fulnes content place might haue sensible must know taste torment thus passion mixt paine throwing eies wildly timerous louers feare discouerie perceiued little light one chinke doth oft discouer sight curious see delicate hand put naturall ornament aside discerning little doore putting passed another roome like first proportion midst square stone like prettie table waxcandle burning paper suffered selfe patiently receiue discouering much presented sonnet seemed newly written sight alone silence might mourne silence sorrowes flow sigh complaint haue poorer paine outworne broken heart true griefe show drop dearest bloud shall let loue know teares shed yet still burne spring quench least part woe till liue earth againe earth doe turne hatefull thought comfort despised day let still night possesse let torment feele excesse light allow state still doth wast wasting light sad dayes vnto eternall night ala vrania sighd well doe word place agree thy fortune sure poore soule thou wert heere appointed spend thy day roomes ordaind keepe thy torture none assuredly matchlesly vnfortunate turning table discerned roome bed boughes man lying depriued outward sense thought life first feare strake great amazement yet hauing braue spirit though shadowed vnder meane habit stept vnto found dead laid sutable habitation long gray robe grieuefull spectacle much amaze sweet tenderhearted shepherdesse especially perceiued might helpe candle teares distilled eye seeming image death yet signe worldly said miserable perissus canst thou thus liue knowing gaue thee life gone gone ioy departed wilt thou vnblessed creature lie complaining death know died thee let truth shame make thee doe something worthy loue ending thy day like thy selfe one fit seruant must doe thus remaine foster stormes still torment thy wretched soule withall since little little losse deere limena louing limena worthy subiect creature ignorant ill like vnto foole darke caue hath one way get hauing candle vnderstanding good doth put ignorant wretch able comprehend thy vertues thee thy murder putting world light men admiration limena limena limena fell complaining passion weeping cry neuer wofull perfection brought deserued compassion excellent shepherdesse already heart tempered griefe apt take impression would come seale withall yet taking braue courage shee stept vnto kneeling downe side gently pulling arme thus spake sir said hauing heard part sorrowes haue made truly pitie wonder since haue lost great treasure lie thus leauing loue vnreuenged suffering murderer liue lie complaining perfection dead make phoenix deed liue againe new life raisd reuenge take end satisfied deseruedly accounted worthie fauour shee worthie say shee god crid perissus diuelish spirit art thou thus dost come torture see woman therefore much marked lesse resisted know charitie pray practise leaue afflicted sufficiently men liues estate vnto euery one taking best meanes attaine vnto good desire duke father best truest beauty would yet bestow vpon great lord country truly powerfull command meanes fit match wonder woman since none could without much flatterie himselfe thinke might aspire blessing accounted worthie seruant much lesse husband shee seeing father esteeming obedience beyond passion worthily oeuer suffered dutifully though vnwillingly said would obey tongue faintly deliuering heart much detested loathing almost selfe consenting shew contrarie selfe yet thus concluded much speed man would make eternall happines misfortune remained ignorant till one day warres little ceased though ended siege still continuing stole mine vncle see heart kept safe came thither found feard found roome power mine enemie accounted enioyed losse hope frustrate ioyes lost spoild grew selfe sences failed trembling possessing whole bodie distemper marked pittied comfort seeme pitty blesse torment procured fauour none carefully sought health especially husband whose diligence tedious wiues onely ioy grieud stay see miserie yet sad goe seeing gaue though barrd delight beholding knowing passion greater sword looking much furie iealous spite could rage demonstrate breath short sword held hand eye sparkling thicke fast vnperfectly kindled fire much blowing giues blower tongue stammeringly rage bringing foorth word thou hast wrongd mee vild creature say thou hast wronged mee shee compounded vertue spirit seeing wild distracted countenance guest worst wherfore mildely shee gaue answere philargus saide shee knowe mine owne heart haue wrongd god knowes haue wrongd selfe speech said follower continued ill false liuing thinke longer deceiue cousen selfe hope able shall finde much want doe faith speake confesse truth truth haue shamed selfe dishonour say haue wrongd giuing honour mine loose wanton pleasure perissus great enough amiable delicate enough lasciuiousnesse must seeke woo heart threatners hath word wrought foolish basenesse feare sword breath confesse demaund true farre deserue eternall punishment would belye selfe dread bare threatning since sure sword danger selfe would noblenesse master choose rather dye selfe blood man seene wrangling betweene v yet doe denie loue perissus noble worthy affection thinke nurst long haue borne respectiue loue knowe part memory tell beginning thus partly haue assurance vnseperable loue beare knewe perfectly selfe shall yet alwayes thus vertuous religious fashion god cryd philargus doe heare stile vertuous religious since one besides husband hath shame possest excellent modesty abandoned haue part satisfied indeed thus see haue iust occasion seeke satisfaction iniury wherefore resolue instantly die obey write letter wast coate see said breast heauenly breast dearely loued made thinke calling purest warme snow yet neuer colour purer loue ti ready receiue stroake shall bring heart blood cherishd dye reuenge wrong reuenge nay reuenge death haue though die pittie ensuing ouerthrow whether word sight seene without adoring wrought knowe together well preuaile hee stood strange kind fashion act part life death tooke aduantage cruelty appeare whe known gaue time consideration repentance said deserue fauor said rather giuing care bewitching tongue haue reuengd harme since haue committed first like faultie men must fall another charity desert procures fauour two dayes giue end sure content answere content selfe present death ioy conceiued assured life beene giuen wherefore humbly thanking promised satisfie fully time hopd pleased away hee went leauing busie thought yet somewhat comforted since shee might acquaint mee affliction cause grieuing ignorant true meanes end prettily gaind little time rarest lampe excellent life endure called faithfull seruant brought dolefull letter first coniured faith hee bare obey shee commaunded bee secret related shee soule rendring storie shee inioynd truly discouer mee helpe getting pen paper hauing written dolorous yet sweete louing letter sent mee day shee giue answere shee assured bee direct refusall esteeming death pleasing noble betray griefe mixt blessing shee inricht incomparable affection giuing charge deliuer mine owne hand besides stay mee assuring would kindly intreat sake shee might truly warrant commandresse soule hee found mee tent ready goe forth wan sad countenance hee gaue death together telling lamentable storie deliuered flouds teares stormes sighes hee concluded rarest peece womankinde destroyed growne ordinary passion like weeping sobbing cry fit excessiue losse falne wherefore like true castaway fortune instant metamorphosed miserie selfe thing able equall mee except owne fellow cockle shell fit change yet mee selfe sudden felt marked friend admired feared least doubted end would happened since earth longer borne wretch sad place molested guest perpetually filling place neere vnceasing complaint despaire hauing left mee ground hope ere long shall ease death prouing mercifull vnto mee deliuering griefefull body rest desired graue lord perissus said vrania idle vnprofitable indeed course since shee bee beauteous constancy gone dead goodnesse pitie bee expected knew nothing desire ill crueltie thou art dead thee ioyes departed faith loue worth dead enioy part short time bee thee though life wee kept cride thou wilt hope let slaue liue touch thought liue borne sacrifice bloud wash away staine pray since vndertake thus aduise mee doe yet obey limenas commaund reuenging death replide discreet vrania proceeded whollie loue shee bare rather another motiue stirre consider since danger shee apprehended would runne right delicate yet vnhappilie iniured ladie iniured forced vse authoritie safetie let preuail hinder deadlie reuenge detestable fact thus shall approoue selfe braue worthie louer deseruing best deserud let neuer said perissus ended vnreuenged philargus concluded dayes like fly corner wordes wrought farre noble heart perissus rising leauie cabine thus said hee perissus second time conquerd must obey reason abounds shall glory attempt belong againe put habites late abandoned hauing gaind victorie ouer vowe beseech tell mee counsellor much iudgement finde directly seeme meere shepherdesse beauty sutable apparell name said shee vrania bringing vp hath vnder old man wife till lately tooke father mother telling contrary manner finding make mee find lost truth much content able know selfe delighted tend little flocke old paire put handes troubled rule mine owne thought doe well credit said perissus like princesse shepherdesse doe appeare much doe reuerence wisedome next vnto limena still honor therefore faire vrania hope giue mee leaue call vow heauen neuer leaue armes vntill haue found philargus reuengd lady death loue memory offer vp afflicted life first shall haue notice successe good shall bee attributed ill continuance ill destinie fortune call hence shall found imploy since world hath place keepe beautie vrania hidden seene bee adored shall leaue till haue found scorne name mee shall leaue incomparable vrania word went caue hee straight going large holly tree place rich tree kind comming melancholy abiding hee hung armor meaning remaine memorie monument death end whosoeuer finde bodie might see hee meane man though subiect fortune hee tooke downe armd himselfe hee arming vrania entreated doe one thing tell came place ill forgot faire vrania said hee know soone receiued letter full sorrow heard miserable relation forced notwithstanding vow selfe made solitary course haue reli ued mee goe enemie new force vnder new leader come within sight army thinking mischiefes conspire together mee inraged furie went towards hoping onely hope left mee encounter ende life care together battaile yet slightly part soule wishing euerie one deale withall philargus wish made mee doe thing beyond selfe forcing company party admire also contrary bee discouraged wee got day onely end warres chiefe traytors either kild taken rest outliud bloudy slaughter yeelded themselues mercie vncles name pardoned condition instantly disbanded euerie one retire owne home done vncle quietly setled seate midst triumph happy victorie stole away leauing letter new seruant directed king wherein humbly asked pardon priuate departure intreates could frame perswaded entertaine seruant mine accept recommended mee accordingly esteeme tooke way first father know manner certaintie found vnspeakable mourning sadnesse mother readie die shee brought forth bee still life though two yet like eye one struck certaine part vnhurt doth lose likewise sight hauing lost lost likewise comfort seruants mournd made pitifull lamentation sorry yet gratefully tooke mourning mee thought mee none able grieue sufficiently selfe losse mother saw euer well loud cryd word lord see miserable woman depriud ioy hauing lost limena respected friend full well remember word gentle mild perswasions would haue v stay going place vnto house would feard beleeud bin safe whereas murdred murdred cri speak againe withall husband said led forth wood thicke enough shade light pitie hee killed burnt clothes found wood besmeard blood hard remnant great fire store teares able wash cleane quench fier brought house went seeke seeing long stay mistrusting harme forgotten themselues rest seeing dolefull spectacle rent haire gaue testimony true sorrow came newes v welcom iudge see feele sorrow v father brother armd themselues gone search seene speed passe towards sea thus heare daughter misfortune must followed mother death god send soone wish lord sonnes may meet vngrateful wretch reuenge miserable child losse done swounded armes selfe still transformed estate helpt much could deliuering seruants tooke leaue buying armour goe vnknowne till could find place sad enough passe away mournefull howres many country went thorow left pleasant sorrow till last lighted happie one since haue receiued much comfort kind wise counsell possible perplexed heart entertaine time hee fully armed made sweet vrania admire pitie lodgd affoorded goodly personage dolefull lookes ill agreeing purchased pitie much almost brought end kind pitie pitie kind loue ordaind another proud onely fine beginning make heart tender others comming ready depart wherefore came downe rock bottome met young sh pherd whose heart vrania although conquered lad shee entreated conduct perissus next town willingly consented thinking himselfe day happy vouchsafed command withall inioyned leaue till saw shipt hee performd comming againe receiue thanks welcome fine new flock bin bestowed perissus gone vrania night draue flock homeward giuing kind looke vnto rocke return promising often visit braue perissus sake make retiring place passe melancholy howres next morning soone light appeare could see light sooner might doe eye making day day else seene flocke betooke selfe meadow thought haue met companion early thought hauing kept carefull watch ouer eies thought selfe growne peremptorie authority found none come wherefore leauing flocke charge young lad tooke way towards rocke mind faster going feete busied still like one holding compasse make circle turnes round owne center shee thought incircled ignorance little moud comming pretie lambe towards pitifull cry bleatings demanded helpe tender gentlenes imagined wherefore tooke vp looking round could see dam perceiuing none wandred little amongst bush rude place till grew something wearie sitting downe thus began speake poore lambe said moane thou makst losse thy deare dam torment suffer neuer knew mother thy misse great yet thou beast mayst brought vp soone contented hauing food food bee giuen feede nothing despaire sustaine want knowledge starues thing plentifull poore innocent thing doth thy wailing sute mine ala pitie thee selfe kind wanting pitie shee heare noise bush looking saw fierce shewolfe come furiously towards though spirit matchlesse liued perceiuing wished beast yet taking wonted strength heart vertuous thought together thus said heauen defend miserable creature thou please grant blessing shall end knowing parent sorrow parent liuing may neuer know losse lest doe grieue shee thus religiously gaue thought last shee thought highest beast running towards sudden stood still one might imagine seeing heauenly creature amase threaten medling conceit vaine since beast keepe owne nature true reason soone appeard hasty running two youth sharpe speares soone gaue conclusion supposed danger killing wolfe shee stood hearkning noise made seeing vrania knee praising god said one another ala haue hasted kill beast turne little helpe giue sicke father vrania looked vp hearing humane voice little expected onely death looked perceiued two young men whose age might bee iudged bee seuenteene yeares face sweetnesse venus loue could compare haire neuer cut hung long yet longer much must haue daintie naturall curling somewhat shortned wind moud curles pretily plaid sunnebeames water apparrell goates skinnes cut fashion made fast sort one might see sight wild yet wildnesse gouernd modesty skinne bare armes leggs one shoulder part thighes white skinne seemd sunne loue would hurt bush much scratch feete kind shooes came vp anckle thus prime shepherdess comming saluting stept back wonder see beautie yet masculine came neere laying admiration farre part keepe themselues safe rudenesse kind one began diuine creature pardon boldnesse hath brought v thus rudely presence haue offended let humilitie sorrow excuse v beast haue kild fauourd take v rude men serue stead meane time accept petition bee forgiuen fault vrania outside seene enough wondred hearing speech bred admiration answered beauty mixt much mildnesse sweetnesse might pleade offended saw hauing giuen much respect miserable woman rudenes see beast haue manfully destroyd habit shew wildnesse speech take away error haue committed fault sauing mee liue greater misery young men blushing humbly thanking taking leaues curteously desired since rescued might know men saued aduenture brought thither answered withall heart would satisfie demand time desired excused since sent old weake father get food done would returne hearing ala said shal haue kept throat rauening wolfe want may helpe goe father accompanie lambe shall feede time sent purpose without doubt cherish good blest man father two sonnes may know storie together happy see fit dish age knee would haue thanked hindred together went towards place hee remaind caue vnder great rock neere sea ariud place elder two went telling old man faire shepherdess coming kindnes wherfore sent yong maid clothd plaine neat apparrell beautie seene alone would haue thought incomparable vrania excelled meeting knowing youth sister sweetly saluted taking hand went found old man feeble e tongue left serue himselfe withall well serue good young men thus beginning vrania admired shepherdes worthy bee since inward beauty mind much excells peereles excellency outward perfection vertue excels beauty see poore signe greatnes ouerwhelmd misfortune excelling happy meanes aidean el destroid hope rising sit grudge honor story ended wil see reason pity scorn son daughter come neere shal know haue til present kept feare shuld el haue held poore quiet liuing ready sit heare story man voice made stay vrania intreated lesse danger seene go forth perceiud gentlema delicacy struck woder sweetnes fairnes rarest painter must confes theselues vnable couterfeit perfection exquisit proportion mantle richly embroidered pearle gold colour apparrell watchet suitably imbrodered haire faire shining young hee signe beard armes none saue sword defend himselfe offend enemy hee came softly sadly towards rocke eye seaward beholding said sweet iland maist thou indeed boast thy self harbour excellent person whose mind distant held eye thought first fixt beseeching sea shee amphilanthus power shee would pitifull vnto hee concluded word whose soule absent lookt towards iland eye soone called admire admiringly behold rare shepherdesse kind wonder lookt rauished sight scarce able thinke earthly creature stood gazing poore soule sight perissus giuen leaue loue make breach heart easily come conquer great passion seemd like two masterpiece framd demonstrate best choisest skill art last men haue stronger bolder spirit went vnto remouing eye least braue ciuill manner thus spake vnto seeme incomparable shepherdesse let bee much fauourd permitted aske question heauenly person rarenesse make imagine let know humble acknowledging fault may gaine pardon ala sir said vrania farre heauenly creature esteeme selfe miserable earth wherefore seruice doe may pleasure beseech command may receiue happinesse shall obtaine obeying demaund said shall thing may easily grant make seruant desire know place neuer beleeue seeme vnlesse greater wonder excellencie masked vnder shepherdesse attire perfection call said vrania made perfect excellent speaker would value estimation make poore beautie touching demaunds well satisfie iland called pantalaria gouernd ancient worthie lord called pantalerius hauing receiud discontent owne countrie family others loud serud came hither finding place vnpossest namd owne name hauing euer since great quiet pleasure remained himselfe rest taking manner life shepheards vpon place part famous kind people selfe say nothing name vrania old man wife hauing bred vp owne till within day told afflicts pouertie estate trouble making ignorant selfe know parent told found hard seaside farre rock laid cradle rich clothes purse gold cradle little writing warnd take vp looke carefully call vrania came sixeteene yeeres age tell meanes haue truely performed haue deliuered mantle purse good fortune serue may come knowledge inioyning besides keepe story secret since sweet place intising many may chance bring one ease torment ignorance could otherwise said since sweetnes peerelesse louelynesse matchd together said vrania let know beseech haue discouerd selfe vnto let v sit downe said vnder rockes shall know cause comming hither nay answered vrania please let v rather goe caue hard haue left olde weake man ready tell story hauing two finest youth maide rarest beauty eye behold desirous speake long cannot endure together came caue graue man reuerently bowing downe head saluting thus braue sir maiestie doe perceiue countenance make giue title welcome poore abiding welcome since trust shall dispose sonnes according long wish desire sit beseech downe tell may discourse lamentable fortune child fallen stranger sate downe betweene old man excellent shepherdesse beginning tale thus name sa parselius prince morea eldest sonne vnto king thereof countrie left deare friend mine besides vntying band friendship liue linked kinsman heire kingdome naples called amphilanthus resoluing returne till wee heard newes lost sister first weeke birth sto ne away since time old man whether diuination knowledge assured king father shee liuing wherefore braue prince amphilanthus resolud seeke selfe louing well better selfe would denied accompany hauing bene euer bred neerenesse affection well conuersation together could must like soule body liue moue betooke selues sea leauing morea passing many aduentures diuers country still seeking least freq ented priuatest place keeping west way wee directed wise man last arriu sicilie country found great trouble warres broke againe departure perissus nephew king setled state good peace quiet heart either fully reconcild reconciled departure heard strange sudden neuer since heard rebelled againe soone appeasd busines setling king seat quiet safety amphilanthus though heart part body neuer shall mind parted one ship taking know iustly course trust happiest selfe guided fortune appointing one place bend brought hither promising parting meete father court italie within twelue moneths shorter hope iourney bee since verily beleeue faire shepherdesse lost princesse rather doe thinke much resemble leonius younger brother amphilanthus whose beautie man cannot equalld though surpassed concluded old man teares thus said almightie god great thy blessing die thou doft thus bring desired happinesse could wish sending hither prince onely restore good vnto v mighty worthilie honourd prince see royall presence vnfortunate king albania warres betweene achaya macedon taking part achaya beaten country forced wander seeking safetie far place safety ought haue came father court true poore vnlike prince sight tooke away much pitie courtier rather brauery contemning compassionating extremitie besides mother sister macedonian king liuing would permit fauour kingdome meane spoild parted among could preuaile strength policy get share found selfe misery wife friend went away leauing morea al hope gaining good greece following course star would guide v came hither pleased god blesse v two boy daughter whose seauen yeares old died yet ioy see owne posterity finding likelihood princely vertues hope shalbe one day manifested hath grieued mee thinke leaue hope reuiued since trust danger past noble magnanimous vertues take pitie much wil honor assist distressed prince may well since seruant mine haue oft n sent thither see thing passe doth assure vncle dead mighty lord next heiremale lawes country otherwise hath got crowne hauing inclosed faire young cosin right heire kingdom macedon daughter late king strong tower til age marry shee refuse keep stil best expect wherefore sir thus bound rescue beseech take two young men protection till knew meane boy daring let know birth lest great spirit liue haue led dangerous course still haue kept vnder making know hardnes misery better still endure crosse fortune come enioy right may know better command hauing well learnd obey serue delicate shepherdes pray accept young maid friend companion since bee king naples daughter prince need scorne companie albanian king daughter parselius taking old king arm good fortune famous king albania said hee haue power serue wronging since haue faire occasion reuenge iniuries offered vertuous prince selfe keeping kingdome vsurping another rightfull queene doubly bound sonnes accept bee companion brother carefull like vrania promise young lady old king ouercharged sorrow rauished ioy able sustaine bursting flouds kind teares soule turnd passion ioy vnsupportable onely able kisse prince parselius vrania imbracing night vrania time went home leauing three attend king body till next morning directing parselius sad abiding perplexed perissus promising come caue sunne rising dispose thing vrania come home little meate contented making haste lodging shee might discourse selfe affliction priuately freely throwing selfe bed thus beganne ala vrania doth miserie loue thee thus make thee continuallie companion new paine thou feelst passion thy heart doth entertaine haue heard imagined father many talke thing called loue describe delightfull paine sought cherishd torment yet hope laue enough already sorrow neede haue oppressed passion passion passion yet thou rulest ignorant creature loue stranger prince hope hast thou thou art knowne thou shouldst knowne loue best place rather yet offend meane choice since daughter italy chose mine owne ranke meaner ambition noble basenesse well doe loue onely fault soone louing neither loue choice loue pleade since offend thy power fault must made salud thee confesse wonne lost thou braue prince pittie saue sweet chastity loue honor thee nay almost vowe selfe vnto thee haue faild loue powerfull god borne subiect rose vp went window see day neuer knowing wish thing except knowledge selfe longs day watch houres deemes euery minute yeare euery houre age till againe inioyd parselius sight night tooke little rest hope loue feare vexing tyrannizing ouer sleepe durst close seaze eye least slumber content thinking vrania wishing soule shee lost princesse might happily inioy wish loue chid since loue able make great enough wish adde ought perfect selfe selfe sufficient make happines greatest greatnes resolue whatsoeuer make wife father country friend must loue vrania thus must yeeld lose already yeelded hee whose youth manlike conuersation scornd poore name power loue become bondman cry nothing vrania think nothing hope nothing gaine perfection loue accusing night spitefully longer euer knew affection desire making appeare tedious vnto kept vrania would say happy wert thou parselius land shore thou hast gaind goddesse earth bee thy mistris vrania thy loue would louers feare take making tremblingly sigh say loue wretch men would become thee courage ioyning hope would bring sad despaire giuing comfort yet sure said heart framd excellent temper face beauty selfe wholly made perfectnesse haue cruelty lodged shee made loue must loue pity claime part deserues selfe affecteth went mouth rocke whence might discouerall plaines carefully louingly beholding blessed plaines said daily haue treasure rest world wanting confesseth sence pouerty dull earth ignorant rich neither knowing caring glory sufficiently bearing continually touching perfection dost thou excellency striue delight sending forth soft tender grasse mixt sweetest flower grace thee suffering thee kisse feete shee doth tread thee lie thee dost thou make thy selfe delicate change thy hardnes daintines softnes happy happy sweet weight yet doth leaue thee flower vade grasse die departure hee perceiud comming farre downe plaines flocke feeding leaping want playing well may doe lucky flocke said hee hauing commandresse faire guardian well doth ioy become shewing sensibly doe know blessing inioy doe shall leaue leaue pleasure pine starue die great miserie ala pity change bee wilt thou sweet iland doe let sea drownd lose thy pleasant solitarines hauing thus said left desolate rock went meete equall loue kindnesse met indeed affection expressed nothing selfe excellent first passion past ioy gouernd sight loue taking place speech ah vrania said sun show himselfe brig te glorious habit entertaine thee meade coueting win thy fauour richnesse triumphing hope gaine moud thy sight soule think grew rauishing sences sunne said shind mee thought fond giue himselfe seruant circling meant body himselfe serue beames tooke hand affectionate soule kissed went together caue two yong sauage prince sister attended priuately bury old king promising business went well parselius fauour might recouer right fetch worthy body lay famous king albania agreed vpon went caue steriamus selarinu yong prince called went first sauage habit resolued weare till came might fit themselues apparell armes befitting estate parselius promising knight next went morean prince leading vrania holding selarina hand come plaine parselius againe speaking vrania vrged likelyhood lost princesse besides assuring howsoeuer lower estate would goe made answer prince said demand promise princely thing beleeue say face thinkes dissemble credit consent goe nobly vertuously trust dispose casting vp eye heauen let attempt prosper said breake faith vertuous respect let v ship nay beseech first said shee permit take leaue good friend formerly supposed parent lest absence bring death ignorant fortune besides wee carry mantle purse v soone agreed vnto together went house late abiding matchlesse shepherdesse found good old folkes sitting together doore expecting returne vrania saw come accompanied wondred though poore yet ciuill wherefore went towards hearing faire shepherdesse prince kneeled downe would haue kissed hand parselius respected care vrania would permit doe much reuerence lifting vp imbracing told story trauell cause thereof done vrania concluded likelihood sought princesse reason agreed goe together promising conduct safely italy proued princesse deliuer father verily beleeued doe seldome doe men imagination kind faile especially hauing good ground lay hope vpon old folkes sorry part vrania yet knowing ordaind tarry would seeme contradict will wherefore fetching mantle purse little writing deliuered vrania whose good disposition could refraine teares shee parted wishing age would haue permitted haue attended feeble trauell especially go vncertaine iourney place desired daughter might serue willingly consented thus euerything concluded tooke leaues way ship found parselius left hee parted much company strange encounter found seruants prisoner armes possessd good hand pirat yet gouernd misaduenture dicouerd till aboord parselius alone regard company woman would neuerthelesse haue ventured life haue kept vrania free loue none surpassed compassion likewise great princesse himselfe feeling iust cause thought mistrust promise valuelesse accident first hoped ioyes shee whose truth beliefe would permit haue least part suspition enter much lesse lodge breast hindered braue doubtfull attempt vsing speech satisfied dearest friend said hazard selfe kinde seeking alter ordaind fate therefore changed rather giue v example confidently mildly suffer aduersity happily might haue enioyed expected onely languishing louing looke answerd pirat contrarie expectation came kneeling downe vrania vsed word let fairest princesse accident trouble since imprisonment shall bee command mee mine neither noble sir offended sooner doe violence selfe way wrong come lady bee patient shall soone see cause taking noble prey said rose placing fine seat cabine lately prince sate free band loue imprisonment himselfe sitting began discourse manner ship vnder saile guided way directed pilar name said sandringall borne bred land romania seruant king thereof king liued long one may say fauorite fortune blest gouernment peace loue people principally happy two child son daughter yonger yeares brother called antisius antisia promising youthes comfort succeed age destinie herein commanded disposing quite way thus king master hauing youth braue valiant prince giuing himselfe vnto seeking finishing aduentures strict league friendship grew betweene king achaia whose sake left country great army assisting macedonian nemie returning honor content achaian king gratefull curtesie growne yeares sent embassadours demand daughter marriage sonne withall haue princesse sent vnto brought vp together end conuersation ready friend loue might nurse affection wel might contentedly daughter affectionately desired sonne towardly prince part called leandrus christian prince compare except two cousens parselius amphilanthus discourse master soone consented achayan king demand although farnesse country might haue refused yet neerenes loues could deny request resoluing instantly send one halfe happinesse old friend end sent herewithal begin miserie caused treacherie heartily repent ashamed arriued court ancient confidence loialtie nobility loues parted til saw yong princesse shipp couetousnes dangerous sin time bred wife seeing infinite rich father sent child perswasions besides rather ioynd diuelish sense gaine made consent detestable wickednes led wicked subtilty resolud take way achaya put island sell iewels leaue princesse religious house bee knowne deare parent esteeme lost vsing gaine owne profit cunningly carry sent seruant ship prouision plot required towards night sweete young lady embarqued beliefe go achaya purposing nothing lesse dead time night wee set ship fire hauing slept conuaide treasure long boate much amasement nothing like bellow fuell tooke princesse mine armes leaping boate calling wife follow withall cutting cord lest others leape leaped short fin heauy drowning trusty seruant al knight number twenty lady sent attend antisia drownd burnd playd waterman making towards next shore could discouer day breaking gaue v sight one yet flattring hope play withall enioyd instantly set rouers kept coast princesse tooke treasure leauing boate towing ship midst sea left mee bread water two dayes without oare sayle hope yet fauourable destinie within time pirat scouring sea tooke mee vp long set vpon another first arme serue gratitude well defended victorie death slaine hand requitall hereof bestowed new barke vpon mee men serue glad hauing meanes search princesse vowed true humble repentance performe neuer giuing ouer till found lost antisia ended life seruice reason took hauing landed chance seene straight remembred face wherefore determind way compasse meanes get parting hence happy occasion befalne mee failed atchiue purpose tell haue ten yeeres long since lost beseech let submission repentance gaine pardon truly said vrania haue told ill tale lost princesse scarce forget great iniury satisfie selfe hope finding haue power one ala lost pirat grew much troubled perplext vnaduisedly hauing discouered former ill thus remaind pirat vext vrania grieud parselius soule tormented others moued much respect two could moue noble mind least thinking themselues comparison sitting armes crossd eye cast downe vpon earth except pirat whose mind busied higher thought none knowing end would haue ascended voice awaked came sayler bad prepare called rest sorrow moued vrania much heare sate tearelesse though speechles sighes accompanied wind loud blowing sandringal looking forth saw cause cry proceeded sight great pirat syracusa whose force therabouts well knowne take armes deliuering parselius hand intreating aide parselius lifted vp eies raised placed vrania sphere alone moue vsing word haue hope since possesse armes shew sauage youth helping time ship come began cruell fight betweene grapled parselius encountred chiefe pirat sandringal blacke knight strong valiant sandringal gaind much honour long hold parselius kild enemy instant black knight strake head sandringal shoulder parselius seeing farewel sandringal said antissia leandrus well reuengd thy treason black knight commanded part bee quiet himselfe throwing downe sword pulling helme ran imbraced parselius knowing leandrus much affection held armes thus busines ended growing friend example al prisoner brought forth ship amongst knew one squire deare friend cousen amphilanthus two gentleman mortall hatred appeare one vnto sooner came together would haue buffeted wanting weapon doe one leandrus tooke custody began story thus lord said first let beseech pardon rudenes next claime iustice villaine hath wrongd vnmannerly discourse iniurd brauest christian prince may know conduct faithfull esteemed seruant sandringal well hee trusted hee would haue ventured life hand appeared putting faire antissia power himselfe loued deliuered king achaia desiring match betweene king paineful search sister returne tooke sweet excellent lady called lucenia wife though fairest yet truly beautifull faire goodnesse choisest beauty second marriage made first know miserie king old telling gallant men gay armour farre performed gallant fight wherein killed one knight body carried thence lady followed knight hauing one whither went matter could tell armour returnd old king kindest father accordingly suffer likely disaster fell last first misfortune speaking antissia bewailing losse concluding miserable men doe liue lament many affliction one child dead liuing vndutifulnes lost treachery man trusted besides occasion bereaue dearest friend comfort one equall sorrowes esteeme seeing vexation iust cause mourning offered best seruice seeking princesse dead might hope find bring content vnto age hee hearing mee say fell vpon necke kissing forehead yet weeping resembled watry parting kiss sweet riuers giue sweeter bankes ebbing must leaue teares kiss face time landed greece part called morea met old man told something princesse nothing certaine aboad yet reioyced heare doubting bring delight grieued father neuer indeed tasted true happinesse since losse thread succeeding misery old man likewise told way finding held laconia earnestly desired company affoorded went together resoluing still enquire leaue likely place vnsought greece till found prettie space thus continued old man passing away time good discourse made way seeme shorter telling many aduentures befalne youth hauing led life braue spirit vse one best remember owne story place wherein producing truth worthy note whatsoeuer faire knight said appeare know birth quite contrary poore alone duke one mightiest richest ancientest sometimes happiest part countrie wherein mine onely subiect homage famous king morea education court time spent time abroad weary last either hound wil neuer wel louing hunting wil last take rest lie downe mine owne home determining end day quiet plenteousnes taking delight adde vnto brought vertuous lady one might goodnes equal ranke truly vnbeautifull yet much besotted young man vnfortunatly chosen companion last delight pastime tedious lothsome liking begun nay wiues company respect vnpleasing long time continued continuance made issueles wherfore made heire giuing present honor could power fauor king euer gracd much procure son wickednes though adopted esteeming possessio far better reuersio gaue place much couetousnesse murder crept credit attaine profit wherefore practised make away friend kindred left expecting nothing ruine seeing bewitchd vndoing plot laid thus betraide trusted time come execution hired man mine iustnesse reward came vnto vpon promise secresie discouered truth vnto making besides promise perswaded time retire selfe till party made countrey strong enough pull downe pride gained power grown powerfull selfe might selfe rule safety consented concealing neuer could wonne thinke harming whose vngratitude beleeud sufficiently would one day burden often entreat beseech performe part satisfie master killing whose falsenesse wickednesse grieud ten deathes could haue sufferd many yet honest car ouerruled submitted counsel tooke clothes apparelling fit change fortune poore man returning castle till credibly reporting going swimme often sweet riuer runnes along valley drownd wee place indeed sweetest world kind true said drownd sorrow teares could haue made streame bignesse answerable swift falling questionlesse made framd report true told duke imagined death imaginarily make shew insupportable griefe possest seemed dispossed sens furiously suddenly stabbing good man life lost owne counted passionate act loue transporting much beyond himselfe able resist owne furie deuillish cunning set glosse vpon brutishnesse keepe treason vnreueald poore soule falling dead foot said take thy detested newes bringing make solemne funeral dead mind though liuing bodie apparrelld himselfe court mourning gaue much content people loued indeed black true picture inward foulenes wife presently retire house selfe built thought sufficiently plaid people began exercise authority beginning wife picking quarrell bereaue estate short time turning seek fortune patiently tooke hauing yet iewels left bought little house thick desart wood long came vnto discouering selfe equall passion ioy sorrow priuatly continued many yeares god pouerty giuing v vnexpected blessing daughter grew vp serued v seruant meanes would allow v though estate requird seuenteene yeares thus concealed liud ioies torture haue end duke pleasure plenty miserie pouery one day young prince accompanied noble companion amphilanthus honour greece bred many braue young noble attended went forth see flight brooke flight two prince hawke went checke made follow long last rescue affliction brought poore abiding reason farrnesse court foulnes weather sudden storm falling accepted lodging although meane could yet pleased like rather looking heart welcome found meannesse place refreshed themselues discoursed freely pleased prince say estate life agreed conuersation wherefore would denied needes must know truth obedience desire hearttearing griefe discoursed gaue word answer commanded next day wife daughter attend court faine would haue refused foreseeing soone ollowd destruction loued friend though hee changd gratefulnesse contrary loue hate yet affection could much alter selfe hate earnestly affected seeke reuenge whose good euer wished obeyed sweet young prince presented father instantly called minde remembring many aduentures youth passed together pittying fortune much younger day affected yet glad kind recompence faithfull seruice instantly sent vsurper reason iourney king made see realme shew sonne departure goe thence excellent cousen search vndertaken come neere place tyrant abode refused come soone force brought king milde fashion royall maiestie examined businesse confessed rather proud scorne repentant heart wherefore king iust iudgement degraded committing strong tower whereinto walled vp meate giuen windowe ende dayes long pride swelling scorne fall burst dyed dukedome sentence restored truely able recouer former losse wherefore humbly thanking king sonne besought giue mee leaue bestow daughter granted wife thinking seene enough selfe againe departing life ioy content besides made one suit since prince much fauour begun honour mee would please im proceed far bestow one young lord marriage daughter king prince tooke motion kindely wherfore choosing hopefull young lord prince loued gaue marriage much honour celebrated court vnspeakable honour parselius prince called amphilanthus prince naples made knight brauely beginning succeeding glory began sport field since haue made famous ouer world ended went away kissing king prince hand vndertaking pilgrimage performed returned place like hermit still liue continue life mee valley sleepie woody hilles caue rest shall bee court pallaces old eye shall euer behold thus trauelled determining conclude day iourney end story resting cell night called resolution noise within wood horse clashing armour drew see matter arriuing place found two gentleman cruelly fighting many slaine amazed v hard ground one mirrours beauty see selfe liuely faire indeed fairenes hath mine eye neuer saw equall rare shepherdesse incomparable lady pamphilia sister noble prince parselius need name world sufficiently filled fame lady lay along head vpon hand teares ranne great abundance meant preserue themselues making pretty brooke truest teares breath shee tooke rather sighes sob quiet breathing yet alter colour feature heauenly beauty resembling excellent workmanship delicatly proportiond fountaine let drop fall without hurting selfe like showre aprill sunne yet continues cleare bright seeme eye admiring came knight blacke armour shield sutable without deuice seeing lady stepd two combatant willing hold hand till hee vnderstand cause enmitie refusing turnd one stricking forcibly shoulder seeing rudenesse feeling himselfe smart forgot parting made himselfe party sticking one blow made fall dead foot whereupon yeelded deliuering sword turning lady knight saw admiration fairenesse sorrow vnbinding sitting downe finding likewise stranger calld good hermit heare discourse vanquished man deliuerd manner two see lye slaine halfe brother sonnes one mother one master day long chase stagge happened merchant house farre hence lady remaine ciuilly courteously entertained gentleman well borne fashion pleasing respected beloud neuer hauing attempted man knowledge imbraced let thought contrary vertue till comming thither resolud course worse man could man imagine proud experience saw ladie desird plotted obtaine purposing ill meaning enioy nothing able giue ende wicked mindes whereto beastlinesse true iustice hath brought hauing made place bed death meant lasciuious desire great imagine birth honour done vnto another spurre deuillish longing yet certaine good fashion dissembling inward intent well could courtier intreated merchant tell lady might accordingly honour respect hee told name antissia daughter great king romania betraied guardian taken againe rouers sold coast towne calld anzolo merchant said bought knowing sold bought till day selfe intreating suffer made merchandize carry father would reward sufficiently paine told vnexpected secret brother hearing inflamed beauty first inticing ambition wrought compasse king daughter pleasure much commending themselues placing loues worthily yet still forgetting vnworthie dishonourable loue desire make politike casting way might betray consulting together last concluded get princesse garden walke hauing appointed slaine men attend doore opened field opening perswaded goe little sweet aire fearing nothing went sooner forth shee found betrayd cry helpe would auaile yet pitifulnesse brought forth house perceiuing intended neere acted fury could compard furie indeed fiue vnarmed attempted rescue v two amorous raging passion loue best mild frenzie would haue able thought themselues haue withstood many especially mistris presence noise also brought forth good woma wife honest merchant began pitifull monefull complaining betweene princesse truly moud compassion heart sure weeping yet mad louers sense nothing worst desire word princesse fell new sorrow knight perceiuing whose heart neuer pitifull faire lady perswaded sad antissia well proceeded possest ladie master led way bringing brother v banket place set downe dishonor destind graues grew strife first enioying farre proceeded word fell blowes short time conclusion fighting wee following master example followed death likewise selfe mercy concluded storie pulling helmet kneeling downe princesse told likewise search much ioy sudden could enter sad mind receiud gratious thankfulnes black knight like manner discouerd face excellent louelines cannot say fairenes whitest beauty must yeeld sweetnes yet doth mind farre excell person person doth others haue seene allow amphilanthus mild yet princely manner told princesse might leaue sorrow falne hand haue honor respect within short time himselfe bee deliuerd father first hee performe promise dearest friend cosen parselius meeting italy time prefixed almost expired search vt erly fruitlesse pray sir said parselius came braue prince againe morea violent storme said wherein sufferd shipwrack done amphilanthus antissia hermit selfe tooke way merchant house found returnd ready haue left house filld discontent passion vnhappy accident wife desperate griefe hardly could shee haue endured life blessed returne antissia giuen comfort like life vnto sorrowes seruant slaine knight guided v within sight house pardon liberty going owne way departed night rested next morning parted selues amphilanthus antissia merchant wife took iourny together towards court leaue till found parselius end vow old hermit returnd priuate deuotions self took way next port ship selfe romania ship also man hearing discourse aduentures master ship gaue ill language amphilanthus parselius saying cosoners prince odde fellowes taking good name vpon since vnlikely great person long suffered abroad trauell sort alone like runneawaies prince much moued mee put mee quite patience hee went giuing vilder curst speech owne lord made mee strike wee fell together close one dyed company parted v wee againe gon ship came tooke v made v prisoner saue liues sir doe iustice wrong selues reuenging great iniurie done brauest prince parselius replide wee worthie liue wee right worthy gentleman selfe reuenge wrong done great prince whose greatnesse yet cannot keepe ill tongue awe sufficientlie absence often wronged therefore friend must reuenge ignorant otherwise may suffer herein wee may bee thought partiall knight see leandrus selfe parselius one cousoning prince pleased honestie call mee would aduise thou sleepe deare heart said long feare thy quiet last thy sonne worthy father vnfortunate mother must cast stormes thee fault enough thee haue parent least thy wicked grandmother thinke hating truth make thee suffer thy father sake sleepe quietly sweet lost antissius looke vp see thy woefull mother take last farewell thus receiue blessing blessing owne soule shee wish may come stay vpon thee god danger might freedome liberty none euer receiued dishonor barrd presence wherefore sent seruants command brake open dore entring roome found laid vpon bed newely dead yet owne accustomed sweetnesse wanted loue resolution reuenge one desire instantly performed buried busband vpon tombe selfe captaine seruants lost antissius tooke solemne oath haue reuenge brauest prince whose worth must need abhorre detestable practises meanes though diserud worst basest honest noble heart detest done parted euery one seuerall way seuerall king make misery manifest iustice demanding ayde pull downe wickednesse againe settle worth romania selfe remaining one whole yeare nere hellispont disguised almost begging lyuing last hope still sought v wee among perceiuing continuall hazard ablenesse latter antissius trauell left greece selfe alone going difcouerd young man must inherite father misfortune hardly escape taking vpon missing v ambassadours sent haste neere prince much falsehood false fault couered foule vaile working farre beliefe feare warre made shew much preuented succour hoped finding tooke boate coasting daring stay till could secure many place haue seene found none rescue misfortune caring whither went freed malicious power hither fate hath brought v haue found serud nobleman good prince haue promisd helpe braue prince parselius likewise assist v feare assure selfe hopedfor comfort thus pitty dwell pitty v allimarlus lord prince parselius embraced steriamus selarinus promising former vowes businesse ended would attend rescue meane time would aduise leaue shore feare danger considering charmes yet aduentured towres vnfortunatly dranke riuer nothing yet scarce knowne made cause doubt resolud betooke themselues sea saw floating vpon water man past sense power helpe himselfe subiect sea disposition shee might bee destroy succour parselius charitie willed goe towards tyde bringing pace loue way neare hee perceiued man deare friend leandrus fury falne wanting helpe ran sea mi ing boate conuay fury cast away himselfe cry would haue antissia spite valiantest blacke knight quickly coold losse strength saue himselfe losse sens come ala soone lose againe life happy aduenture come vnto cry parselius take vp worthy body saue noble person losse made taking vp much care getting life againe put selfe cage body knowing friend forgetting thing else embraced soules would greater ioy hinderd reioyce world encountring best friend rowed sometimes parselius prince ayding old man taking turnes till discouerd morean ship haled comming ruler knowing prince ioy dutie receiud company securely sayled towards greece landed morea determined since instant ayde could giuen strong castle remayne prisoner commander place impregnable fort place none could land without fauour might vse opportunitie place time romanian knight place prince deliuerd seleucius nephew antissius ship thither brought tooke againe sea intending goe romania hired constantinople soone alterd meeting another ship desird know something cause ship iourney discouerie hee found ancient seruant faithfull captaine loyally serud first antissius finding prince found returned castle receiud ready make discourse leaue goe againe parselius tooke directest way court kept arcadia time king pleasure made iourney way delight himselfe delightfull countrey arriud ioy could compard king queenes seeing deerest sonne returnd little ioy felt vrania lost onely pamphilia discouerd deere sisterly affection like bewayled absence sport pleasure euery day offerd still knew none another world onely wherein owne person required valour failed though soule gouernd otherwhere dayes lasted parselius whose loue still vrgd could haue rest colouring paine losse friend cousin indeed cause feminine gender king lesse displeasd worthy subiect yet sorry louingest father deerest sonne displeasd troubled hee saw hee would stay againe goe seeke friend yet depart gaynd promise father rayse men assist steriamus iourney conquer right granted iust cause likewise faire young princesse meriana queene macedon right vnto right restord thus departed parselius leauing steriamus brother attend businesse see men raysd himselfe promising within fit time take iourney returne leandrus likewise accompanying parselius court gaue word vse best power gayning force father assist deserud occasion hauing sufferd parent loues end went achaya giuing hand parselius morea within six moneths time appointed marching forward towards macedon albania next meeting would agree thus parted parselius destinie would guide leandrus achaya prince remayning arcadia king much esteemed soone court remooued neerer sea amphilanthus hath beene long forgot time enough remembred matchlesse prince faire antissia merchant house romanian knight told parselius finding fit time longing meete friend princesse honest paire took way towards court king liued way antissias fortune marke yeelding heart louelinesse sweetnes brauerie poore lady lost libertie saw respect answered kindnesse betrayd shewing kindhearted prince lady receiuing time content think loued know paine vnexperienced therefore soone saw remedy must giuen cruelty hee imagind would discernd might art helpe hee refusd good one faire kindly louing made charitie watch opportunitie least loose contentedly louingly passing time entertaining themselues fine discourse many howers together good people wearie trauelling seeking necessary necessarily leauing much complaining absence last came vnto court two moneths departure parselius next weeke secret departure steriamus hereafter shall heare arriuall pleasing people prince faire weather storme plenty following great dearth generally particularly hee beloued enemy great man good man liues without forced truth confesse hee deserud much admiration hee came pleasantlie thither dayes continued whether misse friend parselius priuate cause himselfe mooued knowne sad hee grew shunning companie would retire himselfe antissia pamphilias chamber hee would hee speke direct speech still blaming brother strangely leauing country could offer speech receiued much respect yet shee generally silent discreetly retird princesse one day alone together discourse falling beautie lady amphilanthus gaue much commendation antissia betweene dislike modest affection answered hee spoke sufficiently praise truly lord said thinkes beautie speake haue seene faire delicate shee yet truth shees white extreame whitenesse like well though fulnesse mixd sweete louelines yet cannot blame thinke peerelesse viewes eye affection amphilanthus gaue reply hee till neuer seene much womanish disposition haue much prettie enuie yet opinion except selfe seene fairer antissia came brought discourse til forced part gone pamphilia alone began breath passion none shee would discouer resoluing rather perish third know shee could subiect affection ala would say weeping selfe haue deserued bee thus tyrannically tortured loue violent course haue euer true seruant wrongd name scornd power might iustly censured punishment ill king see obedience tread vpon subiects doth conquering king loue look heart thy prey self thy slaue take pity heauie went bed hope rest get libertie expresse woe last seruants gone thing quiet ceaselesse mourning soule softly rose bed going window looking beheld moone faire bright implore reading ouer againe fie passion said foolish canst thou make v much paine businesse thou hast gaind v dost thou dispose v vnto folly making choicest wit testimony face weakenesses time dost bring owne hand witnesse vnblushingly showing idleness mee tooke shee newwrit line soone almost shee giuen life shee likewise gaue buriall yet said shee loue must doe thus sure loue force better fansies putting light lest shuld soone wast beholding passion hotter flame continued vnited one candle could aspire comparison smallest million turning bed deepe louesigh cried loue thou dost master proceedes owne chosen loue punishment like crammd one full loue beseech thee make lesse happy loud truly blest enioying heart hath made mine captiue mee doe feare shee doth loue wretch must need befall mee death cruellst death loue procured saying surely discouered passion greater exact manner hee calld attention delicate yet dolefull voyce lute finely plaid vpon giuing musicke song dieu sweet sun thy night neare must appeare like mine whose light new begun weares spun chance right led light false pleasing euer wun come view sweet heat light heauy sprit dulld thy setting made anew renew daysies doe grow spring blest thy warmth grew wilt thou returne deare blesse mine yes loues zeale lye let thy deere obiect mildly burne flie turne season happy bow bud bloom mourne sooner ended queene walking garden attended prince lady knight court euery one discoursing best pleased pamphilia walked alone none daring present himselfe respect bore vnto feare displeasing saw sight lost selfe perceiuing yet pitty willing curstly deale shewd countenance dislike speech yet put mee much besides selfe called adde faignd company bleeding heart suffered disgrace yet handled none owne soule could witnesse thus day past sorrow increasing little mirth growing oft time would ready sigh louing breath shee drew loued cause striue fetch backe againe else couer long breathing many day continued till one night standing round window great galerie lady much vse accompany princesse though queenes chamber standing madam said euer see silent prince surely winne kingdome word must done sword countrey might remaine long time without lawfull king pamphilia looked deadly wound sweetest looke proue pleasingly vpon saying lord see lady finely begs discourse ala diuine princesse said discourse proceed dead man neuer heard till said shee dead men walkd spake yes madame cryd haue seene tree continue greene branch though heart quite dead consumd away hollownesse onely remayning nothing left empty hope flourishing despaire cure said yes said shew said looking seeing lady parted besides hard faire glasse many hanging ornament gallery tooke vp turning mine eye onely speaking seeing face saw cause torment said little onely taking glasse turnd side dull like gaines much scorne contempt could appeare much beauty like sun would spite shew himselfe storme turnd stood still indeed could moue til last comfort sense came mee shew fit place betray passion wherefore getting much strength although men long sicknes gaine goe feeble ioynts length roome much little much ado brought chamber opened brest al sorrow let mine eies make ful sea teares thus remaind till resolution took wander card whither far knowledge leaue cruell beauty owne content yet feare hath though truly wish shee calld brother telling must secret hope loue mee hee vowed mistrusting meant till twas late goe backe sob teares hee besought mee alter told remedie must breake oath heart said must obay charge neuer reueale manner going euer seeke suffer could hinder went pamphilias chamber humbly desired speake shee gaue leaue ready say something preuented haue said busines shalbe ready seruice concerning glasse discouery know shall doe best bee silent greater offence cannot doe mee ala madam said haue pitie haue pity said leaue folly shall wish well cold fauour desire dutifull affection giue least cause dislike besought would honour much might kisse hand departure forcd aduenture calling away nobly grated said wisht good fortune told fortune could made proue little said trembling deathlike palenes left lodging hauing yet fauour lip receiud touching fairest hand kisse shall neuer part till lip doe kisse death wandred away till came hither neuer finding place please ala doth thing pity please lesse distastefull greater noise quiet owne quiet griefe neuer giues mee rest little caue ground lodging one squire attending mee towne farre hence fetcheth prouision lute quality learnd court since comming thither misfortune mistrisses disdaine discourse companion thus liues daily dy reiected steriamus hauing finished tale eies flowed againe teares office giue full stop discourse amphilanthus others ran tell king either shew forwardnesse seruice indeed busines caring carry newes wanting chiefest part iudgement know tell briefe king came finding vnfortunat disorder able win faire meanes truth auoyde ill committed prison whence speedier secure proceeding next morning brought publike arraignement king present fearing thing brake forth would blowne forth indeed accused demaunded could say owne defence said nothing wherein must accuse himselfe vrged hee confest finishing speech thus sake consent knowledge command slew king shee hauing giuen mee faith faith esteemd ala shadow put false light would marry added naturall ambition greatnesse iudicially weighing heauy iustice weight honor bee diuellishly sought attained hee condemned die manner foure wild horse execution examined word vsed confest selfe guilty likewise condemned subiect shee vnder law head struck stranger deliuered free againe many pitied done good none found ill commiserate yet like base world left hauing held power shind set light running rising strength declind said shee wrongfully put death either loue make busines sooner dead one antienter fauorites rose rebellion people apt take occasion stirre new affliction great party hath go ten much gaind king shut vp great city constantinople rebell vnlawfull king doth call besieging vowing neuer lay downe armes till hath gotten power cry antissius honouring name god wishing sir vowing recouer make king thus haue left generall called hauing inioyned find infinite strong want braue men gouerne goe beseech neuer romania need shall euer finde third braue exploit ignorant thinke selfe worthy companion wholly ambition serue amphilanthus looking vpon seeing richnes armes brauerie personage comely strong set euer hee seene made answer sir honor mine gaine braue companion friend wherein reioyce place loue giue mine shall firme vnto heart embrace offer bee third doubting victorie hauing happy beginning imbraced taking left hand steriamus right went iudges sixe meeting together speaking wordes one another parted meete neuer part side amphilanthus encountred one watchet knight steriamus king forrest knight called deuice great pleasant forrest pleasantlie set forth cunning rarest painter could deuise met watchet knight first knight lost stirrop else aduantage side thus continued three course lighting drawing sword grew cruellest yet delightfullest combate cruelty delight martiall men euer performed beene seene iudging eye neuer courage magnanimity valour skill nimblenesse ioynd better together indeed kingdome low prize combate long continued till knight loue disdaining one man hold long gaue wound head therewith fell downe dead feete instant king gaue steriamus great hurt body quickly paid wound belly gaue discharge freed trouble ruling obeying knight forrest seeing companion good fortune knew part accompany surely giuen stroke head last knight fell kisse feete steriamus carried presently towne helpe good chyrurgion soone recouered iudges face glad howsoeuer heart affected came rest presently proclaymed antissius king people receiued much ioy coronation within short time antissius created generall duke neapolis lysandrinus duke selybria thing quiet knight loue would needes returne orea see thing fitting steriamus accompany conquest went knight forrest betweene grew strict bond friendship neuer broken two lying together one roome steriamus another reason hurt amphilanthus night often turnd turning still end sighes forrest knight perceiud yet let alone till morning ready rise onely friend said last night ill rest made mine vnpleasing mine ignorance hinders able serue cannot yet bold demand cause since proofe haue thinke might esteeme mee worthy fauour yet may confident death shall ceaze refuse venter life obtaine desire lose rather reueale secret shall impart amphilanthus answerd saw vnexpected good happen al thing especially blessed friedship sought would conceale cause paine discouerd suffer till must conceale hope occasion excuse proofe accepting truth tell loue fortune shall binde confidence ingage relation mine lord said satisfie wish vnderstand poore selfe onely rich honour subiect perfect apparelled greene haire hanging carelesse nothing holding delicate garland wore vpon head made pansy woodbinds face bare boldly telling onely heart must burne purenesse eye like perfectst mixture heauenly power resisted submitted lipps fully commanding plenty duty seemd demaund obedience neck curiousest pillar white marble breast snow smooth waues milke swelling falling sweet gale sweet breath rise slacke part exquisite none saue onely excelling found thought came mee vsing word arise leaue bohemia rescue hand rebel cride stay stay tell hungaria said shee wakd hauing image perfect breast nothing remooue pretty lay still wishing sleepe againe haue beheld rich iewell slightly appeare worthlesse eye contented seene lay feeding resolution seeke day began appeare ioy greater whole content sonne considering knew way goe wherefore armd squire carrying sword passed vnto emperours court without delay gaue demanded honoring gift excellent horse furnishing conueniencies tooke way hungarie kingdome sooner entred mett newes great rebellion made vncle king bastard sonne called rodolindus daughter heire second brother called melasinda crowned queene decease vncle father hee enuying greatnesse ambitiously seeking honour himselfe claymd contract betweene king mother vowes protestation marriage witness produced true false made terrible stirre brought fairest malasinda great danger troopes continually mett queene much difficultie pas till came ancient lord castle within two league city buda whereshe inclosed nobleman held soueraigne much discourse affaire led gallery shewed mee picture distressed princesse truely say well drawn remaines figurd heart well none counterfeit could appeare beautifull knew blessed night forrest shewed selfe made conclude aduenture reserud wherefore carefully examining thing passed curiously affectionatly weighing businesse meanes atchieue finishing leauing thing vnaskd might auaile concluding aduenture ere came good lord aduised perceiuing purpose bee ruled consented found hee meant honestly princesse good circumspectly safety meanes suffering enter towne selfe reason great hate betweene parent aduentrous knight hearing trouble offerd seruice faire louely hee accepted seruice performed put trust two dayes killing two mightiest strongest knight party ende councell side people weary war aduised agreed vpon peace condition lay downe claime crowne yeelding wholly requitall shee take husband bitter must doe left alone peoplelesse kingdomelesse one vnable set crowne keepe head whole state wherefore louing much daring thinke harme giuing ill aduise could soule allow lesse kingdome rest perswaded till shee told sorry better deserud loue would thinke another fitter vnworthy mine swore truely world treasure couetously sought enioying vrgd vnkindnesse betweene parent made doubt firmely vowd loue made secure happy said onely good safety much adoe long perswasions wonne loue mee yeelding match concluded peace side leading day marriage wedding chamber left husband next morning shee came downe little garden whereinto window looked cabinet key could open owne place conuayd woman little meeting passed houres together thus blest man inioying world rich loue hee contented hauing sought thus liued till found alterd face court little changd towards mee former cause pretended forgetting done mee made fearing harme leaue country little time already seemes age yet moneths number though loue innumerable sad grieud going playd woman wept departing soone hope againe shall meete howsoeuer see newes sonnes well though much welcome beene could haue told thing returne thither parselius demanded squire hee found sir said hee master going away morea antissius company sent mee sea seeke countrey chance shipp sprung leake forced put againe mend beene day sea throughly mended came braue gentleman called ollorandus younger sonne king bohemia seeking lord hath vowd loue seruice knowing mee bee yeelding master spirit oft would shee blame cruelty againe shee would salue ignorant paine iustly accuse selfe long time many yeares could make discerne affection though word plainely spoken soone thought recalled blamed greatest condemnation acknowledging losse kinde proceed vertue shee considered hee loud another put beyond patience wishing sudden end cursing dayes fortune affection cast vpon rocke mischiefe oft would shee wish dead beauty marid recalld againe louing much yet pitty shee would wish might trouble rather continued according owne wish complaining fearing louing distressed secret constant louer euer venus blind sonne bestowed wound dart vpon estate shee stayed wood gathering sometimes flowres grew name began letter name placing well pamphilia said disorderly passion keepe still thy soule thought change thou blame thing let absence since presence giue thee againe thy fill delight yet torment proue shall see hope ioyes content come another loue froward fortune two curse cruell ala blinde therefore let rather hate selfe vnquietnesse yet vniustly shall doe since condemne heart hauing vertuously worthily chosen choice shall satisfie mee much comfort felt despaire poore grasse said shee thou shalt suffer paine louesmarting body thus pressing thee laid shee excelling selfe vpon blessed ground compassion giue mee rest said shee well may doe honord weight loyallest afflicted princesse euer kingdome knew ioy flourish still hope beare vertuous affliction morea place accounted full loue loue thee thus terribly oppressed cruelly rewarded first vnfortunate woman bashfulnesse hath vndone suffer vertue yet gentle pitty sweeter lot sweet land thou sweet loue pardon heare commiserate woe hastily rising low greene bed nay said shee since finde redresse make others part taste paine make dumbe partaker griefe taking knife shee finished sonnet time shee begunne ingraue barke one fayre straight ash causing sapp accompany teares loue vnkindnesse beare part straight pleasant tree imitate torment smart cruell loue doth send heart keepe thy skin testament loue ingrauen hath miserie cutting griefe vnresisting part would pleasure soone haue learnd loues art wound still curelesse must ruler bee thy sap doth weepingly bewray thy paine heartblood drop stormes doth sustaine loue sencelesse neither good mercy knowes pitiles doe wound thee vnpitied vnthought wounded crie outliue testifie woe rootes whereon laid head seruing though hard pillow time vphold richest world wisdome sex writ thought thou hast supported without rest tyred body hath laine opprest loue feare yet thou cuer blest spring prosper last alone vnblest hauing ended againe laying sad perfection grasse see rest would haue fauourd haue thought trauel enough disturbed presently found passion yet allowed time quiet wherefore rising giuing kind farwelllooke tree one would doe trusty friend went brooke vpon banke whereof fine shadie tree choice thorne bush might mixt obtaine name
