rarest princesse pamphilia therefore knowing harme rather loue well satisfied said sweet sad pamphilia loue proc ed neuer enough praised merit loue otherwise haue already exprest tissia answer thorowly satisfied taking princesse armes protesting life little pay requitall royall freedome found fauour receiued expressing loue best manner could plainely making confession concluding incomparable vertue bound best respect yet resemblance shee face famous prince onely beloued would haue forced loue delicate lady told shee could better please telling resemble since sure like true vertue onely body loue dependance doe vex v take away societie amend let v returne court said contented said antissia rising holding arme much loue loue could oyne tooke way backe towards palace great garden met king queene attended backe hall whither sooner come setled place entertained aduenture tenne knight comming russet armour bea er vp sword hand comming halfe way state making low reuerence stood still parting themselues either side chamber let follower better discerned came tenne blacke armour chaind together without helmet sword came sixe armed like first three carrying speares infinite bignesse one sheild two sword helmet knight countenance seemd louer colour like moore fashion rude proud following sixe first diuided themselues came man state leading hand sweete ladie hee vgly shee milde countenance hee insolent shee fearefull hee bold hand another knig sad seemd amorous king court beholding expecting issue busines stout man hollow hoarse voice deliuered word king morea lansaritano whose fame doubt hath spread selfe eares lord ilands cerigo dragonero lesser circkling chiefe iland subiects greatnes lady see vassall birth choice honourd loue foolishly refuseth iudgement farre failing able discerne happinesse vnspeakable good blind fortune hath giuen letting high noble thought abase themselues low looke creature fauour liking might command haue bin contented woe shuld obay ignorantly refuseth yet master worth force haue compelld selfe consent satisfie fond request hath made come court knight cosen loues barre enioying find knight sake enter quarrel call de ence true loue must obserue giue one v fight happen chuse well may wil defend lady dispose beloued must combate ouercome shee shall bee free else yeelded make question since neuer yet knew fortune stout valiant hardy could hold bound men knight brother two rest friend kindred vpon vaine complaint fearing violence would haue iustly vsd vpon made insurrection soone appeased loue would yet put death haue brought mee likewise condition haue fought vanquisht bold fond man whosoeuer aduenture combate shall strike head sir cause comming wherefore desire leaue shee may haue one knight vndertake dare maintaine cause shee account faire good king sorry lady sake court vnprouided braue knight wont honour especially famous nephew braue sonnes absent knew would defend lady cause especially louing lady seemd wherefore hee made answere lansaritano troubled braue man fight ill matter since shee would worth bee wonne thought worthy gaind hazard self must run encounter knight court surely braue man giue owne affection indeede fortune good comming worthy part absent yet doubt haue still honour lady much venter deliuer force loue therfore giue yo free liberty pronounce challenge sorry said worthy might glory ouercome one another since absent one take part giue mee none aduenture combate otherwise ready meete launce three course end combat sword one dare vndertake must sweete lady bee mine want knight champion shee lookt sadly wept louelikely pittied none offered seruice valour knowne strength much feared la saritano till selarinus disdaining man haue though little cause adde fuell fire pride stept forth said mighty king may please honour mee much permit mee libertie aduenture wherein doubt doe iustly lay lansaritanos pride low ea h suffer body lie vpon king glad see fine young prince forward loth venture dangerous businesse told true noblenesse bounty king albania predecessours againe liue maintaine hee willing grant request tender yeares made loth aduenture alone sir said hee shame selfe braue prince mentioned alone left bloud alone aduenture hee asked lady shee would accept stand censure shee answered willingly shee would hee gaue beloued saying prepare selfe know lansaritano shall finde enough doe encounter iustice resolution two take mee combate furie vaine man see young man answer hee could scarce giue one word againe last breath smoked word ala poore boy pitie thee wherefore pray thee aduised hereafter thou hast beard come may grace thee fighting thee vnlesse thou dost hope haue pity thy faire face forbeare hurt thee fight ince haue brauer knight great king morea farewell returne faire lady thinke seruant selfe loue let smug youth champion king infinitely offended proud speech lansaritano like company yet none aduentured answer braue selarinus himselfe againe couragiouslie yet mildlie told hee neede learne know word weapon bee vsed fight therefore hee would answere kinde hee giue satisfaction sword speare lady sake parting thence whether hee would haue occasion speake better hee left speake king embraced young prince straight sending armour first euer amphilanthus worne hauing left taking another brought italy first victorie fame performed two knight defence iniured ladie hee put white saue iust heart hee figure heart wounded curiously made artificially one would haue thought heart seene bleed armour armes selarinus armd king girting sword kissing wisht good fortune first lord armes prooue worthy weare hee knee humbly gaue thankes turning lady willd take loued seruant shee accepted knight shee ioyfully beholding smiling loue equally exprest ioy followed appeared young mar yet ioy mixt feare falling againe hand till time shee told esteemd selfe appiest woman breathing defendant went list king court taking place fit behold fight lansaritano cursing destinie brought dishonour meete childe tearmd though hee proued otherwise vnto field lansaritano conducted field owne knight manner enterd hall lady cald nallinia late distressed reuiued associats placd seate themselues see bee seene prize combate came selarinus field attended marshall master horse chiefe officer kingdome morea marshall graue old man youth one best knight countrie gaue first speare king pamphilia brother king newly come thither visit principally neece gift enioy kingdome decease therefore bore name likewise giuen one iudges prince elis selarinus two lansaritano accept also doubting wrong iust king court uely encountred running two first course without aduantage third selarinus receiued strong counterbuffe breast beate backe vpon saddle pretie hee recouered againe lansaritano hauing strength great blow shewed mouing himselfe though blow forcible girts brake hee came ouer horse slipping saddle selarinus looking back saw foote comforted much fearing hee till receiued worst satisfied new courage hee leapt horse scorning aduantage drawing sword went towards enemy met pufft vp much furie ship run vpon rock withall alike prosper long time combat endure lansaritano brauely valiantly behauing himselfe could doe fighting lady win lady vnexpected fame braue albanian still continued better though lansaritano valiant strong yet enemy aduantage ouer valour hee equald strength hee faild nimblenesse cunning hee exceld brought victory others death giuen thrust face beauer chance flying vp pin cut last blow knight lady set libertie brother lansaritano one carried helmet succeede brother command tooke leaue king court lady euer affected knight married parting giuen marriage brother called sarimatto returnd shee liued much content husband way like cosin though big strong valiant milde curteous honest prouing true friend seruant court morea infinite ioy prince conducted palace entertaind king lady ioynd honoring much honourd sex letting first aduenture bee defence woman carried chamber wound drest many none dangerous yet losse much bloud made fainter hee first aduentrous tryall armes accordingly proceede brauely happily leandrus left way achaia get force assist prince long rid without aduenture place affording many pleasant one yet scarce one number left court took directest way part neerest passe thence achaia went thinking friend loue heart hauing receiud cureles wound neuer fayling commanding eye pamphilia sometimes purposing ask marriage another time hoping first desert win loue promising himselfe furtherance parselius labour rosindy fauour amphilanthus earnestnesse owne affection louerlike importunity hee resolud woe thus hee meant haue yet wanted hee consent better part gaining harder bee gaind yet conceit pleased mad folk delight owne odde thought little lesse madnesse hee sense haue considered worthie selfe bee giuen owne worthie choice thus hee satisfied himselfe till wanting happinesse selfeframd delight also hee fell despaire proued farre worse many hell vnto hee past yet pleasure along way diuided selfe neere delicate fountaine three part hee sat downe side fountaine drinking first spring taking paper wherein hee written sad verse hee read himselfe drowne cruell teares sorrow witnes beares wailing loues failing flouds couer retire washing face desire whose fresh growing spring flowing meadowes euer yet loue pleasant streames moue falling claimes calling torrent curstly fierce past wit power rehearse cry dying may stead verse prose disasterous end sorrow giue conclusion dayes selfe wearied yet pity sake tormenting mee afflicted soule breathing miserable clarimatto accursed aboue men abusd beyond men dishonourd creature esteemed creature woman faire woman cage foule mind keeper corrupt soule false heart else would could haue giuen herselfe mine mine vow solemne prosession others fickle sex vnsteady creature worse call indeed loue though like made thinke hauing shee would changed giuen selfe enemy first betrothed vnto time prouiding marriage married cause torment hither come reuenge selfe shee loue still strong castle merrily liue v proceeding king morea youth braue man armes followed finished many aduentures chance great iust held achaia ioy birth king son cald leandrus heard prooud prince worthily deseruing ioy shewed receiuing lord father likewise encountring king throwne ground disgrace hee took heauily would haue reuenged sword forbidden end triumphes reaching sport discontented burning rage hee went thence watching king returnd iourney place set vpon troopes comming seuerall way charging onely pleasure sent greatest company following two knight squire conflict king got much victorie hee slew enemie owne hand could keepe himselfe taken prisoner carried almost castle whither hee gone without doubt hee thence neuer returnd squire seeing distresse death two master ran euerie one seuerall way till got good number traine together speed fury pursued ouertaking hard castle taking lord killd got hold relating vnlucky aduenture wife slaine lord mother lord hauing great spirit woman breathing made vow bee reuenged court morea king posterity especially hath hitherto performed great cruelty sonne hauing beene nursed hatred doth likewise continue violence spirit much greater commonly man respect woman cause hee hateth moreans countrey borne corinth heart truely scorning iniury done mee inuited hither two reason bee reuenged leandrus thankd discourse told hee made long try hee could bee made prisoner also iust cause deliuer vniustly inclosed rather said hee serue one much iniuried selfe whose quarrell lay mee doe defend honor king country shee worth fighting hee answered true yet honor hee esteemd worth cleering calld vpon thus discoursing lord false lady came louingly hand hand together downe one path shee smiling eye want courting seeking giue occasion mirth hee went like man ill succeeding hee seruants armd owne armour likewise carried hee haue occasion suddenly vse hee cleere pleasing complexion person amiable lou ly curld hayre fayre eye iudiciall countenance might haue made worthiest woman like well hee deserud pitty hee fell hand vndid minde bodie making wicked selfe worst sex looked vpon loue speech sparing either naturally store word inward heauinesse time made silent came neere fountaine clarimatto approched lord said sure know cause comming part examine heart tell iniuries haue impure partiall offending bee true false master behold creature shame mine forehead faire field disgrace shall see written spot infamy wrong lord knew face offence therefore answered thus sir said condition acknowledge vnderstanding rage make selfe guilty free knowledge neuer wronged vnwillingly made amends ready doe giue mee honour againe throwne ground atiable loue cride wrong v said shall ground reuenge answer armd himselfe shee cry aduenture deare selfe stranger knew full well shee kneeled held leggs kissed gazed termes calld dearest would serue encountred enemy truly iustly made owne ill deseruing fought like two one hauing got earnest keepe mistris hauing thee hither happinesse vnhappinesse met make meet thee thus accursed yet blest occasion thou outliue victory conquered said hee death yet might haue honourd liue vanquished rather wish dye thou hast braue clarimatto said hee ouercome slaine thine enemy thine owne hand contented said hee though traight die shall yet end armes men loue none selfe could haue destiny helpe onely aud best beloued herein hath destiny blessed came lady much contempt sorrow louer looked vpon one dead dying said nothing kneeled downe latter loued friend kissed rose againe looked infinite hate vpon clarimatto end came maides attended told comming selfe stranger neuer shee sent demaunding many thing well much amazednesse beholding could permit answered shee tooke delight see moud imagining ba hfulnes made sport thus time continued till one day master went himselfe princesse much discourse concerning among rest shee much prest know country man last directly said shee either hee verie foolish fellow seemes bee rather doe imagine therefore faile tell mee respect loue beare mee know hee loued mee sonne loath discouer mee directlie feare danger yet considering hee much better tell cause disguise would purchase mee good dissembling vpon promise way offended discouering knowne would cost life told withall added extreame affection shee first heard shee seemd offended yet said contented keepe torment tormented selfe word none action going straight chamber throwing selfe bed lay sencelesse speechlesse motionlesse houres told mee time hee went againe telling hee left mee shee kild braue clotorindus haue done amisse beseech pardon likewise leaue macedon shall doe worth contemned slauerie esteemed shee heard honest speech master saw likelihood loosing onely shee could haue assurance truth trust shee told loue truth gaind pardon shee would haue goe meanes mee shee would haue mee sent shee would speake since shee could belieue prince would take course loue direct doe shee found man spake hee returning told mee time come resolud though die since shee mistrust mee goe like selfe putting owne clothes sword side master cloake vpon past garden gallerie honest man directing mee tarrie till shee came vnto mee shee appeared like blazing starre foretelling lost life liberty still perseuer crueltie shee spake heart possessed one word answere onely throwing disguise kneeling downe gazing manner suing shee came nearer taking mee vp shee said lord seruant telles mee may call much doe wonder disguisd till time haue continued loue iudgement much erred thinke could affect low time admired sweetnesse familiar kindnesse louing care tender respect made heart soft yeelding power allurings come fondnesse purpose striue win cast away pleasure desired meeting make miserably end neglectiue forsakennesse man could true assured selfe must enough considered doubt iustlie made man truth loue safely defended selfe disaster amphilanthus thou wert noble iust free change noblenesse bee deceit rule iustice cousonage gouerns freedome bee falshood liues thee thy sadnesse new wound ala assured selfe parting mee much change grow could blinde foole haue markt often frequenting pamphilias chamber priuate discourse seeking opportunitie bee presence stolne lookes fearefull amorous touching hand kissing owne hand rather comming going louing hauing touchd beloued hand oft would hee doe looke mee beleeue meant mee wisht eye betraid mee beliefe bewitched mee falshood must kill mee churlish affection torture alone make likewise smart make likewise vexe need curse since poore lady entring following perplexitie ala pamphilia pitie thee indeed loue thee whit lesse cannot may blame thee louing since none resist conquering force loue seeking whose soule would couet blame spoyling poore heart glorious triumph vnnaturall man preyes owne kind nourishing life ruine simple innocent louers cruell foode crueller deuourer hath wrought hardnesse mee hence loue thee till bee reuengd thee reuenge haue thy hard heart shall melt goodnesse bee left ouer world seeke thee iourney romania ended bee thus quit thee thy false eye flattring tongue shall bee longer able deceiue betray thy selfe others behold true end gaine death thy falsehood thy presence conclude life loue thee wondred yet neuer wit doubt much ceremonie lately came ceremonie indeede shadow substance true loue change wrought change put habit loue know loued mee fond fond fondnesse may properly cald loue eternall changeable many wee see fond sport horse doggs dogged fortune haue fond immortall part soule fond louing loue euer liues loue wanted onely enioying fond fondly prooud desire remoud haue left nothing behind sad remembrance great highest esteemd blessing remaine throwne downe darknesse despaire losse losse affection thus discoursing tossing vpon bed remaind fed slept night next morning early going garden wood whither sooner came pamphilia sitting vnder ashe wherein affectionate afflicted princesse written sonnet shee inuited either owne passion imitation excellent lady put thought kind measure shee perplexed loue iealousie losse shee beleeud made sonnet looking vpon sunne good height sunne hath long iourney goe progresse haue desire disaster deadlowwaterlike show sand ouerlookd hopd hyres thus remaine like one thats laid brier turning brings new paine certaine woe like one burnd bid auoid fire loue true fire let slow obedience feare loue doe conspire worthlesse conquest gaind ruine feele height blest desire danger doubt losse straight see restlesse liue consulting doe study still vndoe vndoe cride ala vndone ruind destroyd spoild forsaken restlesse affliction proceeds forsaking yet would bee beholding enemie mine forsaking torment would possesse might remaine forsaken must bee must onely know pleasure happinesse chiefe happiness loue beloued forsake mee paine torture shame still abide dwell went shee little towards riuer banke vnder willow lay supposed amphilanthus cause businesse helme reason heate securenesse discouered indeed possible except antissia pamphilias leaue key walkes come within side riuer shee gone rashly voyce staid whereat started first trembled feare ioy thinking likewise beene loue iealousie transformd impossible heare see know thing amphilanthus sorrow another time shee would haue laught selfe making vnlikelinesse vexe hee spake low whispering himselfe word deare shall wretch againe inioy thy sight deare bright brightest day owne life sweet commandresse blisse oh shall againe blessed canst thou leaue thy loyall seruant thy best deseruing selfe shall lye secret complaining selfe maist succour quickly ala releeue neuer neede neuer loue sought word gaue full assurance twas iealousie told spoken pamphilia rage outgoing iudgement shee flew vngratefull man rather monster thy sexe said behold thee thy shame dishonour wrought loue thy change rosindy amazed feard betraying wondring sister carelesse shee seeing rash vnpardonable fault hauing thus wrongd loue stood depth amazednesse torment affection working owne way meere chaos vnframd vnorderd trouble tumbled themselues together without light iudgement come blacke knight beheld wondring manner former speech heeding knowne admiring passion vnderstanding word thinking neuer hauing seene therefore guilty blaming shee little come selfe feare modesty causd much bashfulnesse scarce shee could bring forth desired eye cast downe blushing face shee much adoe said thus sir beseech louer perceiue hide imperfection one number selfe vnfortunatly hauing fallen worst extremity iealousie worse may bee worse without cause perceiue falshood hath caused mistooke haue mistaken selfe indeed better selfe conceale beseech may serue thing requitall command obey faire lady said cannot exceedingly pitty estate happiest amendment humblest suit vnto shall onely conceale heere esteeming worthy going hence remember saw till time may fortune may doe seruice come acknowledge fauour shall like obey shee answering promising pamphilia came infinite discontent antissia shee without dissembling withall vnfaigned loue shame fell feer beseeching pardon cry neuer liud vnblessd creature selfe liud wrong two perfect mirrours sex base worthy contempt humour suspition pamphilia tooke vp quickly peace made one seeking giue satisfaction willing receiue rather businesse make stirring promise secret holding knight much desiring know name lest might make suspition desired know discouer againe departed contended happy beene disquieted onely grieued wrongd amphilanthus gone deare brother sister sate downe together pamphilia speaking thus long stay said shee might haue marrd promise desired care keeping secret good chance acknowledgement wrought contrary howsoeuer brought little harme since long feare abide vnderstand newes bring father morning councell set downe macedon fittest first releeud rather easie gaine kingdome one vsurpers hand many mother hath beene infinite earnest earnest knew mind reason young queene neece know macedon quieted albania sooner selarinus younger brother likewise hath desired businesse albania may layd aside till steriamus heard willing bee thought hasty winning honour loue owne countrey absence brother truth must say doth like himselse like one finest prince know like say knowe know must ambition termes gaine honour friendship companion trauels haue promisd meanes beleeue brother thank since sweeter disposition matchd noble minde braue courage neuer beleeue encountred rosindy ioyd discourse knew almost last part speech wringing hand said blessed messenger eternall happinesse force shall goe redeeme number hence said fifty thousand achaia twenty romania twenty achaian demanded ambassador appointed army lead leandrus romanian lysandrinus duke v certainly assures father number refusd master rather force added doth father wish lead men desiring haue honour braue attempt strong working diuine knowledge thinke vnderstanding minde choose whether breake promise mistris yet doe see liberty gaue permit doe said deare pamphilia counsell vniust greatest mine owne vow vowe loue thus may helpe mee assure father know finde let reserue honour charge bring mee receiue time post macedon get leaue returne take charge agreed vpon somewhat late left brother promising come againe dinner let know king answer take leaue returnd found king whole court assembled see heare strange aduenture aged man graue maiestick countenance haire white snow beard downe girdle bound strong chaines iron young man likewise enchaind foure squire leading old man teares pitifull groanes telling story thus famous king behold distressed king negroponte brought misery owne folly much doating daughter mine suffered selfe fall sinne forgetfulnesse sonne worthy confesse deseruing farre better title sonne vnlesse natural father affection vngratefull child mine disinherited soone cald dolorindus whose vertues appeare blacke sinnes sister euen grieue name sorrow bee increased sight noble compassion better say worthlesse creature moue sorrow royall mind auoide briefly miserable relation giue leaue discourse tragick storie vnnaturally disinherited dolorindus present gaue kingdome came wife dead ramilletta vngratious daughter requited viper doe dam sooner shee possession fell ill gouernment indeed beastly liuing report sinnes intices one still purpose leaue one height height enioying make one leaue loue haue offended power loue pardon one among hath rule truth gouerne mee direct hencefoorth assure selfe faith true subiection error make perfect shewes light vnderstanding talke truth commend faith vncertaine whether winne ala shee doth loue woe mee hope quite lost shee loues see end yet neuer shall come without noble conclusion eye eares shall witnesse losse dearest pitty sad lookes shall tell thee doe loue sighes shall make thee heare paine eye shall let thee see thou wilt see mee onely thy sight comfort thee stirre must finde new seat turne head dwell haue nothing see thy delicacy nothing viewe thy perfection turne thee onely turne vnto thee soule hath also eye see thy worth loue hath framd wholly thy lawes command heere breath thy loue doe swarue let loue vnrequited dearest thou kinde haue blisse shouldest thou leaue one since thee ile leaue vnconstant saue twere death true vow vow still keepe himselfe way see inhabitant way side rocke wherefore went downe againe halfe hill found little doore stone euen proportion opening making knowe else nothing could haue disordered close appearing like chinkes clifts pulld would stirre knockd straight little window opened vgly old dwarfe looked whose face wrinkled rocke complexion sandcolour without much red make difference twixt lip face haire beene blacke growne grisled yet still kept naturall stubbornnesse thin haires desirous seene stood staring neither equall length like horse maine new taken grasse wantonnesse companion beene bit natchd diuers place beard none distinguish sexe habit forcd speake purpose onely wart right cheeke liberally bestowed haire according substance sight saw onely dwarfe least creature sort illfauouredst please great prince vnderstand called nainio borne strombolli pretty possession enioyed yeares father decease lord iland better say gouernor passing way seeing liuing pleasant delightfull groues orange lemmon tree fruites plentif lly yeelding themselues v grew loue place hate first hee peremptorily commanded mee bring wife tall men sonnes attend wife child borne free would bee made slaue wherefore must confesse vnaduisedly gaue rough answere bred dislike gaue iust occasion mee sent hee mee made mee scorne eye men hee gloried enough miserie scoffing shape stature saying would make fit commander infidel hee put mee family little boate shipping went greece sent mee along kindnesse found among indeede carried mee brought mee backe againe discouered whereupon die pardon got lady wife lord vertuous sweet lady condition euer found str mbolli part italy die went away first mentioned saylers got sea vnto iland haue remaind continuall feare considering danger life memorie fright mee rather haue sterud gone hence feare harme euerie one heare see place sprite vnto mee appeare till told much doe yet stand awe cruell iland lord king smild heare discourse see action timerous affrighted neuer man beheld like son like munkeys imitating one another answer gesture aptly redily one ecco another like sport doubled great delight hee take little men wherefore gently mildly hee gaind much would leaue place conditionally hee would carry italy feared first enemie trusted power king lord coward feare ouer base mind vnderstanding gaines small place heart appeared else might haue assured company strombolli selfe consent agreeing side went rocke meete prince dwarfes quaking euery leafe shook fainted heard armour little clash going directly lost life met knight able belieue lord friend grew valiant like coward mind brought middle battaile neither runne cry bee heard therefore force must abide hell torment brought sight fight death could haue relieued feare amphilanthus following came great caue hee went putting dwarfes great way passed till hee came riuer either blacke darkenesse shadowed place made appeare vault height sufficient without trouble walke breadth three goe front paued couered round free stone came riuer desired passe first saw meanes last discouerd feare dwarfes discouerd able discerne hauing long darke though first blindes like loue yet giues last fight get found board fastned chaines top vault two pine yron held chaines stuck wall pulled chaines let planke fall gently downe iust crosse ouer water aboue six yard ouer might see great way vp downe streame passed doore opened pretie way along vault brook end thorow entred dainty garden faire pallace alabaster incompassed hilles rather mountaines height way possible bee found come thorow vault king came diuers garden orchard surround pallace euery one fountaine euery fountaine rich art plentifully furnished vertue liberalitie freely bestowing water abundance place hee past staying large stone gallerie set vpon pillers stone hee sat downe complaining still mistrisse whose heart stored paine loue equally oppressing cride dearest loue sweetest cruell euer nature framd haue miserable man offended thee much looke shew pity proceede thee comfort mee thy fauours lockt vp onely sad countenance allotted mee ala consider woman made loue kill yet destroy cruell force changed tender creature sit weeping mourning thy crueltie yet hardly terme since thou knowest paine hee would haue proceeded doore opened roome came graue ladie apparreld black habit many young woman attending shee straight went saluting thus braue king welcome place abiding friend seruant hee looking vpon perceiued wisdome modestie goodnesse figured face wherefore kind acceptance hee receiued salutation desiring bee informed place know came knowne sir said shee name mellissea hauing skill art astrologie haue found much concerning much desire doe seruice find good madam said hee whether shall bee happie loue loue lord said shee shall bee happy shall loue wish yet must bee crost affect though contrarie heart shall enioy miserable fortune take loues may haue shee loues said mellissea prooue fault lose thinke must preuent possible beware treacherous seruant place anciently reuerenced honoured iland delos famous birth two great light apollo diana ruines apollo latona temple remaining day side mountaine called cynthus rich populous poore peoplelesse none inhabiting besides family sharpe cruell rockes girdle iland guarding selfe v dangerous robbings must loose loue said amphilanthus accursed fate happen yet doe hope may assured shee loues mee neuer bee well lord said shee let see hope poore thing comparison truth trust wil giue token make truly see word true haue lately wound woman greater dangerous must suffer indanger life farre last yet shall cause proceede owne rashnesse shall repent ti late time past know meanes might haue preuented doe may good aduise alter determination iourney morea stead goe straight ciprus must finish inchantment returne come hither bring company release shall bee able aduise doth yet darken part knowledge hee remaind much perplext word yet well affliction would permit hee made shew patience mellissea send one maides bring companion hoping sight discourse fortune would little remoue melancholie meane time hee crossed armes walkt vp downe gallerie musing himselfe hee farre deadlily fall himselfe cause owne miserie able though hee best vnderstanding reach misterie sometimes lady discoursed ciuilitie answere yet ofttimes content attend owne leisure replie much power passion ouer thus hee remaind molested steriamus following right hand way brought fine plaine thence foote mountaine hee found rich pillers marble many signes magnificent building sight wrought pitie remembring glorious seemd haue throwne downe ruine said hee fortune faire braue shew cast low despaire losse pamphilia goddesse soule accept mee yet last thy seruant yet thy priest altar thy scorne daily offer vp sacrifice true spotlesse loue heart shall bee offering teares water miserable body temple thy hate cruellest disdaine enemy layes waste yet consider greatest beautie mightiest rich sumptuousest building haue end brightest glory cannot euer dure goodnesse must ill haue grant thy rage must need conclude yet thus paine find conclusion little hee went among ruines hee laid himselfe downe threw himselfe among poore destroyed reliques rarest temple hard hee heard ollorandus likewise complaining melasinda said hee iustly maist thou blame thy ollorandus still trauels thee stroue bring thy loue still neerest canst thou imagine thy immaculate affection well bestowed great neglect requiteth wilt thou maist thou thinke treasure thy loue richest gift well bestowed absence paiment mee thou dost iustly except yet doth hold thee killing slaue setting thy deare soule libertie thy vertues like murderer must bee destiny must onely worke despairing sorrow tyre selfe steriamus wanting pitie knew misse therefore would bee charitable hee could shew goodnesse rose went ollorandus put mourning againe entring waylings telling long amphilanthus hee start vp behold dolorindus came sadly towards called together went place meaning ascend mountaine came seruant mellissea intreating company mistrisse pallace meete companion soone consented inuitation whither come told aduentures one another brought faire roome eaten mellissea againe thus spake lord time call vpon occasion presence required seuerall place wherefore first lord steriamus must say must haste hence desire owne happie end loue obserue aduise goe hence arcadia feare nothing shall encounter harme dolorindus doe like much requisite thence goe saint maura rocke lie iust towards cephalonia priuately remaine till fortune call thence helpe shall appeare death may seeme hard terrible feare since shall bring happinesse goe greece againe helpe friend selfe conquest albania tooke hand kist swearing obey counsell amphilanthus sorry vow especially iourney staid morea hee made cause griefe parting friend ollorandus shee thus spake good shall come must proceede braue king shall giue vnto securitie life onely loue life hee shall venture saue hazard himselfe keepe together still loues firme constant assisting one another time bee shall merit amphilanthus giuing great gift credit say true meanes receiued armour forrest fast sleeping laid haue taken name knight forrest lord thinke carefull though haue left last yet say little feare nothing diamond cleare hard find may yet piercd one kind hath ingrauen loue pure spotlesse white deepe still endure wrought teares neuer resting paine carud sharpest point cursd disdaine raine oft doth wash away slender marke teares make mine firmer one small sparke straw may make fier sparkes loue kindles incessantly moue cruelst doe onely pleasure take make faster tyd scornes sharpe stake ti harder companion hee generall selarinus generall horse prince corinth elis place reserued serieant maior commander archer many braue knight bold men went along loue ambition honor many preferment rendeuous cariapaiary confines macedon farr distant riuer de oda met romanian armie led lisandrinus desired came antissius see braue warrs receiue knighthood amphilanthus hee soone left army find promising receiued honor would haue would returne euer thus marched brauery might euery one striuing sumptuous expresse loues respect generall generally beloued prince except cousen brother euery one wearing colour honor oringtawny white thither came place meeting also achaian ledd leandrus hee visited sister againe seene aged father followed armie gone ouertooke comming towne much ue affection himselfe generall hee came rosindy hee receiued louing welcome euer could imagine glorie might heere haue seeene height perfection magnanimous spirit braue vnconquered men vndaunted souldiers rich gallantry euery respect best excellent souldiers true souldiers excellentest men thus could wisht army together ioynd none refused passage willingly yeelded rid force loue feare made free open way till came within skirt macedon met poore resistance till came great plaine neere riuer deuoda saw great army intelligence knew vsurper went neare discretion would permit considering night grew iudicially prouided army generall himselfe going settle euery quarter right place expert learning art souldier hee could iustly tell compasse ground would serue one hundred thousand hee setled returned tent hee prince commander supped consulting would fittest bee done next day many opinion giuen set vpon king army selarinus liked said hee wee stranger hope power armie wee ouerthrowne lost v hee loose day hee owne country may haue aide instantly brought therefore thinke fitter let vrge v v presse fight besides question hee doe wee bee forward let v patiently goe temper greater bee benefit rosyndie much commended aduise resolued bee perswaded thus sate came trumpet clotorindus defie challenge fight next morning accepted hower appointed eight clocke thus euery one betooke themselues rest hoping next dayes victorie soone day appeared rosyndie tooke horse rid armie aduising intreating commanding vsing faire word intreaties peremptorie authoritie kind hee found subiects must bee vsed iudgement bred onely loue feare admiration heart see great vnderstanding vnusuall exc llencie yeares ready armie hee ord rd thus foote hee diuided three body vanguard led himselfe accompanied leandrus maine battel selarinus accompanied lisandrinus reare graue marshall went loue person sonne lesarino horse reason aduantage found place put either side wing righthand wing giuen tolimandro left prince elis foote placed flanke horse horse put diuision clotorindus put men much kind charged vantguard macedonian led braue valiant gentleman called thesarenus prince sparta brauely spirit day hardly bin lost least soone wonne rosyndie vantguard charged macedonian cruell fight morean horse first defeated vantguard broken disordered selarinus perceiuing came mainebattaile succour brauely hee found rosindie fighting hee made walles dead men owne killing round cast vp purpose safetie list roped combate hee young phalerinus prince thessalonica delicately brauely held hee yet encountred wearinesse besides seeing new succour come forced yeeld rosindy taking armes stead disarming taking word stead sword noble act bred loue young prince towards hee prooued true faithfull subiect vnto rosindy selarinus haste battaile ouerthrowne vantguard required come vp reare stranger aduance macedonian horse great moreans worst last valour selarinus leandrus changed white armour innocent cullour reuengefull bloud lisandrinus prince corinth elis marshall sonne especiallie iudgement mixt true vallour care matched excellent skill rosindy victorie came side shamefull flight clotorindus execution great indured long conquest greater bootie verie rich thus losse tenne thousand one side thirtie retreit sounded next day dead side buried rosindy braue troope marched towards thessalonica queene towne vsurpe got purpose strength yet trick saue himselfe keep crowne neither must doe braue generall set downe thessalonica incompa sing round cutting victuall land blocking sea ship hindred good aide making rare cruell siege rosindy endure length much paine longing soule see lady within time hee great longing hee satisfied sight turnd sorrow desire ioy see changed griefe wishing hee seene cause affliction hee termed proouing terrible thrice sally made forth besieged little purpose meant come forth honourd wound vanquished mightie enemy one day saw white flag vpon wall gaue vnderstand parly demanded beating likewise drum rosindy manner answere came vpon wall prince companion wall clotorindus speake thus great prince rosyndie braue prince companion iniustice doe goe seeking depriue mee mine owne neuer wronged would haue denied haue serued owne person meanes requird seeke take kingdome mee lawfully right next heire male besides mine marriage meriana daughter heire terme crowne exception take let friend kinsman marriage gaine peace haue owne made enemie desire end cruell warres let accepted cosin frendship taken proferd friend rather thus continue shedding bloud let conclusion welcome trumpet drummes turnd musick ioy demand selfe friend please wife cosin infinitely grieued haue owne bloud seeke shed bloud deare husband husband false traytor replid rosindy whose matchlesse worth well knowes selfe cannot abuse knowledge truth yeeld treasure base place neuer staine thy wronging cannot liue vndoe bestowing one vild treache ous thy selfe thy friendship refuse answere friend present contemning thy basenesse wee hate selues thought thy submission punish thee could come heart thy false tale marriage loath heare since falshood wee hate thee thou sayst wee haue iust quarrell monster iustice bee required taking armes putting downe rebell traytor rightfull princesse alliance thou claimest acknowledge none cause enough haue made v ruine thee framing false report wronging thy filthie tongue thy queene queene true vertue macedon therefore recant deliuer vow fire towne breake open gate let iust reuenge thee thee requitall kindnesse said clotorindus farewell doe thy worst proud prince thy fond companie take thee towne bee wonne thy heart shall ake euer wound could come neare thee bring wound thy fond loue went wall stead white flag presently bloudy one h ng forth continued till next day place meriana brought infinite number armed men dressed wedding crowne head haire downe sight army drawne rosindy hast greedily beholding beauty hearkning speech clotorindus thou hast confesse pittie thee since thou free mee miserable liuing thanke thee rosindy hope shall requi e commend best last loue farewell braue prince bee thus confident iust inclosed round circle often seeking hinder last speech presently shee rosindies sight presently againe brought extreamest miserie onely peerelesse head seene set vpon pillar pillar vpon top pallace haire hanging length delicacie rosindy rest time lull passion rest restlesse affliction long hee spake last hee cryed arme assault wicked towne went hee head armie gate engine guided furie next morning broke open iudgement gouerned able perswade themselues could haue compassed gate open furious rage mercilesse crueltie proceeded sparing one creature met hasting take downe head dearest loue hope hee came thither hee saw taken away also crueltie vniust said hee wilt thou suffer mee see wretched fate must bee barred taking yet last kisse thy deare though pale dead lipps seale last life hee complained thus yet griefe increased rage hee came pallace hee found clotorindus hall dagger hand soone hee saw hellish countenance hee looked curst voyce said thy victorie shall yet neuer bee honoured death mine owne hand shall bee brought mee stabd hee himselfe many place bodie fell prince scorning touch commanded souldiers take throw ditch esteeming good buriall went hee hoping despaire know soule parted bodie remaine meaning place make tombe consume pine die hee went many roomes found bodie went hee gallerie hee first spake throwing himselfe vpon ground kissing place weeping woe selarinus staid hinder anie rash sudden attempt hee might make vpon himselfe leandrus rest made safe towne tooke people left mercie rosindies name lying thus last start vp cry hee heard lady call helpe selarinus doubting vnrulie passion mistrusting friend seeing vehemency passion hoping truth followed till hee came tower end g llery hee also heard voice pitifully complaining last hearing bring forth word rosindy iustly hast thou dealt royally performd thy word wretch shall doe soe thee heere must consume dayes vnknowne thee wald vp misery famine die enough two braue men make new comfort new strength relieue wherfore rosindy cryd dost thou liue meriana heere thy faithfull loue seruant come rescue thee lord said neuer happyer time quickly giue life sight ran selarinus downe ioy call helpe rosindy examining euery place might find fittest come throw downe wall new feare tooke might doe hurt greater danger must auoyded lesse taken soldier came threw downe wall rosindy still cry take heed came last blow place resolued end day amphilanthus replied honor gaine braue gentleman friendship euer finde ambitious expresse loue said assuredly neuer aduentured throne loue blushing told true ala lord said haue hope winne told king whole story loue beseeching assist promised doe purpose take way rodes deliuering father sollicit suit extreamly louing hee kissed king hand thus euery one remaind contented vrania longing see parselius yet daring demand thing till one day first iourney shee prettily began pamphilia taking occasion vpon owne discourse shall heare euery one resolues going homeward bee imagind louing lucenia whose heart almost burst spite rage shewed king himselfe came take leaue telling must ill fortune part finished brought thither answerd true finished knowledge doubted many end foolish creature selfe el said neuer beene deluded flattery neuer said protested performd folly said deceiue selfe wrong mine owne worth letting loue much expresse selfe giue aduantage losse first sued leauing mee might haue beene falshood onely turnd shame losse sorry said hee shall part thus much displeasure since know fauourd cannot right said shee goe gone neuer thinke vnlesse owne conscience call vpon hope replyd amphilanthus ouerburdened weight since euer obey braue lady farewell well shee would wish much good shee hated onely making small reuerence parted prince going king queenes attended king ciprus bringing sea morning taking shipp presenting shepherd shepherdess plaines manner sang sported great delight especially pamphilia much louing poetry liked pretie expression loues caused twise song banquet made vpon sand serud harmelesse people written two songes one dialogue deliuered betweene neate fine shepheard dainty louing lasse sh deare doe thy winning eye sens wholly tye sense sight wherein lye change variety sh change choice thee new delight try sh change choose thee changed mine eye absent see breake tyes sh euer flye perfection lie must yet try thy loue change sh thy heart neuer mooue thought ill strange say dye sh neuer could thy loue estrange dead canst thou loue hope life fledd sh vertue beauty faith thee liue though thou dead beauty dye sh lye minde richly spedd thou dost speake faire kind cannot chose trust sh none vn chaste minde euer vniust thus rest true possest loue without mistrust delicate mayd sweet voyce owne louely weetnes vsuall plentifulnesse sang ong seemd fa ne loue hauing great qua ell loue art thou vaine thought mindes fancy wrought idle smile thee beget fond wish made nett many fooles haue caught loue art thou light faire fresh morning cleere thayre soone thy euening change make thy worth coldnesse range still thy ioy mixt care loue art thou sweet flowre full blowne dead houre dust winde staid remaines thy pleasure gaines thy humour change lowre loue art thou childish vaine firme bubble made raine wantonnesse thy greatest pride foule fault thy vertues hide babe staydnesse gaine loue art thou causelesse curst yet ala worst much thee may bee said thy law obayd therefore say first much commended lady well liked onely amphilanthus seemd take loues part blame mayde accusing vniustly especially describing much lightnesse satisfie spruce shepherd began song others keeping burden begin blame loue since loue world moue loued despaird scarce handsomenesse card since much refind new framd tate mind blame loue since loue world moue truth loue beguild haue blinde childish stild let none persist since iudging iudgement mist blame loue chaos appeare nothing yet seemd cleare light could descride crowne light tide blame loue truth doth delight honour shine bright reason selfe doth loue approue make v selues loue blame could past time begin would commit sin liue houre loue since loue make v perfect proue blame infinitely please braue king cunningly many sweet voyces sung banquet ended tooke leaue kind king ciprus company rest taking ship pamphilia sailing directly rodes receiued vnspeakable afflicted man hee except selfe losse thought rather said offended v aduenturing well might considering folly lost nay said allimarlus come hee cause blame hauing committed great error himselfe told hee story past drinking water much knew heard others heard came pamphilia amphilanthus went discourse vrania resolued assured affection much ioyd absence grew terrible afflict delos came whose milkewhite rockes looked smooth ioy receiue within girdle world treasure worth presence richer treasure within tooke directly pallace entring vault meeting graue melissea maides ca rying torch white waxe conducted prince garden hope feare know fortune vrania desiring know selfe pamphilia resolued whether gaine loyalty amphilanthus enioy antissius longing assured hee haue selarina much desired knowledge gaining affection growne betweene shee verily perswade selfe selfe little king beckned enchanted garden allimarlus must meanes gaind shepheardesse thus expecting perissus happily enioying continue pallace graue hermit must next haue time tell story distressed parselius manner beginning louing afflicted sonne heare poore friend say name detareus borne dalmatia lord ragusa bred courtier accordingly thriued repentance last best fortune court liued good fauour king honoured office steward house child content last wife died best happinesse ala soone fell misery increase greater sharpnes thus springing owne best remaining comfort calld chamber dearest daughter bellamira name gouerne seruants hauing beauty fit bait catch misfortune bring king liked perceiuing hasted bestow great heire called treborius happily liued king still louing louer seeking meanes gaine mind neuer spared feasting occasion draw company court yet must otherwise none opinion present husband also extreamely fauoured outward show house often visited maiesty saw seeing wiues vertue spotlesse ouerlookt temptation two glass set see side noblenesse worthy chastitie much adoe eye beheld spake admired discerning last gaue ouer court scorning bee vsed slight dishonour mine retyrd hauing fit occasion visit court likewise country sport faild giue delight ofttimes louing husband oft mee must bee crost fit subiects liue content prince pleased break sent embassador italy king naples father glory prince matchles cosin husband employed another way hoping win absence herein deceiued would haue shadow time afforded wherefore went husband thereby plot hindred king immoderate affection crossed whereby misery increased embassage fell loue lady whose sweetnes delicacie able haue made troylus false lady loued lady happiest destiny vnwisely coniectured loued ala husband terrible wretched barre way loose wicked enioyings coueted yet ordered affaire wee came haue priuate conference many seuerall meeting lady apulia one enioying death life missing death bin sweeter haue bin prised went court saw came thither assemblie entertainement wee liked loued enioyed faile seeke meanes win keepe husband fauour way blessing hee embraced truly must confesse vsed mee well matter end deceiuing haue sorry haue abusd trust shall say know loue therefore braue sir pardon rather relation mee much power affection mee drew time stay last weauing longest web faining occasion could allow mee spider loue working come affliction loue yet happinesse end time grew departing word may iustly vse since like death selfe mee passionate seruant house inuited way home wee yet hauing remaind rome thither wee went made many dayes iourneyes wee could still win time last wee arriued want none fault onely found continuall company good man disliked yet wee conuersed freely well wee might hee free noble courtesie could desire expression fully contented wherefore wee would venture cost hee lying wife night reason care lest continuall businesse might disquiet hauing notice bed sweete silence spread sleepe ouer house rose lodging softly went vnto chamber found sleeping comming bed side shee awaked shee blame mee yet truly belieue hazard put selfe shee accused chid selfe shee cruelly reiect mee though earnestly intreated nay coniurd sudden retyring howers yeelded vnto taking leaue sad dying affection foreseene ensuing harme thus happened rising lighted candle careleslie mind onlie aduenture left burning cubbord chamber light miserable mischance wasting selfe ruine burned selfe able sustaine mallice falling downe throw mee bottome destruction tooke hold carpet setting fire blaze aspiring ende fired hanging hating iniurie guest honoured done owne lord angrie flame made testimony loyaltie master giuing knowledge light see fault bee torch conducting vnto misery fire great smoke greater hastily flew call witness innocency raised seruants master carefull sent chamber call safetie respecting wife dearest went himselfe saue doore vnwelcome meeting encountring mee robber honor hee stood still truth must euer say hee beheld mee rather orrow fury would suffer witnesse ill seeing vnarmd onely cloake intreated passe next roome seeming cheerefull enough el tooke care house preserue possible brought vnto suit cloathes hauing caused make selfe ready together went forth vnnoted well wee might considering businesse saue place destruction wee came faire field teares thus aid till neuer misfortune acquainted worst offence breach true law friendship since falne wretchedest experience must like miserable seeke way cannot deny haue deserud death worst kind yet though may haue yet leaue fault brauest manner wipe away staine cannot washed bloud cleansed ende take sword throwing one mee said defend selfe besought put triall deserud fauour wishd selfe onely hee would honor giuing death spare wife shamefull attempt vertuous vntouchd onely shooke head fetching deepe groane bid leaue speach goe conclusion must bee death wee fought part much foule guiltinesse thought strength cunning good vnderstanding abandond hee furious reuengefull preceiud greedy ende pursued onely held sword offend defend till descernd farre could come part v likewise seeing ran fiercely must either lay selfe open take death holding sword giue end vnwillingly forcd frailty flesh apparent danger alwaies kindest selfe saw came iust take vp body ala followed poore lady extremity shame bringing shew shame seeing slaine cryd spare wofull cause misery let last thus farre blessd hand sent againe vnto sinne mine haue parted neuer let detestable offence rest vnpunished shame call vpon call satisfaction seruants amazedly beheld v till neuer ceasing accusing selfe vrging death seeing could get kneeled downe taking cold kisse lip doubly dead affection pale death suddenly rose vp rising taking sword furious hatefull spite selfe wrong done threw selfe vpon falling downe vpon ioyning manner broken vow againe new one end seruants finde cause whereupon set would yeeld goe choosing de iring rather dye outliue shame happy contrary wish destinie slew left two dead body fell complaint sorrow shame could procure cry affliction hath iudgd self excelld misery haue end death gaue selfe many wound neuer ceasing wounding wounded soule abided body least soule humane sense onely proud others following master mistris found v entertainment wound palenesse mixt bloud outside stead naturall habitation veines hauing made open flouds drowne themselues riuer may swell selfe loose owne name yeeld greater owne pride body carried away mine remaind like tatterd ensigne rather glory gaine losse poore thing charible man louing goodnesse yet louing goodnesse sake make haue better ending bloud tooke martyrd body away bathing many fine curiosity brought mee know liud knowing dayly dying little cell hee recouerd health able goe thence longer would stay ability goe away discouerd nothing selfe passed left sense till recouering generall report burnd fewe said murdred agreed lost true agreement left apulia hermit cloathes roamd vp downe till lighted place neuer finding could content mee since became poore daughter misfortune blessing giue account feare worst since one day one instant one planet gouernd gaue birth onely yeares differing time haue since remaind till neuer disclosed selfe would haue done freedome first ingagd repentance hath beene blessed delight hauing enioyed plentifully comfortably euer ioy soules sir see misery hath beene sparing affliction haue faild greatest bounty excessiuenesse comfort happy repentance rule giues sweeter consolation worldly pleasure could glorious painting giue liking parselius againe grieue yet comfort sprung hard frost flowres though dead may appeare liuing retaining warmth roote breast might gray haires know change misaduentures pure content thus continued sometimes parselius wayling sometimes hermit relating story past hee bent comfort dispaire though sometimes little mooud hope small strength life hath last gaspe must steriamus companion find way destined reliefe following course ordained took sea toward st maura steriamus euer bringing sight sweetnesse brauenesse pamphilia blessing mellissea sending heauen ioy see fauour speake happinesse kisse hand shee mildly permitting said steriamus shalt thou end happily thy destiny bee since thou hadst kind parting thy better selfe beheld sea calme smooth gaue quiet passage said appeard mistris gently letting good come vnto passe vnto vnlooked content dearest loue doth sweetnesse better fit truest sweetnesse dwels harsh cruelty night possesse still one brightned fauour faire moone seemd chastly behold selfe smooth face sea yet sometimes left plainnes rising catching face loue embrace rather keepe dwelling wherein shee deceiud fauours euer free though lent possessd euer thus greedy said chastly refused yet sight bring verse minde pray thee diana tell mee ill doe say thou thinkst loue think thou pleased art proue since ioyfull light thy dwelling still doth fill thou seemst angry cheerefull smile beholdst passion chaste indeed thy face doth seeme doth shine glorious grace loues trust loue beguiles bright still chast cleerest queene shine torment pittying eye thy coldnesse despaires discry faith thy clearenesse better seeme let haue heat dally sunne scarse haue knowne warmer state shade yet hottest beames zeale haue purely made selfe offring burnt wonne sacrificd ash remaine iuory box truth inclose innocency whence ruines flowes accept thine ti chast loues gaine hauing done said dolorindus whose thought busily employd kinde come within sight st maura wherefore steriamus demanded marriners knew white rocke long boate carried vnto landing departed prince taking topp viewing ruines admiring doe desolatnesse found man place man bide saue one little caue went sitting downe afresh discoursed fortune steriamus relating companion manner liuing pantaleria little caue youth touched pantaleria could passe ouer without passionate remembrance liued free therefore hee called happy delightfull pantaleria would crie remaind thee lord selfe quiet content dayes past hunting countrie delight waste hunted affliction paine knew surfetting pleasure yet proued man esteeming change greater happinesse braue parselius rarest woman except lady released ignorance bringing world riper misery fruite happinesse comparison woe prince suffer doth remaine country life pantaleria would still remaind thee would neuer knowne delight still springing thee like thy dainty flower tender grasse increased plenty sweetnes corrected little height time got tender sheep sorrowes abound cruelty dearest loue cruell loue ah cruelst cruelty end tyranny let tyrannie end ending cursed enioy glimmering hope put darker night sorrow parting el might haue left sweet morea pamphilia smiled loue inuited sterud againe feasted mee poysond forcing drinke absence said dolorindus doe lament alone appointed suffer alone indure affliction couetously hoard vnto treasure belongs men call loue tyrant greater taking away inheritance others friend haue much right misery liuing great excesse hauing large possession gouernment spare liberty complaine permit mee say misfortune much mine like fellow subiects let v bewaile weight vniust tyranny pardon mee deare friend said would wholly take ill selfe since free worthy people fittest beare creature framd vassalage loue crueltie since aske liberty bewaile take let bring freedome redoubles breast mine tell mee woe know speake woe selfe speaking vnto dolorindus beginning set order louers sighes teares began discourse thus free knowledge harme hap meete lady hunting great forrest attended many braue gentleman knight womanlike excellent riding left lady rather left able attend surpassing quality young affecting sport fell company marking braue diana chase shee followed stagge though hee tooke pride pursued make follow stoutly commanded attendance yet cowardly flying thinking better trust speed mercy yet rewarded last fit merit standing bay threaten doggs euen face gazing stroke crossebow heart weepingly hee fell downe feete groaning vnkindnesse yet cruelst blow gaue shee likewise wound breast came admiring hurt admired seeing could liue vnwounded praisd hound truly hunted praisd mine eye neuer fault till brought home honor day losse poore heart hunted mine eye vnto bay right done doggs rewarded alone vnsatisfied great gift shee nobly intreated company goe vnto house agreed vnto selfe vnknowne tooke way boldly aduenturing inuitation sat downe dinner discourse still vpon sport morning stagge afforded gaue poore assistance hauing bred abroad learning armes vnexperienced huntsman marked accordingly made vse telling mee sure hunting pleasing want exercise made vnskilfull discourse said latter true reason till day neuer saw sport though knowne field delight many sort fell discourse martiall thing excellently learned art knowledge way scanting thus dinner past horse againe brought forth waited v went forth see haukes flee spending afternoone delight inuiting v againe supper choyce musique bestowed vpon v well best serue best beloued selfe ala proud hurt mee making mee see greater losse loue like se pent poysoning ioyes biting best day venomd blisse making new prisd wound death hope sorrow soule pitie wanted pitie sought pity durst ask thus griefe take make abiding commiseration mark aimed feare held hand saw faire delicate therfore imagined soft pity within sweet cage yet eies powerful might gaue command none dare claime rich blisse ouerwhelmed cruelst spite nature could inflict vpon man remaind fild youthfull bashfulnesse ouerswaied humblest heart disaster glorying patient suffering excessiuenesse sorrow flowing time part would remaine must hide selfe longer stay vnknowne husband returne iourney made vnto neighbour ile wherefore thought amisse company gone take time thus spake vnto must say turne giue offence accursed would thinke time word go vtter comming man wholly deuoted seruice hope produce end directed may make blessed blessing descend one much vnblest yet self time wherin haue enioied full outward ioy beholding hath yet brought loues attendant losse feare losse libertie tyed wholly wil feare heart despise loue cause affection challenge none gratitude giue self stranger name may make scorne knowing worth boldnesse fitting contempt yet may cast stranger seruant sonne king humblest louer dolorindus lookes manifest breeding curst reply little smoothed tempest rage wi h sober reuerence demanded pardon vsing respect yet lord said fault may sooner pardoned since twas cause againe solicit modestly confidently much refusd husband arriued knowing mee gaue free noble welcome sought still induce man loue company seeke hee also hauing end surely might gaine might compasse mine chast reply curious preseruing honour word last obtaine loue equall measure mine without compare equald thus continued yeeres mirth sport negropont still castle maskes iusts hunting nothing bee thought plenty house selfe though sonne vnto king yet sister inherit kingdome much lookt le mind shee rule gaind meanes freedome lesse ouerseers action maske wee wherein lady came whose ill twas fal loue violently flame grew dangerous refusd woman hate deadliest expect consented iust disdaine deare selfe merit hate could stirre mee ill feare lest would blaze vnto hurt made yeeld content two straites would haue asked leaue told cause yet might purchase doubt denied certaine hurt ensued auoid kindly vse word spake onely loue wish vnderstand still tooke selfe thus well could well long last well grew worst ill ill woe loues husband grew doubt wife well might though assured truly might faith yet could shee sometime shew dislike sought win aspire riuall loue made secret deare affection seen long laine close wrapped vp alone knowledge soules hee sooner found hee straight studdied skill reuengd yet seeme still ignorant plot thus wicked practise began solemne feast hee made last twelue whole dayes reason alleaged old man say whose skill great art diuination twas held neuer liue fiftie yeares age time expired feast cause appointed many lady thither inuited lord many knight win faire lady rest amorous lady came whose welcome loue like vnto grieud shee saw shee displease eye firmely held heart lord whose name redulus neuer shewed better cheere heart neuer foule thought ulled base framd trick first show candle light neither masque properly one thing mingle diuers sort sate betweene two whose loues seuerall kindes held lady intruth mixd little feare violence heated dislike one loue yet force shewd two faith sincere affection choyce dissembled faignd respect chosen husband watching catching many seuerall watch close look spider flyes number web wit begin play part allotted selfe throw spitefull iarre among v three effected diuili h meanes flouting lady soule best loued telling shee made choyce hee could blame since hee prince dainty youth neate courtly knight delicate amorous hee bee ene without admiring louing yet truely wife said better doe deserue loue since haue loued haue many partner loue speake iealousie angry displeased onely pitty deceiud courtier know loue choyce mistress ala lucke haue fall snare loue couzened loue
