power resist hee made yet sayd melinea loues assuredly imagine bee deceiud sweet melinea said redulus neuer man passionately affect dolorindus doth see sleight nay passion faile would sweare man violently loue hee sigh folded armes stealing lookes discouers hee feeles haue seene talkd kissd hand throw euen soule eye surely lord said shee cannot see doe speake onely trye would proue vnworthy ioyne doubt good faire protest said hee speake belieue know yet assurd loue greater cause shee euer bend thinke loue prince name able attract chastborne aide know loues heate force loue strong affection ioynd win woman take heede faire maid loue power though gainsaid second time come armes make chastest thought contribute taxe beene chamber markd piercing dart hee sent lookes loue beene enough burne heart would contend yeelding make ioy glory greater pride euer ioy know found verse hee hath made giuen mistresse may ghesse estate restlesse burning soule continues flaming vtter shame ruine name tooke hee forth verse indeed doe confesse made vnfortunately lost line gaue full assurance truth bred true hate v though stroue couer dissemble show sorrow onely griefe yet hee perceiud hauing eye art directed diuellish wit found hee seeke wrought hee still last came practise end happened day feast full conclusion haplesse kind iealous despightfull melinea dancing begin purpose let paper fall selinea must bee next take vp soone opening discerned hand subiect line loue true ala falsly held firmest thought onely bent dedicated affection zeale zealous loue negligence seeking confirme trust confident loue made ala belieue soone paper faigned anger snatched quickly mistris shee blushing said melinea thought beene one much giuen poetry till made said shee sighing said know shee looked mee cruell eye yet affection went though shadowed scorne might pitty calld strake heart sunder sight mee cryed haue framd spoyle fortune haue procurd blisse telling could vtter speach tyed power greater might ala euer take penne hand traytor ioy griefe made guilty seeme shame silence possesse distracted sens false made appeare dauncing went still best like heart ruld feete sad walking pace plot well forward hee wrought still finding fault nimbler sport came intreated take wife begin delightfull daunce hee saw griefe found drift two hated mee death disorderd onely lost thus passd night morning come part directed word giuen meeting faine would haue spoken shee thought false auoided gaue liberty say farewell euen teares loath behold late loud cast downe eye gracing one poore looke though disgracefull yet beene welcome sweetest smile euer louer ioyd loue thus parted dispaire losse yet meant leaue mistris quickly found meanes visit continuing still cruell frownes mee got yet liberty care watch speake although minde cruell fiercest lyon enragd famine bring forth word false man said shee haue yet enough deceipt hath come vnto mine eye false else loud still would haue diligently cleerd doubt thinke enough sufficiently afflicted fault would intice paine glory iniustice make triumphes ill blaze world sinne ingratitude change done hope winne againe none lucklesse vnblessed soule trust cruell worst falsest changing sexe said force could hold wherefore feare rage let goe remaining like creature metamorphosd stone yet last went chamber framd lamentable line let see cruelly shee scorne strange mistaking martyrd mee deliuered shee tooke word ile reade said shee onely perceiue well vaine continues change please ile messenger giue melinea selfe wounded mee sharpest sword ala grew mishapp hating much loud desird loue selfe well refraine shew eye much false ingratitude dwell sake shee would onely doe like mee keeping sight least seeing see shame would foule fault hate men loues besought recall said fixed went thence mourned vnseene last father miserie called succour done againe sought gaine pardon ala vaine resolud nothing griefe shunnd promisd loathed sight husband dyed woe offered marriage sought vassallike desire nothing mooud vntill loue againe take anew conquest heart making contrary liking shee till publishd choose braue yong lord truth worthy man contrary outward markes heretofore said could winne loue saw knew hope left countrey blaming fate thus made causelesly accursed farewell said deere lady soule farewell loue wayward sex iudgement liues shallow outward sight curst man put least trust certainely ficklest weather hath staidnesse feather profit drop raine snow melt spoile onely thus departed married last sake vowed done manly constancy hold true loyall oath neuer loue chuse creature light kinde generally woman bee best alone good shes pleasd giue equall loue suspitious xe fondly ignorant know truth least truth shew fault base suspecting without cause stay stay said steriamus grow curst louelyest sweetest happiest birth euer earth beare mother woman must fauourd blessed braue posterity woman blame dearest soules comfort soules loue aboundance made farre crost blame loue scorne surely scorne perfect griefe charitable aske pardon sinne neuer giue name suffer blessed creature sustaine great abuse rage layes thus deep almost collerick dispute worth woman kinde parselius hermit arriue went day together foode heard men voyces lowde went caue end argument kind conclusion straite parselius discouered deare louing friend likewise teares ioy embraced altogether remaind loue relating still fortune passe away time pleasant sweet content paine truly borne ioy gaind name offerd pamphil hasteth homeward greatest lady must dispatch guest queene bra e beauty true worth pamphilia thinking long heare fate loue yet daring modesty aske coueted vnderstand fai gnd desire returne againe vnto people expected also truth therefore iust excuse lady knowing thing also found drift yet finely striue couer wherefore one day dinner newly done tooke company roome fairest best furnishd place witty sleight diuided windowes pretty place euery one sunder friend one imagining tother came shee pamphilia thus spake rarest woman true loyalty know longing proceeds loue grieue doe cannot blessed power tell happinesse seeke destiny gouernes liues hath thus ordaind might happy power wedd daintinesse feare hinder cannot finde shall marry yet affect many affliction must vndergoe woman kinde beware better speed pamphilia onely sighd turnd blushing face vnto window lady went vnto vrania thus discoursd fayrest sweetest leaue lament ignorance estate know daugher mighty king sister brauest liuing prince honour knight glory country renowned amphilanthus manner reason losse shall bee brought fitter place loue ala must say destinie foretels shall happy enioy first death apparance must possesse dainty bodie shall reuiue loue another loue yet good great hee bee offended fate bee displeased since though must change iust change bringing alike disquieted lady left impatient ill went pamphilia shee found still without speech one would say fixd like heauen world thought motion griefe vrania likewike vexd soule shewd face small content shee knew stood gazing others face shining day starre stood still looke glasse bloud left cheek sunke heart sent pitty downe comfort last assured confidence come plead part sate spake mellissea passd vnto king shee onely told faire vrania sister although deare yet make liue contentedly none else must throw rocke st maura sea feare doe said shee must make liue forget vnfortunate loue vertue water hath loue assure hee blessd certaine heart could bring yet said nay say cryd enough let enioy ile feare ill prophesies tell went window hee found sad sweet couple comforted kissing sister eye ioy telling pamphilia happy yet ollorandus came perissus queen mellissea assuredly foretold constant happy dayes antissius ioyfullst man aliue lucky fortune giuen loue well bee well beloud gaine sought happily still continue like selarina well might said others happiest state good allimarlus louing loue promise obtaine blessd best blessing belong thus resolud thinke returne pamphilia homewards need would take way amphilanthus gaind much last helpe faire vrania rest resolud see morea first therfore sent mellisander vnto pamphilia satisfie councell course assure speedy coming seene father court kind farewell left delos soone landing messenia royall troope came aged king whose ioy expresselesse grown see company glory part much welcome faire vrania glad heart see knew would bring comfort content vnto father beloued friend feast proclaimd throughout kingdom iusts exercise brought forth welcome braue prince court pamphilias honour honouring rest yet could ioy though ioyes plentifully bare accepting inioyed giue least delight whose wounded heart feede vpon sore lately giuen cursed foretelling loosing fate garden wood old sad walke therefore went sadly againe complaine ala pamphilia said shee lucklesse soule cruell planet gouernd thy birth plague borne thee thee thou must haue vertue loose thereby yet ti one deere loue maintaine thy force well heart rule still thou hast worthy deseruing loue breath lord true loue ioy pamphilia thy choice though henceforth thy loue slighted ioy time esteemeth went shee ash sad sonnet ingraued vnder writ teares time flow mirth well sorrow pardon againe doe borrow thy moist rine smiling drop approouing ioy true ioy proceeds louing past heard follow wherefore looking backe discernd vrania amphilanthus straight returnd walked vp downe wood til amphilanthus aduised sit downe laying mantle grasse two incomparable princess laid themselues vpon king casting himselfe feete though man truth perfection world held yet truth made know honourd laying head vranias lap holding pamphilia hand began discourse well liked past great part day together pamphilia still desiring tell aduentures hee passing finely honour great modestly vsing victory relation gaining hee spake steriamus finding passion pretily neither could procure much fauor offend telling yet still hasten end discourse whit dislikt vrania desird stil heare particularly known fortune haue together last king proceeded comming iland cald stalamine anciently lemnos said lady called nerena woman ignorantly proud euer mine eye saw lady ill fortune fall loue steriamus poore man fetter affection seemd rather new torture pleasure yet left suite telling princesse descended king romania absolute lady iland honor knew truly honour loue told twere credit sure sparingly silently modest much boldnesse proclaime affection stranger said shee euer man fondly shew olly till refuse profferd loue princesse one man would marriage bee happy bee onely chosen blessing said hee truly ashamed see impudent pride sexe reuerenced let know farre exceede limit truth vnderstanding vainely oueresteeming selfe assure loue princesse whose feete worthy kisse name fond tongue see image old time adoration heare oracle yet woman indeed perfectest serue contrarie call creature said steriamus vext plainly cald fury flung house two day wee staid afterwards euer came shee perplexing still leauing place quiet till got name made shee vow see follow till shee could win letting proud heart bow nothing loue wherein power loue truely manifested would sorry said pampilia see vpon termes since must fild much spite malice behold wish said vrania since rare thing surely see amorous lady thus pleasantly passed till thought time attend king houre still came forth hal found aduenture soone following last spake king set entred lady beauty attended ten knight tawny selfe likewise apparreld colour page rest seruants hauing liuerie knight halfe way state stood still making guard princesse passe went directly king making modest low reuerence thus spake although maiesty may well wonder first comming cause yet hope excuse bring pleade iustification assured vnknowne although one greatest christned king loues power command ouer heart power scorne much yeelding hath made subiect though borne absolute whatsoeuer seeme yet princesse lady sweet rich stalamine ala iland mine came three knight knight call honor title esteeming higher title prince rarest prince heare namd wil confesse one heart betraying self neuer toucht vnto subiectio loue wherof bin fortunat able see happines falle vnto might haue iustly boasted hee slighting better iudgement would haue reuerencd refused affection mine onely worthy gaine well knowing dispise liberty giuing selfe meaner qualitie steriamus whose proud refusall yet make loue take iourney search comming hither hopd find heard liued much court hee bestowed loue vpo surpassing daughter pamphilia brought assurance win hauing giuen selfe leaue show much humility follow next see beauty admired scorne contemned mine comparison thinke sir well behold iudge rather merit admiration contempt faire lady said king prince speake hath much court long since indeed absent haue heard thing since departure loue rare thing bee found one sexe constant fury procure continue iourney selfe without mix ure perfection see selfe enough conquer one could ouercome loue daughter answer please cleare doubt since euer knew albanian prince loue respect vnto greatnesse nereana turning pamphilia earnestly one might see curiously like riuall therefore spitefully beholding thus spake well might hee braue princesse bestow affection vnusuall beauty abide blame prostrating heart throne excellent perfection pamphilia blushed modesty danger yet gaue answer madam said know princesse comming hither heard fame came swifter self though brought loue truth sorry lady take great painefull voyage fond end first euer heard took knightlike search hand men vsd follow scornefull lady wander passionate disdainefull prince great pitie yet madam much praise would incourage proceede since neuer feare winning many excellency may speake great beauty high birth rich possession absolute command matchlesse loue loyaltie besides assurance may haue knowledge hee loues vpon word affect valiant prince friend best friend thus secure labour may gaine accept offered much esteeme affectionate search word spoken though proud nereana nettled yet could iudgement finde fault openly rather sufferd double force bite inwardly working vpon pridefild heart eye little shewed though suffered knee somewhat bow reuerence answere shee gaue none scorning thanke vnwilling giue distaste hauing vndaunted spirit turned againe king vsing word said great king cannot thinke steriamus loues queene doe find like excellent mind inclosed within allexcelling body rarenes confesse liuing beauty cannot loue iudgement making choice rather belieue loues affect hardest aduentures impossible see win heart may prooue dangerous attempt yet brauely doth aspiring best braue king faire lady pardon iudge fault folly mild eye since neither mine wholly god loue seruant king told cause commend admire contemne since woman vnusuall loue much strange constant passage amphilanthus ollorandus came saluted giuing many thankes royall welcome kindly receiued desiring giue light find steriamus answered delos directed iland called st maura knew heard since going thither another good prince calld dolorindus hauing little hope finding gaue thankes took leaue meanes could perswade stay soule hating sight though refused shee onely blessing seeke yet would honour worth openly protested neuer affect person thus strange princesse departed neither pleased discontented despising passion loue dare thinke ruling must left thus story shall accompany tooke way sea thinking better trust selfe neptune aduentures might befall longer iourney land taking ship castanica meant passe among ilands power commanded saylers bend course st maura night wind changd grew high turning towards day great storme meaning curst fury might seene thus tempest carried another way intended last safely though contrary wils mediterran sea cast vpon cecily famous place cald saragusa saw way contend heauenly power would discretion chafe though blame fortune land shee went refresh selfe passed toward citie seontina shee determined stay dayes proceede rather returne iourney weather hot trauell tedious one dayes iourney past shee wild seruants set vp tent hard wood side shee benefit shade delicate greene playne ran pleasant riuer shee liking place shee thought humbly delight sought inuite stay woman would take content shee could compasse time laid aside state recreate selfe owne liking went wood pretending thought would bee free shee alone therefore bid seruants attend returne willing obay best pleased twas ease let goe taking directest way heart wood farre length way thicknes likenesse path crossing wandred amaze last quite lost selfe straying vp downe exercising part aduenturous louer pamphilia iest calld thousand thought time possessing yet wheele turnd came place desperate estate one cursd loue dislike folly aduenturing rashly leauing country raild vncareful people permitted haue fond desire without limiting power checkd againe said rather would thus miserable absolute blame desteny extreamely reuiling birth euer gloried except selfe owne ouervaluing conceipt would neuer let quarrell wishd steriamus vnborne eye neuer seene spitefully imagined pamphilia bewitched summe often time cursing seldome neuer speaking thinking good good thought wholy bent owne flattery made ill vow turne away seruants take new sycillians attend quickly corrected wishing old one desiring bee lemnos shee might freely speake ill enchantresse pamphilia hath said beauty ouerthrowne loue lastly forespoken iourney finding steriamus thus chafing rayling cursing last cry anger feare shee straglingly continued till night shewed sad face threatning cruelty punishment seruants sought vaine halfe night wasted gaue ouer till next morning concluding deuide themselues looke none fond finding proud curst dutie told shee must bee sought lest shee finding selfe neglected might bring greater harme taking charge tent prouision rest part damsel went search trauelled night weary laid downe hauing finished exclamation meere wearines enuious thought fell asleepe resting till break day awaked one gently pulling sleeue folding armes vsed word liana said hee ala thus long hast thou tormented thy poore slaue allanus looke louingly vpon mee louelooke former ill shall bee forgotten thy scorne shall bee thought thy cruell strangenesse causelesse suspition presented mine eye shall thy leauing mentioned thy flying mee put againe remembrance shall rest vncald bill cancelled throw thy curstnesse embrace mee thy pardoned loue hold mee thy fauour doe thee breast striue anew abandon liud thy search please thee die rather liuing giue offence vnto thee shee whose pride could hardly permit embracing steriamus offered loued seeing day broke man thus bould vexation tatterd torne rayments like one contempt handsomenes put misshapen ill suited cloathes newnes raggs great dispite villaine said touch dishonor habit thy rude handling strugling power get loose mildely said hee would offend thou dost offend sayd shee thou hast long afflicted sayd hee let goe hence villaine cryd pitty sayd allanus hate thee sayd nereana curst word madde man indeed ragged creature distractedly falle miserable estate mistaken loue fell old fit forgetting himselfe finding liana grew apprehend goddesse wood put habit disguise selfe pardon diuine goddesse sayd hee haue thus farr forgotten selfe towards blame outward shew rather neglect spake grew distemperd last rage growing almost madd fully perswaded shee goddesse whether would noe would worship might sure stay hee tide tree haue owne shape vesture imagined made vnwilling abide hee vndressd pulling haire downe full length cloathes hee left none saue onely one little petticoate carnation tafatie greene silke stockins hee turnd row ld little downe making serue buskin garland hee put head armes tucking vp smocksleeues elbowes necke bare wreath fine flower hung crosse one shoulder vnder arme like belt hang quiuer white sticke newly whittled put hand instead boare speare setting liberty kneeled downe admired almost hating selfe estate fled away fast sad mad nesse would carry pursued followed greater speed till weary shee breathlesse cast herselfe downe cleere spring picture owne selfe amaze would goe neere vnto metamorphosd figure spring middest faire meadow ground painted ouer sort dainty flower weeping running waste seeming merry tear pleasant mourning past pleasure delicacy sense hauing outgone least great weaknes ready depart lay vnvaluing ignorant sweete delight till night againe come yeelded vnto iust demaund sleepe body weake spirit madd man like maner rested prety distance towards day awakd cald rest songe sunge one farre like manner taken lodging day little breaking forth like hope enioying made see voyce belongd knight excellent proportion much might discerne soft sweete voyce hee brought forth word doe finde soules extreamest anguish restlesse care hart eternall languish torment life increasing still anguish vnquiet sleepes breed sens languish hope yet appeares somewhat helpes anguish lends sparke life salue languish breath desire ease forgone anguish balmes cure bitter tasting languish yet strait feele hope proues greater anguish false selfe brings cruell languish could hope suffer might anguish least lesser torture smart languish rebell hope see thy smile anguish prince subiect erelasting languish nereana said luckles chance befallen thee art thou lost abused neglected forsaken yet thou art altogether fallen since thine owne royall spirit shall neuer leaue thee thou get free place thy worth desert shall shine glorious ouer mishap thy power reward thy seruants disloyalty may nay assure selfe meanes presented deliuery rising went knight lay song remained little quiet meane show comming shee vsed wordes sir welcome place since assure selfe purpose sent doe seruice said knight looking vp seeing strange odde attire gessing speech vaine apparell phantasticall rising ground hee said seruice would proue perpetuall griefe alotted madnesse cannot finde better bestow otherwise trust shall attend folly folly cryde tell thee greatest prince may esteeme themselues honourd command distraction rule belieue cannot finde fitter mistris answerd god said nereana vertue thus abused tell thee base knight princesse base said thinke princesse since vnprincely termes come said shee ashamed name said hee wherefore haue vnderstanding sensible know cald philarchos youngest sonne king morea brother parselius rosindi finde parselius wee haue lost going thought said shee descended insolent race much resemble highly admired lady proud sister pamphilia hee naturally melancholly sadder loue grew extreamly angry yet moderating fury hee onely replyde thus woman madde liberty say thing whereupon hee went horse leaping made great haste feard infection leauing disorder might imagined trampling horse awaked mad man former fit still distempered rose going spring drinke found nereana sitting side passion shee perceiued till hee close rising chafe would haue left place hee staying faire nymph said hee flee mee meane harme vnto rather wil beseech mercifull haplesse men pitty coniure true earnest affection alfeus bare loue say sue haue compassion mee turne sweet water spring loue hath beene euer called blessed name arethusa hauing taken againe owne shape resumd naturall body metamorphosis taking name new beeing againe vnto hauing gaind godhead euer blesse inrich water gift cruell still beloued liana shall drinke vertue may turne heart sweetest pitty nerena much affraid proud spirit would permit remembring hee vsed day amazed hee said neuer hauing heard thing metamorphosis wit lying another way scorning sight disdaining speech yet forced suffer wordes doubting silence might inrage made answer nimph arethusa goddesse distressed woman said hee fitter keepe company neither said shee princesse prince bee distressed said hee thought beene set aboue reach misery none shepheards like could haue felt estate yes said nerena heere spectacle frowne fortune wherefore let mee intreate giue mee ase affliction leaue mee since company one trouble would sorrowes soone bee helped request might granted bee hope bee said hee happy ala mine neuer haue end may shall longer trouble hee sadly went leauing whose intolerable pride shee would let stay much presence though shee wished would gladly haue conuersation pardoning meane estate madnesse long shee place famine cold want wrought kindnesse else despised contemned thinges hill hill shee went louing imitating height minde shee might helpe see passenger passd way besides hide selfe among bush euen owne selfe berry poore food richest fare aud esteemd since held life thus truth reuenged ignorance shee continuing thus philarchos held course till hee came city syracusa standing vpon hauen arriud great troope lady braue knight one lady seeming onely one delicacie bee mistresse rest passing cast eye viewing rich armour braue stature instantly staying saluted thus sir outward countenance tels excellent body braue mind inhabits therefore beseech pitty assistance like perish otherwise vnder disfauour father aid distressed lady thereby gaine honor selfe grant vnto seruant orilena princesse metelin neighbouring ilands lye archepelago hee whose spirit wholly guided worth stedily beholding replide greatest happinesse whereto onely aspire serue lady defend iniuries bring best content wherefore although hee promised himselfe another way indeed perfect knowne way since search brother occasion laid aside relieue creature selfe spake truth lady loued yet ignorant intreated knight goe aboard desiring delay time hee soone intreated blessing wherefore consented ship began discourse thus gentleman mitalen son richest noblest man descent country father hath chosen bestow man might deny merit condition answerable meanes rich worldly treasure treasure hellish property best quality smooth fashion eloquent speech turnd imployd vse flattery deceitfull glozings worke father haue part hee beleeues loues perceiue hate workes father much seemes desire affection sayes hee take mee nothing affection fondnesse father beares carry ouer young sister mine make princesse ilands consent giue mee prince wickednesse hauing meanes saue selfe destruction loathed match would bring went lord mine vncle declared misfortune ensuing ruine marry hee taking pitie conueyed thence knight lady whose affection leaue distresse accompany mee rather aduenture ill assured ill ala shall say miserablest woman fall hand againe hope keepe aduice friend put search amphilanthus honour knight parselius rosindy perissus steriamus selarinus famous men whose honour shine equally either whose assistance assured gaine perceiued one met farre imployment venturd obtaine fauours met knight told mee amphilanthus perissus valliant ollorandus gone morea wherefore thither purposed goe storme tooke casting vpon place haue gaind happinesse hope selfe finding wherefore pray honour telling worthie ladie said hee since desire haue named knight may thinke fortune worse finding mee putting confidence mee farre short prince wherefore would desire conceale name till action may allow bold discouerie let mee beseech bee fauoured second honour giue mee leaue onely bee called knight till merit seruice knowing mee shee granted request verily imagining speech thereupon comfort increased bestow rich costly armour owne hauing hardly vsd curst ouerthrowne enemy hapned manner left athens returne receiud honour knighthood determination seeke brother parselius purpose passd newes brother hee tooke sea among many ilands fortune metelin win loose greatest honour obtaind freedome hee lost happening thus passing strait way faire meadow hee saw maruellous rich costly sheilds helmet knight conquered pillar placed order wonne greater glory ground aduanced greeke prince scornefully pitying boldly ventured youth experienced conquerour hee vertuous modesty liud mixt fell horse recouerd seeing danger fallen losse helme regard forgot hurt furious rage set vpon prince couering himselfe sheild nobly brauely defended himselfe fought till bloud ran fast wound dropps louers eye comming heartbleeding cause last monster killed prince taken field dead except loue could chirurgion whether hee brought princesse lay one league thence excellent chirurgion excellent ladie carefully tended hee short time recouered lasting paine fauour cure bringing tormenting wound shee put balme hurt giuen enemy shee friend foelike make much deeper harmefull one piercing heart fight kept selfe secure fallen extremitie losse gaind besides danger threatning ruine younger sister cald erinea fell inamord passionate ran father cast selfe feete besought get stranger see soone buried whose fondnesse without expression vowed satisfie prince got notice priuately stole away affection gratefully passionately placed kindnesse wounding bringing loue passed heard still flourishing fame kindred lastly brother losse hee gaind meeting squire clorinus vowed hee search finding hee lost himselfe hee left former follow find himselfe stormes sometimes prooue blessing one tempest brought one place meete thus passed together freely vnknowne beholding kindly hee serue entertaining last arriud metelin met first welcome encounter pillar red marble threatning bloud hung bloudy letter word written white marble seeming like drop bloud snow true seruants erinea maintaine sword speare doe defend trayterous knight speare concerne yet hauing power performe former resolution inly fretted otherwise made show demanding lady knight speare sighing made answer ala lord said lay hard taxe since cannot pay without yeelding tribute many teares euen breaking heart say yet deny nothing freely haue granted request say know hope true image rather masculine vertue selfe loueliest nature framd valiantest followed mar exercise wisest wisdome dwelt sweetest noblenesse gracd sweet mildnesse mildest sweetnesse honourd excellent eloquence true profession making action still word truth gouernd truth honord true worth name birth say nothing since cruell combat first saw brought halfe dead enioying yet loue aspired higher thinke aduenturing let see loud gaind thus much shee spake father wooed selfe vowed plotted al gaine ruine whether pitying surely sir could chuse know loud since fashion shewd though speech daring boldly say flatteringly demonstrated thing made faultrings talke blushings said surely feared loued feare must necessitie barrd since rather prisoner vnto though indeed subiect loue freed said cride euer lothnesse discourse desperate affliction finding sought consenting bee made force yeeld owne made choice stole away truly say since robbed mee best chiefest fourth breake arme shoulder fift fall found legges runne away call company fiue contrary law armes assayled win prize honour loue wherefore couragiously withstood though blowes met giuen foure speares kill take prince ranne vpon fearcelerly attended speare killd first sword second encountred tolimargus knew cheif armor thus spake worth thee much sence sencible shame thou dost honor knighthood let thy knight stand stil end combat self good man thou art therfore disgrace honor fight art thou said thus darest compare said philarchos morea said thou hadst thus butcherd knight rest countrimen could find heart grant thy request nay saue thy life haue quarrel knight speare traytor hath loue mistrisse cowardly run away done villaine said run away man fond affection erinea shew thee better hee daughter returne first knight fledde cause tolimargus comming though hee discouerd name knight gaind notice castle hauing readier way raisd men violently beseigd place straightly last famine grew cruell curst threatner duke yet resolud end famished want foode rather yeeld famished want others company went chappell together prayd together wept last together married vowing dye religiously vertuously louingly together returne went eate poore remaining left hauing done went againe pray returned chamber spent night full discourse ye full loue loue seemd please selfe excellent sorrw teares sigh banquet nuptialls complaint cruelty enioyings could wished giue true delight contrarily wrought morning come rose one parted together went top castle whence saw ruine kissing gently weeping face hee said deere mistake tear shedd onely tendernesse vnto state sauer life life better disposed seruice preserue stranger hurt mangled conducted house relieued cherished care end end welcome life without otherwise gained farewell deere loue kind sweete blessing distresse ile fight thee must last yet feare doe see end make liue ioy death see thee beholding hence courage increase make blowes terrible fatall harme fall stormes high farewell deere life ioy last comfort sweete weepe marre deere eye wound mee see harme themselues stroaks enemie come bee assured victory turne v let cleernes shine dimme die sweetest soule weepe yet wipd away tear fauour shew bright farewell life said shee thou dost die thee ile neuer see day kissd againe part hee gate whereout sallied armd edd sheild old deuice azuer speare vpon rme scarfe azuer colour giuen loue thus enemie came neuer stayd meete troop incompassing round fought rage hope hope dye like himselfe renowne blood though shedd orce yet well shedd would write fame eternally time wit esse worth valour ioynd made loue crowne whereat lei eld still say courage show many slew wound roaks tedious vaine much hee ade way thickest passd spite furyes heir number could doe hinder path made men pa ed ground bodyes blood sought bath leane wash wound giuen ill ground blush shame hee beeing passd side cast vp eye see ee beheld saw made signe enemie chargd brauely helpe short time conquest disposd braue philarchos new come friend seeke among prisoner might finde spring ill last got duke guard brought castle kind orilena came vnto knight holding fast tender armes wellcomd owne command embrace perceaud blood runne along arme wherefore shee went speedily fetch excellent baulme disarming dresse wounde helme stranger knight caught true honoured braue title friend selfe calld antissius king romania setled restored excellent cousen world greatest worth amphilanthus knowledge haue saw picture famous court father morean king withall name many act related passd vnknowne bare knight speare ioyes infinitly possesse court heare fame part hold besides like braue king heauen doth fauour earth best good sake cause affectionatly loue honor lay said great king weake worth hardly beare waight yet last affect something like matchlesse king whose worth ambitiously seeke imitate though sure come much reach ti vnto cleerest starre bring king roome disarmd went backe vnto duke put gallerie well guarded respected like himselfe found ouerthrowne griefe neither hee sad way dismayd seemd beare ouerthrow patiently philarchos thus began lord mee since husband elder child fondly way humanely loue erinea forget would disinherit shee borne good first releiud lastly great king heauen much fauoring haue succour sent farr part comming marryed determining die fate holy wedlock may discerne wrong please accept sonne pardon without knowledge wee loue great extremity haue done thinke shee hath dishonored selfe making husband prince sonne vnto mighty king name philarchos country morea third sonne vnto king thereof duke embrace speaking thus hath done confesse hard vniustly mine owne child hath married vnknowne vnto hath done like offence set iust sight greater appeare yet since choice worth truly speak cannot flourish tender yeares loue commend thus worth doth gouerne rule el would shew kist new sonne presently daughter brought forth kindly welcome conferre iland straight vpon new maried couple making prince fruitfull metelin ilands also himselfe erinea left ioyfull payre went samos liued studying vexe hurt sister thus ill nature breath malice feede still spite young romanian king take leaue first telling came vnto place chance leauing morean court vpon comming happy newes victorious rosindy hee desired returne owne countrie would raise men trauelld would still inquire parselius philarchos longd meete goe himselfe succour redeeme albania loue lord art thou commanding ouer selarina cause going back hee fell vpon ile take water meerest chance meeting peasant country learnd state time place brought happy succour louingst paire euer loud enioy loues well duke departed safe antissius tooke leaue allimarlus steward house many attend little whose leauing morea leandrus hasting heart desired messenger happy successe braue rosindy arriud infinite content court relating dangerous attempt concluding happy end ioy marriage deliuering letter king queene gaue precedence place gouernment husband said kingdome sword loue none himselfe beare rule little leandrus arriue amphilanthus tooke leaue sister went italy pretended st maura shrine hee bent pilgrimage vnto night great sorrow part betweene pamphilia vrania yet time grew king came kind sad farewels left court promising returne speed conduct pamphilia kingdome whence perswasions yet detaind way sister tooke straight vnto sea none going deare faithfull friend ollorandus euening depart leandrus remaining court passion violently increasing height discouering looking window saw pamphilia alone faire garden walking manner could hardly giue title stilly mooue motion earth goe course stirre tree grow without sence increase quiet outwardly appeard inward thought busie wrought song came mind gone ioy mourne paine absence care heauens sad griefes doe turne face stormes shew despaire dayes darke night oprest cloudly weeping paine shew acting seeme distrest sighing like griefe absent gaine sunne giues place hide face day hardly knowne starres night yeeld grace sunrobd heauen woe orethrowne light fire fearefull flame ayre tempestious blast wind warmth haue forgot name blast stormes v assind still blessed heauens remaine distemperd cursed power absence rule brings paine lest care still lower sunne doth back returne call againe lend light flame ioy may burne equall shining sight leandrus growne resolute loose want attempting would let opportunitie passe let slip pretious aduantage went garden indeed properly said businesse passion til interrupted word discerned speech possible excelling queene spirit great princesse thus alone aduenture without guard spirit lord said well guard alone company person greatnesse wall sufficient warrant guardian safety yet safety might bee said hee ioynd one might defend vpon occasion loue strength dull wall onely incompasse traitor assaile helpe bee stand still poorely gainesaying loue ofttimes slacke treacherous answered pamphilia assistance thus wall secure strength rather haue one power could loue discretion said leandrus know loue discretion truest loue therefore braue princesse especially whose vertue beauty cannot demanded whose desert might challenge meriting discretion aduenture pe swade make choyce one might affect husband since onely framd incomparable lady world also woman matched one sit estate birth greatnesse iudgement continue affection betweene discretion loue must confesse said discretion selfe best loue come wholly gouernd wil haue great power loue loose name rule rich baser thing shall p euaile sweetest passion blisse enioying therefore lord leandrus fauour must say thinke erre truth loue supreme power commanding eye heart glory haue cold part wisdome rule honor alone therefore doth oft expresse making proud great one desperately affect meaner one respect yeeld law truly vnderstand great loue must obserue merit may purchase great grace able choose fittest loues power must limited gouernment mixed counsell set protector ouer knowledge wanting aduice knowledge neuer knowing partner truth wisdome knowledge goodnesse truth must haue said loue discretion truest loue since truth loue bastard brought vp home like right borne child yet iudgement hee make discretion shine act seruant greater power heart command tongue deliuer thinkes discreetly doe offence may proceede discretion yet tongue heart messenger leandrus whose end procure fauour contend wittily tooke hold last speech thinking better make introduction loue longer waite expect occasion offered let slip seldome come againe letting louelinesse owne word beginning meanes affection knowledge answered thus madam said true tongue heart messenger yet messenger part haue carry credence let tongue bee deliuerer feruent affection euer heart bare princesse truest vnfaigned loue disdaine affection since loyalty seruice deserue fauour wel better man breathing crowne adde soueraigne command leandrus talke crowne weares crowne vertues lord said cannot thanke princely offer must bee father liking consent nearest dearest friend set crowne head people haue already setled consent great people louing must neglected vertues shall appeare obedience owe pay maiesty rest therefore altogether vnable giue satisfaction must may say said haue answer said cryd leandrus soueraigne selfe iudgement yeares authoritie vnlimited fortune gouernment loue parent goe choice still thread tie dutie replide queene consent said wil eternise happinesse agreeing giue leaue first said pamphilia know mind hinderance furtherance affaire shall answere bee displeasing might doubtfull answer breede despaire cryd much safer said doubt vainely nurse hope bent walke homeward durst withstand though fearelesse man monster yet trembled hee presence went continued louing complaining neither receiuing comfort beholding seeing affection cause hope shee seeing eye thankefull respect without loue yet went still made greater distance yet loue set stirred mooued course whether fortune choice guide sighd thought become sighd grew pale sad wanting sought shee ofttimes would discourse loue thought prittiest theame answerd shee would complaine men accuse fickelnesse change hee ioyned though contrary sexe speake woman slightings thus agreed though different kind please loue stroue pleasing talke third person bewaile case would know meaning yet wit would let see loued himselfe cruell vnderstand affection elsewhere placed yet sometimes would hee flatter himselfe giue fawning hope leaue dissemble cast glasse comfort glasselike brittle although faire faire hope broken dispaire loue violentest storme bring shipwrack quiet heart doe trauell thus bring home gaine onely losse bee fauourably kinde loue mild loue curst poore leandrus know whose springtime ioy turned wintergriefe yet still hee pursue vnfortunately must proceede pamphilia loyall louing distressed passionate night discouery though kind yet displeasing retired rest shee went vnto watch endlesse thought chamber hasted bed doe ala within sleepe scope let imagination play vexing shee call face vnto eye speech vnto eares iudgement vnderstanding brauerie wit like heape starres whose equall lusture make milky way one shee studied gaine loue doubt came feared plot lookes shee weighed might gaine hope assure ioy heart beate quick vnto blisse againe remembrance threatned losse loud might chuse new false traitor cryd thy basenes vild wicked bringing thus mind thou goodnes shouldst haue cast away one errd must bee registred vertues hast thou laid aside dwell thus vncharitably bringst worser part sight harme thou faylest know worth doe excuse fault vow liue constant loue louer matchlesse excellence turnd window poore dull night said keepe still thy sadnesse till thy sun appeare mine together shineing light darke art thou like woe dull wit laid downe rest granted must yet bee shee must endure rose write went shee bed tooke candle read awhile limetwiggs hold fast thought loue vnrest gouernd till day breake shee thus wander rauing thought sleepe couet place calld goe hunting king queene obayed manner soone stagge roused doggs let vnto ouerthrow followed left rest either well horsd lese affecting violent sport behind brauely followed pleasant chase continue till sun set much glory view spoyles ioying conquest great gaine content fairest queene sweete euening inioyed content dainty ayre could giue cleere cleere heart loue cleere cleerest sweetest ayre rode softly coole selfe delicate sweete voyce inuited stay see owner musique voyce draw pleasant groue vnto swift sweete riuers side brinke amonst seges sate nimph perfection chast hard banke quiuer lay bow vndressing bath wash pleasant streame pamphilia almost amasd see rare exquisite creature shee wherefore commanding men stay shee ladyes went whose modesty bashfullnes euen quaked see woman well might shee neuer saw selfe shaddow shee diued hide selfe owne eye yet shee loud queene perceiuing afraid mildly spake thus sweete nimph bee thus dismaid wee none giue cause harme wee friend following sport oft chance hunter fortune benighted going vnto court wee heard voyce hath power sufficient attract creature like sweete youth harpe drew dumbe thing admire choysest tune let disturbe sweetest nimph barre v heauenly harmony shee sweetly make fine replye great princesse pardon beseech rudnesse mee hath made dumbe till vnable giue answer lipps vnseald great grace speech made f ee satisfie must confesse see first amasd wish selfe againe faire riuer hide worthlesse selfe iudging eye oft haue seene hunt faire plaines somtimes taste blessed brook behinde seges lye hid dry farre place fit entertaine vertues sate downe drank cleere water said blessed wert thou thou couldest know happinesse thou shalt arriue first bee touched best deerest lipps passe royall breast thinke saw treames haste sorrow missd fate aboue come hastely catch touch yet one kind looke loud sencible since dispaire marryed mee wedded selfe chast diana life let intreat sweete nimph said queene tell story night pleasing spent fortune yet haue knowne reuerence due state thus beginne tale name great queene said shee allarina sheepheardesse birth first profession still beene lucklesly professd louers name left former happy contented life fourteene yeares age first felt paine young ignorant scarce know torment distempered slept fed coulor waxed pale mirth decayed sigh wholy breath breath admire change sheepheards generally bewaile ill sheepherdesses would parent grieued part knew knew ayld till one day walking pleasant wood vpon hill consider selfe first originall paine could suddenly find ground till last considering well thing found name pleasing mee heart euer thanke meanes bring bee spoken none thought appeard excellent none spake like none sung like nothing could hee doe seeme best nothing done others shew dull quite voyd pleasingnes excellent appeard vnto mee came mind straight sight blushd layd hand vpon panting heart cryd hope loue loue sooner poore namd cald straight possessd heart ala yeelded know loud loue ioyd confessd slaue slaue ala soone growne slauery affect health alterd mother put hand phisitian bee recouered shee hopd vaine power cure ordaind came loue visite gaue life comfort thus remaine fiue yeares loued yet hee ignorant affection placed surely borne conclusion could permit selfe say shew loud poore sad lookes blushing aske sheepe vnsteddily downe cast looke daring behold loued feare burning scorched gaue answer vnresoluedly hee perceiued loud twas sillines saw made innocentlike fashion shew wherefore meant watch find loue late imagining himselfe hee marryed grieued almost dyed remedy past vndone yet one night blessed night desire came fetched sister house set betweene v two hee fell discourse many pretty thing loue finde gayne arte know like last fel vnto foolish sport tell truly asked draw lot demand fell pretily couer intent first demanded sister life shee thought pleasantest best said shepheards asked euer wish loue gaine full content said neuer could obtaine iust satisfaction wish still aboue benefit gaind come seruant question blessedst halfe houre euer knew said time followed poore bird shoote thought mee dearest thought thought ioyed soule hit bird thinke said blusht vrgd swore marrd play must bee punisht foule offence pardon askt said would confesse came say word selfe speech againe faile spirit fainted looked pale red sighd smild instant space loue neuer strange diuersitie present dumb spake little halfe say turned rest comfort poore hart take armes strictly coniure say said thought loued made yet curious holding still perceiuing displeased sweetely perswading say rest soft feareful word afraid heare selfe say loue twas said twixt ioy greefe wept like passd continually tended poore flock forsooke owne stray mine song mee thought many sweete pleasant delightfull game inuent giue content v last sister grew malice respect discerne delight hee studdy present v much pride sheephardesses seldome know yet flowd else like v milde sufficiently witty malice flew vnto height slighting perceauing let go alone vnwaighted yet accompanied mee two yeares indure plague grew wife likewise likewise stomacke poore witte ce sense manifest rage troth sorry hate much loued loued though well worst beast since shee alone saw barre blisse hee saw patience oft time mooud euen spite yet couerd suppresd deere power deerer loue entertaynd braue mantinia great embassador whether calld among strange delight represent innocent pastime loue placed cheife wrestling sport strength farre excell others plaines selfe pastorall song dance like first place among maid came great princesse bless seeing sight still liues ingrafted breast became loue said queene ala al sorrow change cride grew change sort befell hee hauing thus pure spotlesse sort gaind best loue could yet content enioying couet preuent found conuenient meanes slight still avoyd perceaud yet affected much nothing could withdraw loue argument hee would frame euen owne desire sweare true loue loose desire distant vnknowne could man much affect hee gaind knew lye hid richer treasure hee possest deuoutly greater zeale loue still refused hee yeelding obtained beleeue much commend mind praisd likd likewise seemd affected men last certaine kind meeting amongst v thither may day euery yeere beeing day celebrated feast rarest choycest beautyes came among rest one truth must confesse faire aboue common beautyes time meanest parentage ranke seruant shepherdesse greatest place difference distinction made degree though fight well great one much curious choyce shame match owne degree among prince whose great blood toucht staind basenesse match make woman yet allurd loue change worse scorne long would perceiue yet last cleerely discouered attended may lady purpose inticed wished end might behold heardsman kept cattell sister owne grow enamourd beautious lasse last loue gaind hand iudgement priuately marryed grow sure surely inioy could much cruelty refuse especially borne chastity look cast speech wholy bent wit admird iests told wondred company must bee admitted respect quite cast soule wounded heart wasted dryed vp truely growne woman worthlesse outward part looked thus tormented desired oft speake hee shunne mee euer coueted sight came alone stand instantly went would turne ba ke sharpest scorne vnto louing eye aye cryd come passe haue lost liberty haue aduentured death shame come vnto shamefull end loue parent haue left displeasd haue rated mee immoderate loue requited gaine last fowle disdaine feruent truth world fild constancy broad eye saw disloyalty pitied others flouted grieued yet last resolud either speak write speake ala could feare giue offence still fondly louing bed thought woe could resolue speake mind frame speech moderate kind might rather demanding pittie discouer dislike change saw view eye cast cruell sort farre power true ability touch wrong beg poore compassion stood amazed trembling euen one cast vnto loue still affliction fallen change make send line vnto beseech loue bare let know cause great strangenesse towards proceeding part iust tell onely curse selfe true humilitie demand pardon soule purely loue vntoucht vnstaind blame spot faith ground whereon placed loue loyalty hope held selfe vnfained louer poore creature bee looked vpon reward giue scorne ala looke beautie decayed pleasd best wasted yeares still true chast face faire mind fairer cloathd truth loue thus euer deserue pity ala craue iustly hand neglect time owe pay vnto confidence might make erre neuer willingly commit fault blame trust iust assurance confidence reiect since pine teares still shed haue marrd dulld mine eye made worthlesse behold looke faith pitty die sincerely read corrected often staind blot true teares falling writ made sent youth still loud serue loue gaue one morning waked answere would speake next day come found bed bathing self poore yet choice teares vnkindly onely sat downe much looking woe speaking word eies another way voice displeasd writ hansom letter said ala said opprest half mad distracted scorne could silent yet could speake wrongd self said wherein crid rose giuing much kind vnkind look spake another cald together left woe time hee stroue plaine way craftie slight make see cast away left patiently seeme beare losse oh heart could let doe though day stroue couer griefe night time open doores entertaine seruant woe remember many moneths disaster befallen mee hee merrily speake among v also one among rest greatest stranger thought ioyed fauoured though vsed mee triall truth earnestly loued ioyed see poore cold heart warme selfe thinke past leapt saw yet leape like resemble strong conuultionat latest gaspe fell downe dead despaire thus together hee pleased say verse mee good truly much affect thought owne vext belong made framed commend much himselfe said liked strength said good like made much better discoursing tooke boldnesse say something knowing might speake kind yet selfe beg againe trembling aske loue still soule afflicted lest giue offence though sensibly discerning worst ill yet rather offend griefe dispence faintly say must poore recompence gratefull loue force see hill marrs prospect loue oh thence tast take losse poisond pill one coale liues rest dead still fire loue burnd tell though deceiuing led sunne summer winter shewes like bright like hot faire false made blowes shine loues heate dead made answere onely said fine one continued peremptory course hating poore way suffering till ill grow though yet one el obtaine claime sorrow miserie still triumph gaine ouerthrow soule giuen last extremitie griefe paine brought vnable doe thing best consider mishape iustly know cause others smile say twas forsaken others laugh say growne dull said prose gone onely could expresse selfe verse heare truth troubled greater matter shut eares heart weighing slight thing gaue selfe wholly field kept company flocke next kindred would visit poore sheepe discourse liues make descipherd life rockes obiects daily visit meekenesse whole ambition losse gaine thus liud thus still ranne death one day past among rock steepe yet easie ascend countrie hilly earth blacke mourning onely couerd heath stone expresse ill nature soile went still till last descending one steepest ragged hill top crownd milke white rock bignesse strange fashion farre rare sat downe stone mighty height like chaire iust proportion giue mee roome ease yet thing vnsafe looke downe whose eye dazell high place height great stood onely framd sit see bottome directly vnder looking saw folkes spring drinke left rocke straight descend vnto plaine descent tedious slippery thither came company one man able declare thing nature rest stranger countrimen ciuilly demanded spring medicinable made much affectionate ceremony drinke adore man made answere diuine sacred water cure harmes blamd knowing said much since one fit bee termed seruant adoration diuinity told many strange work water performd nouelties take streame drinking found harme demanded would procure said quiet spirit comfort life long demanded ought drinke thereof seuen time replied thrice seuen dayes liuing farre resolud task dranke found good soone alterd al thing truth alone remaines vnharmd whole condition alterd grew free free loue late slaue finding true vertue selfe poore selfe returnd againe embrace true sort loue held agree loue selfe selfe loueth auoid new delight bee sued intised againe put habit hoping purenesse vowed chastity win diana fauour ambition hope thus liue expectation assurance acceptance brooke oftentimes doe goe going iust come remembrance faith keepe ioy alone without desire thought loues varietie day remaining haue giuen truth nimph still remaine name also changed life allarina siluiana habit keepe discourse men vow yeelding liue free vncontrold fortune selfe mistrisse adore keepe feast deuoutly thus doe remaine humblest vassall mighty princesse else sole mistrisse thought freedomes rule happy said excellent queene bee able master selfe neuer see since wore habit ofttimes great princesse said haue seene perceiued desire new win back late must confesse told could haue beheld face without soules affection hardly haue belieued much find heart free loue made himselfe euen meere stranger mine ey thought farre touch loue borne neuer know loue passion eye hung sterud without sight soule loud blessing indeed free selfe void trouble loue prouoked quietnes heare act see day intolerably fond one hated change new mooues saue pity pity ill hap iealous vext hee throw chance looke selfe fault punisht sterne neglect plagueing sharpest kind striuing make see change scornefully expressing sight disdaine fondnesse loues requited growne pitie scorne take loue vowed elsewhere thus loue rewarded scorne scorne pitilesse regard returning home cannot yet belieue said pamphilia loue still liberall excellent discourse neuer liue houre said siluiana hate though made free bond vaine affection thus much truly doe still remaine friend seruant defend harmes may respect make void way doe though iust ill turne many league might good iourney would take yet loue ought faire chastitie sweet discourse concluded braue queene tooke leaue fine nymph returnd promise hunted part would find going court went chamber take rest little sufficed though great yet loue much subiect meanest borne pamphilia said thy great spirit permit thee bee bound allarina haue strength master command euen loue selfe scorne seruilitie subiects soueraignize neuer let meane thing orerule thy greatest power either command like thy self fall downe vassall despaire fond loue insult venture thy sight let babish trick prizd creature vnder thee disdaine thou gouernment shall blindnes master thee guide thee looke sure fall shall way ward folly rule thee looke despisd shall foolish wantonnes intice thee hate vice shall child make thee follow vaine trick scorne thy self vanity yet said truest knowledge tell true wounded heart bleeding doth professe vassalladge great powerfull might loue prisoner guard deere loue keepe safely free yeelding keepe thou hast already made thine much time rest thus imployd rysing day telling brightnesse waited rose went sweete limena accompanied sad fine walkes alone saue second selfe surely said perfectly happily haue loued cannot delightfull place remember sweete yet curst passage loue haue ouergone speake loue speake loue sweete discourse next loue aboue thing cannot say selfe deare trust hath gracd withall tell others truly shall silently inclosed breast let vnderstand choice variety loue mistaking change cross none know yet tell fiction may shall lucklesse vnfortunate shew example void hope much lesse true assurance time house receiuing welcome tooke occasion come againe againe commings brought mischeuous affection affection mischiefes selfe thus happned lady loud hee liked sued innocent could deny yeares passe enioy last three yeares almost worne found time rather much vnprouided refusall extreamly louing nothing amisse imagind ought denyde yeares passed time shee onely loue loues sake doubting least might bee touch vnto affection spot much clearenesse heart held let busie speech pas vnregarded smild friend bid beware esteeming constant opinion worth richer truth thought falshoods thus poore lady deceiud miserably vndone falling loue one inferior respect quality compard though greater ranke euery way neerest friend condemnd ill choice crafty art faire made looke last shewed plainely must wilfully blinde see rest see ala dying eye passion compard none ordinary course sorrow abounded rising height flew dispaire melancholy quietest companion monefully would sit dayes without word night without sleepe oft would tell paine though pittifully would lament hee take notice heard spoken ala would cry worthy liue shame house staine sex pittifull example mischeife shamefull creature liuest thou disgrace thy friend poore soule poore indeed true goodnes leaue vnhappy body take thy selfe away thou hast left may thou mayst better win pittie hence foorth must blame infould must shame couer dispaire losse destroy yet hadst thou changd better constanter would much haue vext mee see desert loue selfe cast onely subtiltie betrayed vild place ala rent heart losse fault worth procure fauour must yeeld outward fairenes faire confesse thought perfect thanke owne strangenes teares shed falshood haue furrowd worne wrinkle smoothnesse continuall falling way shun loue change might haue iustly dealt yet sayd longer loue sate downe alone losse doubly afflicted loosing deceaud want truth greater plague misery loud better selfe much vnworthines extreamest torment oft told would hurt selfe trusting replyd rather bee wretched losse vnhappy suspition befall yet suspect apparent truth tell forlorne remember speake foole tooke time scorne put slightnesse heare businesse concernd himselfe yet coming vnpleasing would yet could lucklesse came thy worthlesnesse ti misfortune torture yet shee thus continued woe beauty dying fortune wasted carelesse man good respect saue owne desire would many time come rather coniecture thinking betray affection hee bore poore haplesse louer neuer denyd commanded poore soule glad would receiue one looke one word gaue new life againe smile made hope lasted make stronger suffer againe misery allotted well continued vndone imagine braue queene misery haue comforted harme held still curst neglect till neere end thought rather onely sure owne honour safety hee sent often made take ioy assuring selfe felt bound loue since thus neere death made hope would gratefull affection though passionate much flatter protest respect aboue life life safety deare owne heart bloud expresseles consolation vowes broken greatest plague trust man excellentest creature doth thus excell ill sooner amended sent againe shew affection comming excused care lest others would haue visited might trouble weakenes bring danger health gloss like faith beleeud cheerishd til soone made know men word onely breath oathes winde vowes water begin ensuing griefe new borne hope soone died tyes knit vp broken asunder violence death brought heauy misery vnto mother misaduentures soone fell direct leauing scanting contempt scorne turning shew fauour fell new change dainty woman must yeeld fortune new choyce whose beauty win craftinesse likewise fall new dislike cry gainst disloyalty complaind misfortune cursd credulity fond hope neuer ceasing complaint reuilings thought chusing first forsaken louer heare accuse euen vnto face changd lately vnto loue cruell need must bee see blamd fault suffered ala would say hap haue accuse fate still heare accusation purpose disloyall lincus hath thy poore louer alena deserud hate canst thou without shame consider wrong thinke desert challeng none leaue thy selfe iudge lost forsaken yet truest loue indeed vnhappiest sufferer blame pelia complaines disloyalty mee flew shee dislike shall doe beare mark shame losse reputation marrd honour dust requitalls scornd despised hated last vnkind man worse cannot call yet turne backe againe look desearts shal find cleerenes discerne fault purenes tel none self deserues griefe mooue compassion lastly iust claimes make gratefull see despise vertuous wayes goe course mourne extreamest crosse thus oft complaine yet neuer shund sight least thinke change could alter saw patience insolentlyer hee presse striuing purpose afflict sight alteration need must bring beheld kisse new loues hand melting heart passionate respect smile eye begge grace write praise expression loue ala cryd shee baites first betrayed thus thus fond hee mee thus careles else transformed truth faith many perswaded keepe away scorn much hate much would cry fault shal neuer make il wil chang though fickle bee yet bee assured loue bee deceiued onely thus far remnant loue extends wonll take course though painefull dangerous hazard life keepe least harme thus loiall louer liue comonly end loyaltie men neuer knew end owne will delight perissus excepted satisfie haue giuen short example true loue faigned confesse story yet may bee louers fate pamphilia gaue great attention last aduenture discourse somewhat neere concurre ending misfortune said selfe chuse like wofull history purpose knowing mind could attaine vnto feele said torment shew like player others part swell limena forced helpe comfort perswasions appease rage thus continued till nanio dwarfe came telling lady happy tydings rosindys arriuall selarinus awaked made melancholy companion yeeld better friend ioy back went together much content met king rosindy companion hall king court assembled ioy plentifully disposing selfe euery one amphilanthus holding course towards st maura thither brought safely speedily going rocke tooke vrania armes vsing wordes dearest sister one halfe life fortune neuer fauourable v hath ordaind strange aduenture v cruell since auoyded executed hand best loue yet blame since haue assured hope good successe yet apparent death action must prolong time amaze discourse ala must say word deerest vrania must throw thee sea pardon heauen appoints deerest brother sayd neede make scruple wrong much thinke feare death sister cheerish life ioy parent fulfill command assured doubly welcome comming free much sorrow since giuen mee hand hand best loue giue whose deare sake onely loud liue much delight wish die kinde teares proceeded mournfull silence possesse tongus till againe besought hee refused yet last resoluing perishd ende tooke armes gently let slide shewing rather slipping letting fall shee fell fell heart woe drownd deepe ocean despaire soone calld rocke furiously threw himselfe vnto saying liue happy amphilanthus onely deare parselius farewell calld leaping cryd parselius neuer outliue vrania sunke straight pulled vp safely brought land help two leaping boat sea spared danger life selfe foure soundly washed came shoare amphilanthus embraced tea e ioy welcomd sister friend well vnderstood operation water parselius knew nothing former loue birth villaine nature prince istria brother king dalmatia proud accompanying vice malice ill abiding mee causd detestable treason hearing many prophesies likelihood greatnes worth amphilanthus studied found queene newly brought bed daughter thought might meanes safety magicke could withstand happy fortune amphilanthus though danger fall vncertaine recouer woman determining haue end way hauing skill magicke cast sleepe vpon attendant babe lay euening tooke child conueyed away purposing keepe protect danger would practise ruine prince deuili h plot cause much hurt might worthinesse otherwise better good part happened charmes spell preuented greater power yet glad child tooke way sea fitting downe looking sweetenesse delicacie babe vnawares robber set vpon helpe left learning art relieue aduenture death onely expected prooued mercifull sauing life took child al esteemd wofully returne mine owne country fell book called others art vnto aide doe could barrd knowledge guesse become child course run heauenly power hiding mee keepe safety neerer till yeare discouered mee shee safe conduct great prince estate vnknowne selfe inprisonment hid though place manner disguise shewed mee shepherdess attire since time haue bestowed time labour seeking sir stole find daughter sir traytor done againe embraced vrania desired know one thing mantell purse left vnto said old man done know protected know till finish aduenture onely left end euery one adiudge old prince lesse death king amphilanthus would consent saying ioyes welcome bee mixed bloud professe repentance great mercy receiued pardon returned towards country halfe way ourney died thus aduenture concluded went forth iusts ready begin presence first day concluded match made twelue twelue sword speare renownes performed p inces determined manifest valour yet euery one priuately taking resolution made shrewd mistaking among king queene placed entred knight black armour deuise wo ld burning cupid houering flame knight straight encountred prince apulia braue valiant gentleman weake prince vihin milan sauoy florence mantua modina many others met earth liuery amphilanthus seeing stole away hoping reuenge country men stranger taking white armour like young knight came fitly black knight want worke long complaine encounter strong furious black knight taking one kindhearted prince made carelesly gaue prince aduantage shake shrewdly meaning mend next time great rage met neuer yet ouerthrowne neere hazard terrible meeting horse strooke vpon buttock yet againe recouerd three course ran thus without aduantage wherefore lawes iusts end sword fighting without mercy feare white armour amphilanthus looking pale rage see bloud mourned master hurt many long fought horseback agreeing horse faint lighted continued fight till king sent downe vrania intreate would giue ouer since hoped quarrell deadly besides greatest pitie knight bee lost time pleasure warre exercised desire yeelded iudgements gaue honour worthy admired combatant italy euer knowne faint sat downe taking one another hand witnesse malice ended might euery one truly belieue beheld face black knight parselius faigned himselfe well purpose bee abler combat commers two friend condemne one himselfe hurting chance often happen among knight went king whose grief great see hurt knowing chirurgions none dangerous though painfull content infinite see valor vrania sorry parselius tended amphilanthus wholly till came abroad two day strange happines wrought diuine power work change would haue left friend parselius time sport ceased began presence prince euery one trial full manner steriamus honour aduenture befall fame meeting iusts noised ouer part came knight prince whose eares tidings came among prince piemont proud insolent vice could corrupt man withall man pufft vp ambition worst kind aspired loue vrania therefore put himselfe bold discouering content demanded fauour weare refusd hating vice much shee abhorred scorning denied hee haue hated himselfe attempt gaue speech befitting take withall snatched gloue hee sware weare yet mildly tooke small notice either spirit made colour shew offended chamber amphilanthus window steriamus standing seeing grew offended much making giue testimony furie boyling within spake word presumption hath causd vnmannerlinesse truth mee prouokes word lay downe gloue againe selfe feete humbly submit yeeld life disposing hauing done vnpardonable act leaue hope mercy receiue shall haue heart satisfie right laughed said gloue well become hatt hauing put time would weare despite best knight steriamus strake hat giuing blow face made stagger took gloue kissing told vrania thereby hee happines begin seruice long ingaged vnto would take power doe else pleasd since desired accounted humblest seruant yet desire much honourd bee permitted weare fauour till brought humbly submit great presumption euer loued steriamus youth ingaged besides aduenturing saue sea gratifie yet tender cause harme spake thus lord said merit farre beyond desert make amazed manner carry selfe doubtfull yet rather offend good ill weare beseech meane since taken ill place let haue accept worthy fitter fauour one vntoucht hand present true respect vnto gaue gloue tooke scarfe infinite content tyed assisted also arme went fire threw gloue wishing danger steriamus might end consumption leather disgraced prince goe instantly send steriamus giue satisfaction presently yeeld vnto kissing vranias hand went downe arme himselfe priuate place armour known ru set plaine one could rich consisting worth mistrisses fauour straight court fild newes two braue combatant entring list king amphilanth though weake court came except parselius could well stirre abroad amphilanthus reason lost much bloud staying within made steriamus missed assembled proud prince come suted humour attendant many shewed receiued education none carried speare himselfe iudges made prince sauoy cosingerman chosen amphilanthus desired trumpet sounded encountred steriamus struck backe horse horse fell fought foote fierce cruel fight lamentable sight except choice prince none could equall piemountois knew incourage made prize power worth one might say horse brauer creature man draweth beareth steriamus fought honor receiued vrania repaire honour touchd vrania thus past fury strength harme shund spard calld highest accompt skill wanting little stirrd renewed payed iudgement discretion sayd combate except last could compare yet sort exceed one bloudy ground hate curst addition ioynd together heigth gouerne nay spend themselues furious deadly conclusion last much care saue euen eye dasled legges grew false body longer willing support fell piemount prince steriamus vpon purpose weakenesse helme puld would haue killed spirit ended shew fury fell swound appearing dead iudges came finding braue prince amphilanthus fell downe king came window vrania ran wiping face rubbed temple hand life againe possest could otherwise armes life loue dwell beheld remembring hee began fearing lost honour others victory offerd get vp knee scarce able rise higher cry miserable steriamus liue see thy shame honour striues honor must proceed cast eies saw lay dead satisfied well might bee since none smallest one chiefest victory strength valour skill well knowne none could yeeld conquered vnconquerable spirit steriamus gaind victory great honor could giuen single fight strong st valiant except cosin brother equall past taken vp raising prince breathed looked vp wherupon steriamus would stay heare speake vnwilling yet would drest forst confesse folly humble maner demanded asked pardon presumption vrania gaue kindly reconciled themselues embracing proud prince departed proud liued goodnesse shaking pride life steriamus conducted lodging vrania visited often body place appointed till buriall prince sauoy taking order excessiue sorrow death life time neuer cared much vertue fine young gentleman vertuous valiant cousin death prince likewise piemount euery day new showes triumphes reason braue prince could number martiall exercise layd aside court sport gaind place amphilanthus parselius within dayes steriamus beeing spectator one afternoone sound trumpet entered hall braue knight brauery vnusuall hee attended many seruants one colour liuery sea greene crimson coat seagreene veluet embroderd crimson silke fashion heart stroke dart twenty euery one carrying picture came two richer former holding one fayrer rest deceiud picture mistris knight commanded set downe side chamber face state standing middle mistrisses thus speaking famous king naples famous truely meriting fame hither come vpon command sent power onely hath soueraignty ouer else free name polarchos sonne king ciprus subiect loue lady rhodes went court father desirous see place loue surprize mee sacrifice liberty altar command oft time went afterwards see like fulfilling wish welcome though father hee discouerd loues though dislike could alter affection strong young yet opposed oft delightfull meeting subtilty come freedom place danger safety wont dwell secure loues tryals many put vpon passd increase liking father hate mee inchantment wherein faith loue valour shewed approued since rarest liuing prince excellent son power iustly deseruing conclude charm let description passe since impossible haue heard whole relation proceed much honord carryed rhodes peace made father consent gaind marriage departed royall company leauing assured certaine content imagined departure two dayes solenizing marriage discoursing many thing among rest aduentures ciprus brought pleasant iust begun matchlesse amphilanthus worthy companion ollorandus well enough son layd ground tooke disgrace due presumed meete yeelded though thought dishonor hearing bred disdaine mistris wherefore told vnles would wipe away staine would neuer look vpon though could marry yet would performe greeued much vexed teller begin could haue found heart kill would auaile angry wilfull resolution princesse iland small party force performe word faith ingaged yet thus farre brought vndertooke carry picture greece italy iust would venture mistress picture mine ouercame haue instantly vpon returne picture gaine present withall excepted amphilanthus ollorandus beene much ingaged shee contented tooke way greece haue passed good fortune hath yet attended neuer receiuing worst must confesse destiny hath yet held mee meeting renowne knighthood three brother companion last mett withall romanian knight brought assured gaine lady princesse antissia hath courteously left grace lady sir humble request maiestie may haue permission try fortune king rose vp embraced giuing welcome liberty amphilanthus parselius steriamus ollorandus lastly dolorindus came vnto louing countenance resolued encouter much resemblance antissia wrought minde king desired haue order iusts proclaimed man must come field iust without lady portraiture ouercome hee must leaue behinde signe losse must offer defend sword lost launce runne six course done equally continue till iudges decided lastly challenger ouercome defendant free liberty dispose picture conquerd night parted polarchos tent set vp end list infinit rich beautifull prince brought thither though faine would haue company court contrary command must wholly obey morning come assembled court iudges foure first named prince came prince milan attended like himselfe two knight milan carrying lady picture indeede louely could browne complexion daughter shee duke florence time extreamely passionate wife within fewe weekes prince ranne finely excellent grace delicate horsemanship polarchos runne amphilanthus equall strength course
