knight iust would must within time doe else third day reason knight vnprouided fourth fift enough doe conquer many came sixt day entred knight gold armour plume furniture horse liueries yellow gold called iealous knight carryed picture antissia came iudges custome refusd liberty saying since princesse beene brought lawfull bring againe since runne infinitnesse yet much vrging challenger beeing curteous valerous consented condition last example parted encountred great force finenesse yellow knight worse hee recouerd himselfe prettily wel brought passe fiue course little aduantage polarchos knowing conclusion neere end like man earnest desird win ladyes loue encounterd stroke flat backe passing losse stirrops honour giuen vnknowne got away hee came somewhat lesse reputation yet shame since hee best forty iusted court thus iusts end polarchos much honor brought court wher continued day hauing finished charge departed rhodes louely triumphant trophy rhodes receiued kindly except mistris examining al done finding none famous woman among told nothing vnlesse brought pamphilias vranias selarinas limenas picture ouerthrowne parselius rosindy steriamus selarinus perissus leandrus knight looking despightfull contempt new moued passion still continuing hate seeing labour esteemd grew abhorring sought scorne adord labour said requited thus trauells hazard haue runne rewarded slightnesse farewell fond vnworthy woman polarchos next seekes thee vse thus hate thee euer see thee thinke thee scorne hee flung presence straight went lodging meant stay night onely next day take iourney homeward thus preuented seeing minde alterd like fall losse calld trustiest seruants gaue charge fulfill command accomplishd dead time night hee slept secure loue passion wont hold eye open busie soule hee freed enioyed quiet rest till disturbd rude rushing certaine men chamber taking vnprouided layd hold binding cord yron chaines carried strong towre topp castle windowes bard thicke yron nothing else keepe sunne cold bed hard floore meate bread water thus liud true spectacle misfortune vnfortunate loue hand lately defended beauty bound maintaining false shadow honour gaind turnd disdained hate surely iust punishment worth carry sword worth defend opposite poore polarchos affliction art thou brought thy friend lament thy misfortune redresse thy wrong may attaine knowledge thus thou must yet continue tortured thy great goodnesse amphilanthus hauing recouerd strength pretily well came vnto father one day telling promise made vnto cosin queene pamphilia conduct home therfore besought leaue depart also permission vranias going besides steriamus proceed businesse concerning recouery kingdome said haue carried presence indeed true gaind libertie demanded though hearty grief part queene also sorry dearest child yet honour deare tooke leaue court braue companion sweet vrania tooke shipping morea perissus hauing continued arcadia king faine would take leaue happy newes arriuall stay morean king vpon euen rauished ioy none blame since ad time whole worth world presence pamphilia neuer contented hauing two dearest brother whither also soone came philarchos fill vp ioyes bringing beautifull chastly louing orilena full comfort comforted happinesse brauery knighthood shind onely beauty vertue vertuous beautie assembled thus court florishing glory despising sorrow sad spectacle cald one morning little compassion lady mourning attire attended number knight lady likewise habit came hall lady face couered blacke vaile next followed lady carrying sweete dainty child armes shee comming state kneele downe threw selfe king eete cry pitifull moane heart ioyne loue condole long shee could bring forth thing last lord said euer compassion afflicted creature verifie fauour shewed mee lady miserable soule forlorne fortune loue resolute ala woman see yeeres still continue deceiued grieueth assist gratious prince alone redresse harme doe doe suffers bloud king amazed beeing able guesse businesse yet taking vp desired know promising best power aide businesse lord said shee dishonoured helpe one knight trauelling search friend vnfortunately mee lighted house ciuility courteous manner intertaind well hee liked place selfe hee neuer ceased continuall importunity woing sparing meanes win end till hee procured end yet chastly bred honouring vertue aboue respect passion would consent till married wee kept together time leauing course contented obscure himselfe name estate armes happinesse like assurance heauen heauen loud would refuse danger loue might expose vnto hauing enioyd desire seeing hidden beautie varietie delight hee left mee faigned excuse neuer since hauing much looked let know hee liud torment great king confider finding selfe child came hazard honour mind danger disgrace staine might bring house belieue v poore woman extremity rather increase infamy paine euer sufferd woman indurd soule body till time deliuery came god sent babe hauing gaind little strength left country hither come vnknowne humbly craue fauour one knight hath done abuse therefore hand implore right sweete lady said king pitie much fortune tell mee knight vow shall stay court fauour hee doe satisfie verified sir said one word haue spoken bee false let shame perpetuall losse requite sir haue spoken onely truth desire iustified yet wi h great ill befall god knowes soule purely louing selfe would haue much tried sincerenesse call beseech knight together demaund alot disposd selfe iustly may put selfe since hath abused owne sonne winning forsaking parselius king grew infinitely troubled knowing say doe last cald sonne talking leandrus pamphilia comming king demanded would vpon honour resolue directly one thing would demand nay charged blessing conceale aske vowd nothing make answere false tell said hee haue child married without knowledge fell straight knee euer cryd gaue word marry child let heauen blesse said lady staying proceeding vow said neuer knew man b husband father babe voyce th n began know yet impossible hee thought dalinea desired see face nay said first promise bee iust father royall presence confirme friend amphilanthus pretended indeede onely voyage fell confines achaya met berlandis came seeke lord intreat company finishing warre antissius consented passing country chanced come castle dalinea faire vertuous sister fell loue withall forgot former vowes truth loue sought flatterd wept protested loues art could instruct vaine vertue strong rocke vehement suite till last pitie procured reward shee granted making wife willingly happinesse long thus enioyed one sad night dreamd first loue furiously reuild change sent reuenge scorne worst contempt waked distracted shee deare shee wife grieued forgiue content vrania vntouchd loue anger likewise welcomd else mourning cast ioy expressd clothes triumph could produce pamphilia admiringly beheld vrania brother last loue said h e strange variety assuredly none thy seruants let wauerings possesse protect mee yet distresse let ordaind licensed true patterne true constancy let loue loyall passion oft vexe perplexe soule one day especially alone wood hee thus complaine neuer quiet tormenting passion canst thou desire couet thou hast gaind absence thou dost molest cruell paine presence thou torturest feare despaire dost burne desire obtaine yet sealest vp lipps discouering leaue contrariety make liue peaceably happily scorchd heate doubt hope burnd ash onely smoake suspition fuming whole selfe consumed fire could belieue sighes could hope sadnesse proceeded ground could thinke lookes loue could imagine hee prouokes discourse like passion find affection seate might fortunate discouer hidden ruines passion thy end onely afflict neuer helpe thou dost still worke thy selfe thine owne mortall enemy ill spirit thy selfe would find cause hurt nurse would feede babe rather milke weane starue able else sustaine cruell nurse denie foode famish mee despaire leane liuing miserable fate vnnaturall murder selfe breed bred woe forsake necessitie haue giuen education brought vp learning loue condemned ill scholler haue learnd enough must make vse teach little onely know pelican let bloud saue young one passion let mee childrens affection pine starue one drop lifebloud hope would cherish hope abandon mee remaine vnfortunate witnesse tyranny welcome teares cryd shee tender kind striuing ease mee carefull meanes wept sighd sobd groand anguish spring run selfe euen dry rose grasse bed extreamest weight heauinesse oppressed variety loue came among meane discourse kind euery one relating story vrania last italy went abroad wood dainty riuer want passed chance walking vp downe call mind sweete iland wherein bred pleasant passage therein farre thought possest mooued sadnesse passion passion attendance power threw self vpon ground remaining trance lull charmes awakd sweete sleepe voyce heard lamentably complaine sadnesse neuer sadder brought mee passion companion desire longing assist afflicted creature word spoke appeard woman louer drew neerer gaine sight could perceiud lie vpon earth head roote weeping willow dropped downe teares christalline streames hanging part faire armes ouer embrace selfe cleare glasse shee lay betweene body sad tree riuer passed close running haste carry sorrowes sorrow sure abiding shee habit shepherdesse pleased see bringing estate againe mind wherein liued first bin enough call reliefe wherefore going brake forth speech mixt many sighes fearefull stopps poore liana said shee thy feruent loues reward haue got hate friend curse parent vtter vndoing selfe hope bee requited falshood ala vnkind shepheard haue deserud thy hand thus cruelly tormented vndeseruedly forsaken neuer may loue thee better doe must though thou proue thus vnkind word vnkind brought kind company teares second seeing stept vnto sorrowfully amazedly beheld feare griefe ioyning together face offering first haue gone would permit haue mind fortune would suffer enioy staid vsd word seeke leaue haue pincht torment hauing loud somtimes wanted pity much shun experienced since cannot better accompanied ignorant paine haue much lamented absence dislike falshood haue gained freedome would could find cure said since command seeme fit obayd flee first offerd shame haue folly discouerd chiefe shepheard misfortune brought knowledge make desire speedy end thus onely child heire estate great shepherd many sought deed young best shepherd countrey youthes striuing made striue vse alike alanius haue heard part discourse sure haue already vnderstood name headspring calamitie alanius affected onely loud say truth desperatly loue loue sweet name honourd power bring disaster secretly loud somewhile vnknowne vnto himselfe heart made selfe prisoner little imagining mine beene much subiect continued till paine made discouer loue pittie held ouer paine mixed mine owne affection compelld yeeld misfortune yet alanius worthy loue hee loued must euer loue still though false false murdering word selfe carry death million torture ioynd yet thou art vnfortunate call thee else worth wanted thee sadd relation proceed continuance loues pretty space another alanius comming thither sought wife good estate equall hope rise fortune giuen husbandry commendable quality countryman affect father minde breed therefore giuen consent looking towardlinesse man great blessing hee receiued vsuall increase stocke allurement scarce heeded rich looked vnto fortune loues till one day father calld telling mee match made doubting liking shewed much comfort conceiud went ioy mariage beene straight bee consummated truely little amazed withall till finding made answere pulling told mee hee hopd silence proceeded ground bashfulnesse since assurd himselfe would gainesay commanded much dislike intended doe wherefore hee would haue mee ioyne dutifull agreement choice order loue goe along pleasure young maides eye like onely father liked loue appoint gaue sight greater mischiefe wherefore kneeld downe word speake onely teares besought remember promise neuer force marry said ought obedience rather wilfull obeying question appoint take bee assured like like wed shall neuer receiue least fauour accompted stranger lost childe word ran soule like poyson veines chilling cold fit ague disperseth coldnesse ouer one body alanius meant death heare marriage yet desirous seeme ignorant resolud desired know pleased bestow vpon hee replyd one worthy thou canst imagine thy selfe deseruing naming name like thunderbolt strike life death yet strength though contrary iudgement doe kneeld againe told please kill better willingly embrace else vnlesse desire see wretched con clude day misery besought alter purpose man breathing could loue staid withall yet rage proceeded cryd haue setled affection else fine man hath wonne idle fancie hath made duty voide whose faire tongue hath brought foulenesse disobedience speake speake truely may discerne choice make refuse fatherly authoritie ouer truely trembled yet meaning obey much possible doe heart louing expression dutie told alanius alanius trimme choice truely said like owne wit discretion see haue done choose man onely ou side stranger thing know runaway countrey none knowing himselfe able say weeping implord better opinion since assured selfe could come blessing enioying happinesse world would come else desird would wedd graue rather alanius onely could loue one placed affection vpon alone life hope comfort hope comfortable company owne sorrow teares neuer left pleasing mee said selfe thus doe suffer alanius next morning sent one seruants young ladd loued well faster tied seruice command said ouerioyd sent attend knight going away also left iland whether seeke serue hating poorenesse place absent youth sent father know continued disobedience night sent word hate selfe conscience euer able accuse offence true loue continued firme vnremouable alanius ala change constant heart fixed like destiny could let thing come neere might mistrusted lead one piece change carry one ragg abroad heart like woole briar catch torne spoild rather pulld intolerable seruitude fast holding losse loosing gaine yet rather lose keepe vertuous constancie answer gaue returnd youth wherupon without seeing sent sister house bee kept sorry must call sister keepe memory diuellish creature neuer liud halfe yeare without meanes let alanius know imprisonment sought guided loue mee hauing truer director found till one day comming flock hee accustomed doe faire plaine wont meet mett ladd seeing sadd asked ayld alanius replide choose mourne whose heart kept indeed said cannot blame hauing losse yet sure haue heart place else could liue feele discouer want know tormenting sorrow feeles would yet perplexed wretch cryed shee bee tormented liue heare without redressing yet talke foole cry ayde baying lambes assist poore flocke buy freedome merit release indeed selfe thinke worthy borne blessednesse releeue vext harmd power hast thou ouer thy teares flow assistance sheepe innocent thy selfe loyall passion armes thy sheepehooke onely catch beast thou vnworthy cr ature art able helpe poorest thing assist friend kinde thou canst neither helpe thy selfe worst thing created end rid world corruption breath serue liana may serue relieue said youth heare take aduise doe would since find loue indeed ought doe satisfied thus farre trust neuer true tell giue assistance towards deliuery yonder house vpon top hill shewes self boldly boasting cruelty committed warrant cruell father aunt yet still liana close kept none saue selfe may see father visit day though loue sends trie vnfatherly torture shee may bee wrought leaue louing much failes impossible famine make one leaue wish food rather want increase longing seeing threatneth forsaking oft haue carried message oft returnd sorrowfull receiuing doome direct deniall demaunds truly hath euen grieud soule see terribly hath perplext handled rude merciles executor way alter blame curstnes neuer mild morning see vtterd word ala said vnhappy liana art thou afflicted thy constancy yet tell father kind command wrought cruelty yet neither loialty loue hardned paine vse paine torment million added rest shall haue power moue least affection vnworthy change soule smart onely body subiect torment told truly master nothing moud rage sending another fellowes sister coniuring since neither perswasions begun torture would preuaile vse mean affliction could alter sparing none limmes harmd doubt shall bee executed wherefore must thinke speedily aide indures still resolud beare misery assure self wil indure al laid vpon rather faile one title loues fealty way know sure speedy write letter deliuer therein let know true constant affection beare bring sole comfort dolefull heart wil venture bring selfe happines freedom make mutually contented must meet little wood next house faile carry misery delight pleasure ah deare friend said hast thou bound thy friendship louing care v canst thou performe said let mee alone take care shall charge honestly discharge deliuer mine owne hand came father shall meanes haue roome priuate discourse shal hinder discouering desire happines agreed vpon parted time youth flock alanius pen paper euening meeting according appointment leauing alanius prepare al thing ready coming couey next town maried comming leauing fals shepherd fairly like falsest betraier blis promised readines v honest lad part telling aunt speak presently great priuate mistrusting little glad let father men see circumspectly kept order brought vp instantly afflicted iron rod saw youth ala said come torment pity sake let haue end take life best last prize tirannies answer could alter master messenger intrusted hee secret message vnto wherefore intreating mine aunt rest leaue roome left v together gone wee free danger began thus thinke sweet liana come matter griefe welcome tidings long desird blisse enioying wil selfe marre owne content possible cryd liue see happinesse reade said tell whether may resolue happy refuse tooke letter excessiue ioy said shee opened finding firmenesse wanting might content loyalty professed large protestation affection expressed dearest kind sweetest manner besides meanes happinesse belieued sought imagine madam said kist letter wept ioy soone foretelling greater cause sake suffered teares proouing slight witness far deeper suffering found contrary alanius false heauens thought would sooner change snow lie aetna would breake faith vngratefull ventured life fortune fulfill desire went youth cald menander hauing gotten thing necessary escape assisted maid house much pitied estate loued menander made vse night benefit disguise brought thither vnder colour necessary left house soone arriud appointed groue hilles foote way feare possessed left long staid giuen cause vnkindnes faster hasted alone could truly giue life comfort desire see made accuse selfe long tarrying especially saw saw death ioy martirdome poore heart saw anothers armes wronging faith breaking made vowes stood amaze willing belieue mine eye accusing would carry light knowledge bring self rather put quite selfe heard vse speech true loud liana indeed fortune made seeke comparison thee affection borne hate onely loue rather esteeming self happy enioying thee thy delight endowed whole iland rich without loue truth rich doe possesse thee word turnd amazednes rage cry false faithlesse creature beast man hast thou thus vildly betrayd thy constant liana hee looking vp perceiuing fault said nothing fast guiltines stord shame could carry hee fled delight wanton following way tooke groue know honest lad would leaue mee bearing part mee griefe shame infinitely molested hee made instrument betraying endured little space like cabinet fild treasure though selfe yet lock hinge cannot containe breake open lock speech flie abroad discouer treasure truth infinitenesse falshood bee comprehended passion grew full strong mee swounded came againe feele increase misery hee perswaded willing heare saw goodnesse cosned left groue accursed place cause curse comming faire meadow dainty wood another side vnfortunate eies againe meete alanius vnlucky encounter saw falshood yet boldly venturd towards mee hee running greatest haste sending voyce coniuring loue bare heare calling mee liana saw error appeare vnto yet griefe rather hate hold glasse though neglected deceiued forsaken truth ioy loose delight another yet mournd deceitfull god knowes loue still fled sent heart wish good like parthian arrowes cry seemd wound word though strike ran threw back true accounted haue cut knot aud left ioine piece againe misfortune losse loue happinesse attend contrary abiding forsaken afflicted liana got wood shelter thickest part petition grant succour coueting greatest shade hide thick shade lately ran manner liud neuer seeing company light still haunting priuatest place striuing gaine sea soone obtaind getting opportunity youth passing italy sought perissus bring notice vncles death king sicily passed came country euer since haue romingly endured neuer one place setled youth menander parted sea thinke going seeke master rather shee close speech multitude teares truly mooud mee much compassion beginning hold deare perswaded leaue life liue would accompany sorrowes rather afflict mirth besides might bee company shee might gaine remedy torture remedy death said shee haue long haue sought yet obay abide time wood beseeehing vrge court poorest place much better doth agree estate enioy conuersation granted thing concluding often visit passe time together louing discourse said amphilanthus fauour sweete sister prooues loue water seemes hath thorowly washed away affection reliques remaine old passion truly dear st brother said shee thought cleane dround yet goe story doe deare sister said begin againe yet blusht find taken yet daintily proceeded promise religiously kept betweene v euery day visiting shepherdesse one day together discoursing walking wood heard one farre v sadly sing od kind song remember getting afterwards coppy bee deceiud sweet cosin said like also song speaking word directed thought power diuine louecommanding eye within whose lid kept fire loue close selues ruiue lie band death darkenesse moue one looke doth giue sparck kindle flame burne heart martyr might receiuing one kind smile find new frame loue build wholly light soule doth fixe thought vpon gazing vnto amazement greedy see blessed light louesheauen bow themselues wretched else kill rule loues god mercy flourish god must murder creature nourish pamphilia much commended pleased vrania infinitely touching thought one estate proper song well composd truly said amphilanthus much liked cosin doth please truth said pamphilia deserues iudgement much liking smild vrania going seeme brother said little willing crosse day proceed discourse song pleasd iest ended voyce againe begin lament manner scorne ordaind reward true loue fully requited firme affection must rewarded contempt forsaking richly payd deserue sweet payment alone consisteth deare loue iniurd none causelesly afflicted cruelly reiected loue suffer thou wilt faith indure neglect euer selues pure vnspotted vnkind liana yet pardon calling thee since heart grieues word vnkind yet giue leaue tell thee haue deserud punishment thee merited rigor anothers offence may make faulty guilty el free loue still thee blame thought staine art thou vniust sweete iudge harmes punish without fault committed pitie yet recall censure wrongfully giuen condemned without cause still led towards execution daily torture without merit man die anothers act must also suffer tiranny else consider falfe iudgement shame vnto iudge lie heauy conscience call backe ere die vnmerited verdict since truth withstands thy cruelty would liana haue gone see thus accused heard againe say verse concluded went wee went heard another speake vnto thus alanius doe thus accuse liana torment selfe shee certaine shee would must pity blame flying seeing belieued vnkindnesse foule error ala said alanius farre euer blame soule permit loue lesse though curst nay false yet loue best assured truth giue leaue blame rashnes curse owne ill fortune vnluckie life gaue giues dislike smart vnto dearer selfe sad day liana knew doe certaine complainer alanius imagine menander willing reconcile broken fortune made goe towards accompaning sorrowes selfe neere looking vp perceiuing without ceremony regarding ran vnto kneeling downe cryd word ala deare liana hath vnhappy slaue alanius deserud thus pitilesse tortured heare truth rashly censure consider great wrong still suffer mistake liana loued much equally perplexed yet little possible bearing owne sorrow affliction caused lifted vp ground teares said think alanius thy liana thee thou wilt haue yet blame directly thing since menander resolue thee cause yet let passe bee confident thy loue hath command mee hadst thou false would say imagined thy repentance thy loued sight haue destroyd thought offence might haue borne thee forgetfulnes mee gouernd memory thy loue rising kisse louers reconcild themselues cast away mourning story strange mistaking arise shall heare time nay sweet vrania said amphilanthus let v heare better company pleasing dearer v pamphilia agreed said continue take care said belieue neuer happy company eye spake shee proceeded wee sat downe alanius kneeling v began first part life happy part sure shepherdesse hath related brought full period nay height misery wherefore begin succession imagine shee left leauing mee plaine better resolue deceit night wee meet coming place appointed saw imagined selfe louer wronging loue well ill might conceiue thus truth liud shepherd companion bewitched young maydes loue vnluckily placd loue plotted deceiue shape winne owne person could purchase wherefore vnlucky night came vnto lodging stole away clothes vsually solemne dayes weare habit went groue like stature speech fauor oftentimes taken euen knowing walke euening towards wood plaine saw followed groue ouertaking iust place appointed blisse little darkish mistooke hoping content blinded wherein doe accuse vsed word giue true assurance twas selfe concerning deare liana vnhappily hee heard must confesse gaue full assurance faulsest fault cannot blame thee sweet loue made thee feare feare inraged thee yet heart thou mightest haue heard thy poore alanius speak yet honest ladd told thou didst neuer hate person though condemne disloialtie greatest misery gaue yet easie stopp vnto paine thou didst assure thy fury flight thou seemedst wish blessd hauing made hast came thither first perceiud shee mistrusted amisse following first direction likewise came stead onely discernd footesteps woman hauing gone hast thought end thinking liana feard danger selfe harme ensued night vnfrequented place might produce dreaming harme followed step knew foot easie discerned others dainty lamb sheepe long persued euen newly meadow see deare much offended therewithall ioyd first fledd giuing mee language fate appeard vndone cryd shee ledd accusd yet wish happinesse attend comfort despaire followed still till lost selfe witts growing madd many trick euer creature distracted could committ pantaleria got cicilie boat taken vp pyrat booty finding estate landed naples passed time yet fame liues madnesse distemperd fell company louing knight since vnderstood dearest friend next degree madnes louing ouermuch came kingdome haue lost heere gained friend menander conducted vnto vertuous lady skilfull physicke neuer left curious medicine curious paine till recouerd lost wit againe sensible distresse tooke leaue menander came vnto place directed sadd man come againe life deare forgiuer onely ioy man directed neere court said liana vnlikely place finde sorrow poore miserable louer said alanius found laid vnder willow tree bitterly weeping bewailing cruelty shepherdesse vnwillingly made selfe mistris heart went demand thing well griefe would suffer answered v strangely appeard desired speake nothing loue torture telling v man whose destiny made vndoe louing one griefe teares praiers estate held could bring pitty hauing setled loue much vpon another shee hated sought though good worke thought change discourse description soone found sweetest selfe deare liana brought v hither wee assurd hoped vnder tree left vowes remaine hath life buried bed shall tombe liana modestly denied knowledge matter much affection loue yet neuer saw image like welcomd heart eye tongue striuing expresse ioyes returne court two stranger deare brother commended pastorall menander tooke waite mee conf ssd hee liana told left pantaleria finde hee attending chamber sweet discourse ended rose went court prince liking kindly concluded enioying blessed thing name blessing without benefit must kinde onely bereft deserues richest plenty ollorandus continuing morean court newes brought vnto brother death hee prince bohemia besides desired old father returne might see possible death age griefe son death likewise soone befall prince met amphilanthus iust returne walk hauing left lady chamber going seeke discourse passion preuented thus deare onely worthy friend read dare beseech company place see necessity weigh fortune know haue beene enioynd leaue know likewise good must receiue likely come amphilanthus read letter gaue thereby saw accompany friend leaue better friend deare behinde great perplexitie diuided twixt two loues one dissembld yet answerd thus happinesse befalne bohemia ioy yet comparison little merit kingdome pay many answer resolud goe straight thither need iourney since passion strongest first would haue causd father death happened neuer bee doubtfull safety bee confident well may time enough goe thither countrey much loues neuer let absence wrong valour none dare goe vsurpe right care thus may bee settled home business resolue heare countrey goe thither promise infinitely ingage stay answere going selfe carrying mee must leaue succour formerly promised steriamus time growes army bee together within moneth ready martch besides confidence much mee good part troope wee dispence put beseech fauour v much yet thinke speake deny going show vnwillingnesse truth reason one deare friend said ollorandus queene pamphilia heare shortly returne owne kingdome whither promisd conduct true said amphilanthus yet preferre friendly respect seruice one whose iudgement mixd noblenesse binde one anothers harme performe complement yet must confesse would grieue mee faile promise came hither cyprus would leaue vnguarded guarded selfe goe whose loue company esteeme aboue men fortune loue said ollorandus shall waite vpon equall dare say selfe much inferiour perfection part must yeeld ability mine shall approue selfe euer faithfull let say reason nothing hinder command hath force euer shall bee power alter rule course steriamus loue next aboue mine owne kingdome else alone calld vpon would stay summond father duty herein obligeth present neede going albania bee moneth say army ioynd may bee two well long martching besides haue certaine way must passe epirus shall without fighting braue faire queene countrey hath alreadie refused wherefore say time euery thing ready army neere albania may meet come time enough serue steriamus said answered amphilanthus one reason alleadged sweare want another cause inuite way must fauourd see melysinda kingdome prouide true ende obedience haue gessed right cannot blame said ollorandus hauing sense parting well let going sake stay heere wee must part said amphilanthus goe especially entend goe hungaria intend said liue must break appointment attend embraced parted resoluing speed take voyage ollorandus promising himselfe much good amphilanthus heartily mourning graue melissea coniurd part therefore must obey supper done amphilanthus selarinus according custome brought queene pamphilia chamber vrania lay intreaty selarina next roome likewise thither come amphilanthus countenance changed wonted manner mirth excellent discourse turnd silence sighes made lady sadd see desirous know ca se vrania therefore began aske reason alteration hee casting eye true sadnes heart prisoner selarina standing iust onely said till time neuer afflicted whereby lord said pamphilia may aske reason desire serue seruice may auayle ala madam said make happy neuer misse happinesse said vrania selarinus sister left together sitting bed walking window finding discourse long went next roome cabinet queenes bookes paper lay taking passed reading longer would haue done heard excellent musick cald hearken consiste lute voyces continued till end discourse betweene matchlesse prince finished came amphilanthus told hee liberty goe goe whi said vrania tedious vnwilling voyage said hee destiny haue yet shall goe better contented feard haue done yet perplexd goe speech passed vrania extreamely bewailing going grieuing knew resolution taken pamphilia also depart sorrowes tooke away attention song late amphilanthus selarinus tooke leaues night going downe backway garden musick passe vnwilling seene threw cloakes ouer face purposed passe master company hating man receiued fauor lady wanted imagining amphilanthus one rudely pulld cloake selarinus downe amphilanthus instantly drew sword strake head likewise struck parted quickly making noise offence giuer knowing selarinus retird passing without hinderance chamber amphilanthus come indured night much impatiency day thought spiteful therfore would appeare kindly forgaue stay instantly made ready attend garden walk hee went knowing lady would long thence wandring vp downe thought restlesse came willow tree antissia found pamphilia vnder lay long heard voice men side riuer hearkning little vnderstood said voice marueld infinitly discourse whe found leandrus struck sory willingly hurt brother remebring maner knew blamd man puld friend cloake downe drawne owne hat low ouer eye although hee able vnder see yet hindred discouery himselfe well leandrus said thanke thy selfe though thou didst offer iniury sorry thee glad harme thee pursuing discourse heard resolud pamphilia refuse would vse meanes possible win friend last meanes hee would vse amphilanthus hee would intreate mediator denied might take vnkindnes selarinus married might haue iust quarrell seeking profest suiter thing troubled prince see ill nature leandrus knew haue time enough bee reuenged pleasure hauing heard thus much soone enough found ill discernd goodnesse seene went back wood met pamphilia vrania rosindi steriamus selarinus comming together saying sent philarchos seeke hereplyd wood walkes could giue onely account since day pleasantly passed together parselius delinea also came vnto passing downe towards riuer amphilanthus turnd backe wondring hee intreating obayd surely said rosindy see place hee great iniury done haue taken amphila thus neuer hauing heard would denied till hee story brother sister deliuerd haue sufferd said thus much ala might liue worthy deserue turnd againe towards company place deuided many seuerall walkes troope deuided selfe euery couple hauing taken different walke rosindy seeing besides perceiuing orilena comming alone sure said hee fashion wherefore leaue two together take yonder lady walke wel placed steriamus vrania parselius dalinea rosindy sister selarinus gone forth selarina thus passed morning returnd dinner found leandrus full discontent company made dissemble dinner king calld daughter pamphilia telling earnest suiter leandrus consent haue marriage liked well considering worth fitnesse estate alleaging reason wise carefull father could make vnto himselfe perswade beloued daughter humbly made answere thing maiesty said confessed true worthy greatest fortune world wife maiestie married kingdome pamphilia husband shee could bee diuorced euer would haue might please giue leaue enioy happinesse besides besought permission lord said shee people looke must need said king portion giuen marriage leandrus lord said shee beseech cannot loue belieue loues ought besides kingdome honour daughter antissia better fitteth appointed king knew reason said assuring would force thing mind though glad match could content fell discourse king going young prince euery one discoursd liked best amphilanthus gone forth ollorandus rest altogether selarinus comming pamphilia telling accident happened night said likely haue well knockt amphilanthus honourd presence late queene bore dislike enough leandrus euen inraged yet discretion told lesse spoken much better would bee wherefore said little discoursed selarinus vsd doe finely plainely man trusted friend indeed euer prooud vnto many action triall selarinus loue desperately philistella second daughter king morea young princesse excelling fairenes snow rose could equall white red face neuer seene excellent beauty whitenesse though pamphilia fame onely princesse liuing yet white face philistella beauty sweetenesse louelinesse excelling richnesse mind beautified person yet purenesse skinne much seene necke hand farre surpasse sister yet thought bee younger lady face without comparison pure faire made skinne though excellent shew duller haire whiter queenes brighter hauing glasse vpon matchlesse rarenesse colour shining philistella conquered heart many selarinus man sought hope others either daring knowing fit contented themselues beholding knowing fruitlesly languish loue selarinus broken secret pamphilia time tooke occasion speake againe content nothing could mooud passion face eye spake heart vpon rack hope feare leandrus seeing belieued pamphilia mooued greater hatred verily thinking prince affected seeing willingly shee embrace company amphilanthus came leandrus straight went vnto desiring would giue one thing would demand aske said hee thing mee whereto engaged grant know may secure selfe said hee haue mind refuse vnder may deny nay said mistrust causelesly touch basenesse neuer yet dealt truly men pardon lord said hee take word first except number thing whereto ingaged two said world wil grant said leandrus suite since haue long earnest passionate suiter faire cruell cosin hauing got consent father mother brother friend likewise ioyne speake vnto pamphilia mee know respect much soone directed friend hath wherefore beseech grant fauour tie perpetually seruice king replied true seene affection confessed worth desert bee equall prince merit wife whose answering loue might meete cosin selfe farre could vnderstand purposed marry gaind consent parent brother hee purchased surest preuaile himselfe although confessed happinesse shee much esteeme fouud would heare soone yet misfortune could doe seruice desired doe make manifest loue vnto lighted one excepted thing since last night said speaking marriage shee said shee already bestowed vpon people married selfe vrging youth pitie would bee die without leauing picture self excellent piece said friend hopd would keepe memory enough striuing perswade altering determination lord said settled euer make mee see loue mee would haue confident wellwishings let mee begge neuer speake husband swore seald vowes faire hand wherefore lord leandrus see bound otherwise belieue would deny noble request speake protest truly soone sooner liuing prince leandrus contented answere belieuing iustly might doe said onely truth parted leandrus giuing many thankes noble freedome going philistella selarina passing time pamphilia bringing selarinus pretily discourse steriamus earnestly pursue affection vrania although willingly entertaind yet meant wary could hauing deceiued wherefore much modesty mildnesse denied yet sweetnesse denying gaue hope heart proceed time together gaue witnesse hauing gaind fauour standing alone window protesting true zealous affection man could beare vnto woman told protestation hee often vsed pamphilia hee perfect said shee brother hath told mee many power loue ouer though shee neuer receiued much pitie true said hee brother found miserable piece mankind made anew loue lesse sex yet greatest slaue shee reiected mee thanke heauens since kept happinesse shee greater selfe wish hee may enioy bee blessed fauour onely blessing doe wish aske onely blisse let former loue bee receiuing mee first hath lost loue blame bee mee choice good pray parselius cosin loue married dalin vrania thinke liked shee throwne rock cast away former fault burie deepes loues cured take perfect one new borne vnto shee blushed told hee grew bitterer louers vse smild told none spot find fault anothers vnlesse cleane washed away remaining feare said shee bee true nothing said hee water could haue cleansed heart ranckling wound shall thing al er truth another charme may cure said neuer said hee helpe loue grieues mee said shee cannot present first affection yet truly may kind liked loued giue mee second said hee first esteeme cherish new created one shall liue neuer blessed neuer truer shall loue one iust mine said thus giuing prety assurance eithers affection presented bracelet diamond next day requiting much pretious one thought brede haire day passed sweet delightfull passage passed betweene court fild loue parselius perceiued loues well contented vrania freely shew amphilanthus infinitely glad seeking meanes continuance day pamphilias chamber swarmd louers steriamus vrania selarinus philistella parselius wife philarchos orilena queene selfe beholding heart true patient must shew leandrus rest leaue visit see passion one sure neuer snare sport else terrible feare fall laborinth queen gratiously respected spake loue deafe euer found occasion discourse somthing el others amphilanthus graced selarina discourse made whole court iudge affection placed truth deserue excellent fine princesse fro al amorous delight braue prince must go betake field aduenture ollorandus next day time depart also pamphilias going ouer night took leaue court willing said seene much woman weepe parting yet vrania witnes getting vp earely amphilanthus ollorandus comming ready stayed till went downe vrania bringing coach two prince teares parted side vrania wept part deare brother cousen pamphilias heart pierced like sorrow greater stopd teares hauing stronger spirit till beholding water amphilanthus eye ready fall waite vpon least summons eye would giue let slide drop saluted loue smiling teares see kind affectionate parting glorying owne worke proud conquest part taking leaue without saying farewell heart eye making long could attend behold long way contrary sight soone lost pamphilia went alone saue owne traine knight come pamphilia attend thither quickly haste made arriud sea shee shipped passed kingdome infinite ioy troopes people shee receiued conducted chiefe city perga shee remaind plenty thing delicate conuersation vsed haue morea want made melancholly afterwards shee comforting selfe hope resolution shee came abroad followed delight shee wont affect hunting hawking like two braue companion holding way hating land chose sea tooke shpp sornesse passing zants setalonia went vp gulfe venice landed triale whence without one aduenture worthy rehearsing came confines bohemia met two knight demanded newes place resolud king dead many going search prince lord ollorandus discouer himselfe vnto infinitly reioyced passing came vnto castle would said lodge night two knight tolde meanes doe dwelt cruelest man part name seuerus next bloud ollorandus wherefore meanes would aduise none left himselfe stocke aduenture doores new king imagining disgrace vnto let thing passe feare would perswaded saying hee assured hee durst attempt thing vpon person amphilanthus disswaded could yet vaine hee resolud nothing could preuaile staying yet obtaind would hold himselfe vnknowne hee replid neede call ollorandus would neuer leaue happy name knight forrest passd many aduentures thus rashly would runn danger worst hazad brauest prince gate came presently bid welcome many seruants attended tooke horse conducting hall old duke seuerus sat chaire little staffe hand thumbe staffe mouth thumbe euer fashion minde set vpon plot comming calld minde little looking seeing rarenesse person louelinesse countenance imagined great quality especially amphilanthus went welcomd rest desiring know thus courteously honourd house amphilanthus told italian hearing bounty country made take boldnes visit hoping also vnderstand manner place yet meere stranger olde duke told hat done especiall fauour wherein could doe courtesy finde ready requitall honour demanded others name amphilanthus replyd friend himselfe vpon certaine vow mistress till saw againe disclose name known title knight loue hims lfe knight forrest thus passed part world whence came last beseech said morea said knight loue newes pray said olde duke haue heard ollorandus prince king father brother death heard said amphilanthus eares vnlesse deafe haue notice valour excellent goodnesse much haue desired honoured sight accounting one misfortune knowne famous prince hath act replied duke made name well knowne heartily glad shall kingdome againe flourish shall gouerned braue king become pray hauing desire see could compasse truely said knight loue going finde accident vnlooked calld morea much heart neuer thing could neither goe albania say must shortly stay desired ee sighd indeed passionatly pittied duke demanded others answered stranger encountred vpon way seemd good knight duke tooke knight loue right hand forrest knight left desiring others likewise sit sitting downe altogether amphilanthus besought let know estate country stood said desire goe court see hearing king dead would willingly ordered doe truely said sir direct better way stay heere till time heare king nothing seene safety much countrey army prouiding men raysing much businesse toward pray sir said knight forrest men raysd chiefe yet replid hath declared himselfe foure great men call troop together yet none hauing right claime thought haue yet discouer himselfe next bloud said marry said last king vnkle brother father sir pleasd said hee withstand force king right ala sir said see old euer souldier borne deformed see armes carpet shoulder crooked mishapen ordaind kept eye would rather bring contempt respect stature low body weake framd chamberkeeper rather knight armes haue son hope wil worthy bloud pray said truely certaine thinke night answered duke thing netled ollorandus yet couerd rage well could thus passd time till supper old duke desir goe lodgeings vnarme themselues returning sate meate duke supper time curiously beholding knight especially ollorandus imagined complexion fauour face king though long since seene ground malice made discerne otherwise laine hidden enuy hauing sharpn sse discouering thus night grew supper ended knight brought seuerall lodging amphilanthus desired lye friend duke complement de iringthey see welcome respect done would permit lodge alone two carried towre farre chamber ollorandus safe thought discouery went bedd taking rest soundly dwarfe lying next roome amphilanthus much liberty freedome rest granted wherefore went bedd walked vp downe camber old posture armes acrosse breathing sighes wishing eye might blessed seeing soule euer beheld feruent loue neuer deuiding selfe heate fire passion growne commander ouer imag loues torment curiously carued life passionate distresse measure thought hee delicately expresse paine verse dainty saue himselfe mistris euer saw especially parting hee made night muse finished conceit hee calld attendance summond fearefull terrible noise mixt voyces armour last hee heard friend say traytors thus betraying stranger villaine doe thine owne house farewell deare friend let misfortune wholly end word knowledge speaker quickly make king prepare rescue wherefore arming himselfe ran towards chamber ollorandus lay way saw fetterd leading gate might appeare prison quickely came cry led stay refused feard many e set vpon deuided themselues held play rest went away king taking aduantage busie fighting hand imployd eye also vsed office well consider traitor neuer let eye made soone perceiue villany readily preuent thinking steale away staied made streames bloud deliuer confession liues victory dwarfe time roared castle two knight awaked came rescue amphilanthus throwing sword sheild one vanquished ollorandus time came hee readie bee slaine old duke sonne comming together incouraging seruants promise commanded threatnings kill armes protected furiouslie flie among old monster reuiling people letting escape death till amphilanthus got opening mouth speake hatefully thrust sword hindring villanous word hee else deliuered two also came saued braue prince killing worme dispatching ill naturd man way molesting good creature sonne reuenged father death killing elder brother whose death amphilanthus quickly payd young man end striking arme whereof died getting close ollorandus set backe backe fought till gaind stepps went vp hall getting euen pressed doore continued fight kept neare got betweene ollorandus doore amphilanthus hoping croud friend come locked doore shut ollorandus ingirdled enemy past hope neuer daunted king espying error soone amended yet forced leape window low aide dore opening outward held close enemy got among againe like thunderbolt piercing killing resisted like poore feeble dogges snarld best defence could bi e rescued friend apparent death thus performed prophecy mellissea made double ioy saue thus soone liberty returne heart found might priuiledged part businesse done old young duke kild two honest brother slaine hauing gaind fame die laid bed honor allotted die king sight quarrell staid castle seeking vnfortunate man creature fallen cruel power man many found among acquaintance setting libertie departed towards prage chiefe towne bohemia attended released prisoner ollorandus openly discouering himselfe troop subiects came daily within day crownd sending force scatterd troopes raised dead traytor confedera oppose king quiet possession setled solemnity past sent dwarfe hungary letter loue dwarfe knowing lord mind wel might nothing hast gesse performd part feareles al thing lord strombolly arriud hungary inquiry got buda thence hee directed castle ten league forrest whither queene gone take pleasure king staying buda dwarfe benighted glad take lodging poore house happy find one wild place hauing lost way next morning hee sooner taken horse rode halfe league met knight others riding great speed apparreld greene demanding met stagge hee told met nothing except themselues since tooke horse passed still met made inquirie last hee saw lady comming full speed attended many whose riding horse shewed could willingly haue heard staggs fall tidings dwarfe witty carefull charge imagining lady herselfe attendant though many brauely clad queene hee stayd one came within two three person desired know melisinda hee answered whereupon hee stayd iust way shee must stay offended began correct kissing letter deliuerd vnto soone knew hand commanded stay attend answer loue expresse thy selfe hunting pleasing sport delighteth tedious wearisome feared stagge would fall soone required wished rude beast would shee say selfe knowes nothing bruitishnesse canst thou finish thy dayes best wish thee fauoring faine would see sometimes little slacke speede fearing company would know stay guiltinesse ouerruld went sometimes meaning mend seate counterfeit cause stay liking againe furie beast pursuing thus rid traueld thought irresolutely till iust claime pardon former offence hee fell yeelding himselfe life power quickly shee alighted performing right required huntsman honour victorie funerall shee walked little groaue horse stirring vp downe hot sore ridden shee shee kissed letter opened hauing read kissed often deare paper said shee welcome heauenly blessing mee thou bringest mee word ollorandus liues hee thinkes poore melysinda liue still dearest loue let honour glorie honouring thee happie newes heare deere king happie hee crownes himselfe constancy perfect lawrell louers doest thou loued remember wretched mee nay make mee see thy mindfulnesse writing mee sweete line expression rather want loue yet louing expression testifying nothing absence make want blessed bee destenie brought thus hunt mine eye thrice happy haue seene word written best men yet sighd al done fire must consume cabinet must hold truth loued must beloued mee prooue sweet sacrifice safety iealousie spread selfe farre onely memory bee safe reliques saue ash remaine safe keeping thy ash yet shalbe preserud sacred still continued came shee forth returnd vnto castle many examining dwarfe whence came hee would haue came whether would goe hee errant well told wandering youth seruant knight imprisond free ioy bard losse loud many desired haue refused saying would returne owne countrie end day master could bee set free thus hee put till day past dispatched queene whose letter sooner ended teares light shee sealed also gaue death rather safer life sacrificing vnto loues carefully putting ash vp daintie cabinet inclosing within verse made witnessing sorrow burning vowes made burned pure hol fire kindly aspire hot performance nature turne crosse selfe neuer burne reliques blessed hand ioynd mutuall holy band loue deare desire blame dearest line loues flame blacknesse twine heart mourning doth expresse grief sorrow lesse deepest groanes couer change woe heart tombe keepes e showe whic worth ill refines ala yet burne pitie smart groanes turne paine away yet must consume content must beare plume dustlike dispaire may liue yet shall memory outdriue paine wherein mourne reliques pure loue sacred keepe remooue purgd fire harme iealous feare liue chast cleare true preserueresse pure truth graue giues youth faith liue mooue famous body still flame anciently preserue name vnto funerall nobly come honour giuing tombe teares loue performe right constancie beares light burne keepe blame satisfie grieuing losse kind line day shee say letter selfe much shee loued shee learned heart looking ash wept kissing put vp againe thus continued shee till ollorandus himselfe came daylie offering made hee hee settled kingdome longing much see shee desired presence put gouernment charge president counsell assuring nothing haue soone parted hee must performe part friendship amphilanthus required louingly brauely accomplished none honouring louing much hee much adoe kind quarrel leaue countrie without attend yet milde perswasions new king commanding power two tooke iourney dwarfe againe returning day left prage towards hungarie haste passing morauia met strange encounter sad spectacle company men foote apparreld long mourning gownes chariot beeing drawne sixe horse beeing couered blacke chariot bodie beeing couerd blacke veluet couering foot body sate ladie face beeing towards pitifullie weeping many mourning likewise walking chariot round behind lamentable dolefull spectacle mooued heart knightes beeing verie passionate quickly felt pitie riding presently one follower desiring bee resolud matter gentleman courteously answered businesse long time discourse would demaund leysure hee thought businesse would well allow therefore hee besought bee excused vnlesse meant succour distressed lady iustly might claime assistance reuenge murdered knight vniustlie treacherouslie slaine loue loue master commanded seruice said would willingly doe best redresse iniurie gentleman going lady told knight said casting vp eye held coarse body soule affection ala sir said shee misfortune hath brought ingage selues true misery ioyning must wretched neuer liued die fortune said ollorandus speaking owne language best could couet may prooue auaileable doe desire know may serue sir said shee let mee bee bold demaund first may discouer estate freely willingly name said hee ollorandus king bohemia amphilanthus king roman happinesse beyond hope cryd shee ala lord king world haue desired meete trauell seeke italy kneeled shee vnto beseeching graunt hee himselfe nobly promised hee vowed performe thing whatsoeuer lay power doe comming forth chariot lighting retired little tuft thornes way side shee beginning storie thus braue renowned king great king bee pleased giue eare saddest storie euer loue louers end hath produced miserable vnfortunate woman sydelia passionately louing beloued excellent tuous antonarus long wee loued hate betweene brother called terichillus loue growne youth hindred enioyings brother curiouslie watching mee himselfe others neuer seldome mee able onely see affliction want sunne content brother heire morauia prince silesia kept venturing countrie knowing infinite malice hee bare vnto ala way deseruing last brother marry orguelea daughter duke bauaria going thither performe left mee guarded seruants absence well wrought compassed sight deare habit huntsman came vnto married priuatly enioyed time till brother returne new ladie full spite ill nature spider poyson disclosed matter hate antonarus gaue charge mee father hauing giuen ouer world retyred religious house hauing left estate brother yet life brother would take title vpon authority county morauia hunt man returne small safetie hatefull spy inhabited surety poore hare hath hand hound haue long hunted prey vpon seeke ruine v extreame hate brother bare antonarus rising cause youthes emperous court liud time young lady house austria xcellently faire fairely conditiond whose vertues prizing worth vertues sake made choice wholy worthin sse conuersation choice companion whole course life ranne way made chooce antonarus much affect nothing death could ender affection yet know say since dying shee expressd affection loued question goodnesse requited wish serue friendship wrought would seeme receiue brother passionately loue antonarus saw accepted loue must kill friend rather doe foule act hee would seeme cruel wrong harme himselfe sooner hurt yet oft hath told hath soule wishd brother neuer discouerd affection ignorantly hee might haue made himselfe happy whose happinesse onely consisted yet denied b cause loued companion friendship excellent vertue embraced cheerished yet herein would friendship beene still terichillus tell antonarus loud saw slighted yet crid loues would dogge kindly treat playes little bird still kiss carry breast thing saue wretched selfe loathd hated comfort telling patience constancy might solicit still presenting himselfe eye might win thing could preuaile loue last brother plainely discerned loue bare antonarus grew furious former passage mistrusted firme friend hee finding way kill cancor tooke leaue court brother parting telling whatsoeuer imagined finde true lady went priuately morning stole away passd many country much honor come wofull part story seeing gone terichillus stay quickly guessd matter grew rage whereas would vse ciuilly antonarus sake plainely shewd hate bare beleeud cause going beliefe told must suffer iniury iniury aboue loue barrd sight grew odious remembred antonarus vsd come saw nothing foule coppy excellent worke presence made see absence sole content bare shelfes ebbed tyde bare without liking seeme yet could beware flowing ill followed spite shee striue shunne thing presence infinitly louing terribly hating let passion grow violence grew infectious sought still continued search loue meanes reuenged whose loue could compasse whose ouerthrowe meant gaine eye lately serud bring comfort seeing employd curious spy ouer affection howres spent wholly examining worth vertues changd plott ruine admiration goodnesse admiring hee could affect body disdaine alteration beyond expectation vnderstanding happened seeke yet dissemble still made loue honour noble heart colour wickednesse making malice spring ouergrow loue nettle doe violet hemlock pincks yet counterfeit affection grow last wrought cunningly hee intercepted letter shee sent antonarus hauing opened read made answer counterfeiting hand well none could discouer know bee messenger made safe telling tale making bloud accompany treason thus continued heaping ill vpon soule shels number vpon seashore ala brother since must thus speake rather would last act made vnwilling vnfit relater ill poore lady still louing writ zealous affection shee could perswaded returne would goe bring famous duke father honour done still answerd de layes last indeed vnappointed secratatary made answere good manner made thus long answer respectiuely since found nothing company marriage would satisfie shee must contented plainly told despised forwardnesse much selfe heart set already one farre deseruing selfe deserued nothing alter former affection could merit thing world marrying terichillus affectionatly loued thus might honor self requiting desired haue much good thought shee must performe else bee assured mortall hater selfe house ala whose heart loue made tender tendernesse pitifull could much pitie selfe breake vnkindnesse yet died shee speedily worst yet kind happy woman wrought meanes brother found antonarus discouered pitifull estate lady complaint indured absence cruelty sought murder faithfully louing discourse made resolue see might saue dying shame working liuing loue could purchase went court found ready depart yet past sense shee knew rather hauing sense loue tooke quick apprehension looked vp spake chearefully desiring else auoid chamber done took hand weeping thus spake antonarus fault haue committed hath brought cruelty thee extreame loyall affection offend haue infinitely offended ala blame selfe vertues made choose winning eies made subiect worth commanded fidelity onely loud onely murder vnkindnesse yet pardon speake thus boldly since feare former boldnesse made despise chide loue ala offended direction write letter reiected despised hearing speake thus touch vpon letter desired resolud admiring seeming ignorant yet loath euen last seeme harsh told curst answere satisfie shewd letter themselues copy said shee burnt come saw man could manifest furious sorrow could speake wept sobd toare haire remained like distracted creature till vrging desiring satisfie swore none euer receiued miserable man said thus betrayd haue done thus plagued insufferably afflicted ala deerest neuer heard thee neuer writ thee sweetnes loue haue beene subiect false terichillus feare come thee thy hand know iest thou wert wont counterfeit hast thou practisd vnkind cruell man shee seeing sorrow clearenesse receiued much comfort taking againe hand happy lord said shee shall ende contented blessed loue cleare end feard sent happy onely deare liue content let lady whosoeuer shall choose loue lesse doe let iust loyall much fortunate sake liue enioy longer beene cruell accused falsely loue pardoned welcommer death beene sent life dislike soule loud loues euer sufferd shewe dislike cleerly passed world without blameing yet happy see truth part must leaue onely loue must goe yet beseech keep memory truest loue let memory bee put loue mooud rage reuenge wrong hath done fauour may keeping worthyer neuer haue truer weeping told tooke last ill shee would say hee could haue worthier said cannot thy worth cannot equald wrong reuengd sufficiently wept spake little tooke leaues shee seeing sorrow afflicted finding sought couer kissed went chaber dying heart almost sooner gone calling woma willed burne paper taking ring finger pointed diamod euer wore vowed doe till died married charged giue antonarus turning side tell said bequeath truest loue last loue coniure keepe went performe command instantly rest company came found dead ala late recouer giue happy end hee tooke onely loue expresse began dying enioyed death instantly left court hearing terichillus stollen away vpon comming guiltinesse condemning went search putting armour blacke sorrowes trauelled cloathed sorrow accompanied remembrance chast loyall loue death treason caused iniury done yet spotlesse affection motiues ran one still first held wrapt fast thus went caught himselfe till hee met terichillus plaine betweene two hill sent squire company discourse call answere wrong done loue squire came hee made answer cause call account would satisfie prepared himselfe met fought cruell fight antonarus hauing iustice side got much better hee terichillus vnder mercy confest asked pardon fault tooke vp word rise terichillus thy shame conscience sufficient reuengers shed thy bloud cannot cleanse foule fault satisfie losse chaste immaculate make cleare purer thou canst true repentance mine eye heart drop fulfill serue funerall leapd vpon horse leauing brother hurt wounded scorne hate himselfe saued kindly thanking done away antonarus posted came morauia visit indeed onely seruant infant loue side haueing made stayd long told story loud better gratefulnesse hauing large command shew vpon death tooke title first began open proclamation hate first forbidding company yet proclaimd house priuate friend yet went warne loue cause hee came sight knowledge huntsman habit last time see brother returned wife watch made new stronger ouer yet loue made fruitles time appointed met meant keepe together boldly writ brother telling done hoped would excuse since taken husband loue youth chosen mee gone loued liue happily obay brother grew infinitely inraged straight sent many horse stay interrupt passage vaine passed laid spy kept v free selesia came finding bringing content hauing owne heart desire antonarus welcommed gift estate returned againe taking farre greater esteemd himselfe true loue best fortune terichillus imagined highly iniured wherefore sent antonarus word ill tooke affront would armes regaine honour touched replied rather opinion done honor match cause affection begun youth growne perfection therefore intreated rather loue armes end businesse hee would prepare attend comming hee pleased within moneths terichillus army entred selesia onely enterd army led polisander brother antonarus met giuing bat aile life also encounter might haue killed mercy iudgement gouernd spared condition warres cease promised firme league made v polisander haue glory thus agreed hee came wee armes dismist sword laid downe nobly entertaind receiued antonarus ment truth dayes passed oath friendship taken side terichillus returnd country morauia polisander bringing confines thereof committing owne safetie antonarus glad conclusion ioyed quiet reioyce one whole yeare lasted time sonne whose birth recouery againe terichillus inuited v vnto court loue better say show belieuing went thither trusting meaning bee false polisanders hand lord put gouernment state also gaue charge sonne well might doe noble honest man liues morauia went met confines noble men lady still greater till wee arriued court gate brother wife met v state welcome wanted outward testimony could expresse doubted like silly bird hearing sweet singing bird set stales thinking mirth imprisonment fall innocent beliefe net seeing smile hearing nothing welcome ioy speake grew confident bold vpon harmes day wee staid feast tiltings brauerie court could yeeld shewed selfe vnto v sport past terichillus would haue v goe hunting two day hauing excellent good great variety sport third day also goe conclude delight indeede wee great wood antonarus accustomed hee huntsman bide whence heard horne signe call vnnaturall man terichillus longer cannot call brother laid traytors nimph vnto horne satyr found wantonnesse vowed reuenge thus doe said men disguised shape fittest sauage act murdered making mee behold cruelty greater torture done ended life went away lifting body vp vpon horse setting vpon mine owne againe gaue bridle leade substance demonstration miserie wood went pitifull yet beloued companion excessiue sorrow shut vp sens wept instant till tell tragedy presently comming plaine meeting selesians accompanied mourning little else could doe county murderer ruled ala company handfull comparison people could doe weepe wish got small troope together much hafte heauinesse could allow v wee gained country selesia polisander related villany whose sorrow sadnesse hee able giue take counsell sometimes hee purpose r uenge treachery himselfe cursing himselfe sparing murderer might haue killed blaming fortune let liue slay brother lamenting time made reconsiliation accusing himselfe much terichillus hauing vnfortunate instrument mischiefe ala said de happy selesia slaine battaile blessed liued see day deare antonarus hath thy brother beloued much thee cause thy losse accursed creature yet pardon mee deare brother lament thy death much heart doe selesia losse vnrecouerable loosing prince punish ready dearest sister cryd take life mee see mee brought worthy lord misfortune antonarus soule dy thee infinite griefe forced watch lest made himselfe away yet vertue hope protect vsing violence himselfe much adoe perswade going morauia reuenge brother last gained thus much leaue reueng whose lo se greatest cause demaunds pitty gaine braue prince right vpon counsell petition granted whereupon put robe prouiding chariot thing necessary iourney appoynting mourning kind day tooke iourney hee proclaimed sonne heire prince selesia himselfe protector haue traueled two month terichillus giuing leaue passe part country goe finde knight whose vallour pitty assist find braue excellent king tooke way hope beg fauor whose compassion worth toungs speake hart admire none magnifying amphilanthus true noblenesse excellent goodnes perfect vertue matchlesse valour wherfore beseech may louer regard aide king asist murderer prince best knight treachery cause strange businesse may seeme nice since sister vrgeth reuenge brother weigh loue husband murderd brother owne hand wipe away doubt cleere implore aid king amphilanthus much pittied admired lady related story much passion fine expression witty sorrow could amphilanthus moued much presently consented gaue promise asist passd court manner traueld vowed neuer leaue body bury till death reuengd came husband one would present ladyes placd see fight proclaymed knight ouercome hee loose head lady terichillus disposing knight ouercame prince vanquished aliue disposed lady knight troope haue safe ground hauing meanes aske pardon heauen offence least thinking good matter quickly got vp sword hand attend amphilanthus whose noble curte ie take aduantage lighted also fight foote terichillus valiant strong fight life honour hee held amphilanthus longer play many done yet last acknowledged others king fittest yeelded vnto perceiuing life end curstly set sword ground brake desirous seemd die vnarmd rather disarmd amphilanthus purpose making openly make confession fault ask pardon direct al obay sister lady princesse weep lament fortune without compulsion according ill life hee frowardly peeuishly concluded day leauing behind certaintie treason neuer left vnpunished country without prince straight sister proclaimed soone forgot speedily receiued king bohemia king roman carried rich chamber since last busines castle would neuer lie alone lodged together soone amphilanthus recouerd slight wound receiued combat took leaues following iourney hungary euen ready leaue morauia hard wood grew bottom hill top hill steepy craggy ful rock place stone cut building stately abby among meadowes farre foote hill betweene two dainty riuers decaied warre met lady running haire loose couering face cry loud fearefull cloathes halfe halfe strange disorder word spake danger pursued helpe requisitly demanded little men hastily followed one especially seemd sought deliuered amphilanthus willing aide seeming beseech rid demand cause fled pursued till came bottom great quarry thicknesse offerd couer self lighting desired know cause flight danger enemy hand amazedly frightfully answered ala sir meane iniury haue done thus follow neuer wrongd seeke dishonour replyd deceiud therefore intreated looke vp againe vpon would see error beholding wishly till wrong pardon lord said mistooke misery hath quite destracted poore lady dwelling farre hence yonder old abbey lady thereof death husband since time young lord hath earnest suter loue fortune dying husband liuing memory refused many haue sought wherupon vowed haue force since meanes would preuaile day performe vow came found slightly guarded newly bed tooke house bound seruants thus farre way hath brought saw thicke wood acquainted hidnest part slipt behind seruant carried mee speed possible ran thinke must need see towards wildernes hope secure shall assure selfe might please take protection curteous beyond expression promised defend pray sir said let yet ask thing name long haue country name said amphilanthus hath bin time brought hither princesse sydelia let bold beseech demand one fauour whether one two came reuenge quarrell indeed said hee fought terichillus blessed said may assure selfe valiantest man aliue thus discoursing lady fearfull cry shricks passed running woodward haste feare made light shee left print much pressing grasse whereon ranne impression seemd weight switnesse allowed foot ollorandus followed shee fledd still till shee lead good distance freind oh ollorandus misfortune befalleth thee witchcraft made thee forget thy vowe melisseas command thy friend carefuller thee constancy accomplishd thy desire hast thou abandond greatest neede sitting lady done speaking deepe part quarry came many armed men set vpon king thinking beene enemy defended himselfe willed take heede take counsell thy selfe cride shee thou hatefull murderer husband dye killing terichillus found betraid wherefore taking best courage could best world resolutely withstood fury last company still increasing wound weakenesse growing place besides ill fight vneuen full bush disaduantages might brought infinite danger much giuing himselfe lost recommended last loue best wish deere selfe resolud brauely meant end ollorandus held discourse like deceiuer friend mett till heard noyse dwarfes calld place fearefull lamentable cry found amphilanthus ready fall among body slaine kild lye hansommer body ill fauored place haue easier bed death saw sadd sight curse himselfe remembred warnd doe sawe fault committed beleefe treacherie togeather made full consent fury hee flew amongst blowes like shame villany heauy thicke good valour new courage presence brought amphilanthus weake lin gaue little respite sate downe within clift quarry mischiefe followed diuellish causer beholding hauing power thought hurt shee rolled stone loose great weight bignesse staying vpon edge clift downe vpon gaue though falling directly vpon little part vpon shoulder cruell stroak especially weakenesse fell face ollorandus seeing verily thought hee beene dead whereupon cried damnd countrey must death world enuied italy blessing nursing braue amphilanthus farewell farewell worth thee fury encrease height two left number neapolitan prince hauing brought many almost none yet fewe many sore wounded dispatched rest one onely suruiuing much molested soarely handled going thought take vp vnmatched king saw stirre rise greater ioy ranne embraced welcomd sauer life craued pardon euen vpon knee acknowledging vnpardonable fault amphilanthus quickly forgaue seeing one suruiuing man againe set finishd noble dayes worke killd owne hand ollorandus looke wonder admire exploit wondring multitude set vpon king strength courage withstood ouerthrowne many indeed one greatest victory without comparison hazardous dangerous euer fell thus beholding slaughter thinking goe thence cure wound heard one speake word accursed fortune still hath crost desire crossed wicked world farewell cruell men mischief attend curst best wish shee threw selfe topp huge quarry place amphilanthus
