son squire passd towards hungary ryding faire pleasant riuers side ollorandus knew welcomd drop passed knowing place mistris commonly liued seated streame thought busied amphilanthus passionately contemplated loue thus rid together yet thought farre asunder might haue made stranger thus passed among osier grew side riuer within water loue rootes chastly embraced making pretty fine pond betweene armes bodyes tree lying kindly much ease fine coolenesse one might passe one dainty maide among tree taken vp abiding hauing made kind bed among vpon bough twind within one anothers armes made lodging secure angle hand lay fishing mind placd higher pleasure little regarded byting fish beeing selfe deceiued cunninger baite hooke loue hauing caught fast nothing could release sate would make pretty neate comparison betweene betraying poore silly fish owne betrayed craft loue time commended yet againe would condemne time reasonable good conceit loue fauorable enough appeard song sung voyce beeing cause seeking body place loue peruse seeke finde corner minde twine wouen shine webb ill made foule framd bastard father namd cannot bee deare behold shall see faith hiue loue bee doe bring gaine string pray desist sinewes daines hold loues life gaines lying bare despaire thus annottomise body heart prise true iust close truncke embalme chest power still shall rest ioy entombe ioues iust doome song ended went towards desiring discourse curteous excellently witty gaue entertainement apparrell said best sort woman gowne greene satten long sleeues ground gowne buttoned bottom button diamond wearing sleeues reason weather warme left open space cut worke smock appeared delicate skin seene shee held angle neglectiuely loue ill causer paine held poore little fish plaie baite offer swallow big yet made corke stirre would say doth loue play shew mee pleasure let enioy nothing touch smart hooke hurt without gaine giues light good hope floting corck giue fish prison imagination laid aside two prince comming presently rose vp fit excellent respect saluted throwing downe het rod wherewith thretned executed little hurt passing ouer transparant bridge went vnto vsed according merit shee vnderstood conducting along riuer curious garden another rare place building trauels euerseene house white marble varietie delight shee desirous enioy giuing free noble welcome could afforded house shee desired pleased vnarme themselues brought rich chamber wherein two maruellous faire bed hauing intreated lodge together leaue till supper time comming againe attend beheld could extreamely admire louelinesse amphilanthus woman shee neuer passionately loue confessed fittest bee beloued though worth honour affection gratefulnesse woed owne choice thus went together roome eate king bohemia vsing respect vnto lady thought much resemble mistris true louer thought shee came farre short perfection supper many knight came visit lady much honoured beloued husband likewise man bee mate hee made punishment excellently perfect aboue common rate sexe fashion stranger could commend full modesty iudgement towards discreet obseruing discernd distant enough affection yet farre neglect fondnesse likewise shee gouernd part loue entertaind prince much kindnes keeping company shewing al rare delight house many greatest rarenesse saw lady much amphilanthus marked discouerd one fellow prisoner castle loue wherefore desirous heare discourse especially louing heare loue desc ibed related woman whose lipps sweet passion sweetely proceeded hee gaue occasion walked along dainty pleasant brooke bankes whereof sweetnesse plenty delicate smelling flower could yeeld vnto shadowed sunnes parching mirtle mirtle preserued high braue tree whose breadth large bough spread giue content vnder would submit solitarinesse place said amphilanthus fitter much louers free prince liue free passion lord said said hee whose sence loue doth rather command hart seruice presume bring fetter rather commandres subiect vntoward gouernment answered assuredly haue yet neuer hauing enioyed quiet minut since knew state rebellious passion haue euer tormented cryd amphilanthus sensible said ala said amphilanthus might fortunat merit great happines vnderstad way bold loue take coquer perfection may soone gaind said shee requite story truly discourse fortune neuer let mee bee rewarded paine said hee refuse noble offer begin sir said shee obay also said tell whole story affection onely keeping name secret ollorandus knew mistrust assurance began thus lord ill seemes loue hath carried himselfe kind fault woman confesse matter yet knowing selfe innocent ill ingaged freedome make requitall venture speak lord loue father sister married one noblest greatest prince countrie rich possession yet possessed much treasure hee vertues richer land true noblenesse noble hospitalitie abounding inherit estate two sonnes one daughter child fit father truly lawfully heires estate rich vertuous quality many yeares good lord liued age claiming due belonging time sore disease taking hee dyed leauing honour vertues chiefe estate eldest sonne called laurimello much father house father putting trust brother law leaue dearest part comfort besides father estate lay neare citie buda conueniency reason court lying seeing frequenting reason whereof father death brought sister likewise thither betweene selfe grew entire friendship great brother beloued honoured aboue prince many sought wife shee knowing perfection greatnesse nice accepting indeed shee much mind marry louing liberty mariages bondage among others offered seruice one called charimellus friend parent sent sue fauour thither hee came comming roome suiter brother many hee cast eye mee brought misfortune bee suddenly surprised knew scarce salute made scorne laughing bashfulnesse caused much blushing trembling regarded traunces beginning much thinke whence proceeded good nature sorry man troth deserued much pitie merited great respect heart elsewhere placed held mine eies set way marking thing mine fortune one starre trouble selfe anothers course cosin would keepe thought imparting friend liberally vsed wit whose part tooke ignorant cause till dayes passed gaue refusall discouered loue withall protesting surprised first sight told could belieue one fight instant could worke alteration true would soone accept refused suiter since fortune trusted would bind take cosins leauings answer grieud yet way allay affection rather like snow plaid doth make one hand burne cold despaire word make hart hot glow loue towards friend liked loud sweet mild disposition valiant accompanied many braue noble condition one none thinke could haue disliked ordaind marry iudgement onely heart settled mine long pursued loue last gained father consent mother friend estate antiquitie house besides person meriting subiect wife saw danger bee bestowed wholly employd time studying might gaine mine owne desire finely put mind third businesse came another match offerd father whose estate greater neerer dwelling father ordinarily affectionate quickly harkned willingly embraced danger heart perplexed knew poore charimellus came vnto wept presented affection memory eies pittied truly much compassion vpon whose soule anothers keeping could haue much fauour grant promise speake father directly refuse new proffered match contented hoping refusall onely good performed promise spake father telling much afflicted passionately loued reason rather accept world taken notice alreadie two yeares suite would disgrace touch take new one find could affect therefore besought graunt blessing might thus yeelded euery great match businesse might carried honour content father confesse vext word yet kind man moderated furie something might expect bringing forth last word confidence haue hope may still continue strength since cannot thinke dare goodnesse sake commit great fault deceiue especially father therfore doubt freedome euer sure yet must need say suite charimellus continued thus long hath giuen occasion discourse dislike care afraid reason will world report like discharging piece ordinance fire smoke noise companion one bullet hurt one place often time miss may harme loud talking people misse hurting although bruite flie yet doe condemne prise care honour necessary woman happy life good lung healthfull body yet trust ingaged promise assured though could deny affection setled father imagined hee knew place thereupon proceeded former match worke end hauing meanes saue mine owne industrie strength mind busied like spider crosse one beame another must worke byway goe farre making web catch selfe owne purpose goe ordinary straight course wit weaue web deceiue mine owne desire last plot make charimellus intreate cosin bee meanes good man fulfilled discreet braue laurimello speaking earnestly affectionately himselfe receiued word accepted counsell patient doth aduise phisition wrought able cure yet weighing whereto answer directed hee let passe accounted seruant remaining secure imagined opinion loue contrary proued soone seeking haue assurance grant wife refused telling priuately vowed vnto selfe neuer betrothed assured vntill time married troubled refusall yet ciuilly vsed reasonably contented withall neuer bee busie swarme thought set mind end aright sometimes resolud speake bashfulnes withheld mee casting mine eye staine iustly might laid maid tender yeeres wooe man often heard say hee hated forward woman could loue none one must win suite loue would loue though earnestly yet pretily make thinke neglect gouerne would like cordial heart diet increase stomack loue hindred continued like branch placed wall faithfull affection blast desire moue leaues speake shew much might called loue doubt ruld charimellus fell sicke many mile distant estate lay austria hearing sent visit late messenger could onely deliuer last sens message last word returne thanks died sending token tooke arme newes seruant came troth sorry found could weepe yet roome left first chose loue inhabit death second came againe friend apparent meanes set rest win freed meant hold self could lest color soone moue hope began flatter saw deceitful thing see bar lie ioies obtaining saue little nice childish modesty would vertue proue shewing modest loue long feed selfe baby fancy till truth lost imagining end married another lady rich therefore worthy misfortune past repaire falne mee priuately lamented moand state grieud still quarreld self lost hope ioy quite dead yeelded second suiters mind consent friend publique feast marryed thanked heauen happily haue liud many yeares doe time said amphilanthus see best chosen friend oft time said blessd heere wee haue pleasure wish content loue happines happinesse bee compard said ollorandus loue meet mutually blessed one selfe kinde doth goodman like wel said made choyce secure chastity yet need must say liud ill froward life two yeares ignorance held willfulnes liued wee came know better bee cleane deceiued wee grew good friend like kinde mate haue liued last three yeares humor hee iealosie could blame fashion beeing free hauing still beene bred court carryed since discerned innocency lye vnder fayre canope close chest lockt inward part may hee accused himselfe growne free doe rather doubt selfe truth need must say much seruant vnto loue discouer outward shew graue discretion permit yet alwayes haue still rule affection vertue arriued wall garden hauing still followed pleasant brooke arme large braue danubia enterd garden met husband sweete enioyer free giuen ioyes none neede tell prince hee hee could hold eye fast eagerly behold feard one part sight faild make full conclusion blisse would looke heart see setled dwelling others faith affection discouered height true loue would wish freely giuen taken blessed paire said amphilanthus sighing selfe ala may liue see good may deere behold lookes smile louing blush may vertue freely grant yes haue seene accu sed man must enioy curst desteny wil allow want made excellent verse subiect desire absence much transported stood like beholder actor loues part ollorandus talking time husband returning house amphilanthus passing accustomed manner braue laurimello leading beloued lady hand supper walked abroad againe till bed time passd houres pleasant sweete discourse lady making owne word true neuer woman make free yet modest shew loue yet exprest fine iudgement sweet chastity loue deemd vertue wanton fault commended witt dainty manner earnest loue next day two prince tooke leaues buda tooke iourney ollorandus contenting himselfe hopd ioyes receiue conuersation melisinda amphilanthus thinking returne vnto deerer selfe blaming condemning himselfe long absent accusing fortune cruelty onely make loose comfort others also make witnesse gaine behold perpetuall harme vnbearable want buda last came entertained amphilanthus merit dignity required ollarandus affection schoole loue could instruct melysinda rodolindus triumph feast giuing testimony welcome many dayes feast continued still increased banquet loue betweene king mistris amphilanthus intreated shew skill armes iust wherein encountered king dolindus vnknowne manifesting vallour would disgui meete incomparable prince vnderstanding reason spare adde honor gaue vnkind greeting though hee valiant strong hungary yet fift urse throwne ground much brused hurt neuer ecouerd within month deceased leauing delicate ife pefect excellent widdow iusts done amphilanthus desired liberty ollorandus rne though infinitely grieud yeeld vnto yet iudging elfe cause moud consented telling would also ac ompany mean would consent louing part parted loue alone resolud goe dwarfe attended sending new squire vnto mistris duertise safty speedy repayring first dayes ourney queene two king accompanied parting amphilanthus tooke towards stiria way goe italy hich country hee mette fine strange encounter delicate adow newly entered stiria fountaine hich many ladyes sitting apparreld country manner ut one colour willow colour imbrodered gold neate extraordinarily rich hee perceiued neere hem singing playing water others discoursing one nother busied yet none busie play hearing horse ookd vp hee saluted alighting came many pretty passage witt last disired know nswerd seruants liuery might testifie ladyes honor princesse stiria absolute lady country subiect none yet free princesse said amphilanthus farr hence answered one walked yonder wood sadest discontented prince liuing may cause knowne said one offer helpe said first doe best said else shall forsweare armes vnworthy man serue braue ladyes sir answered tell matter well passionately lady selfe would doe relate emilina princesse cald hauing beene sought prince neighbour country many neighbour loue refusd louing loue might haue pleaded others haue conquerd valour haue gaind pitty afflicted passion one thing louer reiected hauing wholy resolud within selfe giue possession heart renowned prince naples lately king roman amphilanthus whose fame though person neuer seene continuall petition last prince came whose name souereignisd stood behold examine cause might mooue affection amphilanthus loud subtill aboue men faulse flatterd much wrought gaind desird esteemd giuen le beleeued wronged feruent loue hee seemd passionate surely vnconstant creature change doe loud none loued earnestly fondly none carefully loyalty varyety pleaseth scarse cold hee indure looke vpon much lesse suffer permit vse himselfe familiarly hee need finde fault withall shee loue neuer lookd eye ciuill curtesie continued marryage expected hee gaind promise haue onely neuer doubting prest vowes crediting word assured loue seeking desire stricter vowes make thinke mistrust least action gaue steddy trust shee trusted till shee deceiued hee gaind firmest loue vowes obtained sought vildly beganne change fell inamourd prince maide neere allied vnto lady often came visite court gentlewoman truly faire thinke good till sawe vexd yet knowing curster corsiue bee louer dispised especially loue last found miserable knowledge grieued offer discouer must say louer forsaken otherwise none ought presume tell farlorne creaturs woe first silence beare paine attendance continuall kindnes striue win back rather might thinke mistrust stroue hold loue vngratefull man name gentle affection yet permitt giue discerning respect loue would seeme see neither yet faild outward shewes manifest change writ vnto wept complayned bewailed others forsaken heard regarded answerd slighted ioyned pittying neglected wanted lost beauty sorrow weeping whole night sobbing haue selfe come vncalled sorrowes greatnesse heart though able day couer yet forced night borrow assistance breathing spleene ouer chargd withall saue teares sob silence would shee trust associate forgetfull man abused wrongd selfe alone trusting nay wrong himselfe base vnworthy change aduentured aduise saw misery ouer take shee tooke counsell vrge marriage slighted told growne old beawty alterd willed recouer returnd iourney hand would ala torment tooke heart though hee smilingly deliuered iest till considered aprooued true faignd excuse king father sent returne would misse performe hee promised found expected leaue tooke went neere heart marrow bone yet staid afterwards wench som certaine day vsed al meanes hold ignorant many passage cleare perfect sighted true loue knew yet knew faith cleare would blind sight rather touch truth faithles amphilanthus accursed man brought hard insufferable wrong harme vnto faithfullest worthiest louer euer loue wound proceed went left lady quite forsaken forlorne since vnhappy woman liues groanes daily sorrowings prince said amphilanthus truly sir said falsest ficklest waueringst vnworthiest man doth liue hee else know vnworthinesse liues prince know well said lately saw say ti speake may creature hath abused name end giuen man know prince said doe hee faire false man treacherous well shapd man tall though high mischieuous ill nature slender full wickednes curld haire thicke yet bauld vertue amphilanthus cald himselfe prince knew straight another man meant yet grieued heare name much abused princesse beare wrong besides owne interest matter made vow reuenge wherefore hee desired see princesse first lady told hee would attend comming forth wood hee admitted sight would vrge sat downe one sung song telling made lady perfect noble quality subiect loue bee much faith deceiued victory loue come like commander kild last blow stead lawrell obtaine tombe triumph steely faith show must graue thus frame made stony heart name honor scorne brings tombe disdaine priest bury come cloathd reliques spotlesse loue embrace let true louers pure fire truth doe light mooue lamplike last begin sacred tombe loue lay life neglect sends hellish way offering chastest soule knew loue blessing till change slew doe sacrifice world time truth onely death let part though dying haue perpetuall youth buried alone whereby fall open graues louers saint haue laine see fill themselues paine affliction striue place constant honour gaine grace burne body yet vnlesse vrne framd equall vertue loue hold ash though pale burne true loues ember still moue meanes let dust fall earth lest men doe enuy second birth learne find better state could doe loue immaculate thus here resting place ordaind fate made ere complaine since kept blisse obtaind loyalty sure shall gaine famebeares torch last farewell life loue dwell place neglect appoints tombe hope thus death come come emilina said prince write sure amphilanthus could neuer false creature said truly doth hee make good name signifieth louer two name said giuen ere knew loue himselfe latter sure knowes yet said shee doubt shortly haue better opinion prince neither companion said vnlesse grow vnfortunate louer variety may like changing men delight camelions princesse came lady highest stature low hansome one well might see bin excellent beauty decayd loue withered resembled ruines faire building countenance graue curteous shewing rather retirednes much giuen conuersation pace slow apparrell careles clothes tawny cut willow color embroidered willow garland color gold shew forsaken part noble came towards modest gesture saluted prince helmet presented true amphilanthus eye desired know whence aduenture brought thither told italy blessed fortune brought might repaire iniury done wronged prince serue busines ala said seruice haue since none liues wrongd much one countrie nation right iniurie receiued one yet deare one one wronged answered shall right life shall pay tell thinke know said vnderstood danger reuealing ha haue receiued would conceale thus haplesse liue rather meanes harme person still hold deare happy prince said yet vnfortunate iniured defamed suborner traiterous man falsely assuming thus prince name wrong taxe said sure could loue meaner man prince brauest amphilanthus seemes haue heard light loue change falshood ala heare man nay euen selfe hath loud neuer changed may amphilanthus doe like perplexitie iudge brauest louers proceed shame harme insue saue v wretched trusting woman madam said hee seeke cleare prince let discerne wrong beares one base persidious hath taken name speaking knight newly arriud kneeled telling glad find neare home sorry newes hee brought must repaire speede hee could country otherwise could enioy blessing aged father sight ready yeeld vnto death withall hee gaue letter lord brother hee thus discoursed prince tooke lady askt stranger prince vsed reuerence answered amphilanthus naples prince thought king turning lord said must needes blame name hath brought discontent yet honor person though loue sweet betrayer blisse freely confesse lady related heard young prince venice came vnto newes assured amphilanthus hee met knight ouerthrowne truly sir said valiant strong man need bee maintaine bold charge counterfeit strength hath also got companion call himselfe ollorandus thus passe fame make except stranger meddle seeing face falshood ventured fight hauing iustice ide hoped would bring victory see good arme must hold ballance else sometimes truth may fal ground amphilanthus confident truth deceit took leaue lady earnestly desired presence house taking occasion venetian comming would excuse himselfe keepe free temptation till hee saw perfect commandresse dearest loue lady troubled yet last like cross shee beare night thus lamented wretched woman aboue accursed must affection first placed worth worth name abuse trust better hope betraid cousned false treacherous man prince sure deceiued none betray spake one cals away vnto country deceiud shall haplesse emilina borne ill nursed misfortune must die change ala amphilanthus loue thee best youngest loue innocent giuen thee knew loue find loued thee heart thine knew mine owne giue thou tookest thought prize thou calledst thine thine owne heart didst cherish kindly made said arme god loue himselfe giuing sight power verse waile little absence suffer thy going one weeke mee small space thou didst repay line calling sweet kind telling harme mine eye disarme loue vndoe throne yet falfe thou thou vntrue deceiued yet didst thou plot ruine gaine didst thou make country thine well doe see thy conquest prey atisfie thy variety loues faire possession thy aimd atgames yet amphilanthus true false must still loue thee best though thou wrong must loue thee still torment haue ala thee indurd haue searched heart found thy image limd small corner ioynd seruice made round yet false must liue say amphilanthus proued false vnto yet braue stranger say hee abused well bee loued prince cross came possible cruel man prince whatsoeuer el thou wilt back returne come home againe thy first sweete selfe kind louing prince ile make thee one rather would wish thou wert one title throw thy fault away bee louer iust excellent thou maist doth lodge abilitie good valor vertue else constancy wil pardon come vnto forget euer left thou wert false vnkind remember onely first ioyes thinke time absence dreame happines likely contrary appeares let deare deare doe forgiue thee inuite thee come accept state gift laid thy fee selfe thy vassall worthy thanks performe leaue inticing beauty great wit snarelike catch hold meere aduantage end ticing thee fine brades vowed lock plaited haire dainty shew didst vse haire vnworthie honor worne thee thou thinkst know yes grieue yet silent thee woman free freely offer begge giue aske loue principality rule many know doe seeke thee thy gentle disposition apt bee deceiued loued abused beware cast deare eye wonne freedome faith zeale discouer difference betwixt feruent loue whose end loue vse gaine attends desier thou wilt continue thus yet still safe let loues thee bee firme mine let danger flie thee safetie bee neere ill shun thee blessing prosper thee bee thou blessed turnd fighingly within bed al night thus passe houres distracted passion full mind stord memorie shee call action mind new done liuely make presentment eye past happinesse shee knew mixt new discontent comparing make poore selfe stage ioy sorrow acted diuers part heart sad sceane storie lay oft shee call false loue inraged made recall complaine spite concluding still cannot yet loue though thus forsaken forelorne liue amphilanthus gone fell discourse young venetian related vnto heard counterfet prince hee proceed hee vnderstood hee taken way sea greece thence asia question said dainty pamphilia kingdome hele first visit good welcome surely said amphilanthus hele find thus rid king contemplating mistrisse beholding present venetian plotting gaine louing emelina wife difficulter bee gaind arriuall without aduentures italy thither come king met many going seeke seeking returnd last came naples found father sicke past recouery yet much comforted see sonne life last power expresse face smile ioyfull newes crost next vnlucky messenger greater crosse first time knowne death heauily incounter good hope sonne receiue dead lord common one consent consent accompanied gladnesse good receiued amphilanthus king maruelous braue funerall prepared within time prince neere farre fast notice came sent embassador condole congratulate happy beginning funerall passed straight followed coronation embassadours assist morea france great brittany bohemia romania sweet delicate pamphilia done embassadours tooke leaues king presenting present rich fit giue take next businesse settle estate good quiet gouernment end appoint prince brother regent setled graue honest counecll secure though absent kingdomes good went hee force hee raised number twentie thousand foote fiue thousand horse place appointed ship epirus directing time putting forth way resolued rest would passe albania prince florence milan ferrara naples modina apulia many officer field braue army went trusting army commander himselfe accompanied onely prince venice landed morea thence able easily meet men time enough seruice landed hee heard nothing drum trumpet warlike musique well pleasd eares much hast hee made till came court found great sadnes vnhappy accident befalne selarinus going hee thought safe enough disguisd epirus proud queene country denyed passage armie got notice notice gaue dainger life mother beeing daughter one king lord albania treachery falshood hauing deuided fiue part townes made combination neuer suffer eyther harmd contrariwise harme molest seeke meanes ruine two brother whose fame though honor vnluckely come eares vertue hauing brought world companion malice agreed among wicked confederacy also taught necessary lesson child daughter hauing marryed selfe like vow else maide faire proud insolent creature commonly ignorant enough first giue occasion offence denyed passage army hauing much foolish pride blinded knowledge th se force could passe losse realme pleased saw prospectiue glasse brought thing neerer farther shee pleasd turne end sight drew danger put assurance iudgment goodnes laying waite country either knight belonged vnited king chance hope disguise surely might offer passe way selarinus mishape first onely time aduenture hauing rid two dayes iourney without let kind hazard third day vnfortunatly hapned house belonging keeper standing great forrest keeper youth beene esquire epirian knight slaine mantinia great iust held whose death returnd putting himselfe vnto queene hee gaind keeping forrest man fell discourse crafty fitt ill imployment vsed discourse hee gaind knowledge one belonging either place affection morean court hauing enough worke vpon eaten much poyson hee must breake brake open way destroying selarinus sending boy court ten mile next morning forty knight secure conduct prince trecherously made prisoner queene mistrusting treason vnder greene clothes falshood faire language welcome dwelt night weary vnarmd himselfe went bed hee slept till hee awaked paine hard cord cast armes brought confesse heard noise thought beene squire puting vp armour making ready fitt morning saw deceiud heard poore seruant cry also princely patience said suffer imprisonment mee poore boy said well thou hast enioyed freedome content witnessing fidelius serue infortunius estate faithfully youth knew lord would knowne name infortunius wherefore hee resolud dye rather betray till morning hee thus held deliuered knight straight carryed queene shee hating seene morea countryes belonging cald enemy went hall magnificent state sate behold scorne vnfortunate knight brought chaind queene sitting setled resolution manifest hate scorne contempt seeing sweetnesse louelynesse tender youth modest countenance tryumphing ouer misery noble patience shewing stoutnesse bold suffering giuing way fortune subiect tyranny yet inwardly estate molested shame see braue armes fetterd bound brought blood face though shewed vpon occasion yet prouoked conclusion naturally pale made beauty appeare delicate purpose purchase libertie thus hee forced beholding womanish part restore manly power liberty working worth held least worthy queene though ambitiously raised conceit selfe found greater prince higher authority might would command gazed shee blamd small respect rudnesse shewed knight bring like theife chaind shee caused band taken strictly corrected expected thanks telling disarming beene honor taking naked shame vnto braue spirit called shee prince desiring know name country kindly smiling holding hand softnesse fairenesse grieued handle sword vsed fight fitter bee held likelouing selfe withall assured imprisonment content would yeeld desire hee answered name infortunius nephew lord serigo killed king moreas court presence many hauing thither brought faire lady whose loue winn fight slaine selarinus younger brother steriamus great preparation made winn albania party said truely madam said wish good iust cause otherwise one little able asist therfore dare venture say side intend see warrs intend may said still continue purpose hinder yet must enioyne thing sake hee answered life hand command saue cherish replied therefore goe gentleman shall direct conuey chamber fitt one cheife officer conduct maruellous rich roome appointed carry vnto hee thing necessary braue saue armes leaue owne squire attend many whose respect officiousnesse moud trouble proued liberty true imprisonment yet night freedome queen appointment lye chamber roome safety way trouble might conueniently remaine supper serud vnto seruicable duty infinite rich sumptuous fare glorious plate nothing wanting proud woman could satisfie humour thinke gloryfie selfe obleige fed supper went bed doores shut hee layd downe rest quiet could enioy fearing faire beginning would turne greater harme end could see dishonour himselfe certaine danger infortunius abuse philistellas seruant shame iust reproach hee falsified trust affection tormented thus remaine til towards midnight doore opened bed head came sixe ladyes carrying two white wax candle set downe vpon cupbord placed purpose bed returned queene rich glorious iuno came mantle carnation sattine embroderd gold round pearle fastned faire ruby wastcoate curious worke could bee made needle petty coat suitable mantle head dressed dressing framd worke wastcoate haire delicately drawne many place daintely apparreld able winne spirit selarinus neuer curious carelesnesse better adorne creature queene care sought bee neglectiue apparrell bed side came sitting downe vpon light might serue shew beauty thus spake name comming power nearely agreeing canno giue hope follow haue runne danger breaking command without death satisfied especially like wilfull men obey yet fauor haue lead happinesse neuer honourd thus much kindnes great queene might called loue scorne subiection cannot allow power confesse liking hath made pitty pitty brought mee offer vnusuall honor till time neuer thought wherin ill might lurke inhabit euer moud thus much shew immodesty yet flatter selfe thought ouer much gaine since attendant witnesse truth boldnes durst bee matched loosenes indeed must say like saw first well resolud courteous hath made mee willing speake truely resolud night time chose reason spirit hauing hitherto euer commanded least yeelded authority ashamed giue occasion contrary conceit either countenance fashon doubted would much alterd desire faor might purchase mee yet hope duty respect may lawfully challeng least fall great hazard larke doth shun hobby lye downe till nett laid ouer caught owne folly base yeelding yeeld shall bee noble refuse death honour permit mee demand ought noble thing honour likewise tie obedience knight queene able crowne title king may bee honour loue feare noblenesse dare aduenture thing thats noble come threatning armes weapon indanger loue armd fully would conquer need armes replied distressed prince vnmatched power raignes weapon beautie dwells refusall liue perfection authorise yeelding command mee great queene seruant prisoner vse word heart submits speech oyall hand vassall command pleased well liked pride power satisfied yet pride ordering action calling maides went away assuring selfe loue must bee nswerable ambitious coueting seruile maid omming brought marueilous louely banket seuerall sort ruites preserues time afforded delicatest ines greece know tooke hand countenance maiesty loue mixd neither high state shew sub isse affection sooner gone selarinus shut doore grieued hart tempted iniure philistella whose loue ingrauen truth breast vowed die rather consent ny greater kindnes night yeelded vnto rest ime hee spent thinking loue weeping compassion woe remediles yet teares made print soule euery one shed seemd like drop throwne fire make blacke quencheth spot falshood hee tearmd hem disgrace disanull vowed faith deare starre said nely giues light maiest thou darken thy selfe fauouring nd iustly may condemnd demand pardon dearer life hadst hou heard word seene manner mightst thou iustly cen ure vnworthy thy smallest grace vnable excuse er yet consider must get liberty serue thee deceit f one may vse deceit surely permitted allowed enioy heir loues purpose beare let deceiue ee true thee thee pardon ill giue leaue vse art plaine thee body liberty lie graunt heart thine kil saue sweet like thy like gentle sweet nd assurd liue vntrue vnto thy loued selfe turnd n bed sighd wept continued till day appeared rose drest himselfe page attendant first appointed queene waiting vpon ready walkd roome last ooked window see vnseene lament breathing priuate sigh aire chiefe attendant thinking hee tood admiring sweet fine delight told pleased hee might goe garden leaue hee willing haue signe freedome quicklie gaue consent little place garden like freshwater comfortable stenched fish pri oner downe went walkes extreame high way bee climbd gaue certaine assurance safety wherefore left alone threw himselfe vpon ground beate breast still cried wretched men thus punished ambition choice loue thou didst choose say loue doe deserue thy fauour choice loue honourd choice cast himselfe vnder faire shade orange purling brooke whispering close still hought said philistella see see see wrong cryd better consider true loue thee auoid temptation poore distressed selarinus proud lasciuious queen forbeare thy shame mine came cabinet might behold garden plainely perceiuing said within selfe loue loue command loue inuites time allowes thing longing agree thus resolud left cabinet hasted towards garden win assure enioy found enioying much griefe absence imprisonment could bring loyall louer saw till threw selfe downe started vp humilitie demanded pardon boldnesse rising maiestie fault might excused perceiuing till shee downe laied fault greater said rising since witnesseth desire leauing ill proceeding kind loue stay kneeled discourse making loue coldly answering yet couering still backwardnesse feare respect vnto greatnes daring haue aspiring thought rise high till almost shee forced plainely wooe hardly vnderstand wherefore ignorance duty begge pardon liked assured hold till shee desired might dispose according mind brauely wooed humbly entertained thus day passed night againe come afraid louing visitant lay musing beseeching loue selfe keepe prayer heard shee came morning sent speake conducted chamber many gentleman th ough braue gallery stately roomes arriued place shee giue audience sent said shee businesse may bring good liberty performe life madam said hee power command obay said shee proud vaine man oueresteeming himselfe dare thinke himselfe match mee subiect vassale arrogant creature hath often sued mee threatneth refuse winning mee force hee bring army going albania country haue gain said sent refusa l ad mired brother e part hee boast hee take helpe shalbe made wife though threatnings yet much vnfit fo suffer wherefore desire vndertake quarrell fo mee defend state insolent subiect selarinus wa loath fight one found relation friend yet liberty comfort one soule went beyond consideration vndertooke businesse comforted answered letter sent terenius castle olixia queene epirus sends world affection bee thus still slighted forgetfulnesse rule fondnesse remaind longer endure wrongd force obtain right haue loud proud queene many yeares loud mee likewise told expression chamber witnesse honour much yet defame faire meanes may preuaile happinesse may succeed expect sudden shame cruell force olixia epirus terenius presumptius vassall abu e cha titie thy soule report cannot hid vnder touch giue chamber mine god witnesse thought sid tended looked towards ill offence haue committed good vsage gaue base deseruing creature threatnings feare scorne v worthy selfe much almost hate selfe answering honour neuer receiue let know haue men ready bring rebellious company captiue soone heate dare moo e armes pride let defend honor alone without army haue knight shall defend make confesse insolent might iustice againe vassall letter sent whereupon terenius conceiued disdaine giuing order raised men attend steriamus euer became went court hee found queene like letter towards telling honor bore armes haue bolt hard prison rather liberty combat presumption comming vpon summons defend vniust cause haue leisure fight selarinus preparing busines armor brought likewise good sword whereof infinitely glad b comming downe list soone saw terenius knew hauing seene doe brauely morea iust held arriuall amphilanthus friend enchantment besides loue heard bore brother himselfe troubled fight yet remedy could yet perceiue afflicted ill terenius saying many yeares fought b spake word vpon vow made encountring owne father desired therefore see knight face say somthing iudges gaue leaue comming together terenius knew wept griefe vnkindnes hee forget fight hated true worth especially friend seruant selarinus told hee prisoner knowne would faine get liberty scouerd nothing could saue death uld said fight make shew run away follow mee close leade list content held coward seruice good shall hinder v till wee come men sixe league hence armd armd hee consented speaking aloud villaine said dost thou thinke make betray queene mistris queene smild thinking selfe secure assurd seruant met sound trumpet missed breaking staues though fairely ran meant earnest might haue giuen content great shew fury threw away speares drew sword fighting eagerly show blowes falling fl tlong harme like cloud threatning stormes pitie breakes vp againe clearenes terenius retire little selarinus presse much much neere ouercomming people iudged laughing terenius turnd back prince fled speed loud cry willd stay heard still followed company attended returne victor till staying longer custome certaine place limited one fought tearmes returne honour slauery ran let know fashion acknowledgement victorie intreaty come receiue thanks queene honor done needed went might see two late seeming enemy appeased sword put vp riding together fast horse could carry towards terenius castle messenger returnd ill newes queene stormd tore haire meere anger vexation men presenty raised raze castle ground summes mony offerd proclamation could bring terenius infortunius head thus selarinus deliuerd vertue worth inticement loue danger tempted wrong constanter louer philistella art thou ingaged praise terenius fortune bring freedome thy loue much honour chast affection could wrought wrong thee giue consent much thus free queene rage fury sent youth squire threatned execute hee vow performe deliuer infortunius hand againe dead aliue head would sufficient satisfaction hee swore hee would tooke leaue following lord till hee gaind castle remaind dayes consult vpon affaire albania concluded army passe way ioyne resistance begin thus concluded time infinite number men came vnto squire performe promise got head made life selarinus iustly resembled none first could thinke fleshly pale deathlike complexion eye settled mouth little opener vsually haire colour much wanting cleare brightnesse dead man haire want liuing man bloud trickling downe vaines spinning naturally done life cunning could performe ready army marching confines kingdom welcome moreans squire tooke head wept see like though knew contrary saw lord coffer ciprus purpose made shut vp line written lord direction gaue charge deliuering yong desperate fellow cared life much wit know saue himselfe withall mony hee gaue gold blinding sight danger mad man went court arriud demanded queene answere made could seene shee must seene cryd tell haue brought token wil ioy see told rosse sending man deliuerd present naild sealed giuen demanded head desird said sent squire claimd reward granted hauing dischargd departed glad good fortune hasted away eare recall straight cald court together al assembled hal came two greatest lord carrying coffer made solemne speech telling wrong sustaind cosenage stranger yet none would right take much paine meere stranger done faithfully discharging word vnto said infortunius head head traitor betrayd loue content coffer opened one lady attended night louing visit holding bason pure gold receiue framd purpose hold euer shee determining keepe testimony falshood shewed men cruell example first sight imagined handling found deceit soone others yet durst none discouerers owne eies proceeded cosening shee busily reading line laid vpon face purpose witnes faith eternal performe part part command head infortunius send may cald since dead braue body liues honour earth albania goood famous selarinus first name counterfeit head true let epirus know wrong suffered imprisonment cryd nothing treason deceit infortunius turnd selarinus shame rashly louing discouerd mine enemy lung away chamber vowed make shew reuenge since said nothing come misfortune vext angry remaind fed owne curstnes scorne hated food meane helpe receiue affront sum pind meere ill nature disposition body mind fel feuer willfully would ruld said borne rule brought selfe last act beholding death vglines would die could hansomly would haue liued possibly twas late soone owne desire yet vnwillingly ended day iust army met selarinus meane time assurd philistella safety welcome contrary olixia epirus anciently belonged king albania annexed vnto crowne match good honest terenius alleaging none standing crowne heire left vniustly held crowne steriamus consent whole armie set vpon selarinus head went cheife citty marched toward albania wishing amphilanthus none able tell become coniecturing hee gone release selarinus must haue beene heard part others hee calld away vpon aduentures night strange squire deliuered letter since time hee heard steriamus loath beginne without rest aduised stay assured hee would make hast met italian army ioynd likewise came romanian army led king himselfe told parselius antissias gone visite pamphilia wherof hee glad since sister might enioy good company came dolorindus hee beheld picture polarchos brought hee neuer free affection yellow knight ill fortune receiue worst court morea yet seruice meanes bring antissias fauor hee taking occasion let know affection entertained assured first loues losse yet vowed see againe write shee would wedde dolorindus besides shee engaged oath performe one seruice shee would employ sh e demanded done shee would side parselius selarinus leandrus put last side rosindy much leandrus grudge riuall deemd bee matched wherfore began repine till rest told ioynd respect one two quarrell hardly could preuaile wherfore steriamus discerning changd order taking force selarinus epirus diuision sent negropont leandrus dolorindus king leiue enant went himselfe stayed generall next care passe riuer might haue beene first considering like barr let downe barryers stay combat barr iudgments called councell avoyd danger passe water side wherof desired fruit last steriamus gaue aduice cut downe part wood along side ched lay tree close together fa ten chaines one another lastly together passe ouer first night might helpe fasten tree side discouered hold play till army passd well liked aduice applauded practise habit punish traytors cherrish mee thy loyall subiect much keepe thy iniuries neere threw away booke walked vp downe hand heart feele motion left place shee freely giuen found great braue one stead delicacy goodnesse selfe many flower shewes faire rose eye none sweete many loues braue shew none sweetely chast therefore rich worth inhabited incorporat one one soule breath liue sweete wood said folly idle loue without reward else condemned oft would shee read paper gaind owne hand making though yet time feare shee tooke satisfied read euen many million time lay vp againe greatest prizd newes selarinus imprisonment came presently happy deliuery coronation mitigate ury sorrow tormented vrania see whose heart perplexed especially parting absence often bursting passion like tell mee shee doe happy keepe paine secret close eer yet hath beene hap said eye hath beheld mee together sawe loue sweetest cousin saide vrania wrong great wit taxing vniustly haue seene prettily excellent disdaine refuse humble suite loue eye haue beene euen ready burst teares haue smiled changed first discourse purpose deny plaint alasse would thinke happy philistella art thou aboue thy sexe fortunate poore one like content mee eternall happinesse reiecteth loue steriamus loue like brother doth woman blessed affection seate enthronised thought like summer florishd nippd dayes yet praise desteny nothing except sad absence grieueth mee whether grieud louing cannot well iudge feele shew haue sence absence brings v louers sweetest vrania answerd soule tell dissemble manner face couer yet flame heare deare lord imprisoned faint loose strength hating since sufficient release loue court distempred parent grieued fearing comming danger harme neerer mee could imagine wept mastring griefe passed heart like leade fire melting heate fury call discreete wise behauiour could loue better bee dissembled sparkes finelier raked vp discretion see smile indeed doe better curiously like cunning workemen best beguile eye well sweet daintiest princesse may flout friend said vrania see one whole day sigh weepe steale away heere vow vnto loue vow break neuer creature felt paine euer discouerd doe confesse weaknesse cannot helpe see one poore instant space alone thought duty goe spake another thinke worthy fit talke selfe almost suspition ofttimes grew absolute fondnesse neuer away doe thinke houres haue stood audience king hath giuen haue one minute altogether ioyned eye held haue looked ti true like deare feede start vp feare straight againe returnd vnto food eye tooke yet secret discreet loue neuer credit mee deare cosin speake truth found requite loue till owne lippes honour deliuered shall better credit loue fashion much said philistella since commend troth spake guiltinesse forced mee wee free let bold aske question heate loue former passion neuer come glancing eye could behold parselius freedome steriamus affection said vrania confessor tell truth mee thought wonderfull odde change passing different affection feele alter though freed first loue power choose againe yet amply cured memorie resemble one newly come vision distracted scarce able tell whether fixion truth yet resolued force heauenly prouidence lost first liue second choice deare soueraigne good receiued leucadia thus far proceeded feare accompany change lest steriamus despise second loue hauing giuen first best troth sort obtaind liked loued oft study might compasse blessing future happinesse hee much engaged vnto melisseas prophecy performed wee death shew rose vnto new loue feared likewise would scorne gift many vehement affectionate suings hee presented little booke verse among many excuse himselfe commend second loue remember one sonnet blame dearest though grieued sake loue mild triumphing sits sifting choysest ash wit burnt like phaenix change could shake new heat giuen eye make ember dead cold call spirit pit darke despaire fauour new felt fit death new choice wake loue thus crownes power scorne flame though first yet purely ries best light set vnto eye againe ascends free blame purenesse alone one fixd place dy liue find change happy grace learne fit mee best time contented let see entertaind sute kingdome wonne sweet delight empire gaine first saw rudely yet innocently clad like lamb wool colour softnesse eye touch face blushing like modesty arme showed manly power delicacie asking pitie commanding absolutenes disdaining much bright moone say wee sorry frostie night see face water least might bee cold rather might say feard sunne would burne hee enamourd dainty skinne incloase power ha touching hurt make difference twixt fauours shind shielded others burne kinde embracement soft force language speake milde lookes loue shaddowing within eye face keeping greatest court gaining ah sweet philistella seene vnrelatable exquisitenesse hi youth none could haue blamd euen chid instantly yeelding passion wholly proud ambition gay flatteri made differ loue brother thus changd twas sweete steriamus parselius excellency wonne first bee change booke layd new lookt greate iudgement vnderstood need said philistella striue make se loue cause thereof steriamus since truely speake thinke none worthyer bee truely loued except lord imagine much way defend brother still continued louing haue blamd prouing vniust yet salue good excuse left desteny euer still must rule mee deere vrania aime loue discourse loue walke trauell loue sit still muse loue discoursed withall answere loue made maintaind loue loue shaped squared rule neede excuse plaine truth say doe speake purpose extrauogantly fly matter talking cleaue ubiect diuert proferd speech say loue lord braue royall mind hath like heauens beheld lowly breast taken lodging gracing humbling great godhead embrace true yeelding heart comparison supreame authority meane thus without excuse freed nay euen respected loue adored hee spake heare loue dwels hee hath made hoste doe remaine sure shall wholly affection humblest slaue scorne mee still reckon mee seruant nearest wayting great loue others like painter better set forth coulers king see haue picture drawne eternised ti selues picture drawne workemans skill fauor loue blame though ill peece ti best though ill hand drawne ti life others may smoother bee fairer none like iust vnto perfect true resemblance pure loue thus see royall selfe humblest vassall cupid cherisheth vrania soule comended pretty confession faire philistella made admiring sweetnesse disposition much wodred beauty person embracing deere companion true loue said shall ease freedome serue master dayes must passe without seruice done shall deere vrania said let priuate thought plaine open seacrysie others held loue know think thus liue loue loue liue nerana still remaining cicely growne humble proud ashamed scorning liuing caue alone feeding hearbs root milke goat fed rock playing milkemayd better princesse extremity threatned amphilanthus loues philarchos seruant saluted loue cosins ought beare one another like stood ready behold happned antissius troopes charged enemy led young man rather rash valiant came violence disordered ranck brake antissius order whereupon men rout antissius danger whereupon three knight ran rescued amphilanthus fighting philarchos remounted antissius came twenty thousand led leandrus encountred many led king fauourite martiall kingdome two commander met leandrus vnhorsed amphilanthus killing first martiall againe mounted told hee sorry pamphilias seruant ill fortune knew voice replide honor greater bee aided kept horse day men shroudly set braue prince stood last foote like tower mighty castle rest wals ruind throwne downe dead body lay round rude heapes came vp rest albanian army grosse steriamus perceiuing went downe force prince encounter terrible betweene rosindy came horse helped fiue fresh horse together charged force cunning compassing enemy charging side brake put like disorder brought part antissius braue men equally resolued fight victorie resolutely made proofe will power last three come happy time victorie doubtfull twise amphilanthus vnhorsed death horse helped rosindy requited greater measure though almost kind taking vnder horse belly ready smotherd multitude pressing time hee furnished horse selarinus brought saued parselius steriamus besides death one hauing helme strooke hee couering sheild till new one brought hee rescued many men hand hauing broke sword antissius hee horsed many braue act hee attributed happinesse dayes victory gained vnknowne came salute hee willing hide himselfe besides wanting ayre quickly discouered himselfe enuy deseruing stranger amphilanthus man rooted supplanted true affection prince italy souldiers ouerioyed king arriuall rauished magnanimous valour courage trumpet sounded retyred plaine close keeping field night witnesse conquest king taken aliue hurt death dying within fiue dayes hee heard steriamus againe proclaimed army salue wound sharpe terrible fight wherefore went next towne chiefe yeelded force rested men themselues neuer one hauing escaped without hurt vsurper died buried refre hed began thinke marching forward two knight guided amphilanthus vndertooke bee guide army putting themselues dutifully affectionately vnder steriamus seruing loyaltie amphilanthus selarinus much windowes house vpon thought priuate enough went orchard beyond place raised three ascent like triple crowne tree orange lemond tree pride hauing blossom vnripe ripe fruite vpon midst place stone thought meane suffer amphilanthus relating blessed content felt fortunate enioying truly affectionately discouering expresse knowledge loue sincerest expression made vnto selarinus grew iealous hee neuer compasse seemd vnpossible one woman could bee excellent perfect louer hee ready make reply kind heard voice within tombe bring forth word made first hearing start vp afraid discouerie troubled hurt speech betraying heart suffer excessiuenesse misery vnfortunate woman said cannot die hauing occasion possible deare tombe thou canst hold inclose woe yet keepe safe thee multitude last conclude griefe let sorrowes swell themselues iustest rage fury choke breath serues speake bee drawne contrary onely desire saue weary afflicted life tedious vnpleasing time finish thy labour woe let bee last minute vnquietnesse redeeme cruell slauery liuing bring mee excellent libertie dying life pleasing polidorus dearest alone deare lord know thou art dead else fetched thee ioy thee remaine liuing death would know truth might giue thee last farewell ioyne soule thine twixt violent despaires tortured shee quiet little space perused place long continued like woman spinning staid fasten thread begin againe turne twine sorrowes spun rime like swan weeping verse hearing stayd releasing tombe till said verse infernall spirit listen moanes cauy depth giue hearing groanes great pluto let thy sad abiding moue hellish fire flame fire loue let charon passe woe vnto thine eares boate empty shall load well torture great paine hell waightier earth body beares take downe spirit cloyd griefe paine coniure darkest pit let gaine corner rest let mee pluto wander complaine thee corsiue make wound haue torture disfauor vex forelorne soule thy fury put role loue giues ah bitter eating sore call thy great counsell afflicted sprit examine well woe night shall find none mine nay least greatest ioyntly twine let saddest echo hollow caue answere horrid plaint sorrow giues like mournefull vast cauerne liues iudge murdering passion haue iudge deafe thy iustice proue mend thou fault proud forgetfull loue release thy court send vnto thy brother ioue whose loue doubt hath oft transformd heauenly kind thee transforme killing care blessing hell ayre darke griefe louing fancy bind yet loue thus bind euen vnto death welcomest might obtaine yet must bee ioy euer know yes loue vnknowne knowne enioyed enioyed long quarter time loud vaine poore quarter oft crossd afflicted tormented varyeties paine yet deere lord thou euer wert kind true louing one death little haue thee although wasting lingring end would tenne time might beare thou wert fafe vnfortunate brauest prince bee embraced busines honour crowne possession thy life must bee sacrifice vnto pleasure two young men sweetest loue thou must bee poore lambe offered others fault deere polidorus thou didst merit fame loue trouble reuenge thou didst erre thy father must sinnes lye thee thou punished pride yet deere thou hast required best loue made prouision thy selfe thee none ere haue loue since thee ought haue first creation lasting buriall assurance thou hast giuen keepe thy promise victory thou didst returne bring mee vnto thee thou wert killd brought vnto mee vault might haue graues red marble serue tombe might best esse blood cause end thou art orethrowne find deere hindred confident else none could keepe thee remembring thy poore loue thou wert hindred cursed causers desteny barre last enioying best loud lord let neuer ioy happines loue parters bodyes poore gift b ene giue chosen graue ala must buried easier lesser paine fitter liues dye shees certaine becomes ere polidorus heere liue thy deere memory feed sweetest word thou gauest mee parted liue longer thy end bee knowne mee thou beest liuing quickly come dead assoone tydings shall witnes con ant woe pay thee thou deseruedst vnto thee commend loue dying paine others others yeeld last made ows first last dedicated giuen thee thus dying life doe continue till thou thine release vnto thee ended lamentable speech tryed open chest easily seeing open heart euen opened embracing ioy loued lord bring ready take loue death equally fit either place opening fit discouered found stone like vpper box cabinet lesser part light ancient hall prince house darke lower part bed gold vpon lay apparell roabe purple imbrodered king roabes vse vnder petticoate round kirtle crimson armes finger necke adornd richest iewels buskin white laced vp ruby hayre combd downe crowne infinite valew head scepter hand opening tombe cast downe raysing selfe little vp throwing armes abroad ready welcome heart vnto gone thence sudden light much darkenesse first daseled eye recouerd saw stead polidorus two stranger crossed armes lay downe againe seeming like dead body afraid heard voyce caused search beene dead spirit shee guided soone put beyond amazednes speech said polidorus seruants directed bring death quickly giue mine likewise welcome doe fauour much shut vp againe throne tombe must haue enioy king whose heart mollified loue tempered pitty able know doe gazed appeard peerelesse tombe eye euer beheld strangest saw shee lay still like owne monument curiously cut ala said amphilanthus comfort victory bring find conclusion accompanie selfe victory cryd shee raised sweete saddest selfe little one arme beseech either said bee charitable tell truth loath tell must bring death yet still besought implord teares lookd one another sighd eye intreated speake last braue amphilanthus kind excellent vertues gaue word madam said obay must sue fauour discouer soule doth grieue army ouerthrowne beloued lord wee haue heard much speake slaine said shee see face though pitty speake charitable sir bound beseech add one fauour vnto first last body laid said cheife church among king steriamus owne command noble act said shee heauens protect mercy conqueror excellent fortune last request ile make sir fauours may bee layd since aske haue brought mee wife deerely beloued heere safety mine owne petition left daughter king vnfortunate plamergus greatest happinesse euer gloryed true loue lay braue sir lord deere polidorus thus deere soule thine doth flye amphilanthus beseech selarinus weept would serue shee stretched selfe straight curious art laid selfe forth fit carryed buriall dying word dead kild excellent griefe excellent strength passion bring resolute braue end king changd discourse loue sorrow stayed seeking meanes recouer finding gone hope life went court found king new risen councell prince lord went meete seeing sorrow face wondred little feard soone brought telling cause sad aduenture sent guard kept late king polidorus vnderstood teares intreated laid tombe made himselfe orchard though besought goe conqueror calld steriamus beseech honor performe vow hee made vnwilling busie themselues fearing distast king neuer let last request knowne said thought wound paine made raue others dead matter body lay comparing vnto himselfe gone said care body bestowed thing steriamus liked infinitely offended beene fault might haue dyed surely payd liues neglect ascending height banished hating neglect creature dying imagining soule dye house claime care pitey none neede know fauour mee selfe selfe affection aske truth keepe close cannot trust mine owne soule vnworthinesse lest accusation iustly merited fall mee inwardlie afflict mee philistella selarina orilena time queene naples would call least iourney might bee hindred thus plotted deceiue themselues ranne safety apparent danger sea vncertaintie pamphilia vnlesse necessity venture constant selfe hazard tempt enemy surely shee grew angry see made serue perfectios fury waxed raged shippe grew kindly bending selfe waue aske pitty bowing reuerence demaund safety returne shee sought like proud insolent woman grew haughty regarding nothing owne pride striuing molest beautyes ladyes cryd sea vnmercifully stubborne deafe lament besought came vp sids ship harken slid downe smild feare rose againe glorious height behold sorrowes said pamphilia euer play foolish part iustly may bee condemned error blamd much lightnes despisd selfe complaind loue accused wept saw course comming harme soule long space best knew hurt wayling condemning storme continued wind calling loud sea assist continue fury shoare either side could get fortune would permit ought misfortune gouerne last quite carried gulfe adriatike sea shippe tossed pleased destiney till last cast vpon rocke split braue ladyes saued lay tumbling beating selfe hoping make way hard stone could pierce stoniest heart least look got vpon rocke seeing place selfe appeard first small excessiue perplexity wishing rather storme haue beene swallowed brought thither hope cast depth dispaire except famished pamphilia patiently tooke least silently climbing rocke till top discouerd fine country discerned delicate plaine midst whereof sumptuous building marble shee ioyfully cald followed viewing feare storme aduenture said vrania euer since carried ciprus inchantment woe v may bewitched misery neuer seeing desire fulfild made wretched mischeife let said pamphilia see end led dreame leader bewitching dull spirit craft may said vrania hauing suc esse last yet take heed aduentures framed finish enchanted answered shee went two marking sent one two seruants discouer found round building like theater carued curiously mighty pillar light might many place discerne betweene pillar vpper row within could discouer find gate enter returnd ladyes proceeded arriuing found iust seruants described curiously beholding found one pillar letter ingrauen another letter vnderstood meaning pamphilia desirous knowledge rest went far behind pillar could perceiued space halfe pillar plaine place halfe behind left passage came backe finding imagination likely lookd vpon middle plaine made space foure pillar making square therein found keyhole looked key three likewise busie selues search hauing found euery plaine place pamphilia last found key foote one pillar tooke tryd open presently opening selfe willingly power renting selfe asunder let goe instantly appeard magnificent theater art could frame prince seeing open came pamphilia stood gazing throne nine step ascended vnto top fowre rich chayers marble delicate sumptuous imbroiderd cushion carpet rich embrodery lying vnder need richnes must neerer beheld like woman must see nouelties nay euen pamphilia inticed vanity kind goe venture ascend throne instantly sweetest musicke inchanting harmony voyces ouerruld sences thought thing went vp sate downe chayers gate instantly lockd againe thought shut vp comming forth thence till man louing beloued vsed force release himselfe inclosed till freeing sweetest loueliest creature poore hahits disguised greatnesse redeemd bee finished say braue prince paine say amisse comfort owne heart could imagine selues felt seeing thought loues smiling ioying thus flattering loue deceiud true brought contrary effect good braue prince felt concluding last battel iust take possessio greater townes kingdome setled thing quiet receiued people subiection taken oath steriamus crownd manner army returnd cheife citty resoluing thence send newes morea euery one loues braue happy successe arriued messenger heauy tidings losse whole world beauty steriamus fell passion none thought would haue enioyed kingdome longer one doth loue vision cry haue lo kingdome heart content gaine poore country earth durt haue gaind loose earth giue mee must bee crowned king dye begger neuer man perplexity molested amphilanthus wisely couered passion much condemning indiscretion went sea lamented hartily greeued misaduenture resolud goe instantly search olorandus arriued weekes well last battaile hard terrible last rebells could hope last ouercome helpd well perissus former without whose asistance businesse cleerely passd yet fully end victory losse almost many men partly lost battaile gaine noble valour peerelesse king must vndergoe dangerous busines amphilanthus ollorandus went together steriamus selarinus parted antissius going steriamus would goe alone none could disswaded leandrus parselius dolorindus gone neuer shewing face folly concerning amphilanthus perissus philarchos ioynd companion excellent care taken choice lieutenant two first met knight amphilanthus charge principall counsell albania great bloud tireneus epirus philarchos perissus went morea comfort king queene see orilena rosindy polarchos tooke together first went macedon see meriana thus deuided amphilanthus must first attended hauing part allotted goe sea businesse concerned hopefullest shipped epirus soone could came along coa visiting euery iland searching ship tidings complaining himselfe misfortune much vnlooked time happinesse appeared ready embrace hee passed heart sudden leaped within straight againe teares followed see void comfort yet truly offer helpe must take giue fatall rocke passed ioy sooner passed possessed againe sorrow ala pamphilia helpe neare thee thou must haue lent thee loose ship last came towards demaund newes came greece amphilanthus made answere himselfe man sought lord said brother salute desire speedy returne cause shall letter vnderstand tooke found great warre begun betweene two famous great house italy reason duke milan younger sonne stolne away duke vrbins onely daughter businesse first betweene themselues grew neighbour taking part italy fi e regent respected king brother power none little hee remained rome castle thence sent brother returne gouerne whose sight thought would appease fury grieued goe seeking loued dearely yet occasion bee looked vnto could bee long likely hold wherefore ollorandus aduise care hee poore countrie sake owne preuent ruine hee bent course way ala vnfortunate lady become last time moneths hee shall come neare yeares affection bee much vnluckily fortune prouide thee blessing kisse like stranger haue dwelling hee arriued italy presently letting comming knowne flocked vnto ciuill warre country hath made party yet common enemy come ioyne flee partakings runne happinesse welcome examined cause found matter ill side yet last power loue iudgement appeased setled italy braue peace quiet euer flourishing doubly rich ioy king remained much people frequented thither fame act brought eye behold returned flew report whereupon king dalmati sent embassador treat marriage twixt daughter amphilanthus thing long spoken wished father would neuer heare life reuiued againe much earnestnesse pursued king made courteous ciuill answer embassadour said marriage hee desire excused till knew owne labour certainely become sister cosin hee would come himselfe dalmatia satisfie king full content answer sufficient time thus resolued goe search appointed end hauing called prince together met albania returnd gaue charge estate couns making old graue man much reuerence country house florence president counsell brother would haue setled againe desired bee excused haue order knighthood rest braue prince hee might seeke sister cosins king refused himselfe gaue order parted one way ollorandus young leonius another way himselfe hauing none esquire amphilanthus changed armour colour making tawny forsaken badge liuerie hee gaue soone best deserued therefore least merited reward also gaue himselfe another name cald lost man ollorandus must likewise alter else one would make knowne wherefore contrariwise cald himselfe happy knight carrying sheild victory crownd loue thus trauelled vncertainely stay land letting marriners guide pleased stranger dalmatia whither carried asked question landed went vp countrie comming wood great euery way thicke desart yet traueld came way parted three stood question doe icarus melted presumption might bee bruised proud hope broken fall lighted horse trie might goe vaine kept hill till came place tree bin cut little better horse yet thing easie much difficulty paine vnthankfull loues thus beliefe gaue faith euer constantly louing hee shewed much thus loued thought loued sooner possession freedome followed second loue brought mee onely playing part miserie young full ioy inriched treasure affection fell snare closely couered dangerous caught craft one whose wit strong mee plentifull wickednesse excesse could make execution demonstrate fulnesse true louer seruant discourse delicate vnusuall wit lying way good ordinary one excelling pleasinger varietie sweeter flatterie hee filled made mee giue credit treacherous deceit perswaded mee hee full honest plainenes prety familiar discourse shewed pleasing innocency yet indued admirable learning moued trust considering greater knowledge know truth contrariwise breach misery lord imploid occasion abroad deceiued indeed vndone twas loud yet respect found therefore pardon forgiue sometime lasted succeeding haue told death husband sonne marryed hauing ambition enough hold mee hope obtayning husband king still fauourd mee might arrogancy say loued loue chosen refusd others last refused crafty vnhonest man directly saw hee told left obseruing mee proudly sought loue scornd basenesse thing raised father mischeefe farre doe well let ill succeed goodnesse truth shall gouerne yet falshood shall remaine hid vnknowne tell somewhat hee something concearns story hee came found apt tooke occasion thinke hee spake loue proceeded farr brought fortune answered moderatly yet home owne hart saw euer changed whose change affliction discouerd paine sorrowes said complaind fitly commiserated pittied doe said contemne pitty thence hee grew aspire winne boldly aucely la carryed himselfe deerest knew though shunns much would scorne durst attempt winne loued yet hold owne though despised sort shew villany serues seekes sue haue grace hee perceiueth keep loue thinking himselfe base villaine good enough doe weare wretched liuery losse euer shund haue store forsaken forlorne loue yet continue doe euer selfe said amphilanthus cause extreamity griefe haue told sir said forsaken despised louing dull haue beene called constancy termed assurance faith made leaue mee thing hee think soone wonne rather held pleasure confident assurance firmnesse growing cotempt course doe vnfortunate poore costant louers run become said amphilanthus man liues said hope shame himselfe loue said h fixed truely heart vnhappily affecting mee parent looked without loues eye rather saw child blind goodnes greatnesse estate hopefullnesse man vertues noble condition much perswaded mee vnto yet could mooue possible couetous minde seeme beautifull fire hee wrought destilling offence villanie limbeck wickednesse beginning loue gon iourney king loued infinitely deterius father hee staying left chamber seruants dispose command stranger came plot ordained villaine lord dressing hee desired speake traytor went vnto coming againe paper hand amazednes face made deerer selfe demand cause tederly louing wretch instructed fro tender youth counterfetted loathnes speake vnwelcome newes would follow word troubled silent perplexed deere wherefore priuately called messenger demanded newes answered knew none much ioy content bellamira betrothed long louing friend though till beloued loued may better iudge paine heard giuen selfe another yet thus discreetly caryed hee spake thing vnto though demaunded fauourd seruant chance heard thing bellamira would answere sigh word impossible find woman true said lord bellamira marryed answered hee ill shee betrothed woman loue fickle false deere hearing death loue confirmed likely vntrue manner sai little turned himselfe window teares shed yet hauing noblest spirit world would suffer himselfe long gouernd vnder sorrow turned againe walked orchard conferred last gained consent desired end ignorantly liued daring make expression look humble willing seruices offered much affection embraced yet grieued heard still till euery one saw willing send receiue kindnesse earnest suiter falsely supposed betrothed man still pursue hotly last resolued stretch limit modesty acquaint lord withall letter ambitiously hoped gaine one considering many danger fell greatest fearing deliuery letter sent bar deliuering sent death found cabinet deliuered owne hand vnto mee teares humble petition pardon hee might die quietly lamentably protested hee could doe peaceably leaue world forgaue cabinet found three letter close misery suffer thereby saw manifestly betrayed loosing enioying losse brought vtter ruine assuredly confident sent letter still trusting contrary iudgement neuer receiuing answere excuse selfe since find framed sometime saying could write short time would send one purpose remained louers enioying like quiet many weekes hauing passed writ againe setting downe solicited hee knew almost threatned parent yet gaine like others refused sake would please accept truest affection wholly dedicated vnfortunately sent others kept comming morning hee villany contracted great heire forrest twise sending trusty seruant mother desteny preuailed destined mischiefe could withstand ill perplexd fortune saw thought saw faith reiected mad patience forced beare iniuries cursed harme yet loued harme maker till one night father many friend supper procurer miserie came beloued respected father learning seruice friend entertained placing next vnto himselfe vncertaine lookes doubtfull blushings cast mine eye yet stayed long lest might bee vnderstood heart guiltie loue soule bare lord causing mistrust discouerie owne conscience modestie made boldly looke vp would deadly wound cause one look boldly end life lasting mee know certainely death eager self demanded father soone preuented asking said hee fly youth hath got mighty heire much fauour die hauing cause came speech againe onely employd purpose desire seruants leade chamber beseeching company stirre assuring danger vsually fit father mother especially whose loues vnto dearest would haue gone mee preuaild moouer torment looking much pitie master good dog doth hurt owne setting vpon either bull beare came chamber pretended desire rest made abler dwell vnrest sir euer haue felt loue perfectly deserue name imagine selfe felt seeing scorne disdaine presented mine eies nay cruelst vnkindnes vnkindnes perfect louing heart indeed said misery cruellest murthering haue ala sir said felt griefe said perplexeth cannot say disdaind cherished scorned receiued loud beloued feare vnkind let feare without assurance said shee molest lest make indeed loose mistrust yet mistrusted lost beseech said hee proceede let misfortune remaine none else thought yet said shee forsaken greater miserie losse losse hope ioy life may bee helped againe kindnesse finde enioyed heauenly happinesse neuer complained goe come chamber hauing liberty priuatnesse exercise sorrow absence selfe thus began mourne loue cride enough thou didst win mee thy power thou didst possesse yeares first possible maiden thought entertaine thee make mee chuse guiding mine eye choice one perfection linked themselues chaine power enuy thinking loued thee maliced happinesse enioyed yet cruell cannot thinke suffered passion hatred others enuy paine torment miserie sufficient must turne crosse find greater afflict grant paradise hope throw downe bottom despaire glory inuite heart yeeld vnto winning power eye eye able gaine heart thrice doubled could repay loue fie intising eye wan mee onely set purpose kill frownes pretended murder sparkling conquest seemd gaine vnresistable dart soules
