last taking resolution made necessity came abroad againe meeting father chamber one day still de though forsaken wished much ioy told hee might best wi h hauing caused much sorrow hee told mee chosen loue hee hoped would bring content vnto mee kind true said treborius man must hold affection said forrest heire cryd hath made change mee forsaken liuing thus vnhappily made free free said hee betrothed pardon mee lord said neither bee till wed begin said hee vse vice euer till contemned dissembling thing protested vertue thing abhorre answered would vse faith hinder heauen beare witnesse wrong cryd hee pitie mine said company came v time wee said hee seeke meanes regaine affection feared lost ala labour couer truly doubted selfe safe keeper determining chastitie loue much entertaining outwa complement farther ciuilitie commanded treborius followed sute father vrged mee cast away fortune threw fortune feete bestow truly worth accepting yet loue man made seeke much ioy receiue time appointed friend kindred inuited principall guest lost loue intreated come obayed sad demeanor shewed pleasure see giuen another hee troubled afflicted morning quite dressed according manner country libertie chiefe stranger came chamber permitted custom see bride dressed among rest rest came yet said nothing onely lookes spake soule perplexed ready enter miserable estate went great window curtaine ouer lady respected whose happines know worth noble vertues excellent part admird would denied go befo e performd vowed sacrifice lock haire worne constantly many yeares haire though giuen himselfe ancient seruant vnknown lord vow euer vnfortunate marry himselfe morning marriage burne losse loue next heart euer carried losse finished vow fatall day perfectest woman without teares since noble lady hath told fauour shee would giue libertie selfe speake vnworthy iudgement making mee often call selfe mind yet thinke rather bee resolued shee could coniecture renew torment memorie distresse finished marriage followed torture mee standing betweene loue treborius giue selfe loue willingly would haue turned hand contrary soule gaue selfe heart first loue thus equally deuide selfe within short time went husband house wishing neuer see light company sort enioyd one whole yeare king going see country progresse husband house found fit way lay freely brauely entertained bountifull house man brought trouble liking king place often yeare visited much maiestie pleased grace mee thinke friend respect howsoeuer mine eye ascended higher subiects loue many time king command court seeing word picture heart thought liuely drawne maintained content best satisfied seemed commend witty description subiect pleased thus dissemble thus onely loue loued yet may pardoned pardon may bee giuen fault since loue warrant mee obayd lord time though blamd selfe wrongd kindnes would commend ordinary talke hee praised rude sport told plaine iests huntsman yet best vocation could afford laugh bee merry ofttimes brought discourse best loue delighted sport thus continued firmly chastly louing pleasure enuying good calld misfortune company husband dyed long sonne slaine vnfortunate groue doe sake passe may doe honor answered king shall willingly doe seruice shall please command requitall must beg one fauour must denyed protested would obay anything said leaue sad abiding dead loue goe liuing friend vrge goe sadnesse quite hauing cause sorrow sad abyding yet ioyfull meeting father detereus imagined lost ambassage though lost content liues hermit life rock saint maura much desire know safety inioyned enquire euer hapned country promised would able perswade place goe carry comfort age cannot bring thence may abide thus leaue sorrowing hauing still sad subiect behold worthy man low state true iudgment rule either ouer rule passion hope see againe selues strook amazement heare newes perfectly hee discoursed father affaire truly described shee knew hee spake truth whereupon shee resolued goe thither vpon sent knight kept bridge attend amphilanthus againe desired heare sad story sir said shee heare last widdow suffered many cross poore beauty decayed loue though oft protested bee fixed worth loue yet face alteration gaue eye distaste liberty former band looke else looked tooke heart last making poore seruant false eye follow still change grieued yet neuer lessned affection blaming cruelty cruelty lodging himselfe cruell loue grew still strange manner affect losse vnkindnesse vngratefulnesse scorne forsaking dwelt odd motiues loue yet loud keeper wrong lamented sense pined misery yet sir truly hate man loue stil wel could look backe loue former ill forgotten cannot vnfortunate strangnes hath beene betwixt v wee neuer meete wrinckled face decayed beauty hope yet blessed hee thus much speake kindly mee pittie vse mee courteously haue suffered enough merit respect thinke selfe accusing falshood make shunne ala doe forgiue affect thee still dye loue said amphilanthus discourse touch vpon quality rare woman yet haue seene excellent thing writing let much bound heare verse truely sir said long since made subiect growne strange hardly cal memory made hauing desired forget thing loue fearing ight thought would bring ioyes felt sorrowes soone succeeding excuse said truly sir said truth yet thinke say last made vpon occasion one time begun change hee yet visite mee vse mee somtimes well kindly grew hope little whereupon writ line lying orchard vnder great quince tree weather threaten teares follow drop following drop fall hope drop sparingly coole yet much late dispaire changed state yet possesd gouerne modestly deerest let dropps heauenly shower proue sea fit receiue thy streames multitude compare sun beames make sweete mixture twixt thy loue sea rich plenty ioynd delight sunns kind warmth vnto thy pleasing smile wisest heart thy louemakeeyes beguiles vassell brings greatest sprite raine rather drye gaine nothing much harmeles teares take away paine louing feares finely winns euer lasting raigne like heate drop wast away glad disburdend hot desire let rather lost perish fire hopefull signes brought decay sweete louer puer permanent cast gay cloathes change false slight loue loue truth hath right else like bough perfect body rent perfect sweet bellamira said king art pittie hide darken rare gift commendation brought fruite gayning passd two dayes till shee ready take iourney king parting following search discouerd lady vnlookd meanes amphilanthus first comming caue confident knowne pulld helme bellamira gone monument returne seeing face fell knee blushing errour lord said affliction make ignorant hings themselues haue caused forgetfullnes vnto humbly craue pardon admired knew desiring bee made certaine cause meanes knowledge extreamely sorry discouered displeased great prince said seruant poore selfe knowes excellency since heere shall command shall please knowne name selfe giue leaue expresse ioy afflicted heart little expect beholding sad dwelling matchlesse prince earth carryes may glory bearing madame said hee doe beseech know lord said attended king neece iourney pleased make much pride conceit beauty enough liked little defended field italy among place shee went happines see honor chiualry poore prince lady seruant found cast ground cast fauor scorning selfe yet louing wonne prize beauty mistris king well remember accident discoursing little purpose concluded promise disclose know lost man reason freely disclosed passion sh tooke way towards saint maura two king higher country though way likely finde ladyes yet first could lay memory apart trauelling delicate part greece till came romania passing many aduentnres vnder name lost man one necessary remembred skirt romania came place rockey hilley nothing heath small shrub shelter rayne sunne thing one mighty rock shewed swelling side appeard like swannes neasts breeding angry passenger troubling white fringed holly tree wayes stony troublesome walked foote squire led horse defirous see rarity olorandus went among amphilanthus keeping path braue bohemian seeking among last hapned one wonderfull behold rocke great height bignesse midst cleft bottome euen iust cut hand yet impossible hand doe nature shewing neere come art far excell beyond rocke little caue man lying shallow body might discerne lye left side face light pilgrim cloathes staffe bag add sad sight voyce agreed make knowne miserable breaking complaint vngratefull wretch monster man kinde liue still poyson sweete aire vild breathing wickednesse abound haue committed false trecherous vngratefull haue beene dye shame wrapd round thee dye dolorindus neuer let thy vnworthy face beheld thy false eye behold light let darkenesse blacke thy sinne infold thee thou art creature vnfit heauen looke vpon olorandus knew beene lost strangly manner cause vnknowne king keeping councell til could finde meanes worke good stole away softly calld amphilanthus presently came heard continue moanes cry villaine thought wrong thy worthyest friend vngratefull aldeseruing amphilanthus nay plot ruine conspire death antissia thou art cause miserable brought woman beast amphilanthus pardon soule begs let fault laid iustly vniust command loue excuse make say antissia bad mee kill amphilanthus enough noe truth tels saued mee ruine staruing death shall woman make forget benefit loued loue extend hurt procure murther haue offended beyond pardon mercy must shewed continue mercy cannot aske far hauing forgone truth offence flyes higher hope asc nd antissia hate thee loued thee iustly thy loue hath made worthlesse spoyled name honor content shame reward haue gaind loue thee heauy waight vngratefulnesse lye heart amazed heare word able coniecture whence came voyce knew name sorrow could imagine end concluded speake olorandus began repentance said hee merit pardon greatest ill truely repent doubt shall receiue seeke neerest way confesse freely fault pardon follow pardon cryd cannot pardond cannot hope cannot forgiuen may said ingage honor ruld said amphilanthus hee rose looking knew much oppressed weake body fel ground swound amphilanthus took vp ollorandus went next spring water wherwith rubd temple brought end die afflicted impossible liue doubted amphilanthus vowed vnto second comming himselfe whatsoeuer done thought forgiuen desiring onely resolued griefes cause lord said shall dare tell haue done shame great infinite ill fault traitor take reuenge let giue stay dolorindus said fall one ill greater speake plainely tell perplexeth sought life doe forgiue haue braue king cryd hee said grieued name life aimed commanded antissia kill take wife loue made vndertake hateful practise haue vse merit neuer pardon foule act loue antissius hate likewise solicited murder refused would need hinder mee whereupon haue fought stayd two told v amphilanthus ollorandus antissius sense knew taken name vpon selues vndertooke named ollorandus whose name power ouer came laying low sinne hath puld wounded taken vp saw death giuen young gentleman whose father killed quarrell concerning princesse croatia vnder name abused sight death shame straight possessed selfeaccusing infolded mee noblenes came mind clearenesse shewing foulenes worth blame heart cannot say brake cloue sunder neuer liued man say afflicted truly left affliction soules condemned cannot tortured soule feeling felt miserable torture antissius would little haue fought withall threw selfe feete petitioned perissus neuer think name name might sound like mine especially might know falshood left condemning mee might prooue worse heauier punishment torment blaming iustly would bee terrible condemnation spake word sunke againe againe rerouered amphilanthus chid would belieue said dolorindus think wrong done amphilanthus cannot forgiue dolorindus loues loues sake patient deare friend grieue thus grieued loue commanded subiect twere treason haue disobeied refused kill traitor crowne esteemed comfort selfe free anger spleene say forgiue say erred remember ought first meeting friendship let like phansies passe thy friend cherish thee loue thee yet must blame antissias forgetfulnesse causelesfury offend much irreconciliably displeased vex bee vnsatisfied ought life could death bring dolorindus much ouerwaighed ioy kindnes pressed sorrow could little power withstand fury kind passion teares deare loue fell amphilanthus feete kissing affection hee forced throw himselfe make leaue armes hold fast loue tied amphilanthus crid doe thus exceede possibilitie man noble soeuer shadow much lesse equall gather together perfection admired enuied men indeed fit deseruing bee eternized magnanimious glorious spirit kindnes exceeds act said expression loue find glad rather accident whereby enioy want cause haue missed truth knowledge loue neuer kindnesse shewed offering accepting confessing forgiuing betweene two ollorandus continued discourse former business razed like castle belonging traitor desired know taken name vpon truly said dolorindus know one kild dying desired might much fauord neuer spoken companion something neare mee shame fault lesse lesse sensible speake said amphilanthus haue done said dolorindus little ioy bee mee see gratious fauour died saying onely gentleman taken name honour companion gaining princesse croatia vildly left forsooke amphilanthus relate finding princesse discourse conference woman much pleased ollorandus especially heard gaine name glad heare reuerence done amphilanthus contrary though hee loued best doe well yet cared little told hating flattery much hee loued worth best man nay nice would rather doubt flattery let himselfe thinke heard truth himselfe left till made dolorindus leaue habit long gowne staffe change come home againe sword armour trauaile foote horsebacke contrary expectation resolution warrior gaind licensed trauell vnknowne also resolued doe rude rockey place despaire comfort took towards constantinople towne went priuately furnished themselues according humor amphilanthus tawny embroidred black siluer ollorandus grassegreene gold dolorindus haire colour kind dead leafe colour gold hapned iust time solemnly kept euery yere day coronation antissius restoring country liberty saw honor blazd remembred fame flourish among strange knight put themselues macedonian whereof good number came iusts hauing made habit fashion president present al nobility braue men returnd albania king hauing sent home tooke iourney search amphilanthus two exercise may imagined knowing actor else act impossible expressed starres numbred much inquirie made companion vnknowne passed took way court seene fashion well vnderstood antissia liued greatest distresse report false amphilanthus death came eares attribute shee imagined giuen falshood whereupon shee put mourning seruants clad liuery leauing court taking selfe castle farre sea beheld nothing rock hill sand bare content waues raging like sorrow indeed little companionlike spectacle shee thinking selfe solitarie place looking antissia sadnes looked thus continued time newes comming amphilanthus ollorandus dolorindus passed farther count ie tooke way amphilanthus direction towards neapolis visit faire musalina meanes made allimarlus reconciled amphilanthus betweene ancient quarrell ceased thus delicasie entertained feasted shee excellent lady spirit wit rare discourse vnusuall vertues woman merited affection man yeares inioyed one indeed pamphilia could confesse fit beloued therfore neuer blamed amphilanthus leauing againe louing musalina hither appointed antissia lucenia come giue satisfaction repentance submission musalinas husband duke tenedos amphilanthus spent much time louing leauing destiny commanding obeying power sometimes himselfe came soone forgaue heartily asked pardon yet conditionally forgiue antissia marry dolorindus sight forgot hate conceiued much loue embraced match musalina must questioned marriage performed constantinople amphilanthus comming thither himselfe old vncle gaue dolorindus good content soone tooke iourney negropont discreetly louing doting amphilanthus like king receiued followed men acknowledging peace gaine liberty come backe againe neapolis ollorandus went conduct musalina one first loues youthfull trauailes time spent sweet studied delight search quite forgot left whose memory better enchanted lady pamphilia left time deciding deseruing ollorandus like friend liued loued rosindy companion making haste could arriued thesalonica dearest meriana much loue hee affection met told misfortune losse sister cosin shee grew sorrie sad hee resoluing goe corinth king queenes determined stay till got tydings child impossible knight lady trauell without aduentures befell lady beautie sufficient behauiour insolent encountred chariot blew veluet embroidred gold sixe brownebay horse drew chariot couered clothes trapping suteable set forth feather greater state brauery one side went eight footemen colour rid alone beyond companion hauing two chariot following woman troope knight gentleman attending answerable point beginning pompe meetenesse agreeable waite mistris bare face shee rid threatning beholder contemning sunne well assured respect carelesly slighted heate either able daring harme disdainefully cast eye vpon excellent company horse much fast going pride stamping trampling raised dust passing meriana rosindy drew curtaine proud woman seeing said nicenes poore troope dust may come neere draw backe curtaine againe calling one footman let see error honour behold meriana started suddennesse rosindy angry rudenesse troubled loue seeing footeman bad one men knock hee whereupon troopes began bussell knight belonging company peremptorily commanded lady flew towards rosindy word stung like viper rosindy quickly getting horse made know haste ill end much speed sent escaped backe againe lady seeing turning began reuile fearing blowes tongue stood round chariot infinitely perpl xed calld rosindy comming little nearer gaue ill manner hearing word pride neglect beginner action think submissiue satisfaction ensue caused mee presumed attempt wherefore let mee see shall fauour farre leaue account valiant ciuill man madam said hee fault mine proceeded rashnesse seruant set belieue command might haue seene reason yeeld demand find howsoeuer hauing victory giue satisfaction haue power receiue force yet content acknowledge error queene shall passe withal shal esteeme discreet lady acknowledge errour erre said ala poore man hath little gaine made thee ouerualue thy selfe disesteeme thou art worthy looke ethiopian doe moone worship vncertaine thing pride said rosindy appeares gouerns much make many change waines fortune equall increasings take heed conclusion happen quarter shee infinitely offended turning face swelling anger shee bid chariotman driue rosindy forbad whether would brought seate ground meriana beholding alike distance former pride looked withall shee say terribly heart shee sorry shee giuen distaste phrase shee would vse shee take chariot againe discharged knight vnworthy attend woman footemen continued iourney next towne shee entertained new seruants one old one trauelling rosindy telling story lady saw mistris queene bulgaria empresse pride shee married prince affection sought discreet braue gentleman vertues chosen king bulgaria shee daughter duke country lesse arrogant shee successiue ill hanging ouer inheriting family first loued prince shee married well seemed doe shee still doth vse kindly often haue quarrel shee way yeelding accounting selfe farre aboue birth though honour haue gained precedence hee infinitely fond nothing deare lately hee hath abroad hungary part way going visit ollorandus came faire melysinda time carried selfe farre better presence shewing shee doe rather shee would doe wee know shee loues prince iambolly much better king introth part excuse since greater difference bee betweene men outward beautie sweetnesse twixt yet conscience shee vntouched iust husband may bee pride holding honest much laid vnto king going away got leaue goe morea visit excellent lady cosengerman married prince elis shee hath till within short time returning speed meete lord shee perswade goe trie inchantment rockie island beauty part world except selfe said enchanted iland pray sir said meriana madam said hee gulfe venice farre mouth gulfe lepanto said shee certaine nameth certainty answered hee brought seruants seene inclosed came stored griefe sea side againe stayd til ship came cockboat took aboard landing corinth king morea al court attending end hope soone son cosins returne albania purposeth intreat command aduenture deliuery doe know manner said queene truly madam replyd hee onely haue heard mistris speake place relation marble built like theater round curiously wrought comming thither discerned nothing gate inscription shewes inchantment end bee gained must man louing beloued hee shall partly doe hee shall release charmes hold sens sleeping cannot bring forth till fairest creature disguise come shall finnish many gone thither put disguise purpose serue surely fate hath deceit lord said merian surely may end one part beleeue thinke said shall try cannot consent cryd may god knowes long bard deere heart must parted charmes shall try loues assured need farther venture thus rid till came plaine found one peece armour many last sheild presently knowne polarchos tooke vp cryd alasse said hee heere parselius shield armour become rosindy instantly calld vp voyce lipps meriana seeing also knew tooke horse kissing deere wife gallopd along plaine following tract horse blod hee fouund way wood came ide thereof horseman polarchos demanded could giue notice wounded knight combat lately beene fought place behind said yeeld account desired try selues lad would shew sport rosindy replyed stranger ingaged attend ladyes therefore hasty fight hauing found armour knew desired know become master sir said one hurt companion likewise carryed castle within wood likely remaine wound great held dangerous may see said least heare aduenture may doe please sir said one know remember told hazard feare nothing said rosindy serue friend acquaintance friend said knight yes indeed answered rosindy said hee shall heare story first may better resolue lighted sate vnder tree stranger knight rest leauing beginning thus doe neuer vse tell story first know discourse wherefore pray sir let much fauored haue name shall haue relation rosindy began doubt therefore meant trust much wherefore answered name caudalus bulgarian companion larchos proceeded wood called forrest gulfe plaine passd pleasant way doe delight ride yet none swallowed vp past plaine arriued heere within deuouring throat lady dwelling within heere maintaines selfe pleasure ouerthrow death miserable creature passe way ambitious destruction call themselues called vertuous mistris one vnfortunate seruants held manner prisoner guard still mee yet appointed one guard morea worse doe thriue since hate country hauing beene refused desire braue prince thereof shee bee fully reuenged hauing got custody hope gayning aliue hold close prisoner place force get thence till shee haue end last death castle impregnable vnwinable thus misfortune fell passing along way search seemed sister cousen hee met troop encounterd hauing demanded first hee knowing acceptable present hee might bee lady set vpon finding selues weake blew horne came many succour last number faintnesse loosing bloud fell vnmercifull hand companion taken caryed castle welcome receiued shee glad malicious heart shee hath hee remained ten dayes armour threw card taking care person bring aliue could doe yet heare since wayting woman hee yet liuing though little hope way said king come purchase deliuery mee thinkes country father subiect study doe seruice truly sir said hee loue prince admire worth meriteth could tell gaine liberty losse mine owne life would venture haue power answered rosindy wayting woman named might assist true said hee shee may assure selfe sir said one castle full strong men dangerous acquaint enterprize death wee could expect shamefull death sort would inflicted without gaine assured harme discouerd plotted release besides weake two prince cannot performe thing owne defence wee stay till strong may bee lady extreame suddaine may dead helpe come assistance said rosindy able trauell would aske sir said two amphilanthus steriamus neither said hee may without boasting say haue tryd selfe company haue come away without shamefull affront companion little inferiour liuing knight began mistrust something yet indeede honest meaning said desired see face hee fearing thing freely discoursed lifted vp beuer instantly let fall againe whereat knight heart euen leaping ioy ah lord said shall release prince must venture great hazard must goe castle offer seruice lady court refuse nothing fondnes worke infinitely much may meanes win sight let alone rest cannot doe answered hee harder matter winning castle cannot vniust owne deerer selfe deerest friend may ingaged hate woman neede care doe hinder sexe must make loue said polarchos yes sir said done haue playd part faile hate selfe vexe incessantly fortune neuer doubt sir replyd sure make enough preuaile although crafty deuilish yet much loues pleasure rather made foole enioying misse passionate may haue thing satisfie minde polarchos vndertoke busines rosindy went friend agreed vpon went castle knight nephew great marshall morea held prisoner serue conducting telling rest one purpose come serue lady hearing rare beauty vertues arriued castle went vp hall euery place seeming stroger harder win withdrawing roome aboue stayres venus sate dressed inuiter pleasure vseth bee necke bare low brest could giue leaue much immodestie shew sleeues loose stird armes would rise vp discouer nakednesse surely white otherwise shewed much ill skinne although neuer much delicasie wanting chastity make men distract ill soeuer men discourse liuing yet loue modesty best prize breast though tongue say haire curled dressd vp iewels ring many pritty deuises wantonly phantastically placed eye laboured twinckling moistnesse giuing occasion beliefe humor ruling vnsteady fashion head set vpon slight necke turnd like weathercocke vaine conceit blew braines like staulke oates eare waighty feete neuer moouing willing stand sit still gate wagling wanton businesse perpetually selfe selfe lookingglasse beholding stay woman thought polarchos fit bee subiect enterprize hee saluted affectionately looked vpon shee straight imagined shee saw loue felt much selfe neuer wanted amorously entertained salutation seruant whispering hee fit seruant bee employed shee knew knew therefore gaue credit cast eye vpon rosindy demanding replyde name cautu u bulgaria coming company larchos euer loue soueranize first sight heere passionat new guest euen almost hung vpo beg pity refused fauour shee asked temperately carried himselfe sought granted done sufficient make sure finding himselfe deare hee tooke occasion demand many thing countrey castle indeare selfe told power last secret concerning prisoner counterfeited admiration w tt seemd highly esteeme rather miracle told found woman shee make assured carried caues prison shewed many miserable appeard owne ghost body quite consumd caue little lightsommer pleasant worthy parselius friend leandrus chaind togeather chaines others armes complaining weeping sorrowes walles di mall roomes parselius said hee wretched art thou thus held onely fetter thy sweetest loue become shall heare lost friend say accuse yet right selfe succour braue rosindy would thou didst know estate know thou wouldst free thou wouldst yet certainly comfort wife thou art succeede likewise mine heire louing dalinea cheerishing dearest soule afflictio nothing must suffer could beare thou wert likewise endure paine vnsufferable know dalinea must afflicted death nothing dying paine could sure dearest could patient whe consider affection torment violent passion breathd first absence doe make see death oh sweet soule would rather forgiue thee forgetting dying yet latter worthier none indeed worthy thee none firmely loue thee must body louingly embraced kindly held within purest armes bound yrons like thiefe must cherished daily tended lye naked bare stone die like va lell armes haue conquerd shamd like murtherer eye haue seene world beauty nay dalinea haue bin kissd must eye gaze dead wall expect sight see death instead former happinesse leandrus died kept thee free soule would haue reioyced dalinea bin better contented die thee shee neuer absolue deare brother said leandrus comfort selfe abler die brauely neede lament fortune doth v patient death dislikd seeme enough pleasing make v desired welcome beleeue pitie selues shall hate shall goe therefore sought thinke fine thing free vexation wee shall neither trauell feare misaduentures neither taken misfortune shaken harmes others neither loue hate afflicteth v thing one stay fall hurt v rysing corrupt v friend shall neither discontetd contented death dalinea wilbe held cryd else like al wel could wish said leandrus cursed sighd would faine behold ere died torture saide leandrus content selfe dearest parselius said confident heauens ordaine thing best doe repine haue made selfe already famous sufficient gaine sorrow end reuenge braue resolute make bold death constant suffering quake assaile dalinea doest thou thinke thy poore loyall parselius said thus waile leandrus discreetly comfort equall misery polarchos mistris harkning glorying distresse soule lamenting must counterfet till fit oportunity offerd short time gaind fond hee made gaue keyes prison else hee demaunded prouide armour one night dead time night saue carefull eye rosidis shut stole downe vault discoursed letting see hope ioy soone worke recouerd strength time fit goe night come escape honest morean yet without wench would goe rosindy went carried orchard thicke close tarry coming houre day loth part last time enioying soule foretelling harme ill able tell good selfe preuent hurt onely troubled willing stay reason last pleasing ro e put mantle cloaths againe sat bed taking hand kissd tooke armes kissd farewell de lady said hee better selfe cryd farewell hee presently went downe hauing keyes backway garden orchard staid armor arming himselfe toke way horse attended gate litle sad goe though glad considering cause long hee dissembled feelingly acted part caught indeed allurement sweetness louingnesses delicasies pleasure shee fit seruant yet changing deserud none worth yet plaid himselfe almost loue farre enough rest made sport companion see passion truely confes ed could willingly haue stayed euer said one made stale haue beene loue bee vndone turne way delight lodging halfe sort twenty marriage glad content liberty posted till ouertooke meriana much molested rosindis stay well contented saw happily esteem comming way brought good deliuery parselius intreaty deliuered misfortune ran manner excellent sister deuided selues followe search lost lady ill chance take way led v hither country meane first met pretty aduenture liuely shepheardesse blaming lusty lad falsehood chid answered himselfe cunningly though surely faulty yet cleared himselfe finely grew patient waxed surly introath houres pleased discourse especially see vsed best wit concluded kissing friendship wee met lady extreamely amorous wee story afterwards conducted town thence wee fell plaine found armour wee lost selues nothing doe remember fell till saw selfe caue visited chast lady castle finding weake pitied said knew leandrus confesse merited displeasure surely died husband succourd manner youth passed country brought much kindnesse place shee dwels entertained like king cherished like louer shee inuited loue lookes alwayes amorous woman intice withall requited yet charitable mee merited would perswade selfe want experience made slacke vnderstanding wherefore night came vnto chamber doore made fast inside pulled hard question angry deceiued hope last waked suddenly asked voyce coniecturd also laine chamber whereupon went backe next day told mee answered sorry losse euer fashion haue one squire lye roome slept truely lord saide shee imagined haue attempted loue vrged better may thinke loue neuer offered till time euer ill thought saide trusted blame selfe fauour shee shewed seruant cause curse ill custome caused losse shee tooke well kindly might haue receiued recompence former misse honest kept doore fast two night lay brought thither cousen got thence since heard euer railed saying dishonourd telling story thereupon vowed reuenge taken meriana smiled heare parselius tell tale hansomely polarchos liked cried part liked forwardnes nothing ill giue lady still said need busines woe merrily yeelds loue loue rather asked loue matter held day talke making good sport polarchos opinion louing lady disorder world first wanted woman rising going chamber finding bed made vnusd grew somewhat troubled sent another seruants call morean knight chamber doore found lockd thought might perceiued loue betweene calld vowd put publike shame shee found together fault consisting well ordering affection sight affecting doore broke open onely found table letter lady nothing liue better speede better search euery grewe towards noone shee went selfe roome polarchos laine tell businesse loth awake sooner found losse caue euery missed shee ought found shee shunnd want tore haire called knight sent abroad seuerall wayes till got knowledge way went braue troupe discouered bulgarian knowne madde rage could make vowing nothing death satisfie meriana held iourney happily arriued corinth much ioy sad time could afford entertained queene excellent woman loue striue deserue fauour dalinea grieued ioyed passion present passed rann round thought orilena wished philarchos perissus taken likewise way search made hast corinth knowing bootlesse trauell country seeke question either carried sea remote place kingdome farre else shipwracke cast vpon iland neere gulfe came towards corinth met lady much distressed complaining knight abused philarchos willing ayde demanding matter thus told vnto demaunding satisfied saide wife knight married vnto brother command obayed hauing father man great esttae way hansome neither deformed disposition crooked liued vnpleasing discontented life suffering iealousie froward humour tooke away litle show loue bare fell way discontent vnfortunate woman often doe able longer abide fury parted hee forced recompence portion allow certaine stipend life hee last brought willingnesse hee saide yeeres wee passed manner going friend house remained time kindly intreated courtesie last discouered finding end tended purposed leaue house yet like woman much dislike loue making cause tooke flatteringly commended selfe able winne heart hee frequented company vowing respect begging liberty see mee without touch honour vnder ciuill demaund perished second act please better first yeelded though asked made vnfortunate creature danger loue could procure fell neede say ime sure vnderstand carefull reputation world though selfe knewe wracked possible meanes auoide reproach tooke thought safely cunningly carried matter yet walked net like fowle head hid thinkes safe though body lye open ight blinde selfe action brought light trusting vnworthy woman couetousnesse vndid leauing others vnsatisfied meere reuenge spred shame came husband eares brother inquired businesse found likely may bee true hee left mee yet writ faire letter likelihood comming sister might haue got credit preuailed otherwise bee forsaken husband take disgracefull course mee country strict punishment offence condemnd censurd indurd punishment thought man paine fuff red sake haue found affection continuance loue hee also left mee case haue money meanes sterue want estate againe seased husband yeelded censure writ amphilanthus assist mee noblenesse make question tendernesse lady would haue done hee calld away feare informed fault doubly ashamd grieud ala sir haue made free though briefe confession wofullst woman liuing good house ill life noble parentage meane disposition yet sir mercy sake pitty mee philarchos beheld personage tall well shaped faire complexion good eye sweet fauour modest behauiour owne tongue accused passed vnblamd show ill fashion lightnesse countenance hee pittied demanded might doe helpe shee told would ride brother castle within aleague doubted hee might obtaine peace yet dare aduenture within gate said shee vntill haue preuailed towards castle went within sight philarchos spake perissus goe first nay said since haue vndertaken matter hasty take hand therefore thinke best went met lord castle brother spake good space ciuil fine gentleman seemd learned stored noble quality vnmarried cousen germane liud house gouerne mistris shee young beautifull one might imagine cause order houshold motiue liuing yet braue lady manly demeanour discourse modestest sexe would venture much fashion affected little vnlike well gouerned lady sh e beene hansomer cruell word true yet might well seeme faire house gouernment lord courteous kinde sister honour likewise hee tendred aboue rate cou en would haue care woman credit shee pretended raild bitterly reuiling immodesty dishonouring house shaming bloud adoe sh e kept neerely concerne yet last fairely philarchos spake perissus well wrought got fauour farre contented see meanes time haue abide satisfied themselues first brought next day parted one way another two companion together till came neerest part achaia corinth philarchos meant crosse gulfe perissus aduised meanes venture yet preuaild got little barque sooner vnder sayle great speed made way till encountred ship would need take prisoner made yeeld thought neuer hauing beene bred thing wherefore brauely fought boarding got ship fighting valour amazed saw made party good great space last hardly laid vnto found yeelding must bee best defence contarily hapned another ship made towards boarding likewise fight anew begun stranger fierce others little wearied yet troubled two first encountred knight got new heart againe fought freshly first discouraged vexed blowes last succourer would haue shewed trick suddden falling deuice discouered deceipt punished lesse death two last knowne selarinus antissius foure tooke course corinth brauely entertained eight champion together none missing amphilanthus ollorandus steriamus alone short time likewise arriue rosindy selarinus two deare friend hauing beene long loue made thinke asunder renewed kindnesse manner friendly conuersation walke priuate sweete passd loue possessed selarinus farre hee brake passion ala rosindy said hee euer heauen thus punish louers soule torturd like mine vniustly condemned death chast deare soule merit bee taken away carried brest held dearest sweet dainty philistella depriued mine eye sense hearing accursed sea brought misfortune dambnd barque betraid wicked vanity inticed harme euer beauty treacherously handled euer eye see mischiefe eares haue hearing wofull misfortune philistella treasure truest sweetnesse art thou lost thee euer cruell fortune turned thee alone wert thou made excellent bee fallen misery deare loue canst thou yet send thy spirit mee tell mee thou art feare thou hast long since parted highly prized remaines bee permitted mee mourne thy losse dye thy want assure thy selfe indeed end shall know thou art wh ch yet trust shall doe liue heariug waile thus said rosindy since shee inchaunted enchanted call nothing shee sister thinke hard fortune suffer mischance mee death inchaunted euer thing wee know old fable blind lest enchauntments shall best louer best beloued found till neuer neuer able decide must liue inclosd dull wall louing armes fitter embrace proper keeper excellency marble house epirus conuenient place passe time stone theater shee play part loue liue brest yet make nothing enchantment meriana iniurd something head appeard cause mourning philistella earth star lost enchanted passion said rosindy well fit loue must commend way angry choller constant affection sister moue mee much loue desire haue best friend yet would haue temperate suffering best louer found neuer thing made dare name againe feare displeasing ended cyprus concluded amphilanthus sister yes said selarinus bee sister vrania sister shall fetch neuer think liues none hath worth enough venture haue thought gaining end disguised creature sure disguisd fortune hath caused let liue beleeue tale wil certainty goe see said rosindy heart said hee sure shut vp might still behold philistella may doe please carry meriana aduenture ah said doth truth friendship shine thee braue rosindi shall go soon prouide said went back court rosindy acquainted queene meriana purpose would refuse thing likd moud gaue consent appointed habites purpose disguising selfe shape forrestnymph sea went direction giuen seruants arriud rocky iland pylot knowing place able bring safelier without danger pallace went round ahout beholding curiosity care last came gate againe soone meriana touchd opened question ended point disguise forced rosindi passd throne selarinus would shut venture though alone strait ran philistella met together fold others armes sate downe vpon one ascent right ore rosindi meriana new habit hard content compared happy people esteeme themselues polarchos would attempt alone feare sit likewise alone within therfore wishd sweet lady last parted would alike faire kind walkd vp downe alone iland til saw another ship ariue went towards see company found many determined try fortune glad reioyced finde one could direct among one old loue late enemy princesse rhodes shee ashamd grieud see angry much displeasd see therfore leauing copany almost ready forswear aduenture behold long one hower hate sought meanes selfe friend purchase discourse shund despised humblest intreaties shee made hee saw weepe smild falling teares shee quakd feare frownes hee said shooke long time iron cage colde shee sighd pittifully begd eye heart pitty scornefully said foolish thing breathing louing woman lesse pittied said hee sorrowes like exhalation hot euening odde behold neither hurt burne like lightening woman passion touch heart scorch rne pitty shee confessed fault bee vnpardonable hee answerd strange iudgement would let aske impossibility hee alone shee cryde might absolue shee alone hee said deserud good shee offerd throw selfe feete pardon hee said hee would take vp commiseration shee protested heart sufferd innumerable stormes passionate sorrow since departure hee answerd body heart suffered tyranny shee repented implord pitty slighted denyed euer shee petitiond could bee cruelty imagined suiter none cruell man could doe yet hee blamd punishment could bee sufficient bee inflicted vpon woman left louing hated extremity none enough yet surely shee beares greatest world let know lady princesse samos refused loue philarcos lady stalamina sister nereana iland lady purpose ioynd try fortune princesse rhodes like pilgrime lemnos like pastora like shepheardesse seruants louers men call mistress fauours aspired hope winning rhodian lady must trye alone polarchos flatly refusing wishd shee might euer bee shut vp light hauing vnhappinesse aduenturd polarchos see like others inclosd hee begin bee desirous see manner sit within yet alone hee feares goe lest must bee placed much despised lady dayes hee stayed none came resolued trye fortune comming gate find young lady whose face hee saw loue hee gouernment bee seene little cause doubt refusing one kindly would aske hee taking boldnesse long knowledge place began discourse shee free discourse willing answer hee demand grew well acquainted left aduenturing aduenture night next day made themselues belieue loud enough try winning louingly together placed row two paire forlorne lady still beheld kindnesse heartrenting torment parselius hauing long enough solaced himselfe would need bring dalinea aduenture antissius drownd himselfe almost sorrow hauing visited place beene happy seeing selarina kissd windowes eye wont grace loue looking would need goe parselius dalinea put habit religious woman tooke iourney philarchos orilena likewise went habite country lasse rocke arriud rest receiud shut vp inchauntment antissius taking selariua pamphilia vrania sitting throne beheld rest fittest admired perissus went sicily fetch limena resoluing try much cause hee thought steriamus alone trauels hapned fine vnusuall aduenture hee hauing taken shipping came downe gulfe passing rocke casting vp eye saw imagined vrania sitting vpon top pastours habite wherevpon hee willed pylot goe rocke hee landing foote scrambled vp till hee came top hee found excellent fine woman staffe bagge lying side shee combing hayre thought busied tended nothing themselues combd hayre sung song ending neuer saw pleasure best delighting cannot wish thaw feeles frost spighting keeping cupid hand awe see lighting bee still cruell bent soule distressed whose heart loue long since hath rent pittilesse oppressed let malice spent former ill redressed grieue doe past let fauour granted theeues iudgement dye cast haue mercy wanted alone feast fast thiefe pleasure scanted accuse stole heart directing thought controule yet passion still reiecting place roule left loues new electing though kinder heart place bestowing make roome fit iust exchange truth flowing till fondly gaind bit flying left loue owing debt resting still vnpaid let last gained new loues haue staid welcome choyce obtained let change brest laid liue still vnstained voyce hee knew vrania neither hayre though faire long bright like delicately shining selfe beene hee sorry grieud hope fruitlesse yet spake shee putting hayre aside delicate fine soft hand disconering beauty fit beloud pittied cherished song appeard bestowed mildly made answer sir said shee place sad desolate think inuite stranger vnto onely acquainted sorrowe distant ioy arriuall said causd seeing power able command passenger stay pay tribute deseruings may speake truth since inuited land strange beliefe princesse seeke shepheards attire lost againe fallen ill fortune thought shee might againe put disguised habit excellent creature must need could haue mistaken lookd vpon seeing teares run downe cheek hee spake losse pittied finely made reply alasse sir sorrow must onely wish pleasd say hope haue something serue vnfortunate woman long time haue beene lament would doe seruice except teares assist honour came fortune said doubt borne better ranke estate appeare shewes loue said shee hath tyrannizd ouer well plaid sport yet feele cryde rather rack torture delight vnlesse call playes dogges horse taught stripe blowes pastime haue loue loue playes mee time discoursed wound vp hayre string tawny shew chance hide little rather selfe suune shee put dainty strawne hat head appearing like cere crownd owne plenty hee desirous know place name vnder whose rule loth trouble sweet pastora much vnderstanding minde led h rocke halfe mile compasse middest pretty fine house rather tower built round shee therein three roomes one ouer another top couered lead shee vsed walke view sea two maid attended heard goates shee pleasure rather passe time withall bestowed looking shee hold lady chosen friend carefull shee keepe counsel desirous aid desire kinde friend true one heere began harme smother like wet hay fire smoke flame longer breaking forth lady calld siluarina opened dore going chamber certaine watch made gone forth tooke lampe hung wall bed feete hung chayre hard bed side purpose giue returne occasion looke remouing take paper laid bottome wherin written vilanous letter threatnings reuilings sin cald little troubled siluarina though great spirit told husband knowledge would dangerous honour would ouerthrowne lastly loue might suffer greeud harme fallen shee lesse cared auoid keepe safe resolud speak next morning hand knew first seruant comming room see went iourny determined make day shewed paper hee vexed withall afflicted hazard kinde paine stirring would bee worse reputation shee grieud see perplexed businesse wherefore shee comfort assurd shee would finde meanes salue hee tooke leaue enioyning send word thing passed shee promised willingly would shee doe beene cause heare dearely loud hee gone rose ready sent gentlewoman brake forth word offence euer giue cause malice haue worke treacherous practise seeking ruine honour replyed cousen assurd therefore said shee hauing power seeke marry lady mentiond selfe doe assure selfe spare either husband el whole world shall bee filld shame threaten base woman said shee feare thinke thou shalt make mee neere thy selfe wicked wrong kinsman bloud much let fall mischiefe bee thy husband know wrong cannot haue litle worth fond vile creature forget himselfe farre thinke marrying neuer thinke trick fright mee ill knowne haue committed cleere ayre onely suspition may vrge brought light cause knowne malice beleeue life hath gained settled opinion world stirrd ill tongue husband iust shall heare wil know right farre shall punished whippd slandering good hope doe talke doe haue minde beleeue shall bee spard threatned witnesse brought enuious railing woman selfe onely worke difference iustly made betwixt malice ouerbalance report shee hearing fearelesse knowing thing spake true found shee deceiud plot diania inuention encountring another manner woman lookd shee therefore turnd speech protesting much shee euer honourd nothing value life neglected serue withall desiring pardon said excusing selfe madnesse possessed feare cousen would forsake thus parted shee carelesse danger outward show danger lay yet wished great spirit shee fairely dead honour safe continued thus seruant returning backe againe meeting place siluarina hauing meane time visited husband kinsman lady hee court louers returne discoursed passed businesse shee contented hee pleasd hee finde faith affection best contented gentlewoman affraid thought bring braue lady vnder power spirit onely submit loue happy accounted selfe euen blessednesse loues requitall within one yeere whether fully satisfied loue inamoured might speake thinke truer cause another place led astray first fell violently lesse discreetly shee sweete lady first condemned choyce saw could strong hand hold fell petitioning returne loue writ spake perplexed woman could doe prospered alike companion friend complained wept comforted would beleeue long time chid guilty false accusing sawe plainly others pitied could helpe found hope helpe vowd die constant though vnfortunate louer griefe made loose rest made distemperd sicke none hope life husband tender ouer tooke paine hee himselfe fell sicke worse recouered died sorrow scarce cared noblenesse made gratefull haue vertue herselfe want time selfe caused torment performed right belonging dead husband held selfe according manner vnseene time visited friend louer came together bringing likewise new loue riuall neuerthelesse vsed well though loued respect selfe held kind opinion losse made seeme vnpleasinger eye especially see cruelty cherish face continued height neglecting scorning best deserued merrit herein fault louing passion cannot resisted hating sought beloued loued could haue vsed fashion say make himselfe free importunity might haue sued haue dealt iustly plainely told stroue fashion expresse publikely yet time came visit priuately vsed better showing hy would loose thing though esteeme nothing cruelty suffered wi h patience rare ill example woman could contemne passion must yet slaue one one slauishly vsed could lost especially woman sweete one passed plaine entered litle groue heard comming exquisite musique drawing neerer hee discerned fountaine made fashion emperiall crowne globe toppe like full shower raine vpon bough circkling tree ratling among second musicke vnderneath place many sat round water falling beyond ordained coole canopy shelter heate offend one tearelike drop lest might make sadnesse thought companion life place themselues groue much sicamore tree rootes betweene set rose sweete flower violet pinck many without fine circle paued seuerall coloured stone water fell made pretty murmuring brooke waste deuided itselfe two lesser running paine part excellency teares kissing bankes parting mirtle lawrell also flourishing shew although venus lady yet apollo often called sake tree honoured among beauty many faire maides sitting away might haue commended highly possession sight gaind prince gazed euen blindnes like one long looking sunne admired till lost sense admire yet went sens round comming first place hee sense againe loue wonder put heate little slacked rose rest attended shee leading one wonted troope italian prince prisoner durst follow neere yet eies kisse euery step took imboldned loue yet little withheld feare went sadly softly prety young shepherd came smiling vsing word sir said hee sight hath way displeased may make amends surely see euery day former cause molesteth looke lass assuredly cured said hee little hope cure danger dwells think answered lad doubt man profession feare especially beauty yet indeed cannot blame since al eies haue seene haue yeelded heart slaues leonius made answere shepherd proceeded sir afraid belieue faire courteous ala cryd stranger yet possessor lost liberty imprisoned hart presume come perfection rest dare approch lightning dare presence neerer admire behold must need say replide youth lesse strange touched since heart subiected lowest despaire would touched cryd might scape wounded vnto death would beene answerd done thing yet answere birth taken order would doe heere said hee many occasion exercise strength wee haue game trie say cleare force must bee found best performancers besides wild beast often spoile vexe flock nay last day rare creature su e admire danger fierce beare misfortune let loose stirred vp thought said vnfauoured fortune deserue seruice least one kind looke hold soule seeme angry aduenture confesse selfe riuall haue already little encouraged telling heart yeeld trust shall fall displeasure one company true respect confesse said lad seruant perfection teach v aspire higher behold obay thought wee permitted banish treason able wee giue birth high desire looke sunne without hauing hart throwne downe condemned eye cast wateringly presumptuous gazing begging pardon attempt dare loue said feare appeare bold loue hardinesse said lad ascends serue life hope accepted creature farre beyond merit gaine much feare something make doubt doubt indeed said feare giue offence loue likewise loue said loue loue louer could soone haue found disease iudged straight selfe pitied doe selfe fell loue directly first ight strake wounded first dart killing eye shew towards ala meant vowes harme wretch could hurt durst aske ought pardon granted weekes passe sought fauour moneths ere venture reward make perceiue run error therfo e hold longer doubt shepherdesse sat right hand fairest seeke gaine hope shall win lookes kindly take pres nt smile vpon flockes cherisheth dog fawnes knew master mind stil waights lye feete god knowes could oft enuy good luck doth stroke backe playes take song ings happy line euer gaind blisse kisse sweet lippes passing ayre scorning place breast expose vnto eares harbour sometimes likewise giue mee making commends voice make sing doe yeeld owne word best knowing iudgement requires mee presently sings mine vnto say good doth grace answer best song befits mouthes eares onely signes doe thinke much flatter poore selfe assurance thus sir hope satisfied said doublie tide relation doth speak iust truth loue shews thus discoursing heard pitiful cry shriks wome made hie plaine saw fierce bea e hastily pursue glory part ready almost close iawes rest woman cry assisting onely lamentable voyces helpe sex yeeld danger yet came wel noise brought leonius aide sought saue selfe flight cryde like woman neede desire intreate assist carried wing loue flew succour seeing runne helpe turned course way shee ran dainty leggs seene discouering excellency shape swiftnes bin enough alone conquer passed hee standing still encounter enemy yet eye cast amorous wish spirit raised hope meete beast gaped wanting breath hold ioy hee expectation deuoure sweete portion excellent daintinesse furious deceiued sought execute furie got sharpe sower encounter leonius sword passing throate wherewith fell strake head hauing let presumptuous thought enter hurt delicatest shepherdesse vrania left habit blow giuen flying beauty returnd quiet soft pace let italian leisure behold cry within himselfe oh much affection haue loue would sweet swiftnes run beare sight feare yet content much could haue found heart harme haue indured beast haue clasped armes ran danger hindred attempting pleasure shee saued taking sight heart stead longedfor selfe breast passion full mote ayre flying vp downe like fly hot day buzing swarming like bee profitable hony bring sting like neast waspes one time beset one fury giue profit shund ouercome except owne poore body worthlesse gainelesse thought hee gathered together like fisherman net catcheth come within yet pickes hee choicest appoints keepe sell giue throw againe fit keeping cull seuerall passion chose present withall hold himselfe please withall others seene cast away floud forgetfulnesse whence none arise giue distaste commendable vertue youth shun may youth shame offend hee loued therefore curious displease best beloued highest desire content hee must bee contented hee shunnes else beare yet loues hee brought meanes doe seruice hee killed beast hee tooke head paw heart present withall speech hee framed deliuer reliques prose verse hee summoned doubtfull please stood musing hee might doe please best hee feared one hideous face beast would fright therefore thought heart fittest enough shew prey paw hee thought fit lifted vp head necessary hatched treason three three danced hay discourse still ended iust vncertaine apt begin againe conclude faire victorie made thinke fairer acceptance must yeelded bold attempt saue boldnes might waranted respect speake desert claimes reward claime answerd made must aduenture e refusall cannot bee knowledge instant sight sayes requisite valor must adored loue cherished tremblingly hee stood afraid dead hee kild hand shook held head hand strake eies vncertainly rold ixt ruin leg shake vnder enemy like pillar vphold strength courage loue made seeme weake piece loue made fierce enemy looked towards sighd within himselfe lamentation ala said face heauen mildnes sweetnesse carry cruell force delicacy destroy eye soules comfort looke much loue mine since fairer mine louing beloued dearest lipps let seuer speake requitall let tel bane yet rather suffer heare voice speak thing possible speake loue feete leggs rich matchlesse supporter heauen bring murder mee lade selues pitie compassion come apace giue life pe plexed louer comming attended passionate man doth breaking day visit time loue dawning leasurely shee came hee thought shee made small haste yet came fast loue accompany loue like delicate young courtier make estate marriage great heire hee come first timerous loth offend yet dressed vp richnes finenes hee helme hee tooke rubd vp haire wiped face set manly yet amorous countenance knowing woman loue childish men much soeuer commonly like louelines choicest beauty poore man see busines kept himselfe strange hee newly come know passion bee much variety skilfull manner learned knowledge win naturall inclination change wooe daily pleasure delight young man torture sighed looked prayed wished yet nothing might helpe long distemper either ignorance neglect ill manner like laid charge indeed exact fond louer taken spoild first sight louing country italy could neuer make thus passionate beauty one owne country esteemed nothing pleasing one thought others till tried arcadia place onely captiuate heart must tast paine make wish italy freedome sweet place heauenly paradice said delight thee serpent keepe enioying story haue heard water tree kept monster rarenes euer thus kept loue keepes mee asking pity stood letting imagination twine time might acquainted loue bred cunning schoole haue vsed farre gainefull purpose past feare danger secured death beare threatner turned back came thanke sight word stood still posture beast death also wounded made excellent shepherdesse take hand kindly demaund felt himselfe touch dainty skin rare softnes gaue cruell hurt heart hard sword giuen though death vnto beast hee could answer sigh eies raining shower teares yet wet cloud gazed sorry sorrow wished helpe might pleasure alone could doe du st hope aduenture demand rest come vnto stirred looked like metamorphosed creature hand fast one anothers pittying hee could wish yet fearing enioyed shepheard youth perceiuing louing leonius much man could loue another acquaintance stepped sir said appeares sudden ioy braue victory releasing rare beauty danger doth much possesse else fit day found hath againe ouercome shame instructed carefull starting child doe bugbeares told true fit taken held worse done caused stilnesse asked pardon faire shepherdesse kissing hand assured nothing comfort rescuing thing grieuous rude acknowl dge fauour comming back thanke wherein due one serue preserue beauty thinking himselfe fortunately borne brought thither time doe seruice mildly modestly blushing told good fortune gained onely safety noblest hand heart taking away hand deathlike blow courteously bid farewell million kind thanks sweet word vnto euery one wound vnto soule left gone alone shepherd began complaint partly himselfe partly new friend manner possible arcadia sweet delicate prouinces thee liue dangerous creature first sight wound kill first touch ala friend peril doth abide dainty dwelling place ordained excellent alluring draw men end made happy seeing delicasies see taste none sharp murder father hast thou left thy son thine owne friend dominion bee slaine woman brauest brother disdaine bloud vanquished looke arcadia sweetnes martyrd one king blood thus kil guilty treason shepheard perceiued knight bee prince word aliance country hee kneeled downe thus spake lord said hee blame place doubt shall haue cause loue accuse friend since saw vallour braue destroying fierce beast would without question glory vertue displeased fortune loue since fortune hath brought loue one loueworthy beseech cause haue thus complaine knowing whether may fauourd disgraced see reason bee discontented would receiue kindnesse mildly sweetly affording loue loue cryd make mee thus wretched doe sens sight faile haue comfort deadly dispaire make dare hope shall ioy scarce may venture looke must deliuer mee bondage noe see remedy able aske take lost found dispaire desperate loue teares follow word groanes teares till sheephard began againe lord said hee yet heare way whereby may let see loue yet speake teares thus continually shed sigh still breathing passion groanes foretelling death truly witnesse affliction sue pull habit vnfit passion put wil prouide well agreeing humour cloathes action shall make vnable withstand much pitty must breed loue loue discreetly gouerne procure happinesse direct deere friend said hee let enioy loue assured make thee see vngratefull lord said hee shall put habit tomorrow morning bring yonder groue sure sunne appeare least v follow aduice shall feare come wish end withall must promise performe assistance leonius could kind teares straightly embracing giue thankes promise thus resolued youth went next towne buy thing fit prince sad thought vncertaine wish wrestlesse passion spent time till returne sheepheardesse poore soule knew owne beauty found anothers master would said beare deuoured rather torment perplexe stranger succour purpose sent torture mee must made subiect one know suffer affliction one shall behold fie vpon strange loue make strangly loue affect impossibility see iustly punished disdaining youth part thinking none worthy must loue one knowes see mee surely loues pride haue vndone mee confesse fault sorrow yet venus helpe pan sheapheardgod assist mee let one seruants nay poore seruant thus distressed liue recall former scornings repent disdaines accuse selfe blame mee ayd thus passd night million like complaint till morning come rose hastely dressing raysed flock vsuall time shee raised vnusuall passion plaine went awhile stayed yet rested sometimes shee walked pace would leaue paine behind seeing closely follow lay downe embracing yet blushing would turne face ground seeme ashamed owne thought chastity said shee doe wholy possesse mee deere diana take thee venus rage increase flame making forget affection rising next tree shee went willow branch puld crowned selfe casting strawne hatte sunbeame haire falling downe full length little fine naturall curling reched small leg rich thicknesse spread selfe ouer shoulder awhile stayed grauing word barque tree agreeing paine shee felt condition tree whose softnesse concurd yeelding heart lo er fate giuen forsaken made garland haplesse creature well poore willow said thou shalt yet companion honour thee though happier folk despise thee went groue little stayd shee flying company saw assembled seeking new place doe seeke ease hope trauell shee passd along side one little brook eye still fixed vpon speaking sometimes last shee said word poore brooke said shee like paine seeke flye spring sorrowes fall head fast sweete brooke runne hope eafe fast doe poore hope flye hart stay turne course shall hope liue notwill runne continue paine went sadly bemoning solitary thought heard pittifull voyce vtter vnperfect ioynd word leonia poore nimph said thy vowe must venus make thee change loue coward loue steale thus heart couldest thou haue come brauely contended chase taken time reuile thee scorne thy power set vpon quiet safe thought treacherously lye wait betray mee vnarmd naked without power resist shame sworne diana punnishment chast goddesse lay vpon offence foole talke poore thing comparison woe blossom loue must loue loue die loue shall cruell see written heart murther thus committed vnkind alasse soule melt teares yet thee paine waighed bubble hart weepes blood pitty say pitty saue pitty said sheepheardes want new companion woe haue found heere went towards place whence shee imagined sad voyce proceede little banke vnder shade mirtle tree made cabine selues lay forrest nimph apparrell colour fashion like diana buskin vpon leggs white haire tyd vp shortest temple curled crowned rose hyacinth lay head toward soft pace went till came iust behinde viewing earnestly eye full loue louing creature found power draw call especially eye much could stirre commanding shee could looking louing force bring owne prooued eye full teares seeing themselues streame shewing watry picture earnest viewing nimph naturall humblenesse drew lookes ioy appeard nimphes face yet straight clowded sorrow rose timerous though imagind bashefull countenance fashion saluted thinke faire nimph said louing shepherdesse impossible finde like selfe vnhappily wounded hurt faire shepherdesse said shee ala sorry wish remedy none knowes torment dispaire like selfe therefore charity would haue none else afflicted strange beauty complaine ala said shee oft time perfection turnd contrary spake pray sweet nimph let take boldnesse demand whence hath brought hither loue said must first last discourse get beggery slauery passion rare shepherdesse nothing misery followes ala late said shee giue couusell time prison fast locked meanes loue bee freed loue said leonia oh haples said shepheardesse doth mee pitty said shee loue see deere remembrance many thing report sent loue vnto mine eye nimph blush shepherdesse went offended sweetest nimph said excellent loue doe loue rare true beauty valour well armd afraid diana fled part since haue roamed directed mine owne despaire neuer since haue se ne loue forgetfull goddesse hauing enough winning scorning much care hath feare forgotten contented ill would follow guessed though confesse little somewhat touched care wil call iealousie though twas violent paine seek cleare himselfe satisfie came two alone sitting bed shee looked angerly hauing hindred red fury thinke shame found yet went away challenge though hee seeke make mee thinke hu meant harme vnto loues made mee suspect spition bred griefe noblier stroue giue mee satisfaction engaged forth telling watch hee sent gowne mee weare next day death vnder colour within long robe hee brought rope hee fastened barres windowes thicke placed one might easily get reason heighth made feare loosed hee drew vp fire chamber burnd shutting window himselfe comming downe ordinary way againe without suspition gate hee du st bring mee strongly guarded safety would knowing passage brought mee little garden vpon wall posterne doore low little bigge enough another danger goe downe outside castle standing maine rocke danger wee soone passed scrambling wee got downe holding one another youth though weake yet hauing strong heart saue mee helpd beyond expectation man keeper brother dwelt hard place thither led v telling brother hee sent earnest busines concerning state got horse wee posted youth riding behinde holding much affection imagind beene care feare slipping iniurd worthy selfe could neuer slip wee rid thus till wee arriud castle mine strength sufficient wee left wearied horse furnishing selues better youth rid well carefull though hee still besought mee heede safety hee weary weake horse little lesse fell wherein hee hurt last hee sure wounded tyred pittied saw teares approching end saw letting mee accompany hee seeing lord said hee weepe mee shed deare teares one might haue life giuen one dayes passed ending fast may bee bruise death fall brings mee yet cruell mee one friendship one therefore though v one excellent woman louer also bring eye heart looke one one confesse time thinke loue may discourse discourse know behaues selfe able discouer affect striue gaine others part louing discreet iudicially carried hand euenly kissed one shee fa e betweene v still euer gaue v euen indifferent grace cloyde thinke blessing must diuide take one cannot doe therefore sir must decide question shee sayes take either equall loue equall content take misse say something selfe thus speake lord said heare two story related loue cannot confesse true onely beseech thinke lightnesse ections indifference choice loued faire man confesse first seene perceiued louelines beauty thought ordinary therefore prized dearer faire youth came againe brownnes appeared nothing pleasing together mee thought fit beloued rather different complexion would hold one still loue one wh n affection sw etnesse delicatenesse possessed looked loue fairenes whitenes claymed place turned thus mee thinkes loued equally one loue still one end content contented w th made themselues one thing euen loue true brought choose one father haue marry cannot find heart refuse either haue power choose whether hope freedome hath continued v cause make mee lesse esteemed loue therefore sir allot must take first spake againe doe great iudge beseech fauour although first tell tale first loue wrong friend hee deserues selfe chose choose therefore bestowe sir said loud sake loue made affection grow therefore sir hee first loue chose loues sake onely selfe cruell bestow best deserues let haue cast eye spake amorously seemd cryd within selfe sweet iudge adiudge mee hee sate still last brought forth iudgement louing beloued treason part blessednes able cut euenly threed goe iust middle way affection giue either hardly doe since beg either faire indifferent creature seemes bee displeased offend either therefore shall iudgement take garland hold tye scarfe ouer eye shall come giue garland hee shall bee husband blinde loue made equality blinde fortune onely fit decide tooke garland two kneeld iudge spake word one iustly deliuerd shewed heart one beseeching since garland well hand might keepe still crowne selfe lady oddest passion would passionatly louing equally leaue faire mayde said auoid trouble choyce choosing leaue seeke take third crowne single loue ollorandus liked oddnes best blushd faine would haue spoken went away left like allchanging woman glory owne folly couer selfe owne shame yet shee ooke changer boldnesse lord said humbly thanke iudgement noble care troubled leauing haue ioyed hauing onely sorry must witnesse fault lye sexe come euer againe censure louers pittifull v liud loued shall trust liue loue againe without parted ollorandus hauing sport paine sitting long stander satisfied vncertainty part king towards prague met melysinda three day iourney neerer hauing knowledge comming messenger brought newes emperours death together went ancient braue city thence place prince generall consent met chose amphilanthus emperour king romanes might claime one voice like one cracke thunder sounded name prince transiluania dispatched met said returnd answere whereupon ollorandus deputy till arriuall long fine nimph delicate veralinda liued together time passing heate day fountaine shadow rest abroad neuer weary time night accused great cruelty holding asunder faire veralinda often would haue helped wish father would permit one day shee sitting alone expecting deare companion graue shepherd father came vnto looking steedily wept amazed sweetest soule weept see teares embracing dearer heart said must leaue thee make teares ala sir said shee let mee neuer see day heare bitter word againe true said commanded must obey god gaue mee thee appointeth grieue hope bee eternall ioy warned sleepe send hence vnto island shall blessed happiest successe goe take cabinet open boxe vntill aduenture shall see ended open remember amazd comfort shall goe said shee alone vnguided cast haue deserued ill thus throwne away father keepe else let stay may see face therein shall blessed ala sweet deare veralinda must agree thy demand yet beleeue repent alone need goe shall haue seruants besides nimph goe met acquainted shee gone litle hence send shepheard deare friend prouide horse lament grieue see teares vnconstant thing familiar men take good heart hate humour owne worthy constancy seeke preserue excellent beauty let vncertaine qualitie hurt beautie besides vertue counted among men excellent worth wil draw heart adamant doe iron yet comparison proper heart tender resist easier inuitement say beauty sooner compasse one desire loue vertue since attractiue power though worth often made glosse change many place forced take paine find found scarce enough called iust serue turne termed worth worth trauell seeking yet better shadow fault preserue health must continue beauty let world blame iust cause haue grieued enough men euerlastingly curse themselues one kind giue occasion sorrow deseruing woman yet well may care recouer something touched time see repentance may pity bee wise respect stead louing worthy else deserues one teares false let goe reioyce see imperfection tyed yet bee sure mistake vnmeritingly condemne falshood laid charge clearenes make blame worthy aduise selfe would aduised extremity say dearest cosin would say though knew mine owne brother caused mischiefe brother said pamphilia faulty might yet challenge care testimonie loue ought sister rather hide couer imperfection would said vrania suffer perceiue extreamely pardon said accuse farre heart blame causelesly doe therefore conclude briefly word onely friend dearest cosin world hath helpe left mee obseruation blemish excelling vertues sweet vrania said hath loue done make thus bitter happily enioy desire ambitious thing within authority hee brings wish end yet reuile despise plaid hurt cloyes
