said sorry excellet counsell bestowed one little deseruing able right following able doe answere must make wholy past mistaking wound giuen mee deepely vnkindnes martyr mee forsaken doe lament true loyall forlorne heart within bewailes misfortune vndergoes displaced loued breast cheri ht flattered returne miserable prison body nothing dispaire thus see truth truth shall haue end miserable dayes conclusion leaue false would shew loue sake mine owne loued therefore loued hee leaues doe deere cousen loued himselfe would haue loued hee loued mee loue though dispise true loue contrary reioyce misse ill might trusting true amisse bond blessing beene cu se fayling hapned pamphilia must new composition let thought fall constant breast sanctuary zealous affection well hath loue instructed neuer leaue master precept still maintaine vertuous constancy ti pittie said vrania euer fruitlesse thing constancy taught vertue since vertues sake loue hauing true possession soule vnderstand vertue hath limit hold vertue thus vice breake broken breach free leaue choose againe staidnes may found besides ti dangerous thing hold opinion time proue flat heresie rise deere cousine receiue yet giue comfort king queene afflicted excessiuely sorrow dissemble may see discourse know roote distemper yet satisfaction giue mind secret knowledge speake selfe serue yet euer accuse blame vnworthy inconstancy fulfill desire obay counsell asmuch rise answered pamphilia content parent please else little ioy pleasure take world haue must permit complaine vnto selfe neuer trouble eares mine owne soule sorrowes otherwise deale vnkindly mine owne heart come abroad doe said vrania hinder seeke alter griefe moderated iudgment expressing sorrowing matchles goodnes noble disposition thus diuine vrania againe excellent wit conquer hauing brought perissus desolate sad life fortunate pamphilia let court bee happy seeing though sadnes yet ioy hart emperour prage l onius desired leaue returne corinth thence carry beautyfull beloued veralinda father doubting gaine consent hopedfor marriage bring bake morea marriage might make vp one blessed number request granted tooke leaue desiring trauell alone trusting doe something sit birth bloud make meeting welcome friend parted hee desired onely one squire attending hee passd rest germany without aduenture part wrapt ioy content aduenture durst appeare feare beating bulgaria one sufficient answer rest quiet passage riding great forrest many day met man creature heard wild beast roare make hideous noyses squire passd thinking loue auoid danger place suddenly surprised fierce inhabitant thus trauelled gentlewoman came riding fast towards countenance shewed distresse apparell good comely face sad perplexed hewing frightfulnesse perfectly shee one might say truely disturbd exact dissembler came nere leonius cast eye vpon cryd shee courtesie lodging equall beauty knight hee hearing faire gentlewoman said hee reason haue giuen doubt desire serue answer outward person truely sir said shee owne misfortune make doubt hath beene hitherunto neuer could iustly say liued forlorne happinesse make suspitious misery ala said bee made faire fall foule mischance said shee afflicted liuing let see although assist shall heare story may mooue may blessd first beseech tell mee name calld said hee leonius sonne king naples brother said hope famous emperour yes indeed said happines haue honour happy said haue little share thinkes content haue mine eye blessd sight brother want hart tongue sufficient set praise hauing created already full blessing enioy fortune sir said shee father many child number merchauts haue among ware good bad mixed mother disposition many seuerall heires foure wiues mother last selfe one brother line comfort haue youth bredd together increased affection loue betweene v loued two elder scorning v young yeares want discretion fit accompany halfe bloud halfe affection shewed towards v know truth sure feele hurt want last father died leauing v eldest sonne vsed v well kindly hee died soone leauing second succeed estate goodnesse hee vnkind curst affable louing kept v ti true staruing plenty wee scanted meanes content frowardnes ill nature aboundance brother marry wed ill humour richer ill nature like sacke woole stuffed wickednes third second brother liued whose ill outsprung though plant elder hee went far hee left ill vnpractised much venturd attempt staine chastity shame indeede made hate vncurable like fire hapned oyle pitch rosin flax cumbustable matter together quenched nothing till ruine shewes tryumph wrong heald nothing deadliest reueng able obtaine selfe forced demand helpe acquaint deere brother withall twise met feild brought home hurt alike like resembling death none knowing quarrell selfe beene assured none like could haue grieued perceiuing thus end would iniury alone selues trauelled place castle far hence desertnes place furnished wild beast making abandoned loue pleasure suffered quiet heere whether loue themselues hate v hoping heare daily ruine contrary wish haue continued heere three yeares vnhurt yet vnharmd haue beene cause hurt many braue gentleman like selfe haue honourd truth aduenturing cheering yet haue perished brother infinite strong lucky aduentures confesse hath much perplexed haue almost resolued neuer entreat fauour rather dye reuenge worthles creature yet sir braue stocke brother happy king may thinkes hope yet bound besides hope owne person may giue vrge least luckles procure least harme sir pitty good expected f fall hand wherfore sooner willingly cousent remaine thus wronged dishonord ouerthrowne se ke ayded harme leonius cunningly finely insinuated intreating denying told pleased put confidence would lay life feete feete iustice seemed much respect would encounter brother right honour touched humbly thanked led towards castle standing middest wood receiued much respect lord brother said castle went gate shut againe mote castle bridg drawne vp leonius liked extreamely well yet telling twas safety passd satisfied answere lord al respect kindnes friend part acted welcomd supper delicate fine fare set truth affection exact counterfetting could better acted sad leonius whether foretelling danger hideous noyses roaring beast made melancholly passion minde voyces eares hearer supper walked vp downe seeming iust picture braue brother seldome noble retired spirit selfe demanded chamber carried lord lady found braue roome furnished stuffe plate fit prince lodging weary willing see time might againe blessed veralindas sight went bed folding armes wishing mistrisse instead imagined selfe betweene sighed turned vaine hope put himselfe within clothes couer folly impossible wish euer long rested cald little much many men came first carrying candle rest banket hee sat vp bed admiring maner lady came drank willing merry said reioyce fallen hand making signe eies fixt besides little heauy quickly discernd treason otherwise cord throwne ouer armes made prisoner vilanous treason cryd destable cause meaning indeed falne treachery falshood faire counterfetter foulest fal e laughed see tide told neuer saw chaines better become knight armes especially ought sit best emperours brother next himselfe wished place though condition free said tormented inwardly much noble spirit could careful desirous free could catch opportunity careles desird rise go heedles watch repented rising found chaines loose slipt getting sword lay euer drawne busines made among many hurt kild lady kickt ouer al contempt told would die like prince hating abominable trechery scorning falshood plot seruants ran lord let know accident know bee done hee gowne shirt vnder sword hand following seruants came chamber let master haue place enter indeede daring venture againe roome went finding leonius vpon one men best loued ready strike head hold hand said braue prince end quarrell meriting blow said equally merit punishment disloialty indeed greatest therfore vnfit ill ill beeing punishworthy still holding sword ouer man may said lord satisfie giue liberty said leonius although due brought hither serue faithlesse sister bee poore aske yet must make choice content let v two shirt fight liberty imprisonment ouercome remaine willingly gaine vanquish let haue liberty depart condition saue life creature content said lord threw gowne nay stay said fauourd man safty shal proue harme giues life call sonne seruants coniure performe condition well liked performed leonius castle lord ight daintily valiantly neuer combat skinnes sheilds noble breast steele sufficient strong worth yet noblest must ouercome leonius hauing kild lord hauing himselfe receiued wound none dangerous stood still looking young lord teares remedilesse wound vnkindnesse brings loue grieuous cruelty vngratitude brings forth vsuall among v faire season sommer came one day roome remained woare colour procured sake hating leaue neuer weare looked doth axe whose head taken heart smarted shee perplexed yet durst find falt sadly told seene weare colour many yeares quoth little great request said time said doth loue feared tell doubted well nourish graze prosper inrich oft told haue bin estate haue happy like best rich yeere haue despaird like dearth haue flowed swom pleasure dried sorrow despaire haue bin nothing poore sad thing say force deare remembrance harmes helpe shall waste enough doe tooke selfe paraleld fortune woe auaild shee cryd grieued remedilesly think said leonius rather willingly set forth sorrowes owne strangen sse worthines truth make speake much mine shadowes though true substance misery perfect like perfectest louer say said neuer yet saw storme stirre thought though shipwrackt scorne wind blew change change gliding neare much lesse stay paine sir lady beloued sought gentlewoman attending hath full rule mee shee faire delicate knew shee might bee ought bee beloued looked like princesse secure estate heart shee smiled mee subiect tooke kindlie wrapped selfe willingly snare came hope imboldned craued fauor told marchandise bee gaind way loue free freely giuen quaked instant like child rod tooke courage againe persued yet preuailed affection placed gentleman steward house fine man one meriteth title delicate apparell courtly discourse young man passionate shew curious behauiour like courtier preuailed perfume ascended aboue desearts neatnes beyond estate fairenes exceeded merit enuy fortune hate thing misfortune haue reason hee enioyed much marriage would though euer lost gaind sight deerer million inioyings kingdomes offerd must still want rich prize man earth calld away heauen fit doth inioy place hell tormenting furyes lying still shees dead deere loue perfect beauty ending fauour said leonius lesse lament losse since others shee beene mine owne part others treasure mee griefe see selfe loueth coueteth possest possession would much afflict second losse would neuer trouble assuredly sir said louer one faint one affecter gaine loue losse trouble selfe louer loue owne end denyed loue remoues place profession trade faile one country transport transplant loue haue punnished former fault offence pamphilia arcadia went seeke friend companion calld sorrowes passd along pleasant plaines remembring seen flourishing time fortune richer blessing plenty fuller happines sweetnes ioyfull hopefull delightfull greene playnes cryd shee doth constancy protect gard delicasie doe misery change wither deere arcadia loue yet constancy suit pitty pine vertue euer see decaying waile lasse heere haue breathd blessing among must reueale loss yet continue shall thinke misfortune reserued mee best fittest deserue mischeife yet deere loue thee still though faine would blame iustly thy vnkindnes loue forbids must truth sake loue suffer without condemning cruell yet may call thee thou hast cause blame mee thine owne soule tels thee speake truth mend kindly violence end groue arriued sitting downe hard first met siluiana said liued poore true forsaken louer come finde conclude dayes behoulding place thought perfectly setting selues eye streme made glasse many sorrowfull sigh deepe groanes vttered sonnet losse molester last patient satisfied thy curst selfe moue thy mournefull force thus oft periurd loue wast life liues mischeifes fee behould true misery w find wit hath faind fully proue heauenlike blessing changd throwne aboue dispaire whose worst ill doe see happy beene knowne great losse ing deposd feeles torment thronelikewant lost vp must looke late owne lucifer downe cast losse doth grieue paradice ioy gone doe liue yes doe liue cryd end mourne lament ane state pitty want since musing place whence claymed due would could accuse thee yet loue would rather blame selfe thee deere must doe merrit small could aske reward still iust purely loue thee werr thou vnstaind thine owne worth sake soule doth wish thee though thou cruell still despaire outweighs thought make dryer losse blast doe tree though kill alarina stroue comfort assuring could haue cause sorrow lament hope colour yet said haue passd sad misaduentures arriud happy lamentation dayes thus passed till iourney calld thence taking leaue alarina queene went towards shipping next port soone arriud pamphilia ooner newes arriuall spread people part came see ioy presence hand daughter calling lord round hee deliuered glad newes withall emperours desire concludiug consent gained therefore demanded allowance marriage consented ratified full ioy contentment ioynd hand assembly contracting promising himselfe accompany back morea married amphilanthus intreated honour great king princess robe state soone brought veralinda appeard like venus apple two goddess triumph presently made proclaimd heire apparant crowne thus leonius veralinda made happy earth required braue fleete ship straight prepared voyage feast continuing till time kingdome ioy like summer flourishing brauely among amphilanthus hauing bin long enough germany lawful occasion offerd return morea established ollorandus made deputy princesse gouerne absence hee promised bee short aud returne speedy way tooke purpose dalmatia see king lady offerd wife many aduentures arriued hee entertaind like himselfe expression enough rarest entertainment dauncing among lady one appearing much excelling deserud admiration beauty quality king prince beheld one fauourable opinion amphilanthus enquire bestowd marriage informd daughter master horse married great man wedded affection young nobleman court also brother likd loued shee vsd indifferently could two yeares tell whether loued elder doubted younger feard brother affraid offend remaind vnsatisfied till last whether boldnes truer cleerer affection grew elder hauing beene beloued likewise louing one another though desiring lady couetous humour enioying worthy loue found himselfe shee affected embraced liberally declared selfe happy younger first doubting could formerly since saw hee feard might better auoid fur er danger choosing leauing couple contented themselues though discontented many others mistris grew spitefull wife froward suspitious husband iealous troublesome yet meanes make loue better loues pleasing like stoln fruit alwayes sweetest estate question may asked secret knowne may easily answerd vniustly said surely came happy louer fulnesse ioy content could neere miserablenesse keepe treasure hid kimselfe thus doe many time discoueries come emperour commended especially lady whose part apt take newes brought dettareus kisse hand see fellowhermite parselius two good companion one missd dolorindus gone antissia againe beene long one day royall assembly hall ready see dauncing came graue old man good fashion birth proued beard hayre white face something sorrow age wrincled resembling faire tree frost kneeled vnto king beseeching iustice hee promised bound oath vrgd vnto gentleman rising sir said hee hath done iniury man seeke reuenge dettareus know forget wrong although particularly name louing take vp ash dead staine long quiet graue guilt infamy onely touch thus farre remember breach hospitality noblest band friendship trust call reuenge must bee satisfied king calld dettareus forth couered shamefull sorrow appeard like sonne robd father greatest treasure holding eye ground iustly condemnd king sorry see deiected word ingaged wherefore hee demanded wo ld answer replied life sufficient satisfie foule fault confessed himselfe guilty yet answer none businesse since wrongd dead dead indeed cryed content yet saw honour dye otherwise dettareus man iniurd kild imagind recouered againe skilfull chirurgions blowes one cannot bee cured balme heart bloud mine therefore desire presence braue prince none haue noblier end fight mee honour mee death assure shal welcome ouerthrow neither young vndertake rash businesse age hath made v perfect free old death claime suddaine yeeldings let life strength wee haue bee spent royall company let iustice last haue sway dettareus casting eye vp beholding knew wept yet would deny demanded went forth armd themselues king court greatly pitty especially dettareus appeared already dead eye kild owne foretelling ill instead dancing went list strangest comba fought euer dalmatia seene yet seeme like braue old armes tree whose fruite yet faire good strength maner fight exact perfect young men cause admire learne scorne skill courage dettareus though sight fight continued good space better yet conscience gnawed within made outward power like inward taken poyson shake faint got victory life dettarreus hard much lamented iustice came tell v twas act right made court satisfied yet lament mourne losse emperour prince old friend going body graue much content could accident honour gaind death loued friend returnd liberty court soone apulia whence strayed certaine tidings dettareus liuing discouerd neuer stayed till hee learnd remaind hearing religious life would molest call charity bead sword like liued manner maura mountaine till aduertised people dwelled foote thereof whence hee fetched food going thence daughter taking armes againe againe proue imitator like vse steele followed tract tracing men hare snow till hee found court end iourney related end soone followed hauing got enough thought hauing honour restored satisfaction minde dalmatia amphilanthus friend tooke way towards morea happily arriud found king beautifull court corinth whence tooke iourney mattinea sending pamphilia meete shee humbly excused father rest must beare absence ioy meriana whose heart husband felt comming another onely expresse vrania meere louer philistella selarina musalina lucenia also come inchantment accompany veralinda comming soon musalina lucenia married woman must haue match lawfull vowes vnfortunate match held blessed one must liue amphilanthus thought morea also empire germany court found braue company nothing missing might yeeld nurse content except musalina lady little conuersation sometimes sister much willingly entertained steriamus yet would speake often pamphilia wishing onely spent day sorrow court shee gloried delight sadde thought companion teares groanes liued yet still decaied vnblessed pamphilia haste made marriage performed ioy content trymuphs neuer beene seene morea perselina carrying away honour delicatest sweetest brauest lady time others though excellent aboue relation yet time shee blossome sprung late rare exquisite euer beene queene bulgaria grew little better company workes creature make wildest indure men sight staggs tamed lyon abide handling yet nature remaind honour nothing thing one ought leaue old familiar acquaintance till leaue yet neither worthynesse onely owne neerely toucheth one bone doth marrow lye within assures vertue vsed ciuilly amphilanthus respectiuely prince seruant excceeded rancke dauncing kindly generally friendly come time depart queene naples stayed conducted home sonne first romanian lady lucenia hauing old minde amphilanthus went negropont see antisia steriamus deare vrania went towards albania selarinus beloued philistella epirus antissius selarina constantinople rosindy chastly louing truely beloued meriaua perselina macedon parselius dalinea new kingdome achaia leandrus death father losse ended day falne philarchos orilena mytelin perissus limena stayd queene naples entrety till shee went coutrey polarchos made chamberlaine house emperour aud attended king bulgaria great queene also tooke bulgaria rest euery one occasion calld morea remaind bare like roome great feast guest gone looking vnfurnished braue rich furniture gone thus poore morea queenes naples cicely kept alwaies together neuer failed walking sweet wood inriched pamphilia loue passed time together telling story themselues others mixed many time pretty fine fiction excellently witty queene naples rare poetry limena loued though none writing number selfe one day would needes haue perissus forrest hunt manner charriot sometimes crossing met deere dayes sport happened lighted groue place pamphilia first found siluiana place inuited stay stay procured dainty imagination delicate expression made gaue birth verse framed incomparable queene lady time nightingale sweetly singing vpon grounded subiect might senselesse bee felt paine pleasant tree sweet musique thou deare byrd dost make imagine doth woe partake yet contrary doe passion mooue since sweet note thou dost thy sorrowes prooue sigh teares shew grieue best spent worth doe beleeue yet thy sweet pleasure make euer finde happinesse loue blinde thy wrong sweetnesse attire throwes downe hope make woe aspire besides thaduantage thou hast got thy griefe thou vtterst mine vtter yet thus last may agree one moure still thou gone perissus protested neuer heard like saying right knew well would vnwilling lose due vnto selfe gaue swearing neuer heard thing finelier worded wittilier written sudden limena would onely desire haue shee yeelded thing lord iudgement vp downe walked groue delightfull gaue content sort louers going along spring found many knot name ingrauen vpon tree vnderstood perfectly decipherd found name fained knew perissus remembred one cipher yet pamphilias hee would knowe passd saw handsome well cloathed woman neither walking running staying made motion imployd vanity shee one cryed another chafed smild scratchd head stampd raild loue blind foolish thing said thou euer hated abandoned haue better deserud thee thus handled must miserable testimony thy cruelty merited thy best fauours hate thee froward childe neuer leaue reuiling thee till thou doest requite mee neuer shame light thee thy baby gouernment haue beene quiet patient thy folly suffered selfe fall vnder thy tyranny serue thy wilfulnesse obey thy vaine employment tollerable fit rewarded peeuish boy either speedily requite pacifie sure set forth thy colour bird beares various seuerall calourd plume thou dost changeablenesse shall neglected set foorth life sir may say bitter world shall see vniust waiward babe admire thou hast face doe withall twas well faignd first thou hadst eye indeed true face thou canst neither see truth seene truly vnworthy creature inuention framd thought lighter thought bubble made breath shell blowne straw fired frowne reuiued smile ruind neglect stately constant building breath destroy looke establish least dislike sacke fury shee would haue persisted troope beene louers wherefore went seemd like moouing stirring waterworke turnd againe shee cryd groand scornfully seemd defie passion faint forged countenance would haue appeared sociable greater diuersity woman disposition richer vanity men selfe good woman might hope superfluous vanity sexe beene collected setled vncertainty queene naples intreated perissus speake answred iust like demeanour last queenes drew neerer demanding question answerd thus said shee gentlewoman though vngently vsed loue name worthy knowledge estate ouerthrowne mifortune friend named vnfit consanguinate miserie indeed wretched forlorne soule onely shaddow kind men contemne owne sake necescities sometimes respect haue time beene among highest ranke meanest requitall else thus suffered castdownewretch worthy life presence let reason petition departure shall noble granting happy permitted owne course limena well liked odd manner would licence freed desired heare said shee haue beene afflicted neuer felt felicitie discoursing woe besides see apt discouer passion place well v euer sensible passion lookd vpon noise betweene sighing long breathing scorning directly sigh answered shee haue shee sought said queene desire know losse despiser aud yet dislike said loued ascent scarce sencible ranne behind garden orchard wall sweete brooke side whereof fine enamiled meadowes lay shewing finesse eye place selarina tooke delight heere walked withdrawne little brooke plaine little hill tree grace selfe withall helpe others scorching heate voice place inuited whither arriued found two men shepheards weed countenance spake borne estate yet complexion shewed beene curious preserue selues sun followed fortune choyce men ought doe profession take young might bee said want taken life ripnes yeares tooke away suspition towards forty iudgment content selues discontent one might see brought together queene first saw seeing soone parted one flying company remayning yeeld account going selarina drew neere shepheard low reuerence welcomed demanded many thing gaue true witty satisfaction last desired know cause shepheards shunning hee answered like discerned company vrged vnto violent melancholly would permit time recreation himselfe came neere asked reason replyed secret friend therefore besought pardon mine owne said happy hauing royall eares giue hearing story still vrged much forced obay madame said since maiestie haue must yeeld one princesse hauing power search subiects heart man companion selfe sonns two best men island called sirelius selfe procatus bred together schoole first went court lord grandfather liued good reputation hee meri ing men good oppinions owne noblenes excellent part selfe thinke sake respected expecting something fried much worthines last fell loue young lady daughter father mother great marryage likely true rich sought loue answerable affection young hauing yeares parent loath heare husband yet last desert store friend brought marriage honour giuen father requitall consent lady grew time marryage came solemnized king command court great tryumphs masque banquet court delight neuer man greater ioy receiued wife woman expressed comfort match violence seldome loue lasting within lesse two yeares marryage whether fondnes ran icalousy youth loue change gaue occasion dare iudge discotents grew disliks side spread selues father tooke part son law mother daughter extremity lew fire flamed sparkled higher men eye vpon see whither would come storme raised discouerd stir young lord deserud ala least suspition goodnes himselfe could inuite loue aboue common creature one might purchase shee hee lord take vpon trust find promised pride would loose rather beg ignorance none vnderstanding worth would could accept vncertainty alwaies making loue fortune still refused insolency requited scorne yet fine gentleman noble friend mistrustfull wife must confesse carrying little much respect yet conscience spirit disdaind curbd extraordinary liking often seene proues way make truth mistrust forbad house company refused obay chance shee might meete cabinet hee broke open threatned seruants make confesse letter found friend might passe complement yet appeared iealousie amorous distemperd vsed ill father phantastical thing vaine courtier rash madman ignorant woman would need folly ill nature way wardnesse hee cald care honour friend quiet kill daughter cut blame spot offence might lay vpon noble bloud termed men must much curiositie haue sought rarely found pearles ordinary oyster time chose execute fury husband whose loue though crackt quite broken much crusht hee held hand dagger giuing cruel vntimely end yet little scratch gaue iust hart otherwise laine ope disgrace vnmerciful vnworthy father cryd husband held wife poore lady ready fall vnder weight vnkindnes danger strange dropsie blader blowne wind quarrel taken vp easily might friend could meanes prouoke fight chosing rather giue satisfaction oath promise neuer seeing tide condition drawing sword matter thus pacified god blessed son daughter died leauing witness loue speake remembrance death widdower continued long child bred much care affection grandfather trauel loue imployment state could roote aptnesse disposition loue hee fell enamoured beautifull young lady daughter great duke romania whose perfection yeares called eye admire vassels much sute meanes courted employing friend assistance gayning shee allowed greatest liberty affected much shee saw braue former wife liued liberall fashion might also continue sweete motiues great minde low estate meanes honour calld plenty supply indued father vehemently shut vp course preuaile louer increase loues force fetter creature keeping close growes furious libertie come loue grow heate wheras mild perswasions might first haue beene acceptable nothing marryage content much gayned friend breast vowed haue fortune would allow himselfe loyall affectionate seruant husband agreed marryed ioy none expresse louers meete equall affection liued sometime three yeares passd heate resonably cooled passion haue crept like mothes good stuffe discontent haue risen hath left attended like selfe meanes height estate thing according owne mind himselfe retyring lament misfortune liuing liue loue feares although confident contrary tooke life likewise diuert could course trust shall doe haue preuailed thus far hath promised weare summer sorrowes returne company yet admit feare come abroad againe hee absolute fine courtier new learner art let come forth wood plaines put court apparrell instead sheephards coate scarfe scrip sword hooke trust shall gallant part tired rurall mirth passionate ditty rather heare horse neigh sheephardesses island sing quarr lls haue also risen absence heare breed ill blood wee stay wherfore pray returne queene smiled story thinking fit compared graue suter left widdowes house likely conclusion happen sayes afterwards fall great discontent againe concluded loue loue euer beene least outward shew storyes may bee called one selerina left sheephard intreating vse best meanes comfort friend carry backe wife de ired woman hee premised performe court shee returned meeting king hee came hunting whome related discourse antissius knew resolued cal court soone returnd euer loud employment progresse ended returnd againe first welcome find amorous seruant fortunate man wanting nothing maiesties presence whole consummation blessing concluded marryage king going thence assisting wedding thus happy hauing coueted constantinople king queene soone went selarina ioy ceremony deerest louing first inioyed parselius grew louer shee passionate receiuer affection called minde many passage sadnes parting yet neither stucke long vpon cause one desiring remembrance since occasion feare offending let passe nothing appeered content striuing nothing please ambitious thing affection thus equally bent loue satisfaction happines must need end mind goe abroad could neuer know cause stay accompaning hee liked sport pleasure abroad chose please selfe withall desire desire serue thus loue obserued serued one day going greate desart manner country take delight carrying tent place faigned made fairy company daunce leaped behinde guide comming queene besought doe likewise obeyed led fortune alone saue old woman went thicke thence another little round midst wherof stone white hee came neere enough behold neere owne happines hinder make delayes delicate worke shee knotted tyed vp heart many bond finger made plat wound last round crowne victory bondage shee done hee went marriage passing betweene continued till prince hauing prouided fit marriage came propounded vnto little imagining passd betweene child glad hee see loues nature told necessary alasse least misdoubting mischiefe committed til seemd nice vnwilling bee perswaded hee grew offended yet feared misaduenture hee set mistris husband youth sonne worke promised helpes except young man modestly perplexed able finde way maze trouble end winde skeine vpon bottome destruction ruine shee could finde friend trust reueale suspition beloued sure ill shee thought fit since iust taxe might bee laid vpon iudgement vncurable wound giuen thinke offence deepe though deserued punishment whose sinnes bred flower poyson themselues brought forth ioyes ouerthrowes perplexity shee remaind till night two prince come againe euening rather late might e called night shee went garden breath complaint sweet silent ayre hower late early profitable louers finde conuenient shee walkd done alley close delicate couerd walke heard whispring made stand still vnmannerly onely knowledge sake listen often happens shee heard word deare said one strange mistrust lately fallen mother breast make curiously watch striue depriue v loued meeting shee bee vnkinde owne sonne thinkes shee worthy thee shee cherished mee hearty loue enny seeke vndeseruedly barre chiefest blessing earth hold treasure prize like thee heauens themselues giue mee content thy presence fill withall ioy thy sight ought thee barre mee thy conuersation imprison mee let mee bee banished thee murther mee let mee inioy thee let mee perish perpetuall accursednesse shall say cannot say worthy thee flatter selfe wrong thee cannot thinke merit speech mee yet since thou gracest mee el enuy grudge fortune thou art matchlesse thy fauours blessed inriched enobled purblind chance fond policie hinder trick state trick bee condemnd true thou excellent loyall thou affectionate crocodile treason howle bewray destroy content weepe deare eye hee kissd teares like nectar dranke corsiues see shed cordial shed hee permitted take deare life cryed hee teare soule thy sorrow let mee see thee mourne vnlesse may dye hee still kissd know whether molested paine ioyed liberty kissing shee last kissing eye likewise accompanied showres ioy said shee make question may accident hinder loues will desire ti true may confident absenting gaine neuer shall bee heart soule least thing belongs deare infinitely deare selfe mine eye deare heart well beloud cherish sight dearest selfe thinke fortune dreame ioy ought el selfe metamorphosed wholly loue sate downe delicate fountaine side walke wailed againe testified woe sighes teares last cryed shee father take mee hence forget mee shall absence worke yes said hee admiration thee think chast excellent thou art happy thy loued sight see cause alwaies lament effect absence brings let ruine follow come ioyntly roome found foule forgetfulnesse let mee heauen bee vuremembred thy beauty printed shee wrung hand cryed shee embraced mother came vnto seemd like great showre haruest grieuous couetous desire themselues moone shind thing appeard cleare day innocence ashamd bee heard found alone yet loue made onely desire affection mother made teares fall feare loue respect vnto childe loued made weepe also brought passion shee sufferd shee could speake breath stopped shee choaked kindnesse shee dumbe gaind little thus remaine till hee spake madam said hee bringer forth kinde nourisher youth till time vndoe first worke make mee wish neuer beene borne must doe bee hindred inioying sweet lady freely serud one would dreame ancient change one might think instantly ready transformd fountaine silence gaue young lady opportunity thus discoursed passion mother said perfecter selfe disdaine show ure allow imploy profit seeing thus two purest louers power euer touchd brought vnder obedience behold pain since ioyntly pitty mine bred hand like lambe till seazed wolfe loue though fierce yet kind sweet clawes hold fast hath told power beseech fauour beg loue loues sake thinke miserable death louers vnfortunate caused mother friend loue friend loue cryd old woman mother ti true baue brought miserie child miserable might guiltines condemne think selfe call selfe mother shame make sorrow losse must proceed infamy grieud soule tell truth must cannot choose hate shall say yet heart farre short spirit shee suffered descend wish increase sufficiency estate though shee bought marriage grow subiect hnsband though loath shee doe yet rather want meanes shee would venture limit absolute freedome yet conceit owne iudgement shee erred much shee thought shee doe well enough husband would choose free liuing many beene named one onely shee liked one barre hinder desire hee countenance said shee noble traine halfe dozen seruants kindes two gentlewoman foure men foote staues hand bare footed carrying owne prouision baggs back onely carryed saw princesse apparell greene among bush appeard like diana greatest perfection stayd modest salutation according estate answered honour shee receiued saluting princesse desired rest selfe madam said shee hope yet haue beene denied rest neuer knew one stop crossing would said haue stand vpon word agree desire meaning stay little desist trauell humbly gaue thankes said habit admitted iourneys eate drinke said must let haue time lawfully may demand since song tell mee pilgrimage finished madam said kind indeede perfectly till finde selfe mine home shall think done far indeede answered stranger within league ground perselina againe vrged ciuillity made consent thus proceeded madam said whose command bee refusall say haue seruant selfe performe satisfaction must obserue come said shee thicke let v conferre obeyd willed seruants attend place shee attending perselina thickest part close suffering themselues sate downe princesse desiring know cause trauell much desire keeping ret must bee knowne answered thus afflict otherwise lay waighty crosse vpon bring faire pilgrime said princesse know exactly already mistrust led exellent speech manner said like woman pleased commendation fond follow request yet viper owne kinde doth loue imitate ill new come hunting castle farre hence first saw first last loue tall slender curiously shapd extreame louely amiable haire browne wore good length apparell hansome curious neate discouerd hee rather affected ease fond courtly vanity hee neither forward discourse sparing hee acquainted honour company hee wit incomparable pleasing way hee conuersation made heart eares owne perfection sexe hee vnited yet excellency necessary make perfect man hee vsuall humous change falsehood woe must say truth neither blush looke pale came thither lady hee seemd much respect away time till night calld v rest little rest tooke chamber neere sate discoursed night little gallery betweene lodging morning comming parted like first part dewye teares though houres thought yet hurt hard kindest holding blessed haplesse hunt together hawke pleasure drew enuy v oth except owne contentment value delighted company would haue dyed hee haue nothing thought please study onely bent way tooke hee liking thing delight mee thus agreede happinesse wee liue fauourites prince eye great happy continued ala vse word continue hauing experience contrary blessing foure yeares space know deuill great one himselfe change put spell wicked power mee bringing beauty youth excellency eye make mee excellingly vnfortunate hee caught faire allurement tyed mischiefe taking woe mee lost comfort ioy last greater ill tooke mee another got v long sought held fast could gaine beauty vntying blisse wit losse yet fairer share loosing faire creature vndoer like fortune paris terrible harme haue ioy hope bereft witt gaining discouerd want pittied though shee robbed mee haue compassion thiefe another causeth executed hee stolne forgiuen forgaue sorry long outliued losse shee marryed woman said perselina shee dyed shee answered pelarina shee much loue said beautifull princesse like woman loue ordinary way loue said whose affection greatnesse gift end entice vertue loue selfe death hee vsed mee little better againe casting eye loue vse said perselina could haue patience endure hee vsed vildly change patience madam said yes greater wonder affection continued strong towards doth though mistresse calld dulnesse told good nature would haue giuen title patience excusd witnesse patience haue company abroad nay owne house seene enioyed giuen eye looked bleard hand vntouched poysonous kist baby lookd eye smile flowing frownes plentifully shewing themselues haue hunted haue gone one day must need remember aboue rest fouling much fauour receiued mine little parted v shoote fowle went fast mee hee could without running scorne rann gentleman none el family kindred true louer cousens much shunnd rather goe softly went apace flyer way necessity leading follow disdainer met loue take hand kisse following vnmarkt weary dabled like hunted hare winter tyred disgrace weary wrong sweeting passionate paine durted despaire yet loued still bracelet wore haire braided tyed left arme peice one day hung saw griefe yet little ioy tooke discernd knew seene much shame pitty hee turnd blushd put vp sight would faine haue said newe fauours much discouer themselues feard rather loth displease first little much strange grew sociable continued humble finding fault nothing embracing small curtesies lookes like welcome vsed yet much marked discernd losse publikely noted grew sensible small deale wiser needes would free tried meanes possible force peruaile impregnable strength steely heart faith loue yet vsed instrumentall meanes could thought lookd oft heart could let lookd could choose resolution dislike saying selfe haue suffered scorne mee would faine haue found fault shape fashion thing blaming selfe doting snch one would serue looked saw cause loue gazing though death willingly absented selfe absence got much heart warranted see againe haue desire carelessenesse ventured assured thought couzened meerely though came like giant swolne pride owne power assurance conquest true knight loue came armed mee armes fire truth yeelded could like poore miserable poet confesse selfe rime thus finding error blisse confesse seeing found could loue resolution di boast liberty twas insolency vaine doe onely looke thee captiue againe indeed neuer knew loue stronger necessity ought bee contending iudgement multitude could reherse fauours disgrace mee mistress feares smile ende shew blessed vnfortunate face life say mee onely appertaines story last againe made beleeue loued euer wauering religious glad proud ioyed vtterly ruind shew wont saw gladed heart others told like birde nice blusht yet receiud willingly ad cause finding neglect againe grow shame teares repent credulity manifest true penitence therefore tooke pilgrimage vpon mee haue kind ended haue seene hiersalem confest sinnes asked forgiuenesse remission hope desire pardon though merit hath purchased mee thus returnd free loue said perselina troth madam said loue stil hope charitably yet afraid try selfe left finde spirit like selfe fraile princesse smiled pretty innocent confession thinking shee learned truly consesse shee could doe yet shee deceiud vnlesse shee would shee could bee silent iourney vow wholly made vpon wherin faulty vertue beliefe mixd madam said shee professe mixture made farre beleeue granted may lawfully repent necessarily also loue ruler commanded obeyed could selfe say yeeld must deny saw soule flew asked yeelded yet repent vanity mee liked admired sexe th durst make folly seene vnto fond humour writing set downe thing idle booke written hee saw hee thought touched came neere imagine place turnd downe leaues onely might hee would dislike thought hee would take notice yet neither word writing honouring much slaue finde fault seeme pleasd thought left coniecture went coniecture runne feare sorrow offended yet cleare selfe might come answere cannot could finding selfe thus miserable tooke pilgrymage willingly could say offend troth madam said shee discouerd neere bee ordinary louer losse grow neighbour inhabiter hate two poeticall neate expression made yet came though hurt seemes action let make case owne doubt hee rather cut cord vntye knot haue done forgiue wish hee also doe mee pray truely without faigning loue firmely shall doe let vse worst scorne hath prettily practisd thinke hee neither shew assure selfe study cruelty make hate nay earnest leaue louing though may bee haue errd saying boasting rather hauing strength great loue dearest beloued pardon mee aske repentant clensed heart please remember cause gaue nobly forgiue perselina found selfe neuer come excellency constancy wherfore admired thogh scarce commended richnes plenty fulnesse calld rosindy left constant lady vertuous vowes religious truth liued rest begun dayes feruent zeale affection king queene delicate princesse arriu ng soone macedon ruld power loue loued feare feard could loue enough young princesse soone tooke minde former resolution marrying selfe chosen loue busines could bee effected effect came happily owne resolution conclusion peace nurse loue among philarchos orilena going mytelin met ship riding rather floating vnguided vnruld vnmand tumbling vp downe like boates boyes make paper play withall vpon little brooke onely dogge shew liue creature came hatch walkd much grauity like officer kinde watchfull seruant barkt fawningly sought ayde leaping whining shaking head wagging tayle doglike expression lookd soberly entertainingly like steward stranger prince came laid ship aboord philarchos saw none guardian leapd knight dogge lookd one might say discreetly went guide cabin lady lay ground weeping wringing hand mourning sorrowfull yet illustrious expression mourning could shew mournfull therefore shee habit mournd shee onely lookd vp cast eye downe againe face ground cry ala haue beene miserable enough must assured quiet bee molested haue restfull dying time allowd shall sea castaway barque haue power let mee dye peace yet endure know thou must poore woman dye liue perturbation philarchos went tooke arme gently lifted vp little vsing wordes none purposeth molest wee bee rather seruants disquieters chance came succour resolution please accept sir said noble disposition appeares god hope reward lamentable soule vnable thinke ability though gratefulnesse rule mee onely able pray faile doe sir must leaue mee appointed dye hath power doe onely commanded without leauing assurance necessity saith philarchos obeying though condemnd seemes power ouer gouernes v though soueraiguize ouer subiect v law therefore obey fortune brought fortunately finding shee shall likewise bring life wee saue prey complement let destroy selfe seemes dead condemd may yet lawfully liue v redeeme howsoeuer bee confident wee conduct hence place somewhere shall bee safe certaine ruine ruine mee cryed shee shall bee bard obeying must euer obserue obligation bind said hee soueraignty loue said loyall subiection tyes said philarchos fit bee durable affection indure else bargaine bee made onely one side free hee breakes dye said shee neuer liue disobedient lord prince knew thing loue loyalty beene yet hee willing diuert course running perill therefore hee replyed expression purest zeale loue loue neuer ordained monster destroy hurt change tryall iudicially helpe harme directly pursue shee sighd lamented hee comforted disputed last tooke vp partly partly force ground carried dearest orilena kindly like braue noble lady welcomd dogge would part still attended lying shee sate lay ground feete shee stird hee followed seruantlike motion shee prison haue beene death buriall like one come forth fainting fit shee lookd stard like hauke beene hooded shee come first sight againe decent yet princely salutation shee gaue orilena repayed like much courtesie philarchos commanded put barque two knight brother begged went away vpon aduenture consent sailing towards mytelin gained much sad true lady shee brake silence long deliuer discourse natiue land though vnnaturall cruelty countrey sweet iland nycaria parentage best bloud next chiefe lord child en house though name fell loue young nobleman much esteemed honourd brauery courage spirit island excelling equalling wit comparable nobleman endued vertues learning horsemanship el bee required one whose noble descent answerd demanded excellency hee loued mee like wise passionately fondly last ouerthrow liud father commonly oftentimes went court confesse see ioy presence see vanity yet saw sport court affect necessary folly place masque dauncings actor likwise selfe amongst though neuer affecting content loud saw well pleased many banquet cause met father hee ordinarily come strict friendship betweene neuer hee absent quiet still one seruants wth without perpetually mee thought could let wronging concipt come mee hee mistrusted mee sincere affection haue euer follower mee giue occasion durst else speake none neede bee kept make mee thinke thought neuer strayed staid one minute space father fine pleasant sweet seate countrey ran delicate wanton riuer twining selfe euery dainty meadowes armes deepe fit dianaes nymphes haue vsed imitation selfe sister often went riuer came fauourably grace place close vnder orchard wall backe way wee gardeus wee went bathd selues old gentleman seruant lord watched v neatly carried businesse wee neuer doubted able continue truer himselfe v hee told mee describing truely fashion eight v maner wordes action knew hee spake truth said hee beene one thing could haue wishd master place askd said one v kept smocke would sure haue wishd see knew ment none selfe priuately said heart beleeue wishd beene like chance old man whose thought young toungnimble kinde louing remembrance past lord next comming told hee straight wishd fortune said hee wish told lady hee calld mee said answerd lord nothing replyed hee smild walkd hee came imediatly mee telling mee hee heard vrging mee know thought smild truely confest hee truely louingly tooke louing ioyfull thankfulnesse shining eye twenty passage wee many seuerall lady seuerall complections disposition almost fell loue time hee loued mee thousand curse among long prosperd loue cared none sped mee thought better rather wishing still bee prayed enioyed righter way pretty testimony hee gaue mee must haue beene vnlesse beene vnreasonable forcd bee assurd loue shewing almost contempt others faith imbracd cherishd modest hee besides loud saw greater vertue ordinarily esteemed proofes alone hee neuer vnciuill offer willingly consented vnto yet last father finding easily hee might hauing beene great louer intirely hee coniecturd could deny nothing therefore would rather seeme trust el binde bond serue preuaile true loue one day hee goe iourney leauing farewell daughter said like lord pray bee honest hee blushd coniecture noble lord lady truely heartily ashamd yet soone got courage againe remembred wee guilty word honest made mee thinke contrary thought mooud blood cheekes stird occasion discourse mee feare harme haue preuented thought thought beleeue dangerous matter bee forbidden sweet loue haue heard credibly said know kind exercised wee fulfill desire hee found v hee left v chast affectionately louing forbidding could neuer haue hinderd lessened father himselfe euen enuying v loue though many neuer brought true one lasted long possible man bee iust longer except haue beene yet thinke truely hee slipd sometimes knew cause want mee finde fault fault came side easie take exception would readier answer mee friendes selues yet hee absolutely two yeares giue ouer former fashion though alasse loue dryed like rose mee kept colour sweetnesse remembrance still held witherd themselues bee knowne sight last quarrell hee himselfe euer louing mee hee grew discontented company snapt mee vp aduenturd speake frownd hee caught mine eye withall plotted disgrace carryed himselfe mee brother owne friend said much bore truely left louing grieuing yet last got farre sorrow exprest selfe openly show though neere acquaintance houshold guest mee happened last lady hee taken cast mee loued another discouerd hee liked yet made show hee said euer hee mistrusted loue hee hate might hee heere hee assurd might bee reason held together yet gaue leaue look little lookes like sweet euenings wherein larke delight selfe much shee flyes neuer satisfied delicacie till height shee forced retire bidding farewell forced part againe halfe day blisse hee tooke occasion speake old matter willing hee wee discoursed temperately end hee said cause said hee speaking friuolous vnwaighty businesse god knowes lost left v said time hee sate little neerer mee seemd would haue proceeded wishd made question satisfying euer wee came speake one wicked minister ouerthrow destind spoyle mee spell absence shee spirit able ruine mee sent hee went promised come againe attended resolud neuer giue cause dislike hee stayed mighty fret returnd lodging another time tooke occasion inuited must haue beene desird father ordinary table dinner father made many friend hee esteemd hee solemnly inuited came dinner sitting fell discourse loue woman inconstancie beene guilty knowing innocencie spake like vnderstood shew hee fell kindes yet theame last hee came say poore paris vsd choosing well said iuno queen wonld beloud pallas boystrous woman would fight chosen poore venus onely loued louessake wan aple thus punished loue thinke much replyed lordship fauour distresse false enona said saw vnderstood yet againe another ierke another sort speaking loue returning former loues may hope said introth little said euer shall come tatterd torne worth looking yet said come welcome cloath looked pleased yet opportunitie gained lost mee held shipps tossing hauen windebound well grew desperate indeed heeded nothing befell conclusion spake something something said brought vnder compasse law farre life came condemned though officer sat iudgement thought pitie yet tooke presence cause wherin protest altogether wrongd might haue ayded least sight would haue comforted condemnation much loued absent misfortune present adiudged death yet prince nicaria mercifull would take life according countrie law another fashion would haue hee meant hee censured whence haue relieued put tombe meant chiefe lord officer came see according prince order committed sea ship put meate three dayes man creature dog would forsake allowed loue hope harme victual imagined would haue share last deuoure mee one fiercest country deceiued themselues since wee came aboard eight dayes hath satisfied himselfe little neuer troubled fisherman came would haue dog entised faith euer found man distressed mistris held hee threw large piece meate though stale good enough dog tooke fed little weighing estate left part time man also gaue mee something pittying case daring helpe mee left among officer came liuing execution lord one though stayed see performed came among v hastily stept whispered bad farewell like selfe said hee resolute die confidently cherfully comfort honour end heard could answere onely looked vpon teares told censure harder prince obay command would doe refused yet neare came fulfilling left rock little iland old religious father shee remained spent rest dayes prayer dog still garding death brought outliued old man haue subiects molester ouerruled miserable lady polarchos curstnes gone tooke way also whither shee much cared lookd company attend came dispearsed one way another leauing fortune done dispaires euer alone indures one mischeife tooke pitty although way contrary almost home yet rather distressed kind want offered selfe though willing company accepted seruice thinke would haue body discourse withall well happened mee shee could say nothing men much speake woman could say polarchos beene curst vnkind cold haue said mistris beene false cruell polarchos left vpon cause mine forsooke causlesly could complaine neere rayling wrangling dislike sex traueld yet better euer though losse shee forced confesse fault often done penitently last agreed mee man constanter two vncertainties wee pas gulfe lepanto necke land betweene morea achaia got againe sea archepelago one little island forced stay grew weake trauell want food would take sustenance perpetuall sorrow wrought incessantly could longer without rest sustaine eternall rest shee dyed desiring mee bury let polarchos know end vnkindnes gaue country due said beseeching accept gift repentant loue making louing end cupid surely forced vpon pardon thing past place one highest ranckes court iust dyed came thither lady discontented likewise maruelous strange sort eares open complaint complayners wherefore gaue hearing discoursed manner borne said pantaleria bred seruice vrania queene albania excellent famous woman enchanted ciprus seruice daughter supposed father fell loue one allimarlus romania man fit greater woman loue fortune winne surely flatter selfe grosly deserued indeed commit fault loue feare losse whence proceeded error rather commended condemned loue failes little matter made great nothing pleaseth distast taken cannot truely taxe much inconstancy yet far faulty know lady chase whether loue gratefulnes beene cause cannot guesse tormented soule withall cryd mildly coldly enough told suspitions made disquiet bad satisfied loud still thus could gaine durst vrge intruth besides loue awe fearing frowne though others louer euer longed sight loue stil see absent one day yet saw paine knew scarce desirous please amazed distemperd able resolutly call thing eate thing speake sence blush looke pale case many dayes scarce recouerd lord haue accused selfe remedy passion ouerruled iudgement haue beene best looked best extreamity loue made worse ordenarily troubled trouble made worse oft time straight whither best meanes see often let visitation meeting chance considered might take amisse runne iust dislike part woman louers obserue continued like one ready still goe execution condemnd repriud studied might gaine loue sure purpose went made selfe deere lady sure testimony liberall affection made counsell vsed carrying busines honour might bee saued shee kind danger tooke course shee deliuered care conueied away diligence suspition know name seruice merited thing bee secretly mistrust lady troth could much loue sorry shee likewise time part mee face parting thought saw allimarlus leauing loued accused slighting much restrained manner desert euer merrit reward place soeuer men care longer desire answered said shee otherwise bin better rewarded haue cause giue trial faith hath found yet wretched felt selfe neglect coupled tould sate vpon bed side awhile gaue word last spoke drawne necessity bid carefull selfe bring harme told would command sake must bee aboue thing else deere mooued farther much looke mee sate still repented euer receiued lie although betrothed wife men would kisse wiues heard patient replyes almost ioy hee temperately heard much concerning afflicted stomacke much loue would permit auailed carryed infinite paine secret knowledge suffering beast neuer doe yet christian like euer stroue turne selfe violent hurt great rage longer able conceale retired land vncles giuen attendance remained neere towne often visited troblesome mee dangerous griefes discouery would haue conceald sometimes forced keepe chamber desirous haue knowne way wife obeyed made many excuse ioyed paine thinking braue dainty thing sole lord free encombrance durst meddle finde fault action came also would bee ready iest cleere himselfe hee thought contrary discouerd forced contented yet full resolution speake know graue look countenance vsed went one night rightly serued boldnesse presumption backe came much scorne neglect contempt almost mad withall yet stroue make shew thinke although truely confesse much disquieted withall netled slept night could said haue kissed bad welcome kindly haue vsed thus thus let returne neuer shall visited come inuite want craue louers reward chastly discourse thing could time speak yet chastly one coldly sent home warme selfe choller disdaine nothing much fretting staid long waited crueltie practise obedience offer come vncalld taught thing thinke shall put vse haue beene heere two month trustie friend landed fresh victualls pretended though neither confind command sent shippe away likewise hath beene master king antissius time vpon returne faile attendance soone romania againe relieued power one distracted fall one passion another leauing complaining chafing cry fell singing twenty passion hauing profited little mistrisses seruice louing exactly well little pittie needed grow vnlesse one long enough enioy folly passe away time withall yet case shee mooued compassion greatly distressed song said queene doe often time discouer sadnes said hee haue beene acquainted passion well know kind passage marryed allimarlus said queene introth said prince cannot directly tell spake much word found assurd yet come bee trusted mistris may said queene married know assured respect vsed might serue wife know said went farre way though endlesse replide aduentured firme louer haue learned lately discourse though confesse neuer one scorne contemne humility none expect harme said hee benefit sufficient grace accepting seruice life bee spent rather least feele smart liked flattery knew seldome vsed hee vertuous vrged extreamely know discourse seemd able refuse last therefore told thus young man likewise foolish passionate loue lord ouer pleased looked hee guide sighed hee compelled mee wept let mee fall despaires sonnetted hee inspired mee woare colour sake hee priuatly told ought doe fond woman loued vaine expression could sit day see passe thinke time happily bestowed cast look passed carelesly worse accompanied others shewed fauour mee returned molested presently put thought sad verse presented thankes came blessed fortunate thus liued spoild good paper vild rime lost time wit almost till happily disinchanted meanes lady loud told neglect counterfeited looked strangely vpon end pollicy afterwards priuately sent many time enioyed desired reward nouice like returned contented gained kingdom gaue meanes liberty freely abuse confidence another lady daily hee kind seruant loued great enough good loued mee exceedingly well whether little malice mixt know discouered wronged said keepe busines make men see passion bring selfe danger husband heare sigh keepe quoile others gaine due blinding selfe blind loue reason thinking blessed abused yesterday saw happy man tooke selfe musick leaned ala shee colour deceiue eye fixed amorously another would haue feare made mad haue seene truly distemperd wish wel talked true third well cousoned selfe thought fauourd leaning haue freer liberty vnsuspected speake smild indeed affection laughed leaue fond loue louing find shee requite bee stale others gaine open eye see beauty fit admired person loued mind bee answerably white bee caught like bird greene net haue truly seene much iniured cannot hold telling take please one day say friend said went againe waite remained pensiue doubting doe till sent one lady chamber cherish make picture must need haue continually could haue mee verse must need make tune heard loud writer pleasd self prity fine passionat line truly hart truly loud wrung hand hung vpon mee embraced arme euen yeelding self breast ala thought possible woma shuld dissemble eies ouerflowed loue laboring shew suffering shuld belieue amased perplext swore loued began lament selfe wept cryd vnconstant men faulty aboue expression fainted seemd swound bestirred selfe roome durst call helpe lest husband come suspicious enough kissed breath fetched againe againe fainted againe reuiued last ah heart said canst thou cruell vowed oathes protestation satisfied comming away howers fine deluded foole lady went find meant speake mind chide trick abuse mistris full intent reuile f ee euer afterwards aduising went along priny garden saw man come muffled cloake stealing along wall knew fashion said would seene place none came fauorites therefore must goe none hauing keyes permission garden large mulberry tree vnder closely clapt selfe back face might see way tooke slunke along still till hee came doore opened staire led vp chamber stood last window opened aboue hemd presently came downe excellent vnchast selfe opened doore tooke locking fast againe seeing spleene sweld yet held determination seeke lady though discourse must altred quietly noise except heart stormes maner disquiet went garden ala said could shee bee satisfied little time must make see misery double vexation passed chamber went first fell complaint grieuously tooke auailed cald selfe vnfortunate vngratefull accursed vnnaturall bewitched sorceres cryd birth mine eye mine owne life iudgement beliefe wished bin borne heritick loue made stil greater foole lesse pitied rose chafe vowed loue tell let know offence breach loue liked instantly would put practise found kill presence braue resolution dreame well contented executed like dreames hee hath mistris armes wake pleasure merry day alike pleased ioyed heart thought effected time haue effected slipt away found euening gessed went vp againe lodging met iust lady friend discerned tricke wise carefull louer came took hand euer till done fearing thing might haue offended mistris knew something giuen suspition make men see woman loue else carelesse thought esteemed lord said haue wonderously made afternoone think extreame faulty put thing head considering true shee kind euer looke mee haue thus deceiued take pitie mee sighd ala ab sd iniured let true tongue sullied selfe iust telling mee could else belieue wee discourse little longer last forth came great wicked woman bold countenance ill could set vpon one smild saluted al rest came laying hand mine manner talking v seemd neither fond neglectiue fauours well acted said cald shee musick came indeed exceeding rare song kind seuerall language houre continued retird supper saying shee would come afterwards abroad againe euery one took way chamber purposing soone depart country youth trauell hauing led folly nothing woful experience could bring know shun yet thought bound let know ill going le shee continuall practise ran farre might last dangerous vnto resolued going met lord mighty fur sword hand bloody started lord said busines sword life serue thing said haue done already sir please call guard went forth cald guard straight went directed bringing forth dead body riuall lady truth sorry friendly kind stranger whose bloud would haue reuenged mine told husband righted came woman cry tearing haire took sent prison got liberty friend stir ouer took leaue left country louing also good man telling wrongd made see damnable falshood chiefe many abused al follower alike vsed abusing seased kild great queene story scarce fit excellency heare truth desired thus haue men faulty see woman likewise wee erre sex let v passe vnrequited queene said little went iourny much kindesse affection respect vsed increasing among last bulgaria arriued first entry entertaind multituds people welcome king liked well queene part humilitie shee could indure rudenes pressing said made hot smell folkes troubled whose daintines could brooke sauour perfume little patience therefore sufferd hearty welcome great citie came againe met chief people vsed little easelier boare king feasted prince iambolly triumph made lasted sixteene day time seruant proud mistris many prety fine passage hunting went attending sometimes would bee fierce vpon another rid softly onely make learne ride fast slow pleasure still bee attendant principall lesson obserue comming backe see ride betweene husband seruant sight glory onely imagination aboue height pride could tell must goe owne command pitifull thing yet necessary could dissemble shewed sad dull countenance sorry maiestie greatnesse mirth gaue testimonie shee reioyced time hee strickt assurance loue none pitie parting howsoeuer carried selfe like braue commanding queene ouer owne passion king brought part way parting louingly thought willingly king side prince prince thiques going together neuer seldome parted king returned wife liued couple could doe leonius beautifull veralinda returning towards frigia first going argo king direction wherein met delicate aduenture within league sea lady horseback attended many lady many knight side rode one seemed chiefe yet countenance sad melancholly said commanded himselfe euer hee rest hat freely left view delicate curld head haire browne bright delicacy faire forehead amorous though sad eies yet sadnes soueraignized mouth needing speake seene allured vnto heart pleased take refuse enough sort lip louely louingly ioyned one may belieue would willingly part mutuall kissing lady great therefore faire full spirit intising pleasing richly shee attired brauely serud excellent horswoman huntswoman though properer commendation haue said say man fine semster needleman yet quality commended day allowed admired came nearer sent know might bee bold present themselues vnto inquiry obtained knowledge new louing couple admitted veralinda kissing lady leonius embracing knight veralinda soone askt lady many doggs bowes perceiued amongst answered hound shee going hunt better fortune brought presence bowes either stag came fairely shoot saue dog death bay giuing death veralinda neuer seene hunting therefore desirous enioy sport leonius well pleased hee best pleased giuing content old king trauelled young folkes promising soone ouertake lady brought dainty prince large wood side placed themselues doggs hunt men put beate bring forth deare short time hound came forth mighty stagge huntsman following incouraging doggs voyce horne veralinda thought consort delightfulst euer eares heard life put spared neither horse way followed great affection sport wood ouer plaines thick brake ouer hill place staid lady kept commending euen vnto fury riding last pond side stagge taken soile gaue bay doggs came sweete sad gentleman temperate brauery shot beast euen hurt reioiced turning face fully beholding last piece offerd himselfe sacrifice vnto falling degree great house doe yet runnes place came earth fell hee veralinda cald take say shee ignorant ceremony yet apt learne willing instruction directed hound must bee rewarded huntsman giue peale horne melody stead bell harmony funerall ended lady besought prince princesse honour much goe house farre lodge night growne vpon consented rode thither found ancient house hansome great seemd good hospitalitie desird liud solitary priuate trauelling life remouing imitated trauell odde accident aduenture mother side haue many noble braue friend man haue men equally aboue valiant wise woman height excellency single man said leonius sir replyed dainty melancholy married haue beene long misfortune kind haue marryage lost one loued could aspire hope requitall loues still altogether blame indeed knew hand hat motion enough make noble amphilanthus ready soone hee giue take salutation king said vnknown vnto sure came sort desire reason meeting might see person fight held brauest prince liuing riuall greater happines beloued true replide emperour cause vniust since would force excellent queene take contrary owne affection confesse mine must need irreconciliable since heere pronounce quarrell neuer taken vp seeking take mistris therefore end meeting let v part meete surer tearmes king gaue consent hauing said seene man much admired satisfied till haue conquered turnd armd selues drum trumpet making harmony enough lift heart coward vp spirit little needing emperour whose heart body worth valour king likewise soone armd army order commanded vnarme left court beholder shew warr except fearelesly furiously fighting themselues fearing tending cause brought thither last amphilanthus found aduantage king lifting vp right arme giue deadly blow though failed emperour missed oportunitie ran sword crossewayes body king stood still blow emperour beheld sorry killd sword goard perceiued hee suddenly reelingly ran last fury vpon amphilanthus could haue auoyded strake downe thrust caught
