nobility two sate downe vnder cloath estate loue expressing selfe liuely perfectly eye tooke hand kissd beheld earnestly amorously ready make expression expected hoped yeelding sate ready grant still holding hand passionately gazing affectionately requi ing eye excellent expression louing entertayning passion command needed follower outward sight knowledge long acquaintance growing degree experience knew master mind left expresse eye promised leauing place free soules desired would granted rest rest earth like quiet enioying selues selues could doe seruants respect emperour learnt obedience owne happyest wish left gone amphilanthus master greatest part westerne world assured selfe monarch heart shee knew asia much scarce much selfe much lesse power ouer would like confident man commanding louer neuer shewing account former fault vse time take opportunity offerd eye fixt shee obseruing louingly rather passionately caught like man drowning catching next thing saue himselfe queene armes offender except boldnesse embraced would haue violently refused nay neglect person forcd curstest punishment heere shee onely blushd receiud loue first without expostulation discourse also familarly wonted phrase kindnesse sweet familiarnesse free neuer laid aside thus day passed night come retyrd rest queene happy blest againe enriched loue show although true fire clearer warmer suffised insteed truth filld vp like heate vnexpectednes bedd pamphilia said shee possible thou hast liued see amphilanthus kind againe smile wrincles louing decay hee told mee alterd worse sleightly regarded feard quite forsooke mee wretch yet returning truely must confesse strange change could like blinde man ledd beleeue sung eares blazed mine eye ere could take scarfe credulity vnblinde hope see plainely despaire iust cause thereof haue sate sighing nay weeping disdaine wishing might see teares stranger haue gaind compassion hath come haue cheerd vp heart rather loue done wiped eye hid sorrowes redresse haue beene discouered policie bred pure loue vnfortunate subiection yet loue selfe still striue continue since see pleades pitty fauour shine againe impossible lone reward hee go giue mee yet shall welcome else soeuer come except frownes nay two hee allot hartily next morning went hunt noone euening walked foorth along riuers side till came little rysing bottom water continued wanton course begun vpon top rising rocke top young shepheard playing vpon rebecke ayre playing curled lock hee singing songe loue farewell discouer thee tyrant ore louer thy promisd sweet proue cross thy reward loss pritty thing deeme thee innocent mild esteeme thee find thee curst matter swelling high wrought water cupid name pleasant folly hath beguiled heart holly euen sacrifize homage life soule vnto domage mine offering profferd happily refusd offerd ile keepe reuile thee craft beguile wiser man said amphilanthus liker mind said pamphilia hee loue varities hee looked vpon seeing shee smild shee spake hee likewise went shepheard comming downe rock seeing amased yet good ciuill country manner saluted gratiously requited queene demanded place replied seruant queenes shepheard doe know queene said indeed replide hee heare said amphilanthus much ioy safetie braue good woman said nothing else said yes answered haue heard must speake least heare againe cost dare assure thee said queene shall neuer heare thing thou sayest v doth bee offended thee come question wheres assurance may assuredly hanged neuer wiser trust said haue power maiesty thou shalt secure said hee ile tell first let see face wherefore said queene ile tell maid said puld mask wore shepheard looked wishly cryd heauens sweete face pitie bee long maid louers blushed smild shepherd proceeded guesse face indifferently well disposition lea nt experience marking sheepe seldome doe faile chusing sweetest natured mildest breed see countenance whether tractable cull best nothing queene said said lady loued well thought euer heard speake curteous affable pride dwells meanest speake yet greatest feare iudgement goodnesse breedes respect shee vpright iust gouernment mild louing subiects shee loues good exercise well abroad home shee hath indeed say braue manlike spirit wonderous wise shee yet good part shee could keepe cupid clawes mightily loue still mutterd gallant man braue fighting man whose sake shee refused others lately king celicia next neighbour wisdome belieue ill aduised refuse came army haue force like haue marrd sure frighted v sword men sheep likewise yet last hither came braue man loue though say forsaken wherupon grew melancholly came seldome abroad might haue seene foolish thing loue haue left looked owne busines say shee liuely againe iolly well shee may gallantly release yet hee dwells farre hauing said prety humour changing wee doe wish least wee loose doe call said emperor amphilanthus answered shepheard emperour west mighty man assuredly hath fault euer heard yet mine owne part would queen mind whereat laughed protest said thinke varietie sweetest pleasure vnder heauen constancy foolishest vnprofitable whining vertue thou art honest fellow said amphilanthus warrant thee pray god proue said else may bee wise case feare nothing said queene protect thee harme haue spoken thus freely queene tell v particularly loues appeares haue louer kinde said hee shall heare haue done since infancy since tenne haue looked wench loued since foureteene sixe twenty first vnruly flame bred mee fourteene towards pretty maid mother much age importunitie prettie present fruites flower quaint wordes loue shee bore mistris shee might feare would bee angry shee crost mee make mee sicke may bee wanton young found much aptnesse felfe mee cause power know shee would refuse long long accepting kindly amorously wee liued whole yeare pray long time bee loue one woman thinke merrited neuer bee denied came fine brownetta neighbour daughter crost sight former loue shee daily came milke next ground v thought nothing winne followed mee perpetually watched mee durst goe neare loue neuer without inuention would steale night make bracks hole hedge parted ground sheepe drouen purpose would driue way would change louing well master get father field must goe fetch forth againe saw spake telling shee aduise father keep fence better introduction last wan discourse conuersation wrangling first wrangled selues one enioyed thought like stale bread shee told truly confest weary said well met part equall tearmes quickly chose another another already haue seene haue three besides selfe commend moneths spring summer long faire weather lasted loued second cold came bloud grew chill hart grew faint onely recouered next spring sprang vnto another loue faire diana selfe full contentment cold chaste neatresse truth neate one gaind curtesie fetching driuing cattle sweete secret wood could onely accuse v none else mistrusted sweetly kindly passe time shee former varietie began thinke might purchase creature like disposition gained walking wood found dainty forrest nimph hunting forsooke le home father betaking wood sh e long could wonne like longer loue last ioy shee liked loued yeelded blessed man delicate creature fully happie shee well incountred humour fashion diuers seuerall expression loue gaue still new new woman mee continued varietie side contented loued fiue yeare without change yet wholly constant thinke slipt aside time sometimes may thought would sad came saw thinke become idlenesse mirth misbeseeme others grew sad imitate learnt fashion walked crosse armd sighed cast vp mine eye spake little looked much else nothing say looked thing vnmarked passion pleased different well pleased kind next time would merry liked beyond thought saw life spirit mettle embraced ioy delight finding make still contenting contented much possible mee bee anyes brought reputation good look nay thought many faire maides without pride speake though confesse loue tell among rest another nimph hearing mee seeing mistris made mee thought fine thing loue finer bee loued yet hee consider chuse without offence others gaine selfe ill fortune chuse mee though naturally kind woman would hardly let one sweete sexe sigh much lesse weepe mee would requite yet hee winning power make mee differ indeede shee take mee right shee mistooke time place happening bee nimphs house whither en resorted forresters shee welcomming mee friend done seruice hunting shee house little therefore roomes neare together mistris lodged riual companion roome within selfe mistrusting nothing bolting doore betweene sure comming secretly went bed quiet according agreement came mee together embracing louingly discoursing wee heard noise somet ing nearer v next roome loue first made v heedl sse till comming neare continuing increase lumbring nd wood falling slipping rowes order laid vp rankes wee startled feared mistris shee knowing place aboue fiue foote broad alwaies filled cleft wood chamber stept shut doore goe come place shee made safe opening side shee softly returned mee much delight wee stayed together till day ready breake shee parted mee bee owne bed maides came seeke soone shee ready called mee sent orileda called hauing shee told afterwards make know loue violence whereof made vnchast thought euer broken shin climing ouer wood cursing yet hindrance harme barring letting see power make euer modestie till would permit shee vnable follow dianaes sport well person chaste course thought seemed pitie owne ill fortune missing lament hurt hurt mee shee perplexed mee haunting mee lord life led shee troubled mee mistris grew little suspitious grieued mee stroue mee difference betweene blind accursed left one fortother came queene wood delight self first comming country traine many braue fine woman among rest one prety little lasse pretinesse mee thought commanded largely ouer heart shee made mine faint faile strong thinke forrest life toylesomst wearisomest world plotted bee released onely bee might see loued long studied last fell vpon resolution put selfe court serue officer courtier queene affecting hunting soone accepted taken chiefe huntsman one maiesties seruants excellent blowing horne chase louing infinitely hoping much neuer loued without especiall comfort spoile crosse old companion hope queene went try enchantment neuer hauing seene one horseback still masked know maiestie carried selfe shee report meriting honour might bee though likewise losse shee returned yeares discontented woman world hath continued till within dayes god bee thanked hath recouered spirit long may beseech heauen continued al hapines attend yet angry going caried loue yet farr could carry either heauy light first contrary wind brought forswore hunting court al betaking shepherd liue vnder queen shepheard quiet loue pleasure neuer paine haue lasse haue mee loue serue whether violence making mee truer rather obseruant anie others wor h could thus liue must ay truly fondly ignorantly condemned men yet pleaseth mee auoid meanes importunity business heere serued obserued nothing vexe mee like well enough ouermuch fondnesse fairenesse trouble mee shee helena vertue denies little command humble busie loue mix fine discourse like mee well enough suffer selfe thinke yet nimph dainty lasse ah said pamphilia seemes haue reliques loue truth said haue conscience moue way many time nowing vndid selfe yet firmely loues mee still vnchangeably euer returne said amphilanthus bee againe happy euer enioying long loued louing creature first passion flash e pure true fie feele said hee nd doe yet iustly continue old affection varietie new againe louers smild vpon taking fine shepheards offer drinke poore drinke dranke bottle returned pleased much discourse resolution returne old loue next morning shee went fish dinner hauke euerie day new delight till past inuention like sheepheard returned one morning hunt went one hour chase hound running merrily stag comming neere emperour rest spirit mooued pleasure sparing horse followed speed great desart wood hee thicknesse lost stagge hound company himselfe que e hauing guide coasting came death hou e soore brought deere wood fall emperor missd queene missing misse ioy content heart much still partooke fortune faithfully tould hee would quickly heard againe shee grew sad instead honoring dogges deere last right tooke horse againe went selfe seeke sending traine seuerall way quest taking two lady held chase ten knight continued search till night came house midst wood resolud rest night next day betimes pursue search came house found seruats ready willing entertaine mistris come hunting queene weary sad te downe bed rather neglectiuely threw selfe vpon one ladi meane space taulking seruants concerning mistris ill returned garment blacke damaske reached knee another came small leg sattin buskin finest leather laced tyed pretty knot ribbin al blacke gone euer since loue left head shee wore hat haire vnder tyed braded finely shee might throw hat pleasure remaine finer seemed haue beene excellent yet appeared louely though face said shee youth fullest time yeares yet sommer quite done strength spirit place delicasie sinnes wholesome healthfulnes dainty beauty altogether shee farre contemptible though merriting admired constancy patient suffering shee brought selfe vnto perfect kind way wanted former happines excellent creature without question kind oft time abused excelling change vnderstanding queene house much ioyed withall rauished made whit forget duty others haue done rashly ouercome ioy grow vnmannerly withall stayed attending good fortune might see welcome maiestie done cald tim came soone q hauing tumbled awhile cast thought million various conceit wearynes fell asleepe continued howre space sweete nimph stayd soone ladyes told queene without shee admitted much humillity queene kindnes say man knowes ill might surely walke owne conscience yet good got rid himselfe might mistrust dislike see remorse friend hee stood alone like tree midst plaine branch cut euery wind hath power stood apt shaken euery storme seene considered many last resolud vpon hee reele fall plot layd remayning nobility especially auncient lord desent though many young men among agreed together king wicked wise amphilanthus said hast thou left thy poore pamphilia thus newly raised death despaire life hope happinesse cast downe lower misery better dearer selfe know thy meaning leaue mee thus soone manner deuill risen vndoe murder content accursed bee wood day went hunting motion rude sauage exercise appurtenance brought aided losse sweetest life doe perpetually dye thy absence dearest heart returne restore else come see die close dying eye thy conquering beloued hand would grieue thee yet content spare wish thy absence liue thou happy thou art worthy let eye blessed possibly may aske obtaine blessing seeing thee againe let fortunate finder thee let find thy fauour still luckely eternally happy search many passionate word shee spent time night till tired sleepe would haue share royall queene slept long started cryed stay liue follow loues thee like forsake againe oh stay stayd speech came dreame seeing dreame little better satisfied yet stuck abiding fresh thought foretold extraordinary matter shee dreamt shee armes discoursing hee sad speaking sudden rose went doore shee thought shee saw lucenia calling hee went downe staires tooke coach fled away made crie haste loudnesse hee went still lucenia neuer looking towards lost sight coach odde omen considering happned afterwards well shee rose soone day appeared taking leaue kind nimph shee tooke horse went wood trauelling till shee came desartest place obscure part riding vp downe well shee could thicknesse shee perceiued last vpon white bone lay beene beast killed died rest consumed away one drop blood forrester came cry maiesty taken away theeues carried thickest part wood whereupon armed speedily tooke way directed wee much speed could followed wood lost sight led seuerall spirit scattred lost bauarian duks fortune meete next aduenture hauing trauelled long desart weary paine fruitlesse search hee came vnto skirt thereof high hill towards lycia bottom hee beheld faire pleasant meadowes delicate stream running descended comming hee found many folk mowing grasse making vp winter prouision shewing thriftyer people prodigally spent present time without care future spake vnto kindly respectiuely gaue answere demanded knew strange knight passing way answered two faire armour one blew flowred gold russet siluer hee knew companion one duke wirtenberg brunswicke passed great hast inquiring old man young damsell seemd done ill act pretended duke courteously thanked ha ted directed way tooke passed till hee came head riuer whose sweetnes begining could content selfe must wilfully runne pride farre till looseth selfe lycian sea like ambitious men neuer thinke haue full preferment honor rich benefit till swallow themselues vp gulfe merrited death farre hee espied towne braue country sweete rich euery way delicate called myra rode still towards comming among dainty meadowes fruitfull plaines admyring place greater cause giuen admiration saw pyramede iustly curiously made richly adorned rare trophy belonging loue shewed dedicated god one thing seemed strangest garland hanging one side flower dead withered fallen others decayed following gone vnder line grauen peece brasse egypt pyramid inclose king farr brauer nobler thing vertue beauty loue faith heere lye kept myras tombe shut eye phoenix dye raise another faire borne ash heire sweete place may claime right w e since heere lye heauen willing braue knight beheld wishly coniecturing tombe famous woman monument made seruant made lament though stranger losse part neuer repayred neuer relieued hauing losse called mind owne fortune made light laying rather throwing himselfe vpon grasse foote pyramede letting horse goe owne pleasure master felt none part groaning word weeping deliuered fit aduenture befallen brought place may freely sadly without interruption breath myseries vnfortunate peryneus bauaria world thee hauing lost thy onely delight thou didst loue thou mirror thy time sexe dearest ely thy spring young summer sweet pleasing v nay could bee worthy thy tendernesse delicate thy delicacie tender suffer selfe v thy exquisite sweetnesse wee like bee would greedily haue sucked thy daintines inrich pleasure therefore fearing wee surfet would take away lest part might hurt dearest elyna yet though thy goodnesse beyond merit wouldest thou euer leaue thy faithfull peryneus dye thy losse liues thy memory turnd hee himselfe backe cry heauens behold end without fatallkilling thunder stormes could thought executed neuer let cruelty againe bee indured plague companion noysome smell dangerous infection greatest plague could come depriuing earth hath yet brought last breath shee sweetned euer ayre left delicate odour sweet breath blesse countrey purpose may say elynas breath wee must breathe memory onely companion memory ist mee let mee thee thy helpe relate againe loues thou knowest young wanton idle liud emperours court courting oft time receiued refusing lady elyna appeard like happy signe destruction kinde felt paine pang loue shee tooke away giuing mee life comfort shee requited nay deserud could giue remaind wanting want loue faulty thou canst mee remember loud maide belonging empresse faire fond shee fortune continued latter left thou canst call minde widdow loud mee receiued affection would denye beauty kindnesse shee mee though satisfaction fondnesse fondly venturd danger thou wilt may say led astray liking dutchesse wife great duke cannot denye v must ioyne truely say elyna came like faire chaste cloud wrapt vp heate snowy armes keeping onely warme requiting breast hid bright hot beame harming making others either warme delight hot fury sweetest elyna soules ioy thinking thee wert thou yet vnkinde little leauing mee yet diddest thou leaue mee worthiest way noblest nothing death tooke thee mee threed broke cruell fatall sister could haue disseuered twiued loues hath death done dying thou diddest bequeathe thy loue mee met equalld mine owne remaines ioyntly mixd two one one since compounded may boldly say hold inclosd mee richest treasure loue faith euer man brest glory sex worth mine humility loyalty remember kinde memory shee told shee feard loues discouerd suspitious empresse sweetly carefully shee spake vnto mee wishing care selfe expressing loue height kindnesse mee fearing shee could enough let mee know feare without lesse loue passion would permit yet thus shee cleerd suspition passion neuer force yet regular power shee passionately louing yet discretion temperd none discre tly shewed passion shee forbad mee speaking comming chamber looking writing idle humorous louers doe startling euery motion loue like hunny kept hiues many sting trouble hold one inioying loue care reall vsed lesse fashion noble kinde free suspition although empresse tooke necke led window looked tarras bad looke forth tell walked back towards shee answering peryneus hee said shee hansomest man euer saw truely said shee madam minde ioynd person make appeare excellent dare presume maiesty thinkes bee shee answerd nothing frownd elyna retyrd yet neuer stird former braue carriage mee loue indeed excellent elyna elyna shall say say lesse speake truth thou wert liuing dead art worthiest example thy sexe enough much said one lay side pyramide myra beyond take life death venture take worser answerd hee rather heare elyna wrongd angry vexd hasty choller tooke hurtfullest though readiest way hurt flew one vpon great fiercenesse small harme could insue weapon vsed hand one hauing none first haste vsing none finding others want honor mistresse would contend vnarmed man hee deemed worthy bee medled withall noble quarrell vnlesse hee came like man maintaine businesse great weight wherefore stepping hee thus resolutely spake vnfortunate man said hee see thy error double kinde made plaine vnto thee tell mee plaine shewing error rather plainly confesse presumptuous fault let v trye sword thou art said peryneus vnarmd yet armd greatest insolencie world vse speech venture cal account truth thou must maintain falshood defending thy first foolishly bold word sword haue said hee armes haue forsworne wearing therefore thou wilt keepe thine doe make doubt ouerthrow thee thy armed pride together took sword hung side pyramide ouer place hee lay braue duke would take aduantage besides assured cause iust vnarmd himselfe going conclude difference end liues sacrifice blood dearest onely loues memory happier honour louers fell three delicate nymphes came comming hunting bowes hand quiuers backes apparell greene white buskin delicate garland head two angry louers came sweet perswations mixd threatnings shoot first strake blow pacified desiring know ground quarrell withall discourse fortune consented one would promise bee friendes till story ended lest new dislike relation might arise none would obey first fittest bee answerd nymphes bee cause dislike commanded draw lotte beginne lest preheminence might bee new stirring likd well therein thought mistress honour chance fell defender pyramide hee calld himselfe began thus sweet nymphes sir bee plasd know called alarinus countrey accursed countrey poore beggard countrey hauing lost rich worthy good chiefe command heerein myra commanded mee gone lesse thing miserably ouerthrowne ruind shee say sole lady place honourd name holding sacred reliques bone ash bosome shee interrd lady shee infinite part wanting nothing good fortune shewed much neglectiuenesse enuying surely worth iealous shee haue place ruled wheele whereon shee turnd lowest part thus thus say thus iust depart must yet vniustly shee thus punished surely great offence deare nay diuinest myra thus thy end succeeding end happen wrung hee hand wept tumbled earth weary life shee gone sitting little vp hand vpon knee head hanging downe deiected eye ground teares falling two stilles shee groned hee faire louely winning yet wonne selfe stayed constancie made selfe lose rather want sought shee loud allhappy man selfe say loud little loud serud many enuyed mee ioyed fauour blessing regarded nothing else poore men said trouble themselues labouring harmefull knowledge disdaine allotted heare man inrichd hauenly treasure scornes wealth king lycia nephew would haue whether would dislike refuse ciuility faire language often last flatly deny vpon hee laid baites betray sought doe bribe seruants hee corrupt counsell hee gaine woman guifts promise work end sought conclusion nothing ill false harmefull left vndone treachery wickednesse hee plotted innocent doue vertue shee propounded counsell hee knew shee trusted seruants deliuerd shee confidently put woman hand instantly gaue intelligence shee betraid like pidgeons flattering glasse inticing beleeue good shee betrayd king lycia came visite taking occasion hee pretended neere countrey progresse brought hee entertained answerable minde estate giue hee brought also delicate fine young lady onely daughter hee put vpon myra perswade cousen young iudgement though good great yeares small came short shee speake shee worke wit aad sweetnesse myras wit without compare iudgement sollid infinite knowledge experience hauing setled monarchy excellent part princesse well myra much better shee perswaded prettily myra iudicially refused king returnd troubled expressing disposition naturally gentle milde soft much hardnesse contradiction grieue hee would sooner quarrell went home nephew puft vp malice scorne treachery sweld poyson brest soone come againe ill wherewith hee fill like nut kernell place void much ayre vertue might pierce shee seeing returne vowed forbid boldly thought haue done act came abroad pri ately deliuerd instrument seruants infinitely harmed preuent banishment equall disgracing raysed detestable slander ala saying rather beseech imagine let ill imagination enter thought excellent creature put mee rehearse boldly thinke ill consideration roote selfe deuill inuented pitty mee vniustly suffered see much good hap yet deere cruell though thus young hate aged loue loue hath youth shall see loues fuell deseruing reward denie let see eye kind die wo eye mine thou neuer shalt behold cloud true disdaine may dim desire shall blacke thy fault bold demanding whats vnfit poore old fire wasted like triumph sparcles onely liue troubled rise ember outliue man doe confesse boldnesse ti ought resist sweet selfe command yet blind need must see mine eye must rest gazing stand heauen forbids bacest worme way hide deare beauty must need decay wo beauty hide mine eye put rather perplexed thy sight mischiefe certaine worse doubt thy sight thy absence delight yet mine ill since thee stay tyred misfortune cannot stray man thy beautie hide still cruell liue haplesse dim bright light earth light beauty giue let cause euer darkest night blessed eye fairest face light soule guide true grace sweet commanderesse shall yet obay leaue ala vnguarded shall sorrow euer stray quiet peace hope curst present stand great neede trouble said hee life villaine seekes dishonour said hee hee hath long sued mee refused replide damsell sought betray mee day laid ambush speed horse assistance god gaue mee went shee still proceeding story till comming part wood whence might see walke house stood though hill whereon hill also lifting vp eye see shew place first telling said shee shall soone shew poore habitation looking way poore indeed cryde shee ala lord ruined castle burnes chill cold dispaire hee looking vp saw true whereupon hee little amazed yet willing shew spake brauely aduisedly goe shee consented vnto comming nearer discerned onely first gate fire assalliants master twentie gathering fago prouisions together fire rest labouring put armes onely chiefe armour duke neuer vse loose ayding lady thereof demand aide said hee cannot refuse lady take said one said another throwing stone cudgles heauy vnhappy harmefull thing lighting making smart hee liking tooke vp strong pole feld many killed came master inraged like hunted bull drue sword reuiling prince threatning gained though death dorileus braue good heeded word flang away pole drawing sword thou art armd said doubly sin yron therefore sword shall vsed cut thee thee world though scornd shew selfe thy seruants fought cost traytor whose head dorileus cut presented lady staying behind tree wood beholding issue praying successe seruants fearing sword glistered ioyfully shining truth fled away wood came neere quickly considering danger staid discourse raines let loose ran downe towards combatant one welcome presenting head enemy hee cut gaue vnto like tomeris sithia held haire gaue quickly another conclusion threw midst flaming tower selfe enemy good wasting good yet hotly desiring embrace much ill headlongly hastily fell either grace quickest hottest kiss conceale villanous treacherous head iust punishment fire proceeded farther body sweetnes sake throwne together consumed honourable buriall creature thus past place entred pallace alabaster white selfe pure mistrisse whose heart neuer spot ill body disproportion chaste goddesse true truth neuer loud euer milder sweetest calme sweeter conuersation excellent discourse duke witnessed returne related story giuen selfe word one kind verse hee remained two night going companion bin courting little neuer refusing lady conducted appointment castle neere hand welcome nay welcome duke vnto one friend glading presence longing desiring louer good countenance shewed suter heart eye sued happy seemed presence rather bard sight shee would indure heare tell loues beloued said lady honoured much like loue take could shee otherwise chuse said self would runne fortune told kindly lady granted loue would shee rather flee refuse cryd shee blame ot curse fortune cannot embrace wish lead mee told owne tyes lady vnimitable beyond commendation expression faith able come neere worth alasse sighd touchd mee hee loues otherwise might hope loue grounded place faire carryes power discourse willing put although contrary best wish put speake story lady fetched ayd verse deliuered thus deliuered reading perticulars intrusted would loues sake breake trust passionatly lady loue read pretty pastorall thus sheapardesse name couer owne ill fortune better sheephard care take ought flock whose thought pride could higher make maintaine sheepe time woe must spent broken sleepe thus first wofull change beganne lamb chanct misse finde hee ran yet find past fate vnkind ill led way whereas willow tree behind faire young maiden lay bed despise rule leaues none scrip threw away many e forsakes one one must obey vnhappy man whose loosing found better bin lost whose gaine doth spring ground whereby must crost worldly care neglect cupid end willow still thy branch weare thou wilt accompany ill sorrow beare true friend said sighd turnd leauing restlesse place sheephard pa ion burnd lamenting sad case th maid gone alone left still betrayd scornd heart v bereaud sought delayd yet though thou false hast still faithfull though thou thinkst leaue sinne ile make loyalty shine cleare thy foule fault men shall knowne thy change thy delicate courtier curious habites danced rid thing fit court well braue lady could doe change thus say shee loue would man hangd would suffer sweetnesse decay curstnesse thinke belieue haue made loue selfe shee refused mee neuer heard word deniall offerd horse though shee wanted good one time yet shee would take mine present feare offending presented nothing scorne made verse said commended faintly instead thanks said mee let see hee deare hee belonged haue brother case loue grieud vsd scarce ciuilly mee shee euer respectiuely wrought much mee hate woman hee loues cause trouble sake mine owne part beare denying mee well reason loue often see cause stay longer staid hee last word tooke leaue onely saying hee would follow lady v xe easily hee might doe discreet person h e continued talking trauell wearisome trauell selfe quiet spirit hee gone roome like calme storme foule weather ayre silent sweet quiet pleasd themselues bird spring wi h owne tune florentine desire heare lady knight much respect honour liuerd thus noble prince said hee goe tell story must vndertake tell vnfortunate deseruing woman euer venter relate businesse shall bee vnable deliuer worth e excellency matter may say shee vertuousest fairest maide kingdome vnfortunateliest married vnhappiest wife countrey desolate grieued widdow estate euer shee shee shew good shee substance ill mischiefe succeed youth indeed infancy shee loued braue knight deserud loue respect yet hee fault men haue companion knew much time yet secret neuer intruth mistrusted till gone retyrd life change growne among v diuided seuerall wayes scattered like hayle shee call court continued begun loue hee fell loue much hee raged almost passion till hee discouerd hee vowed himselfe neere madnes passion hot youth flaming afterwards mature iudgement permit hee grew slacker shee grieud lost content yet thinking please onely end refraind fearing seeing dislike scorne presence hoping content giuing liberty new choyce whether offending hee tooke matter making seeme offence shee lost loue onely hee made appeare hee loathd shee sweet creature whose heart softest part new mistris grieuously tooke curst hap shee melted griefe virgin waxe heate fire water yet thereby coldnesse element grow hard frozen coldnesse shee closd cold despaire yet hardened hate dislike suffering patiently dead body permit handling rude stander shee onely felt paine loue metamorphosed delight shee cast exercise left couerd misfortune losse husband loue continued true shee losse beene happy fell vnhappy creature shee ancient lord old age antiquity honour made loue vnto shee perplexd friend parent hee infinitely rich shee finding heart shee cald subiect cald selfe would consent shee refusd great ioy hee loud well hee could thinke imparting though sure enough hee could hold long death gaping denied men sort age fortune durst take boldnesse sue lately young duke countrey made profer loue shee willing entertaine would beleeue hee meant perswaded yet lookes followes hee may meet hee haue opportunity smile seekes please may thing doth neuer speakes lookes loue company allowes noblenesse true loue heare loue ancient lord also mighty rich man estate yeares seekes shee vnderstand sends inuites dwelling shee find still excuse neglect ciuilly hee vowes finde court flyes take iourneys vnthought shun al loue flyes loue willing warme hand fire honour dare come neere louefire feare scorching shee burnes owne flame neuer beloud woman breathd euer breath true louing woman hath shee left vnexprest manifest affection kindes life shee hath venturd honour lost beauty happinesse dead shee growes old truth loue hath owne satisfaction content selfe withall rich vnspeakable owne soule shee say iust yet suffer fault vertue perfection error one pretty tale shee came told still beloued friend came company aduenture hauing deare companion newly growne league friendship brought friend gentleman seeing discreet grew discourse louing loued loud euen mistris sake well pleasd conuersation ne grew spake freely coufidently much saw knew knew fortune grudged knowledge nobler man breathes shee sayes except owne friend hee must haue competitor namd worth goodnesse though shee suffer ill excellent hee yet appeares braue gentleman last fr edome began perswade leaue constancie would hurt continue way true truely say shee loud longer iustlier hee seeing returne hope longer bee slaue might free deserud ill shee loud ill well bee bound yet hee neuer name friend though discourse said knew euer protesting name none kindes shee answerd much loud honourd truth shee desird shee might liue fault grow old vertue whose worthines would giue youth eternity comfort honor world wrincles truth would bee closed shee seeme faire euer palenesse losse complexion restord rarenesse vertue age medea charmes turnd infancy cleerenesse ablenesse worth hee lamented misfortune shee smild heare much mistake told twas perfection error said woman yet generally doe erre kinde may say woman one best therefore pittied florentine naturally loue strange thing could hardly compassd wherefore hee great desire see lady againe court resolud trye fortune hauing thought much boldnesse winning power man helpe talking knight came againe next day absolute endlesse visitor brittany confidently promisd bring thither p together said thou dost win thou hast better luck th n br e bold brittaines haue yet attaind vnto familiarity seemd yet florentine end also bore heard language rudenes tooke leaues lame knight went neerest way abiding yeeld richnesse desert doth lie imbracd night brightnes wholly defacd day alone left light due yet waighty still loue presse loue rather lightly flie passion like woman made tie purpose vnloose oft free thus may lightnesse shewing ruine cannot liue affection dye leaue liuing constancy light heauy wee agree protest god said made instant saw shee vp reddy many made others sudden seldome thinke prince desire heare story pray let haue haue answered ready perfect deliuery speech well therefore please especially prince desire excused since onely haue said conclude see vnhappie vnfortunate miserable lost woman found breathing teares againe fall eye louely appeared sorrow almost equall sweetnesse winning ioy powerfull command fully conquered florantine neuer cured death liuing many yeares louing constantlie death rare seldome knowne thing among men ranke especiallie night grew tooke leaues faine prince would haue staid neuer wodrous seldom inuited though cae staid welcome braue needing men two torture allen parting fro going whose noise would make mad heart oppest melancholly iustly punisht aspiring euer till time loue win saw emperour loued seruant bound like liked loue loued please master got much gaine gaine winning must see rather misse desire perswaded silent companion accompany taking hound visit shew pleasure tooke iourney came lay much adoe got abroad rid daintily qualitie could intice inflame braue prince still attended little hee infinitely fond still accompanied finding meant put beside ordinary knightly pace would take paine like good honest forrester wearier chase stagge three dayes trauell heart told fainting would neuer win spirit hee spurred rid last stagge fell hunting ceased death mote home al eturnd much glory losse glory victory losse heart backe knight house companion went whence next morning prince florence called aduenture ioy esquire came vnto many country seeke meere chance cast vpon shoare informed three braue knight lately arriued west part country brittany description seemed bee sought finding much comforted hope others sent duke burgundy whose good hap goe right way find emperour time much trauell gaue great content prince yet grieued part brittany necessitie compell away went taking leaue knight kind freely noble leauing trust doe friend part remembring seruice lady squire posted much speed country would giue leaue taking first place two companion parted arriued hee instant vnarmed willow colour prince venice fallen aduenture riding downe way allotted came end three dayes trauell side delicate sweet riuer indeed one best brittany place passage crosse side hee tooke boate landing came rich ground much pleasant soyle rather profit pleasure passing found delectable country forrest daintiest part seeming rather exact piece curiositie habitation wild beast wood plaines corne ground delicate spring many braue dwelling faire fine house abundance seemd banquettinghouses many excellent garden wood great pleasant euery field fringd laced tree prince rode much admiration place following prettie brooke sweete murmuring pleasing passing inuited follow louing whisper hee intreated vnderstood rid beholding much kindnes till last hee brought faire meddow hee grew angrie said thing commendation swell grow high spite calme still faire well might close banke lay shepheardesse vrania sufficient expression perfection hooke scrip lay bright delicate haire looked like straw sunne glistering beames shine receiues paye equall lusture yet shee grace straw fearing parcialitie bee sunne corrected wearing beames else punished neere equall defend blowes hat matter radient rayes shunning sunnes hot kiss enuious touch tying flower together rest lying lap picking best liked ca ing others riuer smild thanks fauours thus playd sheepe lamb free ioy shee loue vexation full eye full commanding power forehead couered hat pity feare murdring clearenesse azure veined purenesse yet smoth cheekes plumpe soft lipps delicate fine chin shewed field conquest still held victory hand bare making vp nosegay said vnmatched whitenesse adored put vse vnlesse cherish heart softnesse knowing hard worke could cruell gentle wound themselues especially giuen allurement sufficient draw venecians heart seruitude certainely farre lesse would haue power melt iron breast italian whose heart apt enough loue admiration staid loue wonder yet wonder brought last resolution loue goe vnto little interrupted comming lady towards shepheardesse lady came seemd house top hill wel might thither many mile discride grome halfe mile descent hill seeme immediately come came alone accompanied onely booke riuers side contrary side chearefully affection gloriously shining eye saluted shepheardesse instantly arose kind louing lookes answered salutation lady said water prooued dull element earth ioyned heauy thwartnesse hold asunder ignorant spirit loue heart desire meeting bridge said shepheardesse venture ill businesse said lady little better may fall prince drew neare offerd seruice accepted pulling gauntlet tooke lady hand safely led ouer two louerlike woman kisse embrace owne passion little satisfied thanked knight desiring know accident brought thither especially armed little armes required vsed blessed peace comfort soules hauing gouernment place said strager lately ariued part prince venice chance cast brittan shore whence came bin much fashion armes much said therein happinesse haue knight aduenturers countrie said knight haue said th lady good store aduentures seldome put together knight leauing aduenturing part vnlesse necessitie none louing happy worthy peace better none abler brauer warre occasion calleth trie aduentures many place seuerall inchantments diuers hard way attempt charmes abundance also appeares saith doe carry charmes enough ouerthrow army heart making many yeeld peace none dare warre power wee armed strong resolution said shepheardesse defended owne vertue wee feare enemy lurking owne breast yet haue appeared certaine haue boldnesse aduenture sight free said lady liue state yet enuironed enemy subiectlike freedome yet haue yeelded another prince obeyed wandred good space thought yet making farther iourneyes yet farre shee went till shee came dainty spring issuing stony banke vpon pibbles making murmuring sweetely dolefull tune cleere water effect best bestowed teares euer eye shed though till hardly haue bin dry said speake said hee sad busines againe together neuer againe hope part traine thus arriued knowne neuer staid called kisse hand ranne euery one striuing first casting themselues feete tooke vp much noble kindnes receiued returned cittie next day wood againe see hell deceit abused thence brought loyall seruant brauest f iend euer man noble polarchos amphilanthus recouered sword brought home armour resoluing nothing remaine witness former ficklenes property place destroying monument charmes hauing conclusion recouering none himselfe could haue gayned sword belonging million tryed meane space lamentably perplext finished pamphilia blessed thought heart soule wished amphilanthus expreslesly contented prepared iourney merry contented nothing amisse greife forsaken sadnes cast pamphilia queene content amphilanthus ioying worthily pamphilia amphilanthvs night blacke mantle could darknesse proue sleepe death image sens hyre knowledge selfe thought moue swifter switnesse neede require sleepe chariot drawne wingd desire saw sate bright venus queene loue feete sonne still adding fire burning heart hold aboue one heart flaming rest goddesse held put breast deare sonne shut said thus must winne obeyd martyrd poore heart waking hopd dreames would depart yet since louer haue beene deare eye well indeed doe adorne blessed sphere gazing soules hold deare loued place sought triumph neere court glory loues force borne may terme aprills sweetest morne pleasing lookes bright light appeare sunneshine day clowdes mist still cleare kinde nursing fire wish yet vnborne two starres heauen sent downe grace earth placd throne giues ioyes birth shining burning pleasing yet charmes wounding euen hurt deemd delight pleasant force great might happy tryumph harmes yet hope loue play thy part remember well thy selfe thinke shine eye conquerd haue heart see mine slacke answer thee lodge breast pitty moouing see flame mine burne truest smart exciling thought touch inconstancy waste constant art watch sleepe take rest thought spirit distrest pale famishd mercy cry seruant leaue thinke weares loues crowne must doe amisse seeke good thy force doe lye forbeare darke night ioyes budd againe lately growne dead cold aspect chill roote heart chiefe hope quite kill thunder strooke pleasure waine ala bitter sob paine priuately groand fortune present ill light comfort dimbd woe pride fill strange encrease griefe grieud vaine memory good molested still witnes stood tho best dayes former time knew late gone wonder past like great sow melted wasted change must know backe life come grew pleasing sight misfortune euer bring firme desire painefull torment trye winning eye proue heart sting sweet lip treason hidden lye sunne pleasing blindes strongest eye two much lookd breaking sight string desire still crost must vnto mischiefe hie despaire lucklesse chance may fling eye hauing none reiecting prooues sting killing budd tree doth spring sweet lipps louing poyson proue desire sight eye lipps seeke see proue aud finde loue may winn curse vnkinde shew harmes dislike ioy loue striue still heape disdaine pleasure take cruelty show haplesse sorrowes flow byding make giuen lost thee ala euen griefe growne pitty scorne cryes gainst selfe ill show would giue place ioyes delight flow yet wretched torture beare thee long haue sufferd esteemd deare nce thy yet grew paine neere wish may ende say shall haue deapth heartheld despaire feele death care ile seeke since saue song spring come last tree field flowres meadowes make taste pride sad showres mine eye doe flow make knowne cruell paine cold winter yet remaines signe spring wee knowe sunne earth giues heate light pleasure ioyes spring hateth dearth plenty make treasure heate colde light darknesse since barr blisse heate light behold shepherdesse thus said griefe opprest truest loue betrayd barrd quiet rest weeping thus said shee e approacheth neere willow must weare fortune bee branch tree ile dresse hapless head shall witnesse bee hope loue dead cloathes imbroderd shall garland round scatterd others bound tyde like fall barke booke shall bee dayly write tale haples mee true slaue fortune spite roote shall bedd nightly lye wailing constancy since true loue dead line leaue louer come may right conceiue place tombe still constant loud dead cruell care killd vnkind dispaire change end heere proud loue leaue vrge thou knowest thou hast hand ti cowardize striue none resist pray thee leaue yeeld vnto thy band doe thus still thine owne power pe sist behold yeeld let force dismist thy subiect conquerd bound stand neuer thy foe thy claime assist seeking thy due withstand seemes thou wouldst thee loue doe confesse twas thy made mee choose thy faire shewes made louer proue freedome paine refuse yet sir god boyship despise charmes obey loue want eye ledd power griefe wailing brought false conceit change fallen part seeke small ease line bought increas paine griefe curd art ah vnkindnesse moue within heart still true free changing thought vnknowne woe breed endlesse smart ceaslesse teares causelesly wrought make shun shining light seeke blackest cloud light giue others onely darknesse driue shine sunne disdaines sight yet though darke doe liue triumph may vnkindnes wrong shall loue allay bee pleasd pleasure grieue doe delight enuy ioy haue content contentment hope blisse hope still still enioy let sad misfortune haplesse destroy leaue cross rule still rule free delight contrary imploy keepe good backe torment see ioyes ber aud harmes doe tarry despaire take place disdaine hath got hand yet firme loue hold sens band since despised sorrow marry griefe must coupled bee sorrow ile wed despaire thus gouernes mee weary traueller tyred sought place distant farre yet found end paine labour state mend last ioy home backe brought findes ease though ioy fraught past feare content like soules ascend new pleasure doe descend high firstborne blisse wrought tyred paine minde content receiues ease lymbs greatest happinesse doe finde beliefe faith hope pleasure swimmes truth saith twas wrong conceit bred despight acknowledgd brings heart delight endlesse torment rest oppresse long delight sad paine neuer loue fauour expresse shall still liue euer feele disdaine alasse stay let griefe optaine end feede heart sharpe distresse let see cruell fortune gaine least release longfelt woe redresse let blame cruelty disgrace honourd title godhead loue giue iust cause say place found rage alone moue quickly end doe long debate needfull ayd lest helpe doe come late cloyd torment tedious night wish day come hope ioy crosse finde new torture destroy woekild heart first hurt mischiefes might crye night day take flight brightnesse gone rest heere inioy vsurped hate force imploy night cannot griefe intombe though blacke spite thought sad face sad doth seeme paine long howers tedious griefe great endlesse care face force woe esteeme welcome night farewell flattering day hope breed yet ioyes delay song night weepe day cry ay still doe wish though yet deny ay sigh mourne say still store ill ay coldest hope freez yet burne ay flame striue flye yet turne ay griefe hast sorrowes hye heart woe doe lye ay contrary seeke run ay contrary cannot shun ay delight force trye despaire thought doe tye ay whither alasse shall goe ay despaire hope outgoe ay forrest cupid hies poore soule law tyes ay court cryes fye ay true loue shall espye ay leaue place falsest louers true loue truth discouers ay quiet rest proue ay place alike loue ay constant begun yet say till life loue done ay deare famish selfe gaue foode destroy glory saue kill soule spirit gaue pitty disdaine triumph stood easie thing shed bloud one yeelds graue may true worth mercy craue preserue spoyle nourish good sight food doe desire sacrifice hidden fire stop breath praise moue thinke easie ti sight giue nay euen desert since doe liue camelionlike would liue loue thus conquerd haue lost power withstand ioyes ruine must bee still strength deuoures captiue lead prisoner bound vnfree loue first shall leane men fantsies free desire shall quench loues flame spring hate sweet showres loue shall loose dart haue sight see shame wishing hinder happy houres loues purblinde charmes resist must seruile list seeke host harbour thee flye thy babish trick freedome doe professe hurt make lost heart confesse loue must farewell liberty truely poore night thou welcome art loue thee better sad attire rayseth men fantsies higher like painted outside foule inward loue thy graue saddest lookes see seemes soule dying heart entire like ash happy fire flamd ioy quenchd misery loue thy countnance thy sober pace euenly go louing grace v mee among rest opprest giues quiet peace poore selfe alone freely grant day leaue thou art gone giue cleare light see ill redrest sleepe fye possesse doe fright thy heauy thy deathlike might counterfettings vilder death sight deluding thought doe spight thou sufferst falsest shape soule taffright sometimes likenesse hopefull spright oft time like loue despight ioying thou canst malice kill delight poore foole made thee thinke ioy doth flow thy fond shadowes doe destroy sencelesse selfe left free thee doe well let euer sleepe euer deere image keepe still wake sens may free sweet shade doe seeke giue delight deeme delight vilde place torment sorrow mine owne disgrace taste ioy vaine pleasing sight shew pleasure saw neuer night griefe ioyings fawning smiling face appeares day griefe found neuer space yet sigh groane enuies spite world woe doe lye el harmes striue relye attend like seruants bound heate desire frost care proue wanting loue yet surfet doe loue burne yet freeze better hell better like day night since day liue bitter woe inioying light cleere wrong know yet sad feeling spite night darknesse doth forbid light yet see griefe apparant show followd iealousie whose fond trick flow vnconstant waues doubt alight behold rage cowardly feede vpon foule error humor breede shame doubt feare yet boldly thinke ill feele best darke ioy day light night opprest leaue end spill song stay thought doe aspire vaine hope high desire see meanes bereft inioy ioy left yet still thinkes thought doe say hope doe liue amid dismay hope hope ioy bury feare ioyes destroy thought hath yet comfort giuen despaire hath v driuen therefore deerely thought cherish neuer let thinking perish ti idle thing plaine odder farre dye paine thinke see thought doe rise winning hope lie alone louers treasure thought loue doe measure kinde thought fantsie guide let neuer haplesse slide still maintaine thy force let thinking still free leaue thy might vntill death let thinking yeeld vp breath come darkest night becomming sorrow best light leaue thy light fit lightsome soule darknesse doth truely sute opprest absence power doth mirth controule tree hanging head condole sweet summer parting leaues distrest dying colour make grieffull role much ala sorrow prest thus dead leaues farewell carpet made fall branch mourning proue leauelesse naked body whose hue vade hopefull greene wither loue tree leaues absence mourner maruell grieue like want see sunne glad earth bright sight morne showes golden face take place tedious drowsie night making world still happy grace shewes happinesse remaines one place may heauens alone v giue light hide cheerefull face though long space yet long enough tryall might neuer sunset could obscure desart euer shade sad could black darknesse euer proue bad paine absence make indure missing sunne make night absence ioy see neuer light last saw thee thee see thine image thought lay liuely figurd time delay could suffer heart parted sleepe fauourable let thy loud remembrance stray lest waking might haue cause say one mnute found forget thee since faith kinde sleepe gladly thee present thought still true louerlike thy face doth keepe pleasure shadowlike wrought pitty louing nay conscience giue reward thy selfe doth liue like indian scorched sunne sunne doe god adore vsd loue euermore worship lesse fauours haue wonne better thus blacknesse run onely whitenesse want deplore theu pale white griefes store haue hope see hope vndone besides sacrifice receiud sight chose saint mine hid worthlesse rite grant see offering giue let weare marke cupid might heart skin phoebus light ceasing offering loue liue euery one pleasing pastime hies hunt fome hauke play delight sweet discourse musicke shewes ioyes might yet thought doe farre aboue prize ioy take free eye sit wonder daylike night dispose themselues void right leaue true pleasure poore vanity others hunt thought haue chase hauke minde wished end doth flye discourse spirit talke cry others musicke choose greatest grace god say fond pleasure moue musicke bee sweet thought loue heare aged father say vnto sonne attention heares age wise experience euer cleares doubt feare reason betray sonne said hee behold thy father gray thou hast fresh tender yeares like thee sported destitute feares young fault made soone decay loue like thee feard loue led hatefull threed iealousie striuing keepe lost liberty gaind griefe still sorrowes moue time shun loue offence doubt youth age breed penitence song sweetest loue returne againe make long stay killing mirth forcing paine sorrow leading way let v thus parted loue absence nere agree since must need depart haplesse leaue iourney take heart deceiue fly ioying loued eye part shall part though absent tyme place greatest smart shall band make free tyed yet thinke gaine knot feele paine liue hauing lost chiefest part heart fled sight crost fortune yet deare heart goe soone returne good heere burne poore eye bee blinde light behold since gone deare delight rauishd greater power might making losse gaine others store oreflow drowne till sight restore blessed starre hatefull spight send forth teares flouds kill sight lookes lost wherein ioyd bury th se beames kindled fire conquerd haue loueburnt heart desire losing yet gaine esteemd till bright starre doe againe appeare brighter mar hee doth shine cleare see might redeemd deare cherish soules ran away doe abuse ala left poore brest choose best shrine would harbour still fauour shew vnkindly kill heart fled doe excuse better worse refuse pleasd ile though heartlesse life spill bee kinde iust indeed send heart mine place shall feede faithfull loue deuotion bound shall see sacrifice made pure spotlesse loue shall vade soule body together found fie tedious hope doe still rebell yet enough flatterd cunningly seeke vse spell betray must trophees bee lookd farre sweeter fruite see blasted blossomes fell delight expected han free witherd dead seemd blisse proues hell towne plotted slight may fortune write ember fire ruind thus hope falshood call tryde loth see tryall abide proue true last gaine liberty griefe killing griefe haue torment beene already great strong enough still thou dost increase nay glory mine il woe new past fresh new woe begin onely purchase thou canst win ordaind giue despaire fill fittest mount misfortune hill plaine ioy cannot liue griefe come welcome guest since must suffer anothers rest yet good griefe let intreat thee vse still thy force loue let paine lasting torment proue misse lay thy waights flye hence ioy longer heere abide great thy pleasure despaire looke loss must proue fare long since better foode relide foole oft heauns changing spide mine owne fate could haue care yet past time late beware nothing left sorrowes faster tyde enioyd sunne whose sight lend ioy thought day could haue end soone night came cloathd absence darke absence sad bitter gall death true louers doth fall whose fire loue disdaine reasts poorer sparke blessed shade giue silent rest witnes death hath closd mine eye separated earthly tyes hence higher place adrest oft haue laine heere opprest haue misery wofull cryes deliuerd forth mounting vp skyes yet helplesse backe returnd wound brest wound striue breed harm curd one charme loue yet may releeue let death former paine redeeme trusty friend faith vntouchd esteeme witnes e could loue could grieue song time onely cause vnrest hopd blest cruell art thou turnd first ga st life vnto loue still pleasure moue change though euer burnd haue thee slackd left vndone one louing rite haue wonne thy rage bitter changing minute shall see wherein may least happy thy fauours estranging blame thy selfe folly time gaue time holy true loue end best loueth vnworthy loue doth seeke end worthy loue worth pretend thought proueth stay thy swiftnes cruell time let blessed clime ioy may praise thee let pleasure sweetly tasting ioy loue faith wasting fame wing ile raise thee neuer shall thy glory dying bee vntill thine owne v tying tyme longer liueth ti gaine time lend since thy fame shall neuer end ioy giueth long trouble tedious way loues vnrest laid downe ease paine hoping rest new torment gaine possessing ought tobey fortune came though blinded yet stay blessed armes inchaine cold griefe thought warmth obtaine dissolue yce ioyes decay till rise said reward thee doth send seruant true louers ioy bannish cloud doubt feares destroy fortune loue depend obeyd rising felt loue indeed best least moue fast thou fliest time loues swift wing hope ioy flatters desire louer still contentment brings yet inioy thou dost retire thou stayst thy pace false time desire ill thou hastst eagle wing slow make v see thy retire despaire harme sorrow brings slake thy pace milder passe loue like bee whose wing doth vse bring home profit master good proue laden weary yet againe pursues lade thy selfe hony sweet ioy hiue loue destroy many eye poore loue hast thou guard thee thy desired wish end say thart blinde barrd sight thou shouldst happines e attend blame thee small iustice pretend since twixt thee sunne question hard sight outward thou canst bend heart guide freely thus vnbard art thou blinde bold oft dare accuse thee harmes selu finde led folly rashnesse blinde thy sacred power doe child compare loue boldnesse pardon admire thee sure must borne without fire take heed mine eye look doe cast lest betray heart secret thought true vnto selues nothing bought deare doubt brings louers fast catch alwatching eye ere past take fixt best loue hath sought pride desire let taught fault shame could truer last looke looke ioy conquest searchd hurt double kinde kept safe let themselues looke blinde watch gaze marke till madnesse run mine eye enioy full sight loue contented happiness moue false hope feed destroy spill first breed vnnaturall blrth thine owne wombe conceiuing kill plenty giues make greater dearth tyrant doe falsly ruling earth outwardly grace profit fill aduance appointed death make greater fall please thus shadow wicked vile intent colouring euill show good faire showes malice spent hope kill heart tyrant shed blood hode deluding brings v pride desire farther downe slide well poore heart thou witnesse canst loue oft grief hath made thee shed forth teares drop thy dearest blood oft feares borne testimony paine proue torment hast thou sufferd aboue ioy thou tort rd wert rack longing bear pinchd desire yet wishing reares firme faith constancie moue yet said sure loue cannot small shew passion descrid thy chiefe paine must hide saue one one see know passion heart doth moue million make shew loue song happy blessed eye ruling place haue force delight disgrace whose light allure tyes heart command looke doe mercy stand ti rule life ti comfort giue let scorne ending driue let frownes strife haue might hurt light shine true loues delight see night appeares sunne hath lost force losse doth ioy v diuorce shine cleares heauens clowdes night happy made gazing sight sun faire light beames doe seeme whose sweetest lookes doe tye yet make free spight poore destroy pleasure taste ioy shine dearest light fauour loue let cause cause frownings moue soules delight blesse blest eye vnto true affection tyes shall sunne giue place greater might yeelding doe show perfect light en grant grace vnto louetide slaue shine faith gaue please frowne vse killing eye vntruth falshood lie deare cast downe sweet lookes true desire banish doe thought faigned fire night welcome art thou minde distrest darke heauy sad yet sad neuer couldst thou finde fitter company thine owne humour thus opprest thou beest darke wrong still vnredrest saw neuer light smallest blisse spye heauy ioy mee fast doth hie care outgoes hope quiet rest friendship ioyne haplesse sad darke thou canst hating pleasure delight life silence griefe thee best doe loue three know cannot moue let v liue companion without strife pleasure banishd creature haue pastime inuented wit learning absence making warre peace may biding craue wee delight welcome graue may bury paine farre loathed company alwaies iarre vpon string mirth pastime gaue knowing part ioy deemd heart gone ioy ioy impart senslesse feeler mirth banishd good shall finde fortune must mischiefe binde misery gaine birth giuen mirth twould crosse thus robbed chiefest ioy silently beare greatest losse who vsd sorrow griefe destroy pleasant wit inioy owne ramd wordes account drosse purer thought reckon mosse witsick themselues breath imploy ala thinke plenty shewes want feeling wordes scant yet pardon liue pleasure take grudge neglected enuy show ti dislike doe owe crost selfe wish like make loue poore fooles doe deeme doth appeare fond outward showes kissing toying swearing gloze farre loues esteeme ala redeeme loue lost winning keepe chosen blowes though oft face lookes loue ouerthrowes yet slight conquest doth beseeme ti shew sighes teares proue loues indeed blast faigned loue increase dye fauours slide soule true loue safety lie guarded faith desert still hies yet kinde lookes many blessing hide blessed starres doe heauens glory show brightnesse make eye admire yet enuy though earth inioy sight moue fire doe confesse beauty breed desire shine clearest light v bestow yet doth sight earth warmth inspire louing soule grace know cleare bright shining light ioy fixt stedfast moue light change loue still increase thearth blisse sight giue life vnto louerould eye loue content loue lie euer loue force humane brest euer could moue pensiue heart powre could impart breed flame whose heat brings ioyes vnrest looke adrest soule feeles greatest smart heartlesse trunck heart depart one loue griefe opprest none euer felt truth loues great misse eye till depriued blisse seene must haue pitty showd haue beene made stage woe sad disaster haue open show pitty sure bestowd song sorrow yeeld grieue misse thy rage satisfied sad diuell thee made vnhappy wilt thou yet consent leaue still striue show thy cursed diuelish skill mourne dying would soule attends leaue cursed shoare harmes doe onely flow teach know saddest houres life vnrest tyred minute griefes hand opprest yet pacifie thy spight nothing bring ease last night quickely let vnhappy see time sparing grant louers blisse see time lost shall griefe misse let euer cease lasting griefe endlesse let without reliefe winn againe loue sauour proone end please since dying haue offended yet vnwillingly dearest eye light guide loue ioyes cupid himselfe borne blinde bright shining doth tryumphs binde seeing doth glory moue happy place prooue heauenly beames make sun find enuy grudging long hath shind cleare light match beames aboue ala sight heere forbid darkenes must poore lost roo e possesse blessed light hen orth hid blacke deede darkenesse haue excesse heauen affoord least light misery darkenesse chose fast thou hast st spring sweetest speed catch thy water runne greater riuers welcome woone ere thy newborne streames place feede yet doe well lest staying might breede dangerous flouds sweetest bankes torerun yet much better distresse shunn mak tear swiftest course succeed best doe hasty flight fly ill selfe outgoe whose broken heart testifie woe orechargd lifebloud wasteth quite sweet spring keepe way neuer spent ill dayes griefes assunder rent good still doe torment multitude question rest onely let quarrell breast stil let new stormes soule rent fye still mischiefes augment say answere crosse confest long since yet must euer opprest tongue torture wil nere spent well see way fright deuill speech ala po st madd folkes senseles wisdomes right hellish spirit absence doth arrest poore sens cruell might spare till selfe blest loue thou hast thou hast made thine thee ordaind take thy conquest let paind thy sunne doe seeke thy shade place helpe haue left inuade shewd face least ease might gaind yet found paine increase obtaind way haue loue allayd hott thirsty well came trusting quench part paine loue afresh imbracd drinke could see selfe liuing glasse well shee loue see himselfe truely placd stay mine eye shed fruitlesse teares since hope past win back againe treasure lost breed paine cease poore betraying feares thinke childish griefe reares high powre wretched gaine sighes lament thus spent vaine true sorrow neuer outward wailing beares ruld keepe rest store till roome may containe one sea teares drowne haplesse ile prouide store sighes part shall enough breake strongest heart done shall torment freed like fire doth loue increase longer last stronger still greater purer brighter doth fill eye wonder hope still bee bred breast fire loue free vse part best pleasing vnpossible kill heate great loue strength doth see mine eye scarce sustaine flame heart doth trust passion impart languishingly striue shew loue breath able breath least part increasing fuell smart yet loue till ash proue sonnet let griefe farre dearest breast doe wish hand ease banishd sweetest rest placd giue content loue please let disdaines heart doe ceaze doubly returne bring soules vnrest since true loue beloud displease let least smart mind addrest oftentimes mistaking loue farre false accusing right still truth gouerne constant might shall wished pleasure proue shewes least scorne despite hate heart torne song time come part lifekilling smart fond hope leaue deare must goe meete ioy woe still mirth inioy thy fill one enough suffer ill heart well sorrow vsd better new griefes bruisd thou heauens themselues like made neuer sit mourning shade alone must mourne end haue life griefe spend swiftest pace wailing bent shewes ioy short time lent bide woe must dwell charme cruell spell yet witchcraft trye make wish dye ere faith loue change horrid darknesse range song say venus long haue loud serud heere yet passion scornd doubted although cleere ala thinke loue deserueth loue haue loud looke paine see like haue proud remember goddesse desire sacred powre hath touchd felt fire perswade flame cease redresse poore stormes loue haue excesse restlesse night may show much lo e sighes vnfaignd witnes heart doth proue saddest lookes doe show griefe soule indures yet torment hand helpe procures command wayward childe son grant right bow shaft eeld faire sight haue eye ioy heart loue new hope may spring may pitty moue let triumph hurt saue bragge selfe wound gaue rule shall expect good see since hurt ala may murther mee song crost hauing haue lost may reason thus complaine since loue breed loue loues paine desire allay louing fire may haue yet must misse since another ruler would ruler seruice bad might blisse enioy hope destroy wicked pleasure got brings sweetest lot must taste best fed must starue restlesse rest song loue well make abiding faithfull shepheards brest prince whose thought sliding like swift riuers neuer rest change mind best feeding shepheard care loue exceeding think faith richest fare beauty slight inuiting cannot stirre heart change constancye chiefe delighting striues flee fantsies strange fairnesse pleasure loue e eeme treasure smile doth moue shepheard confessed loud well loud though scorne griefe oppressed could yet change moud himselfe thus contented loue accur hard hap repented since best louers speed worst song dearest deseruing may maintaine thought loue let still enioy faith destroy pitty loue doth moue let new loue inuite leaue long haue serud let power decline purely shine haue truth preserud found heart straying would accuse change constant still need must kill one whose soule knowes range yet may loues sweet smile recouer since loue yet quite lost tempt loue long lest great wrong make thinke much crost song fairest still truest eye light spy desire shine cleare loues delight yet breeder spight iealous fire marke lookes doe behold iealonsie told want loue see sparckle distrust heate thought vniust doe mooue learne guide course art change eye heart patient till fruitlesse ielousie giue leaue safest absence receiue would see let loue triumph haue suspition graue mooue wished freedome brings blisse enioy ioy happy loue sonnet night yet may see kinde light moone doth please shew face sunns roome yeelds light grace otherwise must suffer dullest night fortune barr true delight cold vncertaine like strange place decreasing changing instant space euen full ioy turnd despight iustly fortune bestowd wheele whose fauours fickle vnconstant reele drunke delight change sudden paine pleasure hath setled place stay turning still best hope decay ala louers often gaine loue like iugler come play prize mindes draw wonder admire see cunningly wanting eye yet deceiue best sight desire wanton childe faine fire prettily none see disguise finely doe trickes fooles hire badge office tyranny ende iugling doth make heart instead eye doth take men onely slight abuse sight nimble delightfull skill play gaine lost yet childlike cannot sport refuse blessed night happy time loue shade louers loues delight raigne loue seruants free spight hopefull season ioyes sport mooue hast thou made thy glory higher prooue god whose pleasant reede smite argus eye deathlike night till safe none could loue reprooue thou hast cloasd eye prying sight nourish iealousie ioye right vaine suspition foster mistrust making sweet sleepe master suspect el priuate feares would neglect would embrace blinded vniust cruell suspition rest let daily torment bring thee stay ala make ill thy easefull pray giue loose raines rage loues opprest care sufficiently distrest racke stretch heart way finde least content lay one happy foot ioy one step thats blest end thou flyst greedy eye seeking bring griefe base iealousie strange cage kept little signe fauour prooue must wayd turnd wronging loue humour must state begin many night haue paine endurd many age esteemd since sfortune yet whit redeemd rather faster tyde griefe assurd many houres haue sad thought endurd killing paine yet esteemd cruell loue might haue redeemd yeeres houres ioy assurd fond childe care saue first conquer pleasure graue beene testifie woe might haue beene image delight tombe sad misfortune spight loue vnkindly reward doth show paine still smotherd grieued brest seekes ease yet cannot passage finde dischargd vnwelcome guest striue fast burthen binde like ship goodwins cast winde shee striue deepe sand prest till lost kind sunck deuourd swallowd vnrest lost shipwrackt spoyld debard smallest hope nothing pleasure left saue thought haue scope wander may goe thought cry hope perishd loue tempestbeaten ioy lost killing despaire hath blessing crost yet faith still cry loue falsifie end fond ielousie ala know thy hiddenest thy secret art thou canst new inuention frame part haue already seene felt woe thy dissembling faigned showe wonne beliefe truth rule heart glad minde embracd deemd smart spring ioy whose streames blisse slow thought excuse beene reason true falshood could thee ensue soone beliefe honest mindes wrought finde thy flattery skill idely made obserue thy thus learning bondage bought poore loue chaines fetter like thiefe met ledd forth chast diana gaine vowing vntaught lad reliefe receiue gloried fond paine calld thiefe vowes mainetaine neuer stole sadd slight griefe giuen power disdaine reuenge honour chiefe shee said murtherd therefore must dye causd loue heere many whose heart loue hath made like warre beheld image deare greedy lookes mine eies would way bend feare desire inwardly contend feare markd desire draw still neere soule spirit would appeare boldnes warranted pretend genius yet durst lend eye trust others seemd cleare search whence danger rose vnworthynesse rest starud eye must sight blest iealousie poyson disclose yet heart vnseene iealous eye truer image shall tryumph lye like huge clowdes smoake well may hide face fairest day though wrong may shaddow till truth doe smile iustice sunnelike hath vapour tyde doating time canst thou shame let slid many minute ill doe beguile thy age worth falshoods thus defile thy auncient good cross bide looke vp leaue thy toyling pace misery thy dimme eye place goe fast giue care ende turne thy glasse ala vnto ill since thou sand canst farre fill one sorrowes extend day would euer appeare clowdy night gouerne sad place light heauen haples roomes grace since light shadowd loue hold
